column8:
Absolutely horrendous gameplay full of bugs and glitches, crashes, freezes, garbage Souls-like enemies that require the use of an unreliable, shitty dodge mechanic and let's not forget the long ass loading screens, poor sound quality and 30 FPS cap. A lot of things that make the game vomit-inducing and a MASSIVE chore to play. 

The only reason I persisted is because I always wanted to play a SH game and I genuinely love the music of SH (helps me sleep!) and its universe but damn this game has left a foul taste in my mouth as if I ate out Pyramid Head's ass. 

The game was a very generous OK up to the point where the game starts dishing out puzzle after puzzle after goddamned puzzle as if there wasn't already enough of that shit already... I spent hours trying to solve one glitched puzzle (apparently a well known issue with the clock puzzle) before finally downloading a save file for just after that so I could move on. At many points I was just ready to give up but in a masochistic sort of way I was enjoying it. 

The game is also extremely stingy with save points, ammo and health - it makes the game even more stressful because you just never know if the game is going to crash and make you do everything all over again. A lot of enemies require distance between you and them - so where's my fucking ammo, bitch? Health is actually a little more manageable if you're careful but still.  

Honestly, the game just started to drag in the last half of the game and all of this combined with yet again more puzzles and more annoying enemies (more than you've encountered elsewhere) and a difficult boss is what finally broke this camel's back!

Did I mention that the combat fucking blows? Even the first RE game wasn't this bad and I think that game actually worked too. I've played my fair share of older titles but this takes the complete and utter piss; it's not even worth the hassle of trying to fix either, unlike a lot of older titles. Mediocrity made manifest.  

The only redeeming quality is that it's Silent Hill - the vibes are all there with the music, setting, gritty graphics and atmosphere. But that's it. Everything else is shit. It looks like shit, runs like shit and overall, it's just shit. 

Unless you're a massive fan of the series then I would say steer well clear of this piece of crap because more than likely you're going to be left sorely disappointed one way or another. These guys don't deserve a single penny of your hard earned cash so if you want to try it out for yourself then find some other way. 

Look at all the other negative reviews and you'll see a lot of these issues and complaints repeated over and over again. The positive reviews are literally just people with poor tastes and fan boys/girls.

[i] Another crappy, clueless, greedy, scumbag, scam artist dev to add my list of boycotts. Yarr. 🖕 [/i]

column8: Eu amo esse jogo mas o port pra PC é uma das piores coisas que eu já vi, o jogo crasha sem motivo nenhum e os controles são totalmente bugados e impossibilitam a resolução de alguns puzzles

Horrible port.

It has basically no GFX options and fullscreen can only be turned off via a config file. The game's locked to 30fps with no proper XB prompts. It also crashed a couple of times during startup. There's a community patch for the game, but it's a pain to install and also doesn't work properly, even after disabling MSI AB. Obviously the latter's not the devs' fault, but it's still annoying.
So basically you can choose between 30fps with no proper icons or it just outright crashing with the community patch, which has no real install instructions either and you gotta piece things together yourself by looking for info online (not even PCGW has the proper instructions, lol).
Horrible port that'll never get fixed officially, because Konami doesn't care about a 15 year old game.

column8:
Não terminei ainda. Estou na metade, por enquanto estou gostando muito da história, porém é horrivel o game no PC, já crashou umas 3 vezes comigo e as 3 vezes, eu havia feito um bom progresso e perdi o save. O combate é péssimo e muito bugado, trava toda hora. 

Paguei 7 reais na promoção, por esse valor, comprem, mas se for o preço normal, não gastem seu dinheiro. Amo a franquia Silent Hill, mas fiquei bastante frustado devido à isso. 

Prós: trama interessante, prende o jogador
Contras: muito bugado, trava toda hora, crasha muito e a jogabilidade no PC é ridícula.

Irei colocar não recomendado pelo preço cheio, mas na promoção atual de 7 reais, recomendo muito.



EDIT: Não comprem o jogo, nem por 1 real, Deus abençoe.

tu prends la mayo
Mala optimizacion tanto en steam deck como para pc. No se puede ni jugar

A FUIR ABSOLUMENT. 
Le jeu bug vers trois heures d'utilisation au point de ne pas pouvoir le continuer (avec bien sûr un remboursement impossible). Plantages et erreurs de commandes sont monnaie courante. De plus, impossible de le démarrer en tant qu'administrateur car le raccourci ne veut pas se créer.
Bref, à votre propre jugement mais envisagez sérieusement de pouvoir perdre votre argent.

Después de 1 hora de meterle parches, sonido mejorado (porque sí el juego tiene el sonido en MONO) se crashea, no deja jugar con ratón en los puzzles (no me deja mover unos libros con ratón) y para colmo el combate es lo peor que visto en mucho tiempo, NO recomiendo la versión de PC ni aun que te den el juego gratis porque vas a trabajar más en que funcione y no se cierre o pase algún bug que jugando al propio juego.

Konami, ponte las pilas que ya mismo tenemos SH 2 Remake y te van a llover palos por todos lados.

my experiences fluctuated fairly wildly (while never actually reaching the level of I Think This Is A Good Video Game), but ended on a very bitter note (that last stretch! those endings! ack and augh!). thusly i feel extra un-charitable and will try to quarantine my non-terrible experiences in the first couple paragraphs. because despite everything, there was a solid stretch in the back half of the game where all my hatred had relatively mellowed. its entirely the result of having to Get Good at a badly implemented set of systems, meaning that every newly acquired strategy and trick feels less like an inevitable pre-designed discovery and more Intimate and Emergent...in other words, a sensation i might actually play a video game for! the learning curve was rough, but something that felt so frustrating and unusable for hours become something i could navigate with some level of mastery...thats not nothing, especially in the contrast. in some moments, you can see the more accessible, more boring, more "fun" next gen silent hill game they were trying to make...i dont like that as a goal, but its at least an understandable one, and resolves the baffled bewilderment from my first impressions. 

additionally, i do genuinely want to give props to the story. in and of itself, its main flaws are terrible featureless side characters and at least one climactic revelation that is so bad its one of the first three or five cliches people think of for Bad Writing. the actual main contents though, the story of alex and his family and their connections to an offshoot denomination of the cult that originated in silent hill with slightly different beliefs and practices, is totally good for a silent hill game...a bit too derivative of past games in some elements, but on the whole it is an appreciably new story that is wholly sufficiently emotionally fucked up. even sitting here thinking about it, i dont feel Nothing, and im not interested in denying the game that credit just because i do not respect it on the whole. this is also, shockingly, perhaps the silent hill game most interested in extrapolating the already present subtext of silent hill as a conscious and menacing entity into something at least vaguely political. there is, in particular, a really appreciable tragic edge to alex picking up the mantle of Military Man inspired by his abusive cop dad who gave him no rational reason to want to be anything like him, other then he does in some way represent what an American Man is supposed to be. there is an interest in pieces of the state that are seen as legitimate in their violence, and i genuinely think it dovetails nicely with the eventual revelation of the rituals of the cult. 

i dont want to oversell it (and you Do have a helpful and affable black guy cop buddy for several parts of the game), but what all this means in sum is that, in some universe, there is a version of homecoming that i am stubbornly contrarian about. it wouldnt be the first unintuitive unpolished unfun game i rly enjoyed! i proved myself able to deal with the awful animations that make it unclear where your invincibility frames are, or make it needlessly difficult to anticipate attacks on even basic enemies. i was able to deal with the dodge u seemingly have no control over the direction of, with the million ways to be stunlocked into oblivion, with the lack of a run button. i was able to deal with the fact that all my most consistent strategies (stunlocking with the lightning-fast starter knife and maneuvering to behind) totally destroy the vision for dodge and parry one on one duels. after a while, i was even able to deal with the knock-off resident evil 4 controls, which have neither the utility (no quick turn button???) nor the genuine weight and texture that came with the restrictions

half of the issue is that All of this moment to moment bullshit comes from a deeply condescending need to not merely change silent hill but "fix" it for a mainstream audience circa 2008, ofc. but what's really unforgivable for me is that while it is condescending to the previous games, it is also crassly cannibalizing them...just a totally noxious, rotten-to-the-core bit of artistic chemical reaction that absolutely nothing could recover from. its alessa's otherworld, it's james' faceless sexy nurses, its something that looks vaguely like the closer from sh3, its fucking pyramid head

u ever think about how literally all four team silent games have nurse enemies. u ever think about how different they are, how they were all approached from the ground up to fit their respective otherworlds and accompanying characters. somehow, with core ideas as malleable and creatively stimulating as silent hill's, team silent are thus far in the series still the *only* ones to actually take advantage of that fact. i dont know where blind copying out of creative laziness ends, where genuine reverence and unproductive fandom begins, or where corporate mandates from konami fit in the middle...but the end result is a game that is totally unable to express even its good ideas artistically...a total lack of aesthetic and emotional interest or cohesion

a story with some compelling ideas, a few cool boss designs, and a few good tracks from a very checked-out yamaoka is not enough to achieve anything close to the totally singular objects that are the team silent entires, especially when its drowning in a sea where the silent hill cliches are only outnumbered by the Video Games Circa 2008 cliches. past the conception stage it feels like every single creative decision was made on the path of least resistance, so little effort or discipline, so uninvolving even at its most inherently evocative. if i still dont totally hate the game, i dont wish to give it enough of a pass that would imply this shit is okay even for a standalone game, much less something riding on the coat tails of artistic giants. the type of suffocating myopicness that makes the whole world feel a little smaller for its existence. Moral Choice: Shoot Your Mom, Or Let Her Die Horribly In A Saw Trap

column8:
Steam Deck review:

Playable with some workarounds. You need need to install some patches, an audio program to force mono(audio is glitchy without it) and run from desktop. It’s the only way to play the game at 60fps and in HD. 

Would only recommend if you are willing to tinker, it’s unplayable in its default state.

column8:
Esse é um daqueles jogos difíceis de falar sobre sem parecer imparcial, pra mim pelo menos. Eu sou um fã ávido de Silent Hill, eu amo e conheço todo o universo e, apesar de Homecoming merecer a maioria, senão todas as críticas negativas; este foi O jogo que me apresentou ao mundo de Silent Hill. No final, é muito mais uma ligação nostálgica que eu acabei tendo, do que qualquer coisa, tanto com Homecoming quanto com Downpour, por ter jogado ambos no meu Xbox 360 quando menor. As partes boas, de ambos esses jogos, são muito boas, mas as partes ruins realmente são muito ruins, é difícil de explicar. Não é um bom jogo, mas eu recomendo.

Nota: História/10
the game crashes so way too often, don't waste your money

column8:
The first of the series to throw all lore rules out the window.
Went from Japanese-flavored Lynchian horror to B-movie splatterhouse horror.
Action focus with bad action.
Joke ending can be received on first playthrough.
This port doesn't even work without UnknownProject's patch.

There are some redeeming qualities like the OST, but not many.

column8: mid game

A história do jogo se passa 60% na cidade de Shepherd's Glen e 40% em Silent Hill (e isso não é um problema, vai por mim). A história em si é muito boa (gosto pessoal), tem suas reviravoltas e o final é bem surpreendente. Pela história vale a pena.

Ambientação, cenários, trilha sonora são pontos altos do game, tá bem caprichado.

Diferente de outros jogos os monstros não tem significados, não tem a ver com os traumas ou a personalidade do protagonista, só foram jogados aleatoriamente. (Ponto baixo, vacilaram)

Agora a parte que merece realmente atenção. O JOGO POSSUI MUITOS PROBLEMAS TÉCNICOS!

Não possui legenda em português (em 2008 nem GTA vinha legendado, mas vale a pena ressaltar esse ponto)

O jogo não reconhece nenhum controle mais novo que o controle do Xbox 360 e sinceramente eu acredito que só tenha suporte para o controle do 360 mesmo. Se quiser jogar no controle vai precisar fazer umas maracutaias pra emular o controle do 360 pro jogo reconhecer os comandos. Então esteja preparado para jogar no teclado e mouse sim ou sim. 

Por mais que o jogo permita ser jogado em resolução até 4K, se você selecionar qualquer resolução acima de 1600x900 vai perceber um problema. Acima dessa resolução você não consegue visualizar o mapa ou itens coletados no cenário porque é como se os itens vazassem da tela, o que não faz sentido já que todo o resto do jogo funciona normalmente em uma resolução normal.

Não importa sua config, você vai ter problemas com quedas de fps em alguns momentos, principalmente quando de fato você entra na cidade de Silent Hill.

Ao mudar de cenário, entrar ou sair de algum lugar vai sempre aparecer uma tela de loading que de certa forma é demoradinha e quebra o ritmo do jogo.

Não se surpreenda se do nada o jogo simplesmente fechar sozinho, esse problema acontece às vezes durante o gameplay.


Prós: História, cenários, ambientação e trilha sonora.
Contras: Inúmeros problemas técnicos que atrapalham muito a jogatina, não oferecer suporte à maioria dos controles ou não consertar um erro que não permite a visualização de certos itens no inventário quando se joga em uma resolução muito alta é o cúmulo da preguiça... mas esperar o que da Konami não é mesmo?

Vale a pena? Pelo preço e pela história talvez. Dependendo da promoção o jogo fica quase de graça, mas se atentem à esses problemas antes de comprar.
Bom!
PC port is borked
column9: PC port is borked

column8:
Bem, o jogo tem bugs, muitos deles. É necessário baixar um patch do GitHub para melhorar os crashes, FPS e tempos de carregamento, que são horrendos. Alguns bugs impedem completamente o progresso, obrigando você a reiniciar o jogo, caso ele já não tenha feito isso por conta própria.

Mas, deixando isso de lado, amei o jogo. O final acabou deixando um pouco a desejar, mas, no geral, foi uma ótima experiência.

Ah, sobre o meu pouco tempo de jogo, como o launcher do patch não abre a steam, ele não contabiliza o tempo. Mas garanto que terminei o game mesmo com os problemas mencionados.

PS: Com certeza não é o melhor jogo da série, but oh well
Uma bosta, Nunca será

Buena historia, pero un port malísimo, aunque eso si, mantiene la tensión a cada momento porque no sabes cuando se va a cerrar el juego y perder todo el progreso...xD, el mejor consejo que te puedo dar, es que guardes la partida con mucha frecuencia.
Gracias a Unknownproject por arreglar la mayoría de problemas!!

Terrible PC port! Controls are clumsy and awkward, gameplay is as well. No visual enhancements for PC version, no anything extra or improved that makes this better on PC. I think it might actually be worse. I originally played this on the PS3 & thought I would give the PC version a try & instantly regretted it. If your thinking about buying this and are not sure if you want to pull the trigger on it, do yourself a favor & don't. It's absolute garbage. It feels like they decided to adapt it to PC & halfway through got tired of working on it & just threw some shit together & pushed it out like the turd that it is. Seriously, DON'T BUY IT!!!

column8: nunca tive tanto problema técnico com um jogo. mesmo baixando o pach dos fãs pra melhorar ele ainda é bem quebrado. péssimo level design colocando save points tão distantes um do outro, muito extranho ser um SILENT HILL com tanto foco em combate, e ainda é um combate muito esquisito. Sinto que os comandos funcionariam melhor com um controle (até por que ele é originalmente de xbox360), mas o jogo não reconhece o controle que eu tenho. Ví gente defendendo como o melhor combate da série, mas sinceramente achei horroroso e desnecessário. o que salvaria ainda é a história. mas não me parece ser tão profunda até onde eu joguei.

How many good games are there with number 5 attached to them? Right now, I can't remember many...
Usually what happens by the time a series reaches magical 5, the title becomes a corporate marketing asset and the game itself is just an opportunity to make some more money...

It's worth noting that Silent Hill 4 was the last game developed by the original team in Japan and ever since that time Konami decided to outsoure external "western" studios to handle the Silent Hill brand.

[h3]Homecoming - what's good:[/h3][list]
[*][b] music and sounds[/b] are still designed by Akira Yamaoka here. This time the music feels dialed down a bit and takes the back seat, the main theme is not so mememorable but together with sound effects definitely manages to keep the proper mood when present
[*][b] graphics, story, and the main character[/b] all have potential with Jacob's Ladder serving as undeniable inspiration. An effort was made to create a story that is both accessible and somewhat interesting to new players but those who are familiar with the series can also appreciate it (I think)
[*][b] boss monster design[/b] is awesome, but the fight mechanics are unfortunately not good at all resulting in most boss encouters being quite tedious and forgetable
[/list]
[h3]Homecoming - what's bad:[/h3][list]
[*][b] the game is action and combat oriented[/b]. Silent Hill games before Homecoming were more about the dreamy mystery, mood, and intriquing characters - well, this time it's action time. While combat is a prominent elemet of the gameplay and the monster design is not bad at all, but there are not that many "enemy types" and it quickly becomes repetitive when trying to survive in Silent Hill Homecoming
[*][b] technical issues[/b] - it can be really challenging just to get this game running even on an average "modern" system. Once you manage to have this game in working order, what follows is unfortunately not a smooth ride. The game is not stable at all and crashes are plentiful. I read somewhere that the PC version is a sloppy Xbox port and it feels that way
[/list]
[h3]Overall [/h3]
If putting the technical problems aside, this is not a bad game but also not a good one, so we could say it is a "mixed bag"...
I can recomend it, but only to Silent Hill fans, but even those need to consider that this game is an action oriented "surival horror" that bases mostly on jump scares rather than a truly engaging and unsettling storytelling. Perhaps it's best to try the console version - A couple of years ago I played it on PS3 and it was okay (no crashes) but I remember some framerate drops every now and then...

column8:
El juego como bien se dice, está roto, hay que tener contexto y criterio propio. En esa época los juegos de Pc venían terriblemente porteados a PC. Si lo compran instalen el parche de unknown project. Me lo acabo de pasar a 60fps con las animaciones corregidas a 1440p con Dldsr lo cuál hace que las texturas luzcan muy bien. Tuve un crasheo al inicio y otro a la mitad del juego, de ahí en fuera el juego me fue perfecto. No es el mejor Silnet hill, de hecho es de los peores pero en mi opinión es un buen juego y dadas las circunstancias de Konami por esos días creo que DH hizo su mayor esfuerzo. 

Pros: Música, ambientación, historia (aunque no canónica) los diseños de los jefes son GOD
Contras: Gameplay acartonado, los puzzles terribles, las cinemáticas y cambios de cámara se sienten baratos.

PDt. Si instalan el parche que está en la PCgamingWiki (Son 2) instálenlo en la carpeta del juego. Luego copien todo el contenido de una carpeta extra generada llamada "Silent hill homecoming" a la del propio juego. Reemplacen los archivos y ejecuten el juego desde la carpeta Bin_v3.0

Revisitei o jogo pela nostalgia, antigamente tinha medo de jogar então eu assistia meu pai. Apesar de o que mais ter aqui é crítica, eu ainda estou recomendando o jogo, apesar dos problemas que ele tem, ainda tive uma experiência positiva, mas mais pela estética, puzzles que o jogo trás. Gosto muito da ambiência de Silent Hill, aquele vazio com neblina é impossível dar errado, os puzzles que são a parte chave do jogo foram até que interessantes, senti falta da escolha de dificuldade que é a marca do jogo... teve poucos puzzles também, mas os que tem são bem difíceis por envolver interpretação, o clássico puzzle poético... O combate funciona, senti raiva algumas vezes mas acho que é mais pela incompetência minha do que injustiça, mas é muito difícil terminar uma batalha sem pelo menos tomar uma porrada, mas enfim...
Partindo pra parte negativa, o port do jogo é >TENEBROSO< começando pela otimização, MESMO usando fix pra consertar os problemas, ainda tive bastante problema de performance, em uma das jogatinas, depois de ficar mais de 1 hora jogando, simplesmente o jogo derreteu e fiquei jogando com 15 FPS constantes e foi um sofrimento até achar um save e reabrir o jogo. Falando em reabrir, não poder dar ALT + TAB é horrível, de o jogo crashar instantaneamente, isso me deu raiva algumas vezes por acabar esquecendo disso. Muitos problemas com compatibilidade com controle, não cheguei a jogar no teclado e mouse, mas acredito que deve ser quebrado tanto quanto.. Agora partindo pro principal problema que afeta diretamente a imersão do jogo: o som.. É simplesmente quebrado, funcionando só de um lado, a voz dos personagens sendo menor que a música ou som ambiente, muitas vezes ficando totalmente abafado não dando pra ouvir ou as vezes até doendo a audição de tão distorcido e ruim que ficava o áudio, isso me deixou muito decepcionado, estragou MUITO minha experiência com o jogo, pois eu era obrigado a deixar o áudio MONO pra conseguir ficar decente.. e mesmo assim  tirando imersão pelo problema do som abafado, agudo estourado...
Apesar de todos esses problemas, foi legal revisitar um jogo que eu amava tanto quando menor, mesmo que só assistindo meu pai jogando. Se você tem paciência, de ir atrás dos fixes, configurar etc etc só pra tentar ter uma experiência ok do jogo, posso recomendar, se não, não vale seu esforço por algo tão quebrado, ao invés disso, posso 100% recomendar quem tiver o próprio XBOX 360, pois jogar pelo PC é complicado..

The amount of people who get bent out of shape over this one just for being different is absurd. Apparently a slightly different angle to a lock-on camera, a slight dodge to the side, and manually aiming your gun is tantamount to being a DMC clone? I guess?

Homecoming is a perfectly solid game in terms of design and writing. Double Helix was made up of people who knew how to do good melee combat that still has bite. And that's the thing - unlike prior Silent Hill games, running is a bit riskier. You can't just moonwalk your way through this. The enemies are harrowing. Resources are scarce, especially if you ignore side puzzles. The puzzles themselves are great, particularly the House setpiece towards the midpoint of the game.

As for the story, you want the quick and dirty version? [spoiler] You're not actually a soldier! You're heavily implied to be an adult with arrested development running around in his father's uniform. The spirit of your brother is vengeful and wants payback for what happened to him and his fellow kids sacrificed by your parents' cult. Your bro appears as the Pyramid Head in this game. It's not the same PH from Silent Hill 2. The entire game is about choosing whether you'll follow him in being wrathful or be merciful. [/spoiler] The game just had such a troubled dev cycle that almost every aspect is compromised somehow.

The real issue is that the PC/360 versions, which are the ones readily available, have the most bugs. If you can track down a physical PS3 copy, it's worth it. At least the Xbox backwards compatible version will have a much higher resolution than Homecoming likes to run at on PC.

Just like most of the Silent Hill sequels after Team Silent, it's not that it's a bad game. There is a nigh-impossible to please fanbase that just wanted the high of Silent Hill 2 again so bad that they got their wish with the Silent Hill 2 Remake... which has a lot of design decisions in common with Homecoming. 

Homecoming regularly goes on sale $5-7.50 depending on the platform when on sale. I've enjoyed it enough to play it several times. I hope you do too.

With a renewed formula and a weak narrative but at the same time with potential, Silent Hill: Homecoming fails to be a memorable title, thus marking the tragic decline that Shattered Memories will not be able to repair, despite the latter remaining a masterpiece for PSP.

However, Homecoming manages to excel in a well-crafted atmosphere and excellent level design, accompanied by an inspired aesthetic sector that manages to disturb the player, with Akira Yamaoka always in form.
The plot, however simple, manages to give you one twist after another, giving us quotes and references to other chapters of the series.

Not the best Silent Hill out but still worth keeping an eye on.

Primer juego creado por la empresa estadounidense Double Helix Games y segundo juego de la saga que no cuenta con un equipo de desarrollo japonés tras [i]Silent Hill: Origins[/i]. 

[h1]Un secreto familiar[/h1]
Alex Shepherd acaba de volver a casa tras pasar un tiempo en un campamento militar, pero el deteriorado estado en el que encuentra su pueblo no es más que la punta del iceberg. Y es que [i]Shepherd’s Glen[/i] esconde un oscuro secreto que empieza a salir a la luz. Aunque el ritmo de desarrollo no es el más acertado, la trama es más interesante de lo que creía, con algunos personajes convincentes y ciertas elecciones durante su transcurso que alteran el final.

Siguiendo la estela de anteriores entregas, se trata de un juego de terror y supervivencia en tercera persona, con cierto hincapié en la exploración y puzles. Lo que sí es distinto es la linealidad con la que está concebido. En los anteriores había muchas salas y pasillos por los que moverte, haciéndolo confuso y necesitando consultar el mapa con bastante frecuencia. En este encontraremos la mayoría de caminos cortados con excepción de aquel que debemos seguir para avanzar en la trama. Los puzles son sencillos en general, excepto el del desván, que es de un tipo de puzle que detesto. Y, como víctima de la época, la presencia de QTE ([i]Quick Time Events[/i]) es más molesta que otra cosa.

La exploración cobra importancia a la hora de encontrar objetos curativos y munición para sobrevivir. Bebidas saludables serán los más comunes, que regeneran la mitad de la vida, y los botiquines, que curan toda la barra de vida. Existe un tercer tipo, los sueros, que además de curar toda la vida la aumenta un poco de manera permanente. Dibujos y fotografías son los coleccionables opcionales del juego. Y si estamos atentos podremos encontrar una mejora para cada tipo de arma.

Han intentado hacer el combate un poco más complejo que en anteriores entregas, con aquello de la experiencia militar del protagonista, pero el resultado no es tan bueno como debería. Podemos fijar la cámara en un enemigo, esquivar, contraatacar y tenemos acceso un simple sistema de combos alternando entre ataque rápido y fuerte. Lo malo es lo tosco de los movimientos y el sistema de colisiones, en especial la de un ataque enemigo y nuestro esquive. Al menos es funcional. Además de acceso a armas cuerpo a cuerpo, también contaremos con armas de fuego, que pese a su escasa munición cobran mucha importancia en los puntos más difíciles de la aventura.

Existen dos dificultades: media y alta. En alta los enemigos hacen más daño, encontraremos menos munición y los objetos curativos sanan la mitad. El juego no tiene compatibilidad con mando pese a ser un port de consola, pero sí funciona. Eso sí, los botones que muestra son poco precisos, con números en lugar de colores y en ocasiones falla a la hora de mostrar qué pulsar. El control con teclado y ratón me parece bastante bueno, posiblemente mejor que con mando.

La ambientación con la que cuenta el juego, el modelado de los personajes y el diseño de los jefes y enemigos (algunos basados en la película de 2006) son bastante acertados, pero la baja resolución de las texturas y los escenarios poco detallados, dañan la apariencia general del título. El audio no está mal, exceptuando cierto detalle que comentaré un poco más adelante. Por otro lado, la banda sonora, nuevamente en manos de Akira Yamaoka, es extraña y buena a la vez (lo habitual en la saga). El juego viene con voces en inglés y textos en español, aunque la traducción no es ninguna maravilla, con muchas frases traducidas de manera demasiado literal que no quedan bien.

La historia debería durar unas 10 horas. Dependiendo de nuestras decisiones en tres puntos concretos tendremos acceso a cinco finales distintos. Estos finales no son pequeñas variaciones, son muy diferentes unos de otros. Una vez terminado se desbloquean trajes y armas para futuras partidas en función del tipo de final obtenido.

En cuanto al estado técnico y estabilidad del título, es terrible. Independientemente de lo que marquemos en las opciones, el juego sólo funciona a 30 FPS. Sólo soporta audio 5.1 con lo que si no dispones de dicha configuración, durante las conversaciones el audio sonara únicamente por un altavoz, junto con otros detalles. Los QTE no funcionan como deberían. Es muy posible que el juego te eche al escritorio en el momento más inoportuno. Y más. Un port sorprendentemente flojo. Por suerte, existe un parche hecho por el usuario Unknownproject que soluciona la mayoría de problemas. Aun así, no es definitivo y cuanto más avanzaba más problemas aparecían, en especial las salidas al escritorio y pantallas de carga cada vez más largas.

[b]Silent Hill: Homecoming[/b] no es mal juego y, aunque le cuesta arrancar, cuenta con una historia bastante interesante y un buen diseño de enemigos en general. Pero existe bastante margen de mejora en muchos de sus aspectos, y el estado en el que recibimos este port desequilibra la balanza en su contra de manera irredimible.

column8:
Probably the most shameful legitimate video game I've played on here. Charging $40 for a broken port of one of the worst Silent Hill games is laughable. I honestly wouldn't even advise buying it when it's on sale unless it's something like $5.
Pros:
[list]
[*]Akira Yamaoka does good work again, although whether or not the track used fits the situation is entirely a coinflip.
[*]Some neat visual effects (though they were mostly ripped from the movie)
[*]There's a few neat enemy designs.
[/list]
Cons:
[list]
[*] More crashes than the opening of Final Destination 2. Played through the same sequence on five occasions in the span of an hour and because of crashing continuously lost progress. Savepoints are few and far between because it's a survival-horror, but because the conditions of the port are more horrific than anything found in Silent Hill, it's very possible you could get soft-locked because the game just decides to crash before you can find a point to save. There's a file somewhere down in the reviews to patch it and stabilize it, apparently.
[*] Despite it initially releasing on the Xbox 360 and PS3 in 2008, there is no controller support unless you find a custom file to force it to work on a controller.
[*] Lots of garbage enemy designs. Cool names, but there's probably four or five good designs, and two of them aren't even original to this game. 
[*] Game is definitely from 2008 with all of the Q.T.E.s. Click multiple times to chop down boards in a cutscene when it could have been one-and-done. Rapid Click to pull your hand free from a cutscene wall. And sometimes you'll be given a prompt for the Q.T.E. and it won't matter anyways, you were at low enough health that you still die even though the prompt was there, but your health doesn't go down gradually, just upon impact or death.
[*] Pacing is awful. Stop a heart-pounding cutscene and sequence to tell you that you got a new item. Exit one cutscene, be stuck in a single spot pacing back and forth unable to actually do anything until the next designated cutscene pops in.
[*] The combat. This combat is bad. And not bad like how Silent Hill should be. The game flip-flops between wanting to show off its horrid combat system and remembering that Survival Horror wants players to flee from encounters. Enemy placements are ridiculous; at some points you'll be placed with one enemy in a wide open space and you can easily dodge it, which is fine, but other times there are so many aggressive enemies placed in one tight corridor or around the corner without being warned via The Radio Static (Police Station pops to mind) that you'll end up running into a mass of four enemies that all charge, and you'll just never be able to hit the right one or find a way out. This only serves as a frustration rather than a genuinely scary situation 90% of the time. You can only fight in your combat stance, requiring you to toggle it on and target the nearest hostile, except there's a good chance you'll target another guy farther away and try to hit him with your Super Weapon Combos, letting the closest thing skewer you in the process of hitting the wall conveniently  between you and your Silent-Hill-Homecoming-Combat-Designated-Target. 
[*] Game crashed again while I was writing this. There's only so many times I can handle "load, wait for NPC, cutscene, run sequence, cutscene, get your items back from the police chief's office, cutscene, spawn 5 schisms in a corridor, die, gamecrash" before I just call it quits for the evening. 

 I haven't tried the community patch that allegedly fixes the crashing, but even with the patch I can't recommend paying $40 for this sad excuse of a port. If you find it on sale for $20 or less, then sure, grab it and grab the patch and play a mid action-horror game. Otherwise just skip it entirely and just watch a playthrough of it.

column8:
Silent Hill: Bugcoming

El juego presenta muchos problemas bastante fastidiosos que arruinan totalmente la experiencia de juego.

Dobře, hra určitě není tak dobrá jako její předchůdci a je mi líto že zrovna Homecoming je jediný díl Silent Hill který se dá tak lehce koupit na PC. Celkem špatná kamera, neohrabaný bojový systém, hra někdy padá. Ale co udělala dobře, byla atmosféra, která vysoko vyvyšuje hru přes všechny nedostatky. Už prvních pět minut jsem se bál tolik, kolik jsem se ještě u žádné hry nebál. Udělal jsem dobře, že jsem hru koupil.

This title gets a lot of hate compared to others in the series and I can understand why. The combat leaves a lot to be desired but isn't too bad when you get the hang of it. I managed to complete the game on the steam deck. If you want to capture the feel of 1-4 look elsewhere, but if you want some SH fun without emulation or spending hundreds on physical copies (this is the only title available for download currently) I still managed to thoroughly enjoy my time in Shepherd's Glen.

column8:
[h1] Silent Hill: Crashcoming [/h1]

Este game até parece ser divertido, porém o jogo trava ou fecha sozinho toda hora, você faz um progresso bom no game, daqui a pouco perde tudo porque o jogo simplesmente fecha, estou desistindo de jogar já, porque assim é muito desmotivante. 

Eu acho que este game esta muito datado, envelheceu muito mal, mesmo sendo um game ai do final de 2008, parece ser um jogo mais antigo, não suporta nativamente o controle do Xbox. 

Outro ponto muito negativo do game é que ele é travado a 30fps, e mesmo editando o arquivo que o pessoal na internet diz para editar, o "vars_pc.cfg" o game não respeita a configuração que esta ali e simplesmente roda a 30fps, até existe um patch / mod que vi pela net que da para instalar, mas eu não quis arriscar baixar e testar softwares desconhecidos que possam conter códigos maliciosos.

Além do game estar a 30 fps, ele ainda é meio "descompassado" da impressão de estar rodando com framerate variando, não sei se isso é mais uma das incompatibilidades do game, já que meu monitor é de 165hz. 

Estou rodando o game em um Avell com uma RTX 3060 6GB , Core I7 11800H, 32GB RAM, 2TB SSD, monitor ASUS FullHD 165Hz G-Sync compatível.

Infelizmente, apesar de ter zerado o Silent Hill 2 e 3 pela primeira vez este ano de 2024 pelo Xbox SX (versão HD Collection) não terei como zerar este game porque esta "injogável" no PC e no Xbox não existe para venda!
Konami, empresa sem responsabilidade nenhuma com o cliente para deixar uma versão tão problemática assim a venda, acho que este game deveria ser banido da loja!

column8: Silent Hill Homecoming es un juego de terror desafiante con un combate extremadamente deficiente. A pesar de esta falla, el juego logra ser increíble gracias a su atmósfera inquietante, su historia intrigante y sus gráficos decentes. Los jugadores se verán inmersos en un mundo oscuro y retorcido donde tendrán que enfrentarse a sus peores miedos. A pesar de sus fallos, Silent Hill Homecoming es una experiencia única que vale la pena jugar para los amantes del género de terror.
Минус игры - очень много багов
Confiem quando dizem q esse jogo é ruim e não merece sua curiosidade, muito menos seu dinheiro

Lo compré porque en su día era el único Silent Hill disponible en Steam, jugué 2h del tirón hasta que me quedé bloqueado entre 2 estanterías del ayuntamiento, no había guardado manualmente y no existen los autoguardados así que lo dropeé. Ahora le he echado valor y he conseguido pasármelo pero no ha merecido nada la pena, la historia es muy mala, el juego está roto y ni siquiera la banda sonora se salva, tiene 2 cosas buenas: la interacción con las enfermeras, que es más o menos fiel a la peli, y que aparece Pyramid Head 2 veces, pero no te hagas ilusiones que no vas a combatir con él. Todo lo demás apesta, el combate es pésimo, ortopédico, si te sale secuencia de presionar muchas veces un botón y no reacciona, reinicia el juego porque se ha pillado y no va a entrar el comando nunca, CONSEJO: para recargar un arma apunta y mantén ataque fuerte, pegara cuerpo a cuerpo con ella, pero si mantienes el botón terminará por cargar, lo descubí en el penúltimo capítulo del juego, por cierto, también tienes una munición máxima muy limitada, por lo que no podrás coger más de 3 cajas de balas de cada arma si no las gastas, el juego no está adaptado a mando de xbox por lo que te deseo mucha suerte, sobre todo al principio, para saber que botón pulsar en los quick time event, durante las secuencias de vídeo es posible que las voces se bajen y se suban de volumen a placer o se te ponga una música que no pega ni con cola, el mayor terror del juego es que se cuelga, así que guarda SIEMPRE que puedas y reza para que no se te cierre después de haber avanzado mucho sin guardar, si se congela mientras vas andando no toques nada y reza. Ahórrate el mal trago, no lo compres, ignóralo, nunca a existido y ojalá saquen los anteriores o nuevos con mejor esmero. Silent Hill 2 Remake por favor, no me decepciones que bastante he tenido con este

Up until SH2 Remake's announcement, this was the only SH game on Steam, and hoo boy this game sure is something. 

Everything you hated from the late 2000's post SH4 games is here, from the QTEs, the messy combat, the bad boss fights, to the uninteresting locations. 
The story has some okay bits but it's still pretty dull sadly, and Alex is as bland as it gets. 

And yeah, BUGS. Tons of bugs. I had flying enemies die and float in the air, falling into areas I'm not supposed to fall and instantly die, a chunk of the cemetery just not loading up and having to walk into the ether with the map's help, the list goes on. It's a good thing the community has made some patches which do take the game into a somewhat playable state, but once that's done, you still gotta deal with the frustrating gameplay this game offers. Soundtrack's still great, it's Yamaoka after all. Also they use the movie designs for Pyramid Head for some reason? Go figure.

Not a good game by any means, at least it's dirt cheap when on sale. Patches are damn near mandatory if you wanna deal with this thing, though.

[h1]Jogo: Silent Hill: Homecoming[/h1]
[h3]Nota: joguei por 11 minutos[/h3]

Escolheram o "Pior" jogo da franquia para colocar na Steam, eu joguei por 11 minutos na época que eu tinha um PC ruim e broxei com o mal desempenho e a má jogabilidade, talvez algum dia de minha vida eu volte para ele e dê uma análise mais aprofundada e então eu atualizarei essa.

[h1]Atualização[/h1]

Decidi voltar a jogar por um amigo ter me pedido pra eu fazer live de um jogo pra ele enquanto ele tava na escola, o jogo tem tantos problemas que tive de baixar um pack de correções feitas por fans e uma tradução da nossa queria e amada Gamevicio.

O jogo é repleto de problemas, incluindo: crashes, loadings longos, queda de FPS e muitos outros.
É jogável se você usar o pack de correções e não vale a pena, não cheguei a zerar e talvez nem tenha chegado perto porque dropei de desinteresse pela história e pelo personagem que tinha mó cara de bobão.

Se quiser experimentar um Silent Hill, não tente esse.
Wer Silent Hill in der Vergangenheit schon toll fand der wird das auch mögen, Ich hab Silent Hill 2 sowie Silent Hill 3 gezockt und ich finds immer noch Großartig!!

molto scettico del gioco perche' lo sviluppatore non e' konami ,ma Double Helix Games , pero' dopo aver giocato e averlo finito,  posso dire che e' un gioco entusiasmante , rispecchia i vecchi canoni su cui si fondavano i primi silent hill, quindi ambientazione cupa ,atmosfera e musiche inquietanti e profonde, gioco abbastanza longevo , lo metto al terzo posto insieme al 3, ovviamente i primi due sono imbattibili, pero' questo gioco da pienamente l'idea e l'imprinting dei primi due , acquistato nel periodo sconti per 3.99 euro , adesso costa 19.99 ,posso dire che li vale tutti .
su steam deck bisogna fare dei piccoli cambiamenti per farlo funzionare perfettamente , 
ho dovuto abbassare il frame rate da 60 a 30 per non farlo crashare di continuo, pero' cambiando la nitidezza delle immagini quasi non si nota la differenza .
sono un fan della saga giocati e fini tutti , 
l'unico che non acquisterei e' downpour , osceno sotto tutti i punti di vista.
Muitos bugs, nenhum trauma psicologico e historia mais obvia do que comedia romântica, horrivel
3 razy wyjebalo mi gre i juz odechciało mi sie prób
Egy irányíthatatlan, konzolportos rakat fos.

Regardless of my illogical love for "Silent Hill Homecoming", the PC edition is not something I would ever consider recommending to anyone. It is the most broken port ever contrived in the history of video games. I wouldn't wish this thing on my greatest enemy. If you're interested in this game, go for the XBox 360/PS3 release. If you don't have an Xbox 360/PS3 then you'd be better off not bothering at all. The PC edition will bring you nothing but frustration and sorrow.

I enjoy Homecoming. Yes it has its faults. If you plan to buy it, do so now before the sale is over. Don’t buy it full price because it’s not worth it. Why? Because it has its faults. Audio will only play on both ears during cut scenes but not the actual gameplay. If you find the fix online, Konami shut down the server so the fix won’t work anymore. The game relies on 5.1 surround sound.   You’re stuck on mono.

For those that will ignore this version thanks to my review, then get the Xbox version on the marketplace. 

I don’t know why this game is $39.99 after so many years. It’s not even worth it because of its faults. Not like Konami ever cared to fix the issues.

column8: Its incredible how a game is so harshly criticized that despite all its problems and all its bugs I always play the campaign every time I have time and without ever getting bored, damn I even did it since I was 9 years old and I still love this game

4.5/10
It's actually insane how this game is available on Steam and it's the only SH game here. The vanilla version runs at 30fps, has broken qte's, crashes a lot, it makes an already poorly made game even worse. I installed a patch that fixed those issues for the most part, I probably wouldn't have finished it if not for that.
The game's story is meh, it could be better but it's also not the worst thing in the world. The main character isn't very interesting but he could've been worse, it's the same thing with side characters. I also can't believe they used Pyramid Head in this for like 3/4 scenes, it's hilariously bad. The voice acting and sound design is mostly bad, with sound effects often just not playing.
The atmosphere is nice during a few sections but it's mostly lacking.
The combat system here is kinda bad, it's not that responsive and sometimes your attacks don't even affect an enemy when it should. It's pretty barebones but it's an interesting change from previous titles, just not a very good one. The game also makes you fight some enemies or you'll have a hard time exploring some sections so that makes you get even more bored of the combat and the way it works.
The enemies are a very mixed bag, some have interesting designs (specially bosses) but they're mostly a chore to fight against.
Overall, it's not a good SH game. As a horror game, it's playable (with a patch) but you'd be better off with pretty much any other horror game.

column8:
[H1]Silent Hill[/H1]
Como primer y único titulo de la saga que hay en Steam (Aparte de la futura llegada del 2 Remake).. Es una tremenda porquería de PORT... es un hecho lo que dicen, tienes que gastarte tremenda hora jugando al cirujano para revivir ésta porquería ROTA de forma manual. LITERALL!.. hay que descargarse mod para los 60Fps, mod para el arreglo de algunas misiones rotas, mod para Alt+Tab (No le sirve el Steam Overlay), mod para actualizar el juego, mod mod mod mod... puro pínche mod para cada cosa del juego porque por si solo no sirve (aunque te deje correrlo, la verdad se muestra al jugarlo).. Lo peor fue, que al hacerme como 2 jodidas horas jugando al cirujano, en cierto momento se me cerraba el juego, siempre...

[...]
Gracias por ésta basura, nos enseña a evadir/cuidarnos de esta Desarrolladora/Compañia que no hace nada y nos obliga a reparar su juego por cuenta propia.

-Graficos: Aun se mantienen hasta del dia de hoy, son decentes y no son tan brutales pero para fecha de salida, envecio bastante bien. 7

-jugabilidad: es facil de entender, el problema son sus mecanicas, es como un re 4 pero mal hecho, el sistema de esquive es tosco, los enemigos te pegan enfermos y aveces cuesta esquivarlos, tambien hubo ciertos momentos donde no podia sacar el arma, por que estaba bugeado, quitando eso, cuando entendes lo basico es entretenido. 7 

-Mapeado: Me parecio muy bien hechas las zonas del mapa, la ambientacion es buenisima. 8/10

-Musica: buenisima, un 8. 

-monstruos: la verdad, no hay mucho que decir, los diseños estan god, son incomodos de mirar (salvo las enfermeras) llega a dar mucha incomodidad cuando te toman por sorpresa pero en general son un 8 (Algunos parecen reciclados pero con un ligero retoque).

-Bosses: me gustaron todos, muy buenas mecanicas y diseños, lastima que son poquitos, le doy un 8.5

Rejugabilidad: si queres sacar logros, o probar trajes y armas que se desbloquean, es bastante genial, incluso podes subirle la dificultad si te consideras bastante bueno, aunque no recomiendo sino queres ser oneshoteado por cada cosa que te cruces. eso ya es opcional, en mi caso, con una vez me basto. tengo muchos juegos pendientes. 

por ultimo, los finales, son bastante meh la verdad, a expcion de ALERTA DE SPOILER .. 


el del verdugo y el final bueno, yo me saque el final UFO a la primera y me cague de risa. 


NOTA FINAL: No es un mal Juego, lo que resta muchos puntos es que esta mal porteado y su historia algo predecible, por todo lo demas es bastante disfrutable, buen silent, aunque no llega a ser God como la trilogia original. Un lujo haberlo terminado, me gusto el juego Y si te gusta algo de accion y la exploracion te lo recomiendo,. no puedo recomendar el titulo a aquellos que busquen solo terror y historia por que este titulo no ofrece lo que buscas. es una experiencia para otro tipo de jugadores mas añejos. 

8/10

Me encantó lo que pude jugar pero tuve que dropearlo por los incesantes crasheos hasta que ya no pude avanzar mas por el mismo, una pena la verdad me estaba adentrando en la historia y me estaba fascinando pero bueno, es lo que hay XD.

column8: Esse jogo e uma obra de arte! a atmosfera escura e silenciosa deixa o jogo muito bom de ser jogar! amo as parte que ta tudo escura e não tem musica e você só pode escutar os paços que o Alex da , e falando do Alex , ele e diferente dos outros protagonistas de silent hill os outros eram apenas pessoas normais usando armas o Alex tem treinamento militar então ele sabe lutar bem melhor que os outros ele pode ate esquivar de ataques! deixando bem claro que ele e barra pesada, amei mesmo o jogo muito lindo!

Es entretenido, yo como muchos crecimos jugando Silent Hill. Por el precio a descuento, considero que fue buena compra, ya que hay veces que se atora y te saca del juego, le falta mucha optimización.
Para pasar el rato esta bien

Crash every few minutes, really bad port. If I know Konami right  they will never fix this issue sadly. Play this on console instead.

EDIT: Here is the patch to fix the game. It runs really good.
https://unknownproject.github.io/silent_hill.html

EDIT 2: I played this second time now without the patch. If the patch dosen't work and it still crashes, play on 1280x720 resolution because this game is hardcoded on 1280x720 and 30 FPS. Works super good and havent have any crashes yet (Only if you alt+TAB or hit the windows key). If you dont have any issue playing on 1280x720 and 30FPS then game on.

column8:
[h1] SILENT HILL HOMECOMING (RESEÑA) [/h1] 

[b] Logros conseguidos 0/0
Calificación 7.4/10
Terminado el 30/enero/2024 [/b] 

[i] Obviamente no es el mejor silent hill pero cumple lo suyo es divertido, y el combate es mejor que otros juegos de la misma franquicia, la historia ira de ir a buscar a tu hermano con bastantes escenas que te van dando pistas de lo que esta pasando con muchos finales por descubrir, juego muy corto unas 5 horas, 4 jefes disfrutables pero muy fáciles y nada memorables, el final que saque es donde se van en un OVNI , muy a lo suyo, aun con todo lo bueno y lo malo sin duda no deberías perdértelo. [/i] 

[h1] (CRITICA) [/h1] 

[i] Aunque el juego sea bueno, hasta el momento de hoy, solo este juego de la saga es posible comprarlo en steam y el port es lamentable, enserio no exagero crasheos, bugs visuales, los controles, bloqueado a 30 fps. no soporta resoluciones altas , ya se imaginaran un port sin ganas.
Por suerte esto es PC y existe un chico que hizo un mod para arreglar esto, aunque con el mod puesto, arregla todo menos los crasheos constantes. así que ten en cuenta que te crasheara el juego mínimo una vez. si no quieres batallar con todo esto juega la versión de consola y evitate todo esto. Aquí te dejo el link del mod  [/i] 
https://github.com/unknownproject/Silent_Hill_Homecoming/releases/tag/v3.10_pt6

Silent Hill serisi içinde en sevilmeyen oyunlardan birisi, ancak oyundaki yaratıklar özellikle bossları baya iyi. Oyun fena değil, çok da iyi diyemem(İlk 3 oyunu gibisi yok) ancak asıl sorun oyun pc de leş gibi, sürekli çökme yaşanıyor, bunun sebebi windows 10 veya 11 de değil, eskiden de böyleydi pc portu acayip bug dolu ve çökme sorunlu, belkide bu sorunlar olmasa pcde sevilen bir korku oyunu olabilirdi. Ancak internette bu sorunları çözen yamalar var indirmeden sakın oyuna başlamayın!

VALE A PENA?
Minhas considerações para o Silent Hill Homecoming: Se você gosta MESMO da saga Silent Hill, deveria dar uma chance a este sim. Quando me falaram sobre o port lixo do game eu confesso desacreditei e enfrentei ele, foi uma das coisas mais difíceis que fiz para jogar um jogo da saga pela primeira vez, baixei alguns mods para melhorar o port que não havia mapeamento de teclas, alt + tab crashava jogo, um certo tempo de gameplay ele também crashava até que eu não aguentei. Enfim, o jogo é bom se não fosse por esses detalhes ''pequenos'', a história é típica silent hill, prende bem e os puzzles são tranquilos e alguns bem complexos.

jogo muit bom, interessante, com um terror sem jumpscares e sim psicológico. A história e muit boa e te prende. O que quebra é o fato do port desse jogo ser péssimo, crasha quando vai salvar o jogo, carregar cutscene e uma sala nova, além do fato de que se você der alt+tab (ou apertar a tecla windows) o jogo simplesmente crasha, isso é ridículo.
i like it it takes some time getting use to but this great game

column8:
L'histoire est sympathique mais je ne recommande pas ce jeu en raison des nombreux bugs du portage qui le rendent difficile, voir impossible à terminer. 
Personnellement je n'ai pas pu le terminer à cause de problèmes de caméra sur un boss, vers la fin, et à la lourdeur du personnage, qui, couplé à mon faible stock de soin et de munitions, l'ont rendu impossible à battre sans recommencer le jeu.
J'ai donc abandonné.
Jouez-y sur une console à l'ancienne, vous mettrez ainsi toutes les chances de votre côté pour finir cette histoire qui m'a malgré tout intéressée.

O jogo em si é muito bom, eu gostei, mas esse port de pc é tenebroso, sinceramente, se for jogar, eu recomendo que jogue a versão de play 3 mesmo. Que esse de pc não vale nem os 6 conto que eu gastei nele, uma pena.

Lo recomiendo PERO. 
Este juego es un desastre. Cuando lo juegues te darás cuenta por ejemplo, de que el sonido no va muy bien y que escucharás por un lado de los auriculares, los diálogos. Hay un fix de esto, pero yo no me calenté mucho la cabeza con programas y cosas externas y puse el sonido de windows en ''mono''. A veces este juego se cuelga. Recomendable que lo juegues a 30fps (como te viene de base sin modificar) porque te da menos errores. Que piramid head esté en este juego es una tremenda fumada sin sentido (fanservice) el combate no me gustó mucho, pero tampoco me quejo. No hay mucha variedad de enemigos. En general no está a la par de las 4 primeras entregas, pero eso lo sabes tu y yo sin necesidad de jugar este título. 
Con tantas cosas negativas. ¿Por qué lo recomiendo?. La trama está entretenida, hay diseños de enemigos que son turbios y molan. Me gusta mucho Silent Hill. Legalmente solo puedes jugar en PC al SH4 (JUEGAZO) y a este. Y como Homecoming está barato, pues me lo pille en pc (jugué hace mucho tiempo en xbox360) y, aunque no lo he terminado, diría que te entretiene para lo que has pagado.
Pieno di  Bug, continua crashare.
Só realmente não curtir, por isso não recomendo

O jogo é muito bom, para jogar e se divertir tem que lembrar que é um jogo mais de história. Por mais que ele seja de 2008 ainda sim acho um certo bug muito irritante, você não pode mudar de janela quando o jogo estiver aberto se não ele fecha e você volta no seu ultimo save, então se você for jogar lembre-se de sempre salvar antes de sair. Estou perto de zerar, vi vídeos sobre a lore de Silent Hill no geral e acho muita boa a história, sem contar que a trilha sonora do jogo é muito boa, pra min especialmente o "The Terminal Show", esse ta até no meu top 5 trilhas sonoras de jogos.

column8: Yo no tuve ningún crasheo. Te recomiento que lo juegues tú para tener una opinión propia y no guiarte por lo que dicen terceros. Me gusta mucho la saga y he disfrutado el juego. A pesar de ser una llamada de atención completamente vacía a los fans de la franquicia, el juego se puede disfrutar. Me gustó :)

La historia es bastante buena para no ser del Team SH original, pero tiene su propia alma que lo hace interesante, lo malo es que el juego esta muy mal optimizado para jugar en PC. 
Tienes que buscar de manera externa para solucionar esos errores.

Review:
Dude, totally into the whole series vibe, but gotta admit, this game's been a rollercoaster of suffering for me, especially with the hardcore mode. Like, there are these enemies you just can't even touch, and they gang up on you. Heads up, gameplay's kinda meh, feels like stumbling into a Dark Souls without the whole attack pattern thing, The Needler and the Schism can shove a metal pipe up their ass.

Honestly, if you wanna enjoy the story, better off watching a gameplay vid cuz it doesn't really add much to the Silent Hill lore, aside from a couple of endings.

Review:
Dude, totally into the whole series vibe, but gotta admit, this game's been a rollercoaster of suffering for me, especially with the hardcore mode. Like, there are these enemies you just can't even touch, and they gang up on you. Heads up, gameplay's kinda meh, feels like stumbling into a Dark Souls without the whole attack pattern thing, The Needler and the Schism can shove a metal pipe up their ass.

Honestly, if you wanna enjoy the story, better off watching a gameplay vid cuz it doesn't really add much to the Silent Hill lore, aside from a couple of endings.

column8: esta complicado decidir si darle pulgar arriba o abajo, el juego es bueno. sacando que el 1 el 2 y el 3 son mejores pero la comparativa seria injusta porque este silent hill es suficientemente bueno para sostenerse por si mismo. pero los problemas técnicos que tiene lo hacen complicado de disfrutar, cada tanto crashea (yo no instale ningún parche y me crasheo 2 veces), ademas de que pasando la mitad del juego, empieza a congelarse momentáneamente, cuando se congelaba yo esperaba y arrancaba, pero es molesto porque pasa a cada rato, también los fps no son estables y hay roturas visuales que en las opciones gráficas del juego no se puede arreglar. en definitiva, si tenes forma de arreglar los fallos, el juego es disfrutable y lo recomiendo

column8: Desde mi experiencia... no pude ni jugarlo, apenas lo abrí se quedó la pantalla en negro y el sonido del juego si sonaba. Me hubiese gustado poder jugarlo ya que he jugado todos los anteriores y soy fan de la saga pero por lo visto no fui al único que le hizo pasar mal rato. De saber que iba a ser así simplemente compro otro juego.

TL;DR -- I played it once and don't recall playing it again, not even to see the other endings. In the context of Silent Hill 2 and 3 I can't really think of a worse thing to say about Homecoming.

Here is a list of gripes in no particular order: It's buggy AF. It does that weird thing American horror games do where when a new monster shows up it grabs the camera, some stage lights make all the blood, spit, and leather/plastic/metal on it sparkle, and the monster does a little tap dance just to make sure you get to see all the work the character modelers did despite the fact that whatever Freudian mess the design team thinks is scary is way less scary than battling your own instinct to want to know what the hell that thing you sort of see in the darkness is and not wanting to find out if it can murder you. You get *two* annoying sidekicks and I could not be bothered to save one of them and I'm pretty sure you aren't given the option to not save the other one. Alex is so good at combat that the monsters aren't a threat for most of the game apart from the odd gimmicky bossfight [spoiler](despite the fact that Alex's entire background as a war hero is a delusion and he doesn't have any military training *at all*)[/spoiler], which loops back around to the developers not really getting what makes a horror game scary. The plot borrows so heavily from "Jacob's Ladder" that I'm surprised there wasn't a lawsuit. Morality systems in games are always dumb and man alive is this one is dumb. Homecoming's morality system decides which ending you get and for some gobsmacking reason mercy killing Alex's horrific mother instead of letting a machine [spoiler]her guilt[/spoiler] tear her to pieces nets you a bad ending point--nevermind that Alex has been basically mercy killing [spoiler]undead children and/or their murderous parents[/spoiler] every bossfight up to that point. Also it turns out that Alex's family is supposed to [spoiler]sacrifice a child every generation to Silent Hill's God by drowning and Alex killed his brother *by drowning* but somehow this didn't count and it's Alex's family's fault that the town earned Silent God's ire[/spoiler]. Really, the writing is just such a mess that it's impossible to take its plot seriously at all.

Petty gripe: giving me a combat roll automatically makes it not a horror game because I'm going to be rolling past every skippable fight while making Link's combat roll noises to myself and giggling.

You get *two* annoying sidekicks and I could not be bothered to save one of them and I'm pretty sure you aren't given the option to not save the other one. Alex is so good at combat that the monsters aren't a threat for most of the game apart from the odd gimmicky bossfight [spoiler](despite the fact that Alex's entire background as a war hero is a delusion and he doesn't have any military training *at all*)[/spoiler], which loops back around to the developers not really getting what makes a horror game scary. The plot borrows so heavily from "Jacob's Ladder" that I'm surprised there wasn't a lawsuit. Morality systems in games are always dumb and man alive is this one is dumb. Homecoming's morality system decides which ending you get and for some gobsmacking reason mercy killing Alex's horrific mother instead of letting a machine [spoiler]her guilt[/spoiler] tear her to pieces nets you a bad ending point--nevermind that Alex has been basically mercy killing [spoiler]undead children and/or their murderous parents[/spoiler] every bossfight up to that point. Also it turns out that Alex's family is supposed to [spoiler]sacrifice a child every generation to Silent Hill's God by drowning and Alex killed his brother *by drowning* but somehow this didn't count and it's Alex's family's fault that the town earned Silent God's ire[/spoiler]. Really, the writing is just such a mess that it's impossible to take its plot seriously at all.

Petty gripe: giving me a combat roll automatically makes it not a horror game because I'm going to be rolling past every skippable fight while making Link's combat roll noises to myself and giggling.

mediocre

Jogo impecável no quesito história, plot, uma trilha sonora não tão marcante e presente, mas que faz seu trabalho. Com certeza meu top 5 da franquia. Infelizmente, como todos comentam, é verdade que esta versão da steam é lástimável. cheia de bugs dos mais diversos tipos, desde travamentos, crashs, falta de compatibilidade com joypads e bugs sonoros, além de também serem relatados bugs de impedem seu progresso na história, porém, não cheguei a presenciar, creio que sejam bem raros. Apesar de tudo, existem pela internet afora projetos que consertam 90% de todos esses bugs e te deixam com uma ótima experiência, caso você tenha interesse em dedicar mais uns 20 minutos antes de jogar para procurar, baixar, e instalar esses mods e fixes, além da tradução em português, valerá demais.

Bel gioco un must to have per gli amanti della saga, peccato solo per il pessimo porting. A riguardo del porting ho lasciato una piccola guida per poterlo giocare e riuscire a goderselo appieno: https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2880178559.

2nd Edit:
Well, I finished it.  It is extremely buggy and does crash on occasion.  The sound engineering is awful and not very useful when playing (which is like, kind of a huge part of Silent Hill, ya?)  I hated the end boss and the ending.  It wasn't too difficult or anything, just kinda stupid.  #sorrynotsorry

Overall not horrible, but also I wouldn't consider it worth the time to play.

Edit:
My friend helped me figure out how to make this work!!?!?!  It still crashes occasionally and has its bugs, but I am now halfway through the game!

First of all, it helps tremendously to change the display resolution to 1280x720.  Then we used DXWnd to make it run in its own modal, fixed-ratio window.

And that was it!!  Like I said, still a bit touchy... but totally plays!!!  Will update my review later with whether or not I actually would recommend this game.  So far it's still a 'no', but I'm not hating it that much (otherwise I just wouldn't play it lol).

Silent Hill: The Movie: The Game.
What, those words aren't enough to convince you this is the weakest of the main entries?

Well, I guess I'll elaborate.
Homecoming, in contrast to its four predecessors and Origins, is a linear experience: It focuses on combat with some light puzzle solving, and the combat owes more to Condemned: Criminal Origins than it does Silent Hill: Combos like "Light-Light-Strong" and "Strong-light" rule the melee space, and firearms are literally overpowered, the handgun killing enemies in two shots if you aim properly. Making things worse is that unlike in Condemned, ammo drops are as present as any other main Silent Hill game (albeit reduced to the power of a gun this time) This means the game utterly fails as a Silent Hill game despite it sharing DNA with what came before. And further more, the nickname of "Silent Hill: The Movie: The Game" is well earned: This game owes far more to Chris Gans' loose adaptation than the series prior. The Nurses and The Boogeyman (Pyramid Head) all return in their appearances from that movie, the Smog is LITERALLY a redesigned version of the film version of the Lying Figure from 2, and the game lacks the brand of subtlety from the series prior much like that film. Because of this, Silent Hill: Homecoming feels like a very blatant attempt by Konami to ride the coattails of Capcom's success with Resident Evil 4, and the results are... flawed.

So... Why do I find this game to be overhated despite also being the weakest one?
Don't get me wrong: It's flawed, the PC port is inert without the UnknownProject patch, and all the reasons above. But Homecoming is still a damn fine outing in its own right: The controls feel fine, the combat mostly clicks (ESPECIALLY ranged due to the guns being OP), monster designs are pretty fun, and the atmosphere feels genuine. Scare-wise, the game is home to the best version of the iconic Otherworld, and there are a few good monsters and jumps that will catch first-time players off guard, so it does work as a horror despite the aforementioned flaws. You can tell as you play that developers The Collective were doing the best with what they were given, and it's pretty fun despite its flaws. It's honestly tied with Daikatana as the best "bad" game I've ever played. So if anyone is curious about Silent Hill as a franchise... Start with Silent Hill 2 with the Enhanced Edition mod. But still go ahead and buy this. You can do much worse than Homecoming when it comes to survival horror.

column8:
Como um cara que conseguiu terminar mais de um Silent Hill, incluindo esse em específico, posso dizer com todas a palavas possíveis que esse jogo, como seus antecessores é muito bom. Tanto a história, personagens, cenários, monstros e as musicas são muito boas. E se você for como eu que se assusta com coisas bobas... bem vindo ao barco.
Dito isso, o jogo não é perfeito, ele apresenta muitos problemas de desempenho, como lag, travamentos, lentidão e principalmente crashes, acabando muitas vezes com o ânimo e o proveito de muitos fãs do game. Problemas esses que por ser um porte é até esperado, mas vindo de uma empresa grande é um tanto desapontante se comparado com outros portes feitos por fãs que existem por aí. Um exemplo seria o porte do SH2 para PC que temos que concordar... é um bom porte. No meu PC pelo menos ele nunca crashou :D . Por fim, recomendo imensamente o game, mesmo tendo esses problemas, porque é tão bom quanto os anteriores...
PS: Existe o "Unknows Patch" (se não me engano esse é o nome rsrsrs), que se instalado, ele melhora mais o desempenho, mas você tem que configurar é claro...
Muito bom, é um ótimo jogo

Benim favori oyun serim Silent Hill. Bundan önceki tüm oyunlarını ne olursa olsun zevk alarak bitirdim. Başka oyunlar için de eğer çok kötü birşey olmazsa mutlaka başladığımı bitiririm. Ancak bu oyunu 2-3 sefer yükleyip denememe rağmen bitiremedim. Oyunun zorluğundan vs değil. Oyundaki hata ve buglardan. 1-Kamera açıları çok buga giriyor. Bir anda görüş gidiyor. 2- Oyundan o kadar çok atıyor ki. Birkaç defa sırf bu yüzden çok eski bir save e dönmek zorunda kaldım. 3- Kaçma mekaniği çalışmıyor. Düzgün bir şekilde savaşmak neredeyse imkansız. 4- Grafikler yılına ve porta göre bile kabul edilemez derecede kötü. 5- Oyunun kayıt sistemi iğrenç. Oto-save olmaması kesinlikle normal çünkü eskileri de böyleydi ve haytta kalmayı daha çok hissettiriyor. Ancak böyle ilerlemeli bir oyunda bu kadar az save konumu olması kabul edilemez. Mesela otel ölümünde neredeyse tüm bölüm bitti ancak taa en başa dönüp ya kaydetmeliyim ya da öldüğümde hepsi gidecekti. Ve geri dönerken öldüm. Siz yakındaki kayıttan başlar diyorsunuz ama yüklenirken oyundan attı "yine" ve baştaki manuel save e geri dönmek zorunda kaldım. Oynayamadığım ve satın aldığım için o kadar üzgünüm ki. Malesef bu yapılan port kötü değil, bu seriye bir hakarettir.

"Silent Hill: Homecoming" delivers a chilling and atmospheric horror experience that stays true to the unsettling legacy of the Silent Hill franchise. The game excels in creating a nightmarish ambiance, with its eerie environments and haunting sound design. The storyline, filled with psychological twists, keeps players engaged as they unravel the mysteries surrounding Alex Shepherd. The combat system adds a visceral intensity to the gameplay, enhancing the overall sense of survival horror.

However, it's important to note that the gaming experience is marred by consistent crashes, affecting the overall enjoyment. Despite this technical drawback, the game's strong narrative, disturbing visuals, and psychological horror elements make it a worthwhile addition to the Silent Hill series for fans of the genre.

column8:
Bu saatten sonra bu oyunu indirimden alan olur mu bilmiyorum ama yine de oyunu almayın.Oyun bozuk.Oyun düzgün çalışıyor olsaydı da pek tavsiye edeceğimi sanmıyorum.Neden bu oyunu önermiyorum;
Kontroller iyi değil,oyunda kontrollere alışana kadar acı çekiyorsunuz.Yaratıkları öldürmek hiç keyif vermiyor.
Hikaye anlatımı yok gibi bir şey zaten.Öyle çok orijinal,sizi çok şaşırtacak bir hikayesi de yok, e zaten birçok şeyi oyunun başından da tahmin edebiliyorsunuz,o yüzden oyun sizi hikayeye kilitlemiyor.
 Mekanlar bomboş.Mekanın size yalnızlık hissi,tekinsizlik hissi vermesi gerekirken sanki adamlar doldurmaya üşenmiş gibi geliyor.

(He bir de en çok takıldığım şey Pyramid Head'i neden bu oyunda da görüyoruz? Pyramid Head tuttu diye cılkını çıkartana kadar kullanmak zorunda değillerdi.Bir de boss falan da değil ara sahnelerde geçip duruyor.)

Save sisitemi....Eğer oyun save noktasından uzak bir noktada çöktüyse geçmiş olsun.
Oyunu almayın dememenin en büyük sebebi oyunun sürekli çöküyor olması ve bazı kilit noktalarda bugların olmasıdır.Bir yerde boss buga giriyor vuruyorsunuz,vuruyorsunuz ikinci faza geçmiyor. Boss ikinci faza geçene kadar bi yarım saat oynuyorsunuz,haliyle kaynak tüketiyorsunuz ve boss savaşı bittikten sonra kaynaksız kalıyorsunuz vb.

Sİlent Hill serisini seviyorsanız oynayın ama gidin başka yerden indirin. Ben mazoşistim diyorsanız hiç kaçırmadan alın :d Sevimli dostlarımızdan kaçarken ki gerilimi seviyorsanız,oyunu  deneyin derim :d
Jogo muito bom, quando você aprende a tirar a porra do mosquito da cara ninguém te mata

He jugado todos los silent hill, puedo decir que realmente la ambietacion es algo muy decente y realmente tiene escenarios interesantes. La historia se desconecta de la saga del team silent. Este port para pc es horrible, con constantes crasheos y bajones de fps. Sin embargo, gracias a la comunidad, existe un parche que permite mantener 60 fps estables y una calidad Full HD, este parche soluciono los problemas en su mayoria y pude disfrutar del juego. (Cabe resaltar que aun asi con el parche, se puede llegar a crashear el juego por lo que es muy recomendable guardar constantemente, igualmente solo se me crasheo una vez despues de instalar el parche.) Sin dudas es un Silent Hill con mucho potencial, con un buen combate y una historia que hubiera podido encajar con la historia del 1 y el 3 si se hubiera tenido una mejor construcción del guion.
Para mi esta entrega es un 6/10, me la pase muy bien jugandolo pero es un mal port y no es el mejor juego de la saga.
yyyy!! es un silenhill ¿q mas se puede decir? tenes q jugarlo pa formular tu opinion. Gran juego

there's the classic silent hill stuff at the heart of the subject. the chasing after someone we love. i'll admit it has a few flaws. like constantly closing when you alt tab. i had to play some parts 4-5 times, but you can solve most things with one button. besides that, the team that developed the game is the americans, not the japanese. even though the places and people that silent hill series is about belong to america, all these have been told to the player through the filter of people who have been fed with japanese culture until today. now this american game company cannot dare to make this game for the pleasure. of course these producers are people who have devoured the whole series, they sat down and put their heads together. too many bad comments but i liked it. it's enough that it's silent hill and it's part of it for me.

silent hill means loneliness, trying to survive, fog, very rarely encountered people and none of them are solid shoes.  it's the horror of facing your deepest, darkest fears, traumas and afflictions in a metaphysical and terrifying form. your biggest internal problems coming to literally terrorize and harm you. that's what this game made me feel, so that's enough again.

i love nurses i have to cosplay them one day. and the pyramid head here. i don't know what he's doing here! we're not supposed to see him except silent hill 2. he's a judge that only james can see and he symbolises his own sins in james' story. bosses are great thanks to use of christian imagery and connections. 

AHHHHH AKIRA YAMAOKA, I LOVE YOU.

silent hill means loneliness, trying to survive, fog, very rarely encountered people and none of them are solid shoes.  it's the horror of facing your deepest, darkest fears, traumas and afflictions in a metaphysical and terrifying form. your biggest internal problems coming to literally terrorize and harm you. that's what this game made me feel, so that's enough again.

i love nurses i have to cosplay them one day. and the pyramid head here. i don't know what he's doing here! we're not supposed to see him except silent hill 2. he's a judge that only james can see and he symbolises his own sins in james' story. bosses are great thanks to use of christian imagery and connections. 

AHHHHH AKIRA YAMAOKA, I LOVE YOU.

atmosferi, keşif hissi, bulmacaları ne kadar şahsına münhasır olsa da ve milletin neden silent hill markasını sevdiğini bir tık anlamış olmamı sağlasa da günümüz şartlarında aşırı baş ağrıtıcı sorunları var. 
en temelinden 3 kronik sorunu var: 

1- alt+tab yaparsanız oyununuz kapanıyor 
2- oyun içi ara sahnelerde ses sorunu (sesin tek taraftan gelmesi gibi) var 
3- 30fps locked

bu üç temel sorunun dışında da oyunun bir yarısı keşif hissiyken diğer yarısı olan dövüş mekaniklerinde de çok sıkıntı var. kontrol şemaları olsun kamera açısının sapıtması olsun animasyonlardan dolayı bazen düşmanın sizin saldırınızı ignorelaması olsun baya baya kanser olacaksınız. 

özetle; internetten patch yapın. patch'siz halini önermiyorum.

column8:
I've heard so much shit about this game in the past. I've heard that it's unplayable garbage. I've heard that it's bugged beyond belief. I've heard that the story sucks, & that it fails to capture the spirit of Silent Hill. Well, let me tell you from a totally unbiased standpoint that this game is a perfectly good, spooky, uneasy time. Of course it isn't going to be better than the original Silent Hill, but that isn't what it needs to be. This game is spooky, mysterious, & definitely feels like a true Silent Hill title. Almost all the mechanics are still intact from the map system to the way you explore the town to the enemies. The only real impactful difference is the combat system, which I do admit is fairly clunky at times, but definitely not unplayable garbage. Now, the bugs are definitely an issue, but the game is definitely still playable. Especially for a game that didn't get a single bug patch or any post release support whatsoever. If you like Silent Hill & have been back & forth on playing this game, just remember that bugs are an issue, but as long as you save as often as you're supposed to then you will have a good, fun Silent Hill experience. 

6/10 for me!
