column8:
(edited for formatting)
TO GET THE GAME RUNNING:

The PC port is pretty borked and needs unknownproject’s patch in order to run properly (it still crashes on alt-tab though)

For some reason I also had to copy (NOT CUT) GLOBAL.PAK from Engine > pak > PC into Engine > pak > extras

If you invert y-axis on aim, it un-inverts it on look. If you want to fix this, go to Engine > vars_pc.cfg and change
cameraInvertFirstVert=false
cameraInvertThirdHoriz=false
cameraInvertThirdVert=true
to
cameraInvertFirstVert=true
cameraInvertThirdHoriz=false
cameraInvertThirdVert=false

ONTO THE ACTUAL REVIEW (please note that my recorded playtime as of reviewing is incorrect because I played a lot of it offline):

The actual game is… fine, I guess, although it takes a bit of a dump all over the continuity. If you pretend it’s from a different franchise it’s an okay horror/action game.

The plot, without going into spoilers, is interesting enough, but is somewhat of a rehash of previous entries. The combat is kind of annoying with the way it makes you lock onto enemies, but not unbearable or anything. You can’t really avoid enemies because you just end up with a big line of guys chasing you down the street. Because of this, you’ll be using way more health drinks than you should be, which is annoying because the game is pretty stingy on them. Keep multiple saves so you don't softlock.

Save point placement is awful. When you first get into town, your first objective is to get to your house. There is no save point in your house. You are expected to go to the town hall whenever you want to save. This would be fine if it just told you to go to the goddamn town hall in the first place. There are a lot of points where there is no save point available after doing a particularly long level/"dungeon", or a puzzle, or basically any time where you’d expect there to be a save point. It literally feels like the developers stuck the level maps to a wall and threw darts to decide where to put the saves.

The inventory system is pretty badly designed, in the sense that it’s kind of awkward to use and it’s way too easy to accidentally use your consumables.

If you can get past all of that, it’s a decent enough game. I really wish steam had a middle option, because it isn’t a terrible game and I enjoyed what I played of it, it’s just that I can’t recommend it with the amount of flaws that it has. It feels like it needed another few months in development.

Good things in this game:
Fun boss fights
Decent monster design
Good ideas/plot outline, even if it isn't always executed well
Real-time otherworld transformation. *chef's kiss*
Great soundtrack as always
Decent atmosphere

I highly recommend reading the 3 diary entries on the Silent Hill wiki before you play because they establish the backstory and characters.

Also get it on sale because the full price is absolutely ridiculous for what it is lmao

column8: Recomendo bastante este jogo, para quem curte jogos do tipo Horror-Survival!! Esse jogo é muito semelhante ao Resident Evil

Mas com uma jogabilidade e os controles horríveis, principalmente o combate que é uma piada. Agora o port pra PC é um dos piores que já vi (senão o pior de toda steam), mesmo com os mods de correção o jogo continua travando e fechando sozinho e com quedas de FPS constantes. Consegui até zerar, o que foi um milagre. Só comprei por estar custando 3 pila e por gostar da série silent hill e nunca ter terminado esse. Não recomendo.

It would be an okay Silent Hill game if it wasn't so messy. In the 3 hours since I first started, I had an insect clip into Alex's head and get stuck there, the game crashed maybe 4 times, and Alex completely just vanished for no reason for a good 30 seconds. 

Aside from that, the visuals are great considering the game's age, the music is masterful, and the story is a little cliché but not terrible.

If you can get past the technical issues, the game is fine. But I can't recommend playing it in this state.

column8:
Do not buy this game from Steam. 5 hours into game play and the combat controls (fast/strong on the PC using keyboard) stopped working. All I can do is dodge and die. I tried starting a new game, that did not work either. Because I have played more than 2 hours I cannot get a refund EVEN WORSE Steam offered nothing in regards to a work around. This Games has been around a long time, which means this glitch as been around for a long time. NOTHING has been done? Horrible, just horrible. I am so disappointed. I LOVE the Silent Hill games that I have played and have been away from gaming for a long time. I was so excited to play. Should have just bought the game from a platform that supports the products it sells.

Update: I actually found a fix... no thanks to Steam. I still do not recommend buying this game from Steam. The game is well done. Jump scares, high creep factor, great story, decent graphics.

column8:
This isn't a horrible game, but a horrible port. I couldn't finish the game because my save file corrupted, I'll try to keep it as neutral as possible:

Technical Issues:
- Controller support sometimes works, sometimes doesn't (If it doesn't you have to remap it manually from the system files, but that's how I got my save file corrupted)
- Constant crashes (You have to reload your latest save, no checkpoints)
- Unskippable cutscenes
- Locked at 30 FPS

Game Issues:
- The combat was quite clunky
- It seldom gave any sort of healing
- Bland voice acting, mediocre animations

Putting all these aside the game's strong points are the ambience; they nailed the SH fog and the OST (By the legend himself Yamaoka Akira). I've heard the lore is pretty good, With 7 hours on the game I didn't get very far into the story but it was okay.

I cannot recommend this game to anyone at full price. It occasionally drops to $2 ish, you can get it then. It's not a huge waste, but even with the fan-made patch, it was unplayable for me.

- Bland voice acting, mediocre animations

Putting all these aside the game's strong points are the ambience; they nailed the SH fog and the OST (By the legend himself Yamaoka Akira). I've heard the lore is pretty good, With 7 hours on the game I didn't get very far into the story but it was okay.

I cannot recommend this game to anyone at full price. It occasionally drops to $2 ish, you can get it then. It's not a huge waste, but even with the fan-made patch, it was unplayable for me.

column8:
A culpa do controle nada tem a haver com o jogo, os drivers para constroladores sao feitos pelos programadores do sistema operacional gênio, alias esse comentário é bem típico do pesssoal que gosta de uma janelagem, que sequer tiveram a dececência de programar um driver oficicial para o dualshock4 se bem que uma empresa que nunca conseguiu desenvolveu u m navegador o que você pode esperar, nao vejo a hora e e isto esta proximo dos jogos rodarem todos nas distribuições linux voltadas ao púlico leigo.
Voltando ao jogo ele é muito bom, nao tão bom quanto o 2 ou o 3 mas é sim sem sombra de duvidas um exelente jogo comparado com essas inumeras porcarias sem sentido de sobrevicencia online, terror de sobrevivencia, the last of lixo e toda essa porcaria pseudo-intelectual prefiro jogos mais honestos que sao toscos e assumem isso como five nigth e todos aqueles jogos de terror todos iguais que alias já tomaram conta da steam, uma pena nao ter um meio termo, indico um jogo bem legal chamado the best inside of me que descobri aqui na steam, quando homecoming hoje em dia ele soa como uma obra prima
o jogo é tão desafiador que até pra configurar os controle é um verdadeiro  desafio , agora eu entendi porque falam que esse é um dos piores silent hills.

Tô começando o jogo e sinceramente, tô curtindo dms. Achei a gameplay muito boa, a ambientação e a trilha sonora assustadora e gostosa de ouvir. O jogo tem sim alguns problemas, não sei se é só comigo mas o áudio do jogo fica só de um lado do mic ás vezes. Enfim, não posso comentar sobre mais nada nessa analise por que ainda não terminei, mas assim que terminar vou voltar aqui e dar meu veredito final desse game.

Por enquanto é 8/10.

column8: 日本之反人类操作游戏

Sümüklü ağlak zırlak erkek kardeşimiz Joshua'nın peşinden koşturmacalı keyifli bir oyun. Diğer Silent Hill oyunlarına göre epey basit ve kesinlikle korkunç değil fakat ben bir Silent Hill nerd'üyüm ve tüm oyunların içinden geçeceğim. (Bıçağı elimize aldığımızdaki çıkan sesi seviyorum.)

[h1]Silent Hill: Homecoming[/h1]
[hr][/hr]
SHH je akční hororovka, viděná z pohledu třetí osoby, kdy se v kůži hlavního hrdiny vracíte domů z válečné mise a zjišťujete, že vaše městečko Shepherd's Glen je zahaleno mlhou, téměř vše je zavřeno, masivně se tu ztrácejí lidé a městem se pohybují podivná monstra. Je na vás, aby jste pochopili co se tu děje a případně se pokusili změnit osud města i ten svůj.

[u]KLADY:[/u]
+ pěkný vizuál, byť se jedná o hru z roku 2008
+ hratelnost
+ audio
+ pět možných zakončení
+ dlouhá herní doba

[u]ZÁPORY:[/u]
- Scarlet boss fight (miniboss asi v polovině hry) je brutálně těžký a po mnoha neúspěšných pokusech jsem musel nahrál předchozí checkpoint a vyzbrojil se i palnými zbraněmi a i s nimi to byl tvrdý oříšek 
- chybí hororová atmosféra - jde spíše o akční hru 
- hra je zamčena na 30 FPS
- bez ohledu na nastavení jsou občas dialogy vůči ostatním zvukům velmi tiché  
-  Unknownproject's Patch zlepšuje vizuál, odemyká FPS, zrychluje nahrávání, ale hra je pak extrémně nestabilní a  ve Quick Time Eventech se nezobrazuje, jaké tlačítko / klávesu máte zmáčknout - bohužel nepoužitelný patch

[u]HODNOCENí:[/u] 
I přes ne zcela ideální technický stav konzolového portu pro PC, nepoužitelný neoficiální patch a střetnutí s jedením opravdu nefér téměř nesmrtelným bosse v polovině hry  se jedná o titul, který má i v roce 2022 potenciál nabídnout milovníkům žánru dlouhé hodiny kvalitní zábavy. [h1]70%[/h1]

Puta intente jugarlo pero la caga de port se crashea, se relentiza y se pega, tiene problemas de sonido y las texturas de los objetos se ven como el piko... eso, queria jugarlo como en su tiempo en PS3 pero pucha injugable aqui en Steam. 

Video de lo Injugable que es: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7EAv2AYX7AU&feature=youtu.be&ab_channel=Wargr

KONAMI CONCHETUMARE!!!!!!!!
A saga é tão boa que está tendo como paradigma de influência os novos residents evills
Please fix this I want to play it

column8:
As a massive fan of this franchise and someone who enjoyed a lot of things in Origins, Shattered memories, and Downpour, this might be one of the worst games I've ever played. I could go on about how it misunderstands the series and it's lore, but ultimately I don't care about all that as long as the rest of the game is good. It's not. This game is awful to a almost comedic level. The gameplay is awful, the story is awful, the characters are awful, its not scary, its not fun. 

The PC port is so fundamentally broken that even after I installed mods to help fix the game, it still didnt work. On a fresh install it would crash randomly and 100% crash every time I tabbed out. I have a friend who couldn't play the game stable in anything but a 600x900 window. AFTER I installed the fixes the game would STILL crash at random points, and the save system was completely broken. If I ever died or loaded a save, instead of taking me to where I saved, it would take me to the nearest checkpoint. These checkpoints are only present at the start of new areas. This means every time I got to a new area I needed to play through the entire section till the boss without dying or the game crashing, or I would have to replay the entire thing. This game is 9 hours, my playthrough took 18 because of this. And all that is only maybe 10% of the issues I had.

There are only 3 things in this entire game which I actually think were well executed. The music as always for this series is great, the otherworld visuals and monster designs were for the most part interesting, and maybe 15% of the time the atmosphere was nice until it got interrupted by a glitch or the awful combat. If you are going to subject yourself to this hell, do it on the console version at least. 1/10

[b]Warning[/b]
This game is a straight up console copy & paste.
A lot of bugs are present in this game.

[b]Unplayable[/b]
I got to a boss-fight about 6 hours into the game and upon completing the boss-fight the game crashes,
I retried the boss-fight 5+ times, however the same thing happened each time. So it's impossible for me to get past the section. I then took to google and couldn't find any fix, reddit posts with the same crash all turn up to say you would have to download a save game that skips the mission/has it pre-completed. However all savegames are 100%  complete ones.

[b]Refund[/b]
I attempted to get a refund as i can't play the full product (Technically a scam), however i got the stupid auto-reply email stating how i have too many hours to apply for a refund.

column8: Bom 7/10

Despite from it's terms of gameplay wise, clunky controls, wacky storyline, and Chippy AI, the gameplay of the premise of Silent Hill is unique, from 1, saving your daughter, 2 all of it being about James realizing his death, 3, being able to play as the daughter of Harry Mason, and 4th being somewhat random, but keeping the relationship of silent hill, Homecoming took a different approach, and made it, if Homecoming was a revelation game, Homecoming may have an unoriginal concept and storywise, the game itself is very fun and memorable, once you compare the game towards Downpour, which i do believe its a bad game, (even if i haven't tried it out), Homecoming was a longshot of being the best and positive game for me, for the entire life, just like Resident Evil 5

So, if You can accept all this, You can get veeery good horror game that reminded me the mix of Dead Space, Resident Evil and The Evil Within, which is the best possible review I can give after all. 
If You think RE:4 remake is too far distant in the future and You have nothing to play, just buy this and be satisfied!

column8: Aunque no sea el favorito de muchos o cambie cosas que ya se habian establecido en las anteriores entregas esta disfrutable

Ok this is NOT a good game. Straight up it's pretty bad. The port job sucks it takes fan patches to even approach running decently, and will never run perfectly, it's not scary, it makes a mockery of Silent Hill lore, the story is a lot of nothing for like 4 hours and then in info dumps the last hour, oh and it's like only 5 hours long, it's the most linear game in the franchise most of it is walking down hallways, the graphics aren't impressive even for the time textures are muddy, character animations are stiff, the combat sucks enemies stun lock too easily and you can easily beat the whole game with the knife as a result, the puzzles are like elementary kid level and.... I've played it for over 40 hours and completed it like 5-7 times.

WHAT THE HELL!? I keep coming back to it. I'll never understand why. It might be that it's easy and brainless. It's a good turn your brain off and let your instincts take over as you listen to a podcast kind of game. It also could be that it borrows a lot of it's visual design from the Silent Hill movie which regardless of what you think of the film you gotta admit it looked pretty cool. IDK but if you're a weirdo like me and like mid-tier games that kinda look and sound neat, aren't difficult, and can be a fun puzzle to even get running this is a decent buy.

column8:
En resumen es el dark souls de los silent hill. No tiene una buena trama pero podes esquivar golpes como en el dark souls. No tiene buen diseño de personajes, pero tenes parry como en el dark souls. No tiene sentido la cantidad innecesarias de armas que agarras pero tiene combos como en el dark souls. No tiene buena musica pero hay jefes como en el dark sous.

En resumen, la historia es malisima parece que la hubiese escrito mi sobrino. La musica sin sentido y en situaciones que nada que ver. Los personajes eran todos iguales. Y las armas cualquier cosa por que te daban 6 armas a mele y 2 range. Y el final fue mas malo que el de breaking bad. 

Este juego tenia todo para competirle a aquellos que se golpean el pecho diciendo que silent hill 2 es mejor pero la pechearon como benedeto contra corinthias. 

SI TE LO REGALAN COMO EN MI CASO, bueno que podes esperar, jugalo y listo esta bueno, le terminas buscando la vuelta xq los pve estan buenos. Ahora si tenes que comprarlo, solamente te diria si esta barato y para que confirmes con tus ojos que es medio poronga. 

IMAGINATE que lo jugue una vez y saque el MEJOR final, siendo yo que en mi vida nunca pude tomar decisiones buenas
el juego se peta de vez en cuando, teniendo en cuenta que es un port de ps3 no es un problema muy grave. Ambientación muy buena e historia bastante decente

Kay, I'll be completely honest with you, I'm only writing this because I saw I had 45 hours in this game and I am still wondering how the hell that happened. Well, I'll get down to brass tacks. First, lemme say that I have always been a Resident Evil fan first and foremost, and while I also love Silent Hill, there's no doubt that I'd rather vacation in Raccoon City. However, one thing that I've always admired about the late, great Silent Hill is its willingness to stick to its guns. And strangely, Homecoming is actually proof of this fact. This is the most action-packed, the most in-your-face, least subtle Silent Hill game of them all, and yet it somehow still feels like a Silent Hill game. When you get to Resident Evil 5 or 6, you may ask yourself, "is this even the same series anymore?" But when you get to Homecoming, it's like, "yep. Same series." Which, quite frankly, is impressive.

Which, quite frankly, is impressive.

No point beating around the bush, this is easily the worst of the Silent Hill franchise and its an awful port to boot. 

I really enjoyed the first 2 Silent Hill games because they provide a lot of interesting narrative and unique ideas to the horror genre. 3 wasn't the worst thing I've ever played, but it sure wasn't great. 4 has somehow evaded me to this point, but I can emphatically say that with the concept of The Room, at least they are trying something different when compared to this game, which is a massive flop of old ideas poorly executed. 

I did not finish this game, and I feel no need to in order to finish a review for it. My opinion at the end of the game would most likely remain largely the same as it is right now, and I feel no obligation to torture myself with 10 more hours of something I don't enjoy. 

The combat feels like it belongs to a different game. Someone in my chat described it as suffering from the RE syndrome of the early 2000's where every horror game suddenly wanted to be both horror AND action, I think thats a good way to put it. The enemy encounters are far too frequent and more annoying than scary. The combat itself feels clunky and while I'm sure there is strategies to overcome this, I shouldn't have to cheese the game to win.

The story is... lacking? I should mention, that Deputy Wheeler's character is a marvel to exist in a horror game from the 2000's. He subverts so many tropes. He sees the monsters and isn't part of the "well you're just crazy, I'm gonna keep on moving instead of helping" crowd, and he is a black character that DOESNT IMMEDIATELY DIE in a horror game. Seriously, that never happened, so thats pretty awesome to see. 

That being said, the plot overall is almost like watching one of the later Saw films. It still has the bones of the originals, kinda, but ends up just retreading ground that didn't need to be walked over again and doing it in an uninteresting and ultimately unenjoyable way. 

Its worth mentioning that the game crashed on me 4 times, one resetting me about a whole half hour back, and I have a pretty high end PC, so I would tend to blame it on the port rather than something my PC is doing. 

Pass on this one, there are a lot more horror games you could spend your time AND money on, or just go emulate SH1 and 2 again, those both hold up and will give you some good times if you haven't played em yet. 

If you made it this far, thanks, and I would appreciate a follow on my steam curator page. I mainly review indies but I do my best to give the view from a thousand feet for all prospective buyers. 

[code] Check out my steam curator page for more reviews on (mostly) indie games: https://store.steampowered.com/curator/42143664/ [/code]

vamos la, eu joguei esse jogo a mais de 10 anos atras e foi muito maneiro, sou bem fã de silent hill . 
foi legal re-jogar .
otima trilha sonora do Akira, Ost linda como sempre. 
ambientação e Monstros  Bem legais, personagens Bem mais ou menos, os Boss são sem graça,fracos e muitas das vezes te prendem o atacando sem deixar o Alex levantar, bem chatinho. 
o combate é facil alex diferente dos outros protagonistas é um militar logo consegue se dar bem com eles. 
o jogo é muito inspirado no filme, oque é bom ja que o filme introduziu coisas legais, mas o Pyramid Head aqui eu ja não gosto...  mas as enfermeiras bem maneiras... 

essa versão de PC é horrivel se comparar a de que console que joguei na epoca, e sem falar que não tem os trofeus nessa versão... é ruim mesmo. 

peguei na promoção por menos de 4 reais e valeu a pena... para quem gosta de silent hill vale...

column8: I personally enjoyed the story and the concept of the game. I can see why people say it seems a little out of place for a silent hill game. But I DO like the take they went for with the story. It does have some plot holes like some games do. The boss fights are pretty basic but the boss designs were pretty good and thought out well. The game also was pretty enjoyable for me personally even with the crashes for only paying $3. I've been checking the game and series out for years and have finally recently jumped on the silent hill series and started with homecoming and am not disappointed. The dodging mechanics are sometimes a little janky. But once I got a pattern down with it I was unstoppable almost. I also felt for Alex even tho I read some comments and remarks about alex.  I give the game 8.3/10 it was pretty enjoyable again even tho I had crashes. If you are looking into playing or getting the game. I'd recommend getting it on sale at least and to just play the game in 720 to avoid the extra crashes doesn't stop em all but makes it happen less.

column8:
This is quite possibly the worst PC port I have ever encountered (even worse than GTA IV), because it just sucks. I've played this game some time ago on an old PS3 and the game itself isn't bad (although it's still one of the weakest Silent Hill games, and I have played them all). 30 fps lock isn't that big of an issue for me, the biggest problem is constant crashing, extremely long loading times and corrupted saves.

Even with unknownproject's patch, my save games refused to work (the game would crash as soon as I load them). This is really annoying especially how far in between save points are (you could lose 20-30 min of progress just because the game decided to screw you over).

As for the gameplay itself, well it sucks. The game has puzzles here and there and they are not difficult (apart from that annoying sliding puzzle, use a guide for that one unless you want to get stuck forever). The combat is a total mess, but if you learn to stun lock the enemies with knife/ceremonial dagger, you could get some enjoyment out of it. You can also use guns in this game and you are given the opportunity of free aim, since the game plays in third-person view.

Also, use only knife/ceremonial dagger for melee combat and don't even bother with other melee weapons, and use guns only against bosses and tougher enemies.

If you really want to play this game, try to get it for Xbox 360 or PS3, and don't even bother with this awful PC port.

column8:
Listen, I'm going to be honest with you here when I say that this game doesn't run the greatest on the PC. I enjoyed this game near it's original release on my first play through (playstation) and I was absolutely engulfed in the story. If you're a big fan of technicalities and worry too much about "lore", please don't buy the game. I'm a very big Silent Hill fan and while I didn't appreciate a lot of the inconsistencies throughout the story, the game IS worth playing as a Silent Hill game at all (and even more certainly worth playing as its the on Steam available SH game).

I honestly didn't mind that this game was more combat oriented and found it really funny considering the story. I found the controls to be pretty manageable, however I've had a few instances of my game freezing or crashing, nothing too wild but better hope you'd hit a save point!

With all this being said, I do recommend this game but I don't recommend paying full price.. try to get this while it's on sale and enjoy yourself! Don't read too much into it and just have fun with the game for what it is and also, enjoy the music!!!!!!!

Um dos piores que ja joguei, não só da steam mas de toda a minha vida, jogo fraco, esquecível com graficos feios pra época, fisíca bugada, os bichos atravessam a parede do nada e grudam em voce que nem um imã, a mixagem de som é horrorosa, me pergunto como não fiquei surdo jogando isso, Aqui acaba a analise do jogo em si, que joguei no meu ps3 a algum tempo, agora esse porte da steam, a konami deveria ter vergonha de ter feito, essa porra crasha toda hora, além de nem ter um suporte descente para os controles tem, uma tremenda vergonha, pra rodar razoavelmente voce precisa baixar fix feito por fã, mas porra, eu paguei pelo jogo e tenho que ficar pegando fix da Internet, coisa que a empresa que fez o porte deveria ter arrumado antes de lançar essa praga pra steam, resumindo, não recomendo nem jogar esse jogo que é uma merda nem comprar na steam porque o porte é um dos piores que ja ví.

Lo recomiendo, pero ojalá Steam tuviera un botón para marcar un juego como "Méh". Los Silent Hill siempre serán increíbles y, personalmente, este fue el primer SH que jugué y completé, y debido a ello siempre tendrá un lugar especial reservado en mi corazón. Pero así como digo unas cosas, también digo las otras: este juego es uno de los peores de la saga. 

La historia, los personajes, la atmósfera tétrica y decadente, la ambientación infernal y la banda sonora son, como siempre, lo mejor de lo mejor. En cuanto a temática de horror refiere, cualquier Silent Hill deja muy por atrás a la mejor entrega de Resident Evil, y eso yo lo valoro y respeto. Los personajes están bastante bien logrados, la historia es poderosa, entretenida y muy intreresante, la ambientación es espectacular y, personalmente, la banda sonora de este título me parece la mejor de la saga. Pero... Aquí es donde el vino se vuelve vinagre.

Normalmente, al criticar los puntos negativos que tiene un juego, trato de desligarme un poco de las opiniones generales, pues nunca me ha gustado ser una especie de canario que solo sabe repetir lo mismo. Esta, sin embargo, es una excepción, pues no solo la comunidad tiene razón en sus quejas sino que, comparándolo con otros juegos de la franquicia, el terrible bajón de calidad es como una patada en el trasero con treinta metros de impulso. La cosa está potente, así que empecemos de una vez.

- Primero, y lo más importante: el pésimo port de PC. En la versión de ordenadores el juego, en ocasiones, se vuelve injugable. Bugs, crasheos, bajonazos de frames, algunas cinemáticas se traban... Los tres peores que me han ocurrido son los siguientes. Uno, en el que, cada vez que vuelvo a abrir el juego y cargar partida, algunos de los controles se desconfiguran, y eso me putea demasiado. Dos, que puede arruinarle la experiencia a los más try hards y puristas, ya que si te atascas en un boss por cualquier motivo, haces Alt+F4 y vuelves a entrar, por algún motivo los jefes son mucho más fáciles. Y tres, el peor de todos: cuando vuelvo por segunda vez a Silent Hill y trato de buscar una forma de entrar a la prisión, el juego crashea y se queda en el umbral entre la pantalla de carga y la zona a medio cargar. Puede quedarse así perfectamente por 5 horas y no va a cambiar. Cuando lo jugué pirata hace algunos años me pasó lo mismo, y no pude acabarlo debido a ello (cosa que no ocurrió cuando lo jugué por primera vez en consola). De verdad, el port de PC es de lo peor que he visto.
- El juego se siente demasiado lineal, más acción que survivial horror, y eso le quita la esencia. La dificultad no está mal, pero no va acorde al espíritu de la saga. Los tiempos de carga son excesivos. Siento que, en ocasiones, la voz de los personajes está increíblemente baja.
- Homecoming tiene los mismos problemas de serie de la saga Silent Hill: jugabilidad torpe y acartonada, gráficos de van de lo regular a lo malo, mal rendimiento general... Normalmente, al ser defectos "de fábrica" serían más perdonables, pero solo resaltan más los fallos del propio juego.
- El fanservice es excesivo. No me molesta en lo absoluto que Pyramid Head aparezca en un cameo (algo de fanservice bien hecho nunca queda mal), ya que al propio Alex lo corroe la culpa. Pero no hay ninguna excusa con el resto de los enemigos que, básicamente, son todos de anteriores entregas. El peor ejemplo son las enfermeras. Eso arruina por completo el espíritu de Silent Hill, donde cada monstruo, cada lugar y cada situación significan algo. Los bosses están bastante bien. De hecho, perfectamente colocaría a Asfixia y Amnion en el top 5 o 7 de los mejores jefes de la saga, por todo cuanto representan, su diseño y su lore, pero con tan pocos jefes y tanto reciclado de enemigos no puedo simplemente disfrutar este título como se merecería.

Si eres pionero en la saga Silent Hill no lo recomiendo, o puede que la experiencia tan regular que ofrece te coarte y te prive de experimentar la que es la franquicia de terror por excelencia. Empieza por el 2, el 3 o el 4, pero no por este. Homecoming está hecho más que todo para los veteranos y puristas de la saga, y aún nosotros quedamos insatisfechos. Sigue siendo mi juego favorito de la franquicia (porque fue el primero que jugué y todo eso), pero no quita que sea uno de los peores de la saga. Aún así, recomiendo jugarlo para aquellos que deseen disfrutar de una magnífica historia, con personajes interesantísimos y una banda sonora de primera categoría, todo en una amalgama que forma una increíble experiencia de terror y horror psicológico. Eso sí, prepárense, pues no les aseguro que la experiencia jugable sea tan siquiera agradable.

Si quieres jugarlo, consíguelo pirata, en un emulador o espera a alguna rebaja, pues realmente no vale el precio que tiene.

column8:
Silent Hill: Homecoming funciona perfeitamente no Linux 😁  É só selecionar a versão do Proton, baixar, e ser feliz.

Dica: Máquinas mais simples é bom colocar o game em Modo Janela. Infelizmente essa opção não aparece dentro do game. Tem que mudar manualmente no arquivo "vars_pc.cfg" que fica em "/home/SeuNomeDeUsuario/.steam/steam/steamapps/common/Silent Hill Homecoming/Engine"

Dentro do arquivo "vars_pc.cfg" é só mudar em "FullScreen=true" para "FullScreen=false" e salvar. Aí o game abri em Modo janela.

Distro: Linux Mint 20.3
Usando o Proton 7.0-3

Se você gosta de Silent Hill, procure outra forma de jogar. Horrível. Se quer jogar aqui tenha em mente que você irá precisar: Jogar em um resolução perto de 1366x768 (pra não bugar os mapas), baixar uma tradução pt-br, baixar um patch de som 5.1 o deixar o pc em mono e rezar pra que o jogo não crashe do nada no meio de uma boss fight pela quinta vez consecutiva. PS: tentar arrumar os controles da forma mais confortável que achar, os padrões são ruins.

DIFICULDADE
🔲 Mamão com açúcar 🔲 Normal
✅ Difícil 🔲 Que isso meu?

VALE A PENA?
✅ Me arrependo 🔲 Pra passar o tempo
🔲 Foi divertido 🔲 Vai querer jogar o dia inteiro

GRÁFICO
🔲 Confuso 🔲 Ruim ✅ Padrão 🔲 Lindo
🔲 Pintado pelos Deuses

NARRATIVA
🔲 Nem tem 🔲 Rascunho 🔲 Tem que ir do ponto A ao B
✅ Te motiva a continuar 🔲 Pode fazer um filme agora

JOGABILIDADE
🔲 Irritante ✅ Dois botões 🔲 Padrão de qualquer jogo
🔲 Deveras interessante 🔲 Fluidissimo

BUGS
🔲 Não vi nenhum 🔲 Bugs visuais 🔲 Bugs na jogatina
🔲 Um pouco de cada e crashs ✅ Lançaram o jogo ainda no Alpha?

100% NA STEAM
✅ O jogo acaba com 100% 🔲 Fica mais um tempo fazendo
🔲 Tem que rejogar 🔲 Tenha em mente que demora muito
🔲 Ou eu fico feliz ou eu faço 100% ✅ Impossível
Pra quem é fã da saga vale a pena jogar...

column8: oyunu fazla oynamadım ama sıkıldım bayıyor bir süre sonra.
Ótima história, a gameplay é boa. Porém os gráficos as vezes dão uns bugs. Mas no geral é um excelente jogo. Recomendo!

Ni aun jugando de manera legal soluciona los bugs, me alegra averlo comprado a 2 dolares que si no me molestaría mas.

Los errores mas notables fueron:

-Controles que se quedan por defecto aunque los cambies
-Crasheos
-Pantallas de carga larguísimas
-Un bug de los botones que hace que cualquier enemigo que te agarre te haga instakill.
-Congelamientos del juego que tardan en volver a la normalidad
-Hitbox raras que te impactan aunque esquives
-Animaciones torpes que no esquivan bien haciendo que te tragues los ataques
-Bajones de fps

Al final no pude pasarlo, llegue con un jefe que se te pega rapido cuyos ataques son agarres,  eso sumado a los arreroes de arriba se traduce en:

Inicia la batalla se te acerca en un segundo y aunque esquives te agarrara y hara instakill por la falla de los botones y despues esperar un largo rato hasta que cargue el checkpoint para volver a intetar y que se repita lo mismo.

Esta Basura es injugable, no vale la pena ni por 2 dolares.
Quando eu vi o valor e as fotos, eu falei: Esse jogo deve ser muito ruim. Mas quando eu comprei e joguei por 5 minutos. Mano, que jogo foda. Tô viciadão kkk

Bu kadar kötü olduğunu tahmin etmemiştim. Oyunun eksikleri var. Hikaye ve sunum konusunda çok sıkıcı ve klişe geldi. Oyunun korkutma yöntemi ucuz geldi. Önünüze bir anda tekerlekli sandalye geliyor. Bence bu tarz yöntemler çok kalitesiz geliyor. Vuruş hissi yok. Duvara vuruyor gibisiniz. Arayüzü beğenmedim. Oyunu klavye de oynarken 1 tuşuna basmamı istiyor. 1 tuşuna basınca bir şey olmuyor. Bazen tuşa basmam gereken yerde tuş yerine kırmızı bir simge çıkıyor. Eski oyunlarda yapılan iyi şeyler bu oyunda yok. Tembelce yapılmış bir port olduğunu düşünüyorum. Zaten hali hazırda yapılan şeyleri bu oyuna neden koymadınız? İndirimlerde 3TL oluyor. Korku oyunu severler göz atabilir. Seriyi sevenlerin beğeneceğini sanmıyorum
Bu arada alt+tab yapınca oyun kapanıyor :) 
Konami diğer Silent Hill oyunlarını yayınlar mısın? Mgs serisini de unutmayalım.
Konami Can you release other games in the silent hill series? PS: don't forget mgs series :)

Não vale a pena
Silent Hill a franquia toda é uma obra prima do terror! Pena que nunca veremos o "P.T" e nenhum outro novo titulo da franquia.

Silent Hill Homecoming está longe de ser um dos queridinhos pelo público. Comparar esse game com outros da série chega a ser desleal, tendo em mente que os três primeiros jogos da franquia são muito acima da média, e estão no topo do gênero. E isso deixa a imagem de Homecoming abaixo do que ele realmente é. Quando o colocamos em uma prateleira de jogos de terror genéricos, com poucas expectativas de grandeza, ele tende a ser um jogo divertido.

Ainda assim, conseguimos encontrar pontos positivos a se destacar. Dentre os quais, a trilha sonora de Akira Yamaoka, o designer de algumas criaturas também devem ser levadas em consideração e eu diria que até certas partes do roteiro e a atmosfera que ele constrói. Mas seus grandes defeitos, e os pontos negativos que mais me atingiram, ficam a cargo do péssimo porte do jogo no PC. Entre bugs, crashs, engasgos e inclusive, desses o que mais me incomodou, os tempos de load, que são muito muito altos.

Eu só te recomendo jogar Silent Hill Homecoming se você realmente quiser muito jogar, porque do contrário, as chances de você desinstalar o jogo depois do primeiro crash ou bug são bem altas, e eu sei que existem mods para corrigir esses problemas, mas a grande realidade é que pessoas que jogam casualmente não querem se preocupar com essa dor de cabeça. Então jogue por sua conta é risco.

As a game this game is like a 3/10 because at a functional level it's pretty bad and the plot and characters are pretty dumb. It also has crashes and various performance problems. HOWEVER, THIS GAME IS SO BAD IT'S HILARIOUS! I have finished this game and I have to say that it's some of the most fun I've had in a long time. The jank and crappy story of this game make it so captivating that you can't look away. And although the game is pretty horrid, the enemy design and music are actually fantastic.

column8:
Acabei de zerar o jogo aqui 100% em 30 horas, se tem alguém que pode dar uma Análise sincera dessa perfeição de jogo sou eu:

➤HISTÓRIA DO JOGO: A Trama é muito bem trabalhada, você começa sem intender nada do que está acontecendo e termina o jogo chocado por compreender como tudo se encaixa perfeitamente;
➤GRÁFICOS: Obra de Arte impecável, nível de detalhes absurdos, vai rodar no seu PC sem problemas é bem otimizado mesmo que não tenha placa de vídeo;
➤JOGABILIDADE: Muito intuitivo, o jogo te explica muito bem o que você tem que fazer "sem dizer o que tem que fazer";
➤PUZZLE: São difíceis se você não prestar atenção nas coisas como elas se apresentam, foram feitos para quem nota detalhes e presta atenção.
➤ No geral a Gameplay se torna viciante, o mapa é grande, bastante exploração, enigmas para desvendar sem ficar com trava mental sem saber oque fazer pois é tudo bem objetivo, nada repetitivo ou enjoativo e toda luta é unica.

➤Agora vou falar dos pontos ruins... tenho que ser franco com você, mas te darei as soluções para os problemas:
✅O jogo não tem legendas Português (Mas tem na GameVicio só baixar e instalar pelo navegador)
✅O jogo Crasha do nada (Patch2.5_PreRelease corrige isso e muitas outras coisas que melhoram o que ja era bom antes)
✅O jogo é travado 30 fps (Fix 1.7 - Steam006 corrige isso, você fica com 60fps e te disponibiliza a resolução 1360x728)
🔲Usando a Resolução 1360x728 você não conseguira fazer os dois primeiros Puzzle (Estante do Quarto do Josh e Caixa de energia em Silent Hill por problemas de resolução, terá que usar 1280x720 "padrão do jogo" até passar por essas duas etapas, então salve o jogo e inicie em 1360x728 que não terá mais nem um problema depois desse tipo) 
✅ O jogo pode Crasha quando você for abrir seu jogo salvo (Relaxa é so fechar o jogo e os programas que não esteja utilizando no momento e o mais importante, de um Atualizar na área de trabalho, resolve sempre você não perde seu save nunca pode ficar tranquilo)
🔲✅ O áudio do jogo, Usando fones de ouvido de qualquer tipo, do lado direito você escutará os sons de passos e ações enquanto do esquerdo as trilhas sonoras e sons ambiente, Não creio que isso seja um erro e sim um diferencial porem você não saberá de que lado o inimigo está vindo, fato curioso 'as vezes da pra escutar eles no lado esquerdo vai entender, mas não é algo que atrapalhe só um diferencial mesmo.

➤Vale apena comprar ? Sem a menor sombra de dúvida.

Ne surtout pas acheter ce jeu sur PC.

Au début, je pensais que le jeu allait tenir puisque je n'avais pas rencontré de bug/freeze ou quoi que ce soit, mais à partir d'une heure de jeu, j'ai complètement changé d'avis sur le jeu ! 

Silent Hill est une très bonne licence, mais celui-là, vaut pas la peine surtout ce PC qui n'est pas du tout optimisé pour.. Le jeu est bien bloqué à 30 fps même si on peut régler ça dans les fichiers du jeu, mais pour moi ça me génait pas réellement, en revanche, les freezes et crash me gène énormément, c'est impossible de jouer sans crash ou de freeze tout les 20 minutes, dans chaque cinématique, dans chaque sauvegarde, et même au plein milieu du jeu, c'était vraiment horrible, on prend pas du tout le plaisir de jouer à cette licence comme j'ai pu avoir sur les autres Silent Hill. On sauvegarde pas par peur de mourir mais par peur de crash.

Je comprends pourquoi les autres Silent Hill ne sont pas sur PC si c'est pour nous vendre de la merde comme ce jeu, croyez-moi, ça vaut pas la peine.

A ne surtout pas acheter, même en promo (1.99€) où j'ai pu souffrir durant 8h de jeu, en priant à ne pas crash.

Uno de los mejores Silent hill. He tirado la versión no oficial y he comprado la oficial y lo he comprado como tantos otros similares juegos, por que es uno de esos juegos que debes tener en tu colección de Steam.

Puedo decir tranquilamente que este es uno de los peores Silent Hill que pudieron haber hecho después del Downpour pero tuvieron los huevos suficientes para hacerlo completo.

Puntos a favor:
+El soundtrack es muy bueno porque obviamente Akira Yamaoka es un Dios y Elizabeth McGlynn es una genia.
+Jefes espectaculares, Asfixia es uno de los más terroríficos que se hicieron.
+Buen apartado gráfico, lindo a la vista.
+Buena historia, atrapa desde un principio y muy buen plot.
+Mecánica y gameplay divertido.
+Buenos personajes y buen protagonista.
+Curioso sistema de decisiones que no viene mal, lastima que la terminaron de cagar con el Downpour.

Puntos en contra:
-Pesimo port, jugarlo en un emulador me sale más barato.
-Enemigos, todos reciclados de juegos pasados. 
-Poca exploración, es demasiado lineal.
-Es un survival horror donde no te sentís indefensos porque acá podes dar hasta volteretas, cualquier cosa.
-Occidentalización completa de la entrega, es demasiado yankee este juego y perdió toda esa cultura japonesa que venía con los anteriores, sobre todo el SH4.
-Pyramid Head es una representación personificada de los deseos de ser castigado de James Sunderland, así que no sé que c*rajos hace acá él.
-Las enfermeras también, ellas eran parte del trauma de Alessa en el hospital. Así de sexualizadas era por la frustración sexual de James, otra vez, no sé que hacen acá.
-Demasiado fanservice y dos millones de referencias a juegos pasados, literalmente el pueblo y apellido de Alex es Sheperd (Apellido de la ex mujer de James) dejate de joder Konami.

Conclusión:
Como juego funciona y es divertido, en menos de 6 horas tranquilo te lo pasas. Como Silent Hill es creo que el peor que jugué con diferencia, por no decir que este es el culpable que la saga perdiera el rumbo junto la esquizofrenia de Konami. Recomiendo este juego en oferta grosa, porque realmente no vale lo que cobran.

Agreguen logros, mínimo eso.

F*K KONAMI!!

column8: Let me just start off by saying I'm a huge Silent Hill fan, and I think this was a natural addition to the cinematic universe, it very clearly followed aesthetically in the footsteps of SH3 and the first movie, and the protagonist is probably the most relatable since Heather and seems to deserve his own personal hell the least. It's very Jacob's Ladder, and depicts PTSD and strained family relationships wonderfully. BUT I hate this port. I've only ever made it as far as the house, and usually I encounter a difficulty interacting with key objects long before that point. It's also way too difficult to use the keyboard controls, and none of my controllers are compatable. This is the biggest tease of a game on Steam, and an absolute waste of money.

column8:
Listen, I'm going to be honest with you here when I say that this game doesn't run the greatest on the PC. I enjoyed this game near it's original release on my first play through (Xbox) and I was absolutely engulfed in the story. If you're a big fan of technicalities and worry too much about "lore", please don't buy the game. I'm a very big Silent Hill fan and while I didn't appreciate a lot of the inconsistencies throughout the story, the game IS worth playing as a Silent Hill game at all (and even more certainly worth playing as its the on Steam available SH game). 

I honestly didn't mind that this game was more combat oriented and found it really funny considering the story. I found the controls to be pretty manageable, however I've had a few instances of my game freezing or crashing, nothing too wild but better hope you'd hit a save point!

With all this being said, I do recommend this game but I don't recommend paying full price.. try to get this while it's on sale and enjoy yourself! Don't read too much into it and just have fun with the game for what it is and also, enjoy the music!!!!!!!

With all this being said, I do recommend this game but I don't recommend paying full price.. try to get this while it's on sale and enjoy yourself! Don't read too much into it and just have fun with the game for what it is and also, enjoy the music!!!!!!!

[h1][strike]돈 줎곲 셊곖 쵮곲읪 횞삾 콦낪밊읪 벖긊; 삾짒 맚셊욦: [/strike][/h1]
(콘솔은 없는데, 평소에 사일런트힐에 관심을 가진 경우는 제외)

1. HD(1280×720)를 초과하는 해상도 못해먹어요.
블랙스크린 나오고 반응이 없어요.

Win+Tab 키 눌러서 새 데스크탑 모드로 간 다음, 
데스크탑 2에서 작업관리자로 강제종료 해야돼요.

게임이 된다 해도 지도나 그림이 잘려서 나와요.
모드 깔아야 해요.

2. 30 FPS 고정돼요.

모드 설치하고 설치 파일에 있는 vars_pc.cfg 파일 수정해서 
해상도와 주사율 변경 가능해요.
해상도는 ScreenResHeight, ScreenResWidth
주사율은 fpsLimit, maxFPSLimit 
수치 바꾸면, 4K, 144fps 가능해요.

하지만, 그래픽카드 리소스 별로 안먹어요. 
재대로 활용 못한거에 가까워요.

3. 한글 미지원.
한패 깔아야 해요. 

4. 커서 2중으로 나와서 거슬려요.

5. 충돌 많아요.
게임이 중간중간에 멈추고, 
간혹 게임이 예고도 없이 팅길 수도 있어요.

6. QTE 판정 너무 구려요.
열심히 버튼 난타해도 죽어요.
게임 재시작 해야 돼요.

 [url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=OJLOcTrOST8]모드[/url]
 [url=https://gall.dcinside.com/mgallery/board/view/?id=savedragon&no=2910]한패[/url]

모드, 한패 둘 중 하나만 적용하세요.
둘 다 적용하면, 게임 시작도 못하고 팅겨요.

모드 깔았다 해도 안심하지 마세요.
어느 순간이 되면, 게임 진행도 못할 정도로 문제가 생길 수도 있어요.

고로 이 게임은 글리치도 아닌 버그 그 자체 입니다.
버그만 아니라면, 게임 자체는 할만 해요.

column8: MUY MALA LA CALIDAD, CORRIJAN pesimo se ve horrible y se para trabando el juego.

Bon j'étais sur le point de laisser un avis positif malgré les crash et freezes omniprésents, mais le jeu ne veut même plus se lancer et fait buguer mon PC.

"Homecoming was developed with a stronger emphasis on more interactive combat."

This game is hell, If it weren't for me streaming this game with friends I would have turned it off very quickly, theres just so many things wrong with it, ignoring the fact that it's not a good fit for a Silent Hill game.

Crashes - Plenty of them, mostly when I entered or exited the Shepard house, losing approx 40mins to and Hours worth of my time.

Freezes and Slow load times - Especially when saving or entering new areas in later stages of the game, i'm talking a solid minute or more by the end.

Lighting Issues- Pretty minor to be honest, but often characters eyes and teeth would be blacked out

Sound issues - Sound only coming through on ear, badly balanced, or some enemies appearing not to have proper voicelines play.

Lipsync - minor to me but it's bad

Puzzles that potentially softlock your game - The Mask puzzle later can and did ruin one of my save files, thankfully I was warned about this and had backups

Camera glitches - always when interacting with some objects like valves, it's clearly broken but a bit funny

Massive FPS Chugging in the later parts of the game

Guns not working ... like seemingly at all, at least the Chromehammer pistol did nothing for me the entire game


Control Issues - In general the combat in this game sucks, it's dreadful and I hated every second minus one thing which is the silly spin attack move the knife has ... but tonally It doesn't fit at all in this game, it's so stupid.

-Enemies will stunlock you, all the time. This especially goes for bosses
-You're rolls have little or no invincibility frames, so even if you try to roll you'll often get hit
-Enemies attacks and movements are faster than yours, especially Bosses, so even if you try to dodge you'll get hit, this is compounded by the lack of I-frames (Backwards dodging is the safest )
-Hitboxes are fucked, enemies will hit you when you clearly rolled away, and you won't hit enemies when you clearly did
-Horrible hit detection, especially noticable later in the game when enemies stopped staggering, there was no impact sound or animation often, for guns I got no indication they did anything, and i'm sure they didn't do anything - the only indication is sometimes enemies will have weird red marks on them
-Having to lock on to attack is frustrating, I often found myself not having enough time to dodge > reposition > lock on > hit because something knocked me on my ass already, this encapsulates bossfights.

-Bosses have a stupid amount of health, it's never obvious what you have to do, like the Aspyhxia fight were you cant damage her from the from despite looking like so. And her movements don't work well with how your meant to defeat her.

-The best way to beat most enemies is to stunlock them, with something like the knife in my experience, it just saves you the headache .. which if i'm resorting to breaking the game, means it's badly designed.
-Needlers are perhaps the worst enemies in existance, having the ability to block melee and RANGED weapons by just standing still, the aim I think is to go round or to the side/back of them, but theyre so fast you can't, the lock on system just prevents you, and then if you get caught int their grab you have to do a Quick Time Event!

LET'S TALK ABOUT THOSE QUICK TIME EVENTS

They suck, a relic of the time and don't belong in this game, especially since theyre broken. I died so many times to these because I needed to cling to my mouse and slam my fingers down so fast, it was so tiring. Bosses will spam these at you forcing to use most of your healing items, and regular enemies will use these too, often killing me in parts of the game where the last save point was 20-30 minutes back.

The WORST instance by far is the drill scene where It wouldn't work, thats right I didn't even finish this trashpile of a game because the QTE was impossible for me. I tried installing fixes, using an autoclicker and other savestates but couldn't get past this section, it's broken and comes so close to the end of the game, just a massive final F-You.

-The amount of enemies the game throws at you is horrendous. In the medical offices before the 2nd boss it will spawn 5 nurses to fight you in a tight corridor or small room ... WHY, why would there be 5 nurses here and why so many? Especially when the combat is so dire.

-Items, ammo and healing placements are really bad, most of the game I had no healing items because the enemies forced me to use them all, You get a lot more near the end but presumably you need those to combat more shitty enemies. Ammo was laughable. For a good 3 hour section in the middle I had no ammo, and after that my guns stopped working, making firearms completely useless. 

-As mentioned save points were also a problem, with early on them being very far apart, which didn't help in the section where the game crashed the most and I had no healing items ... horrible balancing.

-The map is broken, a pain to look at and it just looks bad all the time

-Exploration is also really linear and I was never really rewarded for exploring

-Some creature designs are copied from other parts of the series with no regard for their symbolism or meaning, Pyramid Head, Nurses, the closer like enemies "Siams"

-Other enemies have very basic horror designs that don't fit very well into Silent Hill in my opinion

-The cultist enemies are stupid, the look dumb, don't belong in a SH game, have very bad VA and sound effects

-Generally the game is so frustrating and glitchy that your never afraid, enemy noises would spook me, not because they were scary but because it meant I needed to use the god awful combat system and go through my resources again.

-The story is either trite, predictable or robbing off a movie or the franchise, see Pyramid head, or scenes heavily taken from movies like Jacobs ladder or Hostel.

-If it's not those things it makes little sense

-Characters aren't nearly fleshed out enough, you might see them two or three times throughout the whole game, and often the first time you meet it's not notable at all. They try to go for something with these characters, especially the Shepard family but it all falls flat because theres no reason to care about any of them, theyre bland, look bad, and don't feel like they have a reason to exist.

-Wheeler being the exception because he's kinda funny and makes some sections of combat playable because you have help

-The cult plot kicks in so late into the game and is so sudden, it just falls flat

-The fact that an Objective menu needed to exist is telling to how confusing the game is, because its so hard to understand what the hell you're meant to do at any given time ... like why am I going through this graveyard? 

-Also the objectives often don't help at all, especially at the end of the game, it's so half-assed, just "look for josh" or something similar.

-Often I would have to backtrack around rooms, to find something so unobvious , just confusing and messy map layout.

- The endings felt anticlimactic, or downright insulting like the Pyramid Head ending, the UFO ending is the only good one because at least it's funny.

This game is a nightmare, and theres still more bits I could nag about it. Stay clear, ignore this steaming trashpile, it's the worst game I've ever had the displeasure of playing.

column8:
Contém spoiler!

Depois que participei de forma indireta do acidente que causou a morte de meu irmão mais novo, minha família tornou-se indiferente para comigo e me culpam pelo fato à ponto de me internarem em um hospital psiquiátrico, onde tenho pesadelos, vejo representações de fatos através de confusas visões, fico ciente da idiotice de minha família e de mais 3, compostas de fanáticos religiosos que fundaram uma ceita, praticavam rituais que consiste em matar um de seus filhos à cada 50 anos para inibir a "ira" de seu deus e com a morte de meu irmão e meu internamento, o ritual óbviamente está incompleto, o caos se instala e dentre os 4 finais... opto por dá fim a forma corrumpida da representação de meu irmão.

The game is unplayable due to how shoddy the port is and legitimately the worst experience I've ever had with a game. Even with fan patches, the game is incredibly unstable. With manual saves still being in this game, expect to regularly lose hours of progress due to the game crashing for no discernible reason. The map doesn't even render if you play at higher than 720p without the patch and there is no option for controller buttons (the fan patches don't even fix this issue entirely). You're better off buying a PS3 or Xbox360 copy if you absolutely must play this game, which is exactly what I've done.

Legitimately a 1/10.

column8:
Imposible recomendarlo debido a su pobrísima versión de PC.

Como Silent Hill, Homecoming siempre fue un título que me gustó. Soy un gran amante de todo lo que tiene que ver con esta saga en la cual nunca encontré una mala entrega. La primera trilogía sigue siendo pura historia inamovible de la historia de los videojuegos, junto a The Room, Origins y Shattered Memories, que para mí son unos añadidos maravillosos. 

Homecoming, aún con sus fallos y sentido del combate más imperantes, siempre me gustó especialmente por mezclar con gran acierto la vertiente más psicológica de los personajes junto a la trama del culto de Silent Hill.

Por desgracia, esta versión para PC es un producto horrible: 30fps capados y con caídas, nulas configuraciones, crasheos constantes y problemas en la compatibilidad para mandos. En la comunidad pueden encontrarse varios fix, yo por ejemplo conseguí eliminar el ruido de imagen y poder colocar los botones correspondientes a los del mando de Xbox. A partir de ahí, poco más.

Como puede verse en mis horas de juego le he dado varias oportunidades pero tras un par de crasheos, he decidido dejarlo. Una pena porque era un título que me hacía ilusión volver a jugar después de aquellos años en mi 360.
super

Woof

This is everything I did to make the game run 'somewhat' properly:

1 patch for 60 FPS. Installing it asks to create a shortcut but I still ran it through Steam because the shortcut creates saves separately and I wouldn't be able to use a Steam custom controller configuration (more on that later)

Another patch for audio which only improved it slightly. Audio was still low most of the time. The patch also recommended installing a Razer sound driver but when I tried using it, I got no audio from my PC so I wan't able to benefit from that driver.

And another patch for controller button prompts. Unfortunately it didn’t give the prompts for boss fights so I had to fumble my way through those. Also halfway through my playthrough, the prompts changed from Xbox to Playstation and I couldn’t fix it.

[So that’s 3 patches all with unintentional side effects. When the fan made patches are as problematic as the crappy port you know it’s a total **** show.]

Lastly I created a custom Steam controller config because trying to remap controls in game is ill advised. Not only is it nearly impossible to tell what button is what because they all were all just labeled generically but I would also get double functionality on some things. 

Also, the default speed of your character is jog and I prefer walk like in the previous games and rather than just trying to hold halfway on the stick for most of the game, I instead lowered LS sensitivity so pushing it all the way would still only walk and then mapped 100% sensitivity to a button when I wanted to run. Of course I had to unmap the button so it didn’t do a game function. (I chose the weapon menu and moved it to clicking in the left stick because that didn’t seemed mapped in-game and also because you can cycle through the weapons with the dpad so the menu wasn’t all that necessary).

I then did close to the same thing for the right stick because I found the sensitivity to great but once I acquired a gun, found the sensitivity I changed it to, too low while aiming so that needed 2 different sensitivities as well. At least with that I could map 100% to the aim button without the need to unmap it like I did in creating a ‘sprint’ button.

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Now here is everything I encountered during my playthrough:

2 crashes. Once the game just closed after the load screen following the first boss fight so I got to do that all over again. The second time gave an error message of too many something (I can’t remember) but following this crash is when my button prompts changed for the rest of the playthrough.

I couldn’t shift focus from the game to look up what to do when I got stuck because the game would just close after I tried to go back to it so I had to use my phone to look up what to do which was at least half a dozen times.

So it’s up to you really if it’s all worth it to even play this game. I’m a huge fan of the series and while this game in particular is middle of the road at best for the franchise, I still wanted to see if I could make it work. I was able to complete the game but in order to ever play it again I need to write a guide on not just how to run the game properly but also what to do in areas I got stuck in since I can’t alt+tab away to check online.

And so while I did enjoy the game in general there is 1 more criticism I have and that's the combat. There is a dodge mechanic that just doesn't fit. Staring closely at the enemy waiting for a tell so you can dodge an attack and quickly counter attack just seems out of place for a game like Silent Hill. It's no surprise this is the only game in the franchise to have anything like that.

So after all that, why am I recommending this game? I'm actually not, it's just when all you see are reviews that are mostly negative, giving another one will just get lost in the shuffle and won't benefit anyone when in fact there can be enjoyment found in this game if (HUGE if) you are willing to put in the work. Having said all that, wait for a sale. DO NOT pay $40 for this.
column9:
Woof

This is everything I did to make the game run 'somewhat' properly:

1 patch for 60 FPS. Installing it asks to create a shortcut but I still ran it through Steam because the shortcut creates saves separately and I wouldn't be able to use a Steam custom controller configuration (more on that later)

Another patch for audio which only improved it slightly. Audio was still low most of the time. The patch also recommended installing a Razer sound driver but when I tried using it, I got no audio from my PC so I wan't able to benefit from that driver.

And another patch for controller button prompts. Unfortunately it didn’t give the prompts for boss fights so I had to fumble my way through those. Also halfway through my playthrough, the prompts changed from Xbox to Playstation and I couldn’t fix it.

[So that’s 3 patches all with unintentional side effects. When the fan made patches are as problematic as the crappy port you know it’s a total **** show.]

Lastly I created a custom Steam controller config because trying to remap controls in game is ill advised. Not only is it nearly impossible to tell what button is what because they all were all just labeled generically but I would also get double functionality on some things. 

Also, the default speed of your character is jog and I prefer walk like in the previous games and rather than just trying to hold halfway on the stick for most of the game, I instead lowered LS sensitivity so pushing it all the way would still only walk and then mapped 100% sensitivity to a button when I wanted to run. Of course I had to unmap the button so it didn’t do a game function. (I chose the weapon menu and moved it to clicking in the left stick because that didn’t seemed mapped in-game and also because you can cycle through the weapons with the dpad so the menu wasn’t all that necessary).

I then did close to the same thing for the right stick because I found the sensitivity to great but once I acquired a gun, found the sensitivity I changed it to, too low while aiming so that needed 2 different sensitivities as well. At least with that I could map 100% to the aim button without the need to unmap it like I did in creating a ‘sprint’ button.

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Now here is everything I encountered during my playthrough:

2 crashes. Once the game just closed after the load screen following the first boss fight so I got to do that all over again. The second time gave an error message of too many something (I can’t remember) but following this crash is when my button prompts changed for the rest of the playthrough.

I couldn’t shift focus from the game to look up what to do when I got stuck because the game would just close after I tried to go back to it so I had to use my phone to look up what to do which was at least half a dozen times.

So it’s up to you really if it’s all worth it to even play this game. I’m a huge fan of the series and while this game in particular is middle of the road at best for the franchise, I still wanted to see if I could make it work. I was able to complete the game but in order to ever play it again I need to write a guide on not just how to run the game properly but also what to do in areas I got stuck in since I can’t alt+tab away to check online.

And so while I did enjoy the game in general there is 1 more criticism I have and that's the combat. There is a dodge mechanic that just doesn't fit. Staring closely at the enemy waiting for a tell so you can dodge an attack and quickly counter attack just seems out of place for a game like Silent Hill. It's no surprise this is the only game in the franchise to have anything like that.

So after all that, why am I recommending this game? I'm actually not, it's just when all you see are reviews that are mostly negative, giving another one will just get lost in the shuffle and won't benefit anyone when in fact there can be enjoyment found in this game if (HUGE if) you are willing to put in the work. Having said all that, wait for a sale. DO NOT pay $40 for this.

column8: Realmente no se como calificar este juego, por un lado nos encontramos con una historia interesante, unos excelentes jefes (muy aterradores) y una música muy buena. Dentro de lo malo esta que los enemigos comunes no son muy interesantes salvo un par, el reciclaje de las legendarias enfermeras del 2 o del mítico PyramidHead descuentan puntos. Pero el problema principal y por el cual pierde mucho es por el port a pc... Es horrible, catastrófico, vomitivo y repugnante, la hermosa música no se puede apreciar con detalle porque el sonido viene roto, los gráficos pierden mucho por la optimización, los bajones de FPS de la nada y los crasheos que a mas de uno le habrá ocurrido. Para solucionar esto existe un parche que resuelve muchos problemas, pero esto no debería ser así, el juego no tendría que venir en estas condiciones tan indignas. Si encuentras el juego barato creo que deberías comprarlo, porque a precio completo no lo vale. Si estas decidido a comprarlo, obtendrás un buen juego (quizás no tan bueno como la increíble saga original del team silent, pero que merece una oportunidad aunque sea), no te vas a arrepentir, pero estate listo para enfrentarte al horrible port que tendrás en frente, que sin dudas, es el enemigo mas difícil de este juego.
Tiene unos cuantos bugs, pero no son de cuidado, de ahi en fuera no hay problema alguno, y creo que el unico problema seria que al querer transmitir el juego por OBS se cierra
Joguim daora

Terrible port. Couldn't fix the game even with tons of modding and patching. The best state I could get it in still had audio issues where some sound only comes from one ear, which I found unplayable. While modding a game to get it in a working state is fine, it's not good practice to let publishers get away with this stuff. Don't support this.
Your best option would be to emulate the game. The PS3 version is broken and has audio issues too, so Xbox 360 emulation is the only way to go for emulation. Otherwise, just play the game on its native console. 
I ended up refunding this; I would not recommend buying it.

Update:
The PS3 emulated version no longer has audio issues, so it is a viable option for playing this game. However, the PS3 version had graphical issues for me that I can only describe as astigmatism. The Xbox 360 version has frame stuttering issues and the PS3 version looks terrible. Pick your poison, I guess.

Zapomnij! Krzysiek (Alex) robi co chce, a jak nie chce to też nie robi.

column8:
SH: Homecoming cumple su función de ser una auténtica pesadilla que logrará explotar tu cabeza. Pero empecemos por partes;
- En primera, el port a PC simplemente es un asco por dónde lo veas. Gritches, bugs y congelaciones de pantalla será el pan de cada día. El juego tiene necesidad de descargar un parche (hecho por fans) que haga que funcione relativamente "decente", pero ni aún así se logra salvar.
- En segunda; El mapeo de teclado y mando es literalmente una broma, ya que se resetea tras quitarse el menú donde configuraste éste mismo, en teclado está un poco aceptable su ubicación, pero vete  olvidando de conectar cualquier otro mando/control.
- En tercera; Pensaba que por no jugar las entregas "clásicas" del Team Silent mi opinión sería menos "estricta", sí es un tanto interesante lo que le ocurre al Alex, ya que es el prota, pero se ve que querían meter de a huevo otros temas como el culto o digamos, el mismo Silent Hll como ubicación junto con su "castigador" guiño, guiño.
- Cuarta y última; Vamos!!! tan siquiera le hubieran metido un poco más de ganas con la originalidad y variedad en sus monstruos.

Tremendo texto, en resumen; F**k this port & F**k Konami.

column8:
The game is very badly ported for windows, at the level that you'd get a better experience if you install linux and run it through proton. 
The Cutscenes and characters models are poorly made, everyone seems like they're on antidepressants and don't have any sort of expression at all, everything is very dead to be sure. 
The mechanics at the start look interesting, but as time pass, you'll notice that the only weapon you'll need, is the knive, just spam attack 1 with the knife, dodge some attacks and you're good. 
The story is the same as every silent hill post silent hill 3, traumatic event, memory repression, guilt trip, etc.
I'd say, if it wasnt for the bad port that makes you need to install a ton of UNOFFICIAL PATCHES to run it badly  (because it is unplayable), it would be like cold coffee, still good, cause it is coffee, but not as good as it was when it was warm (like how silent hill used to be on 3, 2, 1, you know).

column8: Si eres fan de la saga Silent Hill pues ni modo, es tu deber tener que jugar este juego, pero si lo quieres jugar por diversión mejor busca otro, esta muy mal porteado a PC, crasheos constantes, se congela la pantalla por varios segundos, bug que no permite hacer daño con las armas de fuego, animaciones inexpresivas en las cinematicas (gente hablando sin mover la boca por ejemplo), la mecanica de pelea muy mala tambien, ese boton de esquivar no funciona como deberia, la historia esta bien supongo pero a mi consideracion es el peor Silent Hill que he jugado hasta el momento. y es una lastima ya que los enemigos que ponen tenian mucho potencial.

This game is pure Evil.
But not in the way I would have liked it to be.
This game doesn't work for pc. I found so many bad feedback online about it. I would have liked to receive these info before I buy the game. After a short research I found a soluition. Or it seemed so. There is an external device you can download in order to play this game at the best on pc. The idea of download something extra to make the game work is already quite annoying.
I followed each steps (thanks to nice people who made videos on youtube where they explain how to set everything) and started to play.
Beautiful game.
A real horror game.
But when the horror comes also from the moveset of the character, you can just insult all the saints' mothers alphabetically.

Of course I unistalled the game and I decided to play another game, equally horror: Animal Crossing.
I would like to have the original game for Playstation in order to really appreciate this game. because it's a masterpiece anyway.

This might be one of my favorite games of all time :D I love the combination of action & survival horror, because I came from a background of action games (mostly Star Wars & Lord of the Rings). column8: I miss Silent Hill. I downloaded SH Homecoming because it's the only SH game available on Steam. This is a bad port. the amount of freezing that happened turned my 10+ hour experience into a 15+ hour one. The Sewer save point kept force closing the game, making me start a new game and be weary of any save point. The game itself is fine. Really dark even with flashlight, okay story and cool game play but out of place for Silent Hill. A dodge button and button mashing should never appear in a SH game. Overall I'd say it's a 7/10 game but with all the technical issues it's a 5/10

column9: not really playable

column8:
Bueno pude jugar unas 14 horas a este juego, la verdad que nunca jugué a ninguno de la saga de Silent hill. No es un mal juego, gráficamente es como volver a jugar en ps3. Su historia esta muy interesante cuyo personaje principal tiene esa humanidad hacia los demás personajes secundarios. 

Al principio sus mecánicas como esquivar o defensa son un dolor de huevos, pero a la larga te vas a costumbrando, luego se te hace fácil seguir avanzando. Los acertijos no son nada de otro mundo pero lo pasas igual. 

No es un mal juego solo que esta optimizado muy pero muy mal, cuando empiezas a jugar luego de guardar y seguir avanzando este juego se te va cortar por primera vez. El juego se cierra y si no guardastes la partida fuiste a cargar y hacer todo otra vez. 

Luego cuando pasas de zona al finalizar la carga este se congela, y tenes que esperar unos 40 segundos o algunas veces 1 minuto. Y no me vengan a decir que no tengo pc para jugarlo porque no es eso, a mi me sobra la pc y el juego funciona muy mal. 

En cuanto a la resolución de pantalla se ve bien en 1440p PERO los mapas y los objetos se ven mal como si estuvieran agrandados por una sola parte y es un dolor de huevos ver le mapa de esa manera agrandado. Lo recomendable es que pongan una resolución original de 720p, es la única manera de jugarlo bien si que el mapa se deforme. 

En el sonido se escucha mal porque por defecto se queda clavado en 5.1 y yo no tengo parlantes 5.1 yo tengo parlantes 2.0 y se escucha para tuye.  Y en algunas partes del juego se cuelga algunos efectos de sonidos como puertas o los ruidos de los bichos. 
Otra es si te morís muchas veces el juego prácticamente se cierra para ahorrarte sufrimiento, y te lo digo por experiencia. 

No es un mal juego, pero esta muy mal optimizado y tiene muchos errores, por parte de la empresa responsable ni si quiera hay un parche que solucione estos problemas y no hay que ser experto de la nasa para darse cuenta que es notorio y frustrante jugar un juego así. 

Como siempre la comunidad sacando parches no oficiales para que podamos jugar bien a este juego, yo no baje ningun parche y lo jugue así como te lo venden roto y cree me que es un dolor de huevos jugarlo así pero se pudo jugar y llegar a la final. 

Por ahora NO lo recomiendo que lo compren en pc, pero si tienen una ps3 allí si te lo recomiendo.
In all seriousness, this is a bad port, it's still playable. that doesn't mean I don't recommend it because It's honestly a good story.
column9: In all seriousness, this is a bad port, it's still playable. that doesn't mean I don't recommend it because It's honestly a good story.

column8: The Best !

[h1] Revised as of 5/24/2023 [/h1]
Actually came back to complete this game despite being disappointed a year prior.  After patching game on a new system, the only issue I experienced was CTD's when trying to alt+tab out of the game.  Combat is jank, but its a remnant of the old school combat that was present in older silent hill games that in all honesty should be left behind in any upcoming SH reboots/remakes.  Outside of the combat and HEAVY reliance on Unknownproject's patch (and any bugs of course).  The gameplay and story themselves aren't too bad and it definitely kept the atmosphere the older SH games brought to the table.  I wouldn't say this game is a particularly great game- definitely not anywhere near the best in the series, but it's decent for what it is.  Buy only one sale as the price tag is laughable.

-Original Review Below-

Even with the patch the game is a buggy mess

After attempting multiple times to get past the sewer despite multiple crashes, police station enemies not registering being shot properly (may as well just use the axe exclusively), and overall reliance on the patch and having to re-download the game a couple of times due to issues with the saves not loading/causing crashes, decided to stop playing.  Hopefully one day Konami will remaster the game properly.  This is NOT worth the money in its current state, not even on sale.

Öncelikle şöyle başlamak istiyorum, diğer silent hill oyunları kadar güzel bir şey beklemeyin çünkü beklentinizi tam olarak karşılamayacaktır. Ama ben yine de hikayeyi oldukça beğendim, silent hill atmosferi başarılı şekilde yansıtılmış ve yaratıkların dizaynı da oldukça iyiydi. Oyunun tek sorunu başa çıkılmayan bugları, oynarken o kadar çok donup çöktü ki sürekli aynı yerleri oynamaktan gına gelmişti artık. Neyseki güç bela bitirebildim oyunu derken artık neyi yanlış yaptıysam gelebilecek en boktan son geldi ve Konami'nin babannesine bir kez daha sert bir dille sövmüş oldum. Siz yine de oyuna bir şans verin Silent Hill'de geçiyor sonuçta yahu

Não é o melhor jogo da franquia, mas é muito bom mesmo assim. Mantém a média. Recomendo pra quem é fã da franquia. Falam que o jogo tem muitos bugs, mas são bem poucos e é fácil de contorná-los com 5 minutos de pesquisa na internet e lendo as dicas.Eu não tive problemas e gostei bastante da experiência.

column8: This game needs a lot of help; maybe more than one should be expected to give. And even after you give it electro-shock treatment what you end up with is the wonkiest, stankiest, jankiest action horror game I've personally had the misfortune of playing. The only genuine scare I had during my 11hours in its recycled and repurposed gameworld was a disappearing save file. I still can't figure out what sort of paranormal witchery resulted in my progress being deleted; I was 2/3rds of the way through. I was very disappointed after that and I couldn't bring myself to replay this game. One note I will say: this game has the scariest animated mouths I've ever seen. Pay close attention to the player character's face during cutscenes...it's uncanny, and quite frankly disgusting. He doesn't so much speak as mill grout about his fleshy maw in a completely unconvincing manner. Play at your own risk.   "Scariest Mouths In The Game!/10"

column8: Just replayed the game after my friend told me he started playing through the Silent Hill series. i wanted to see why it was so hated as when i played it originally i was like, 6 to 8, i remembered very little and wanted to see if it earned the hate it got through the years. and i dont think it did, i had a great time playing it, while i dont think it has the best replay value if you play it over and over again, its still a good game and, in my opinion, a good Silent Hill title. its fun to play and hating it for what it did different is wrong. the twist land, the symbolism is good, and Alex is likable. the atmosphere isnt great to start but it ramps up fast too. definitely worth a play even if you do so without paying 40 dollars for it lol.
