column8:
Magnífico juego. A pesar de ser independiente a los otros, consigue mantener esa tensión tan característica de los Silent Hill. Buena jugabilidad, historia interesante y, sobre todo, muchos momentos de miedo.
Me ha traído recuerdos muy bonitos de cuando empecé a jugar a esta saga. Muy recomendable.

I'm leaving this negative review not for the bugs (though the biggest buzzkill ever, since any wrong turn or doing things too quick will crash the game) but for the games entire purpose. 

Honestly, the plot is quite interesting, but is done very poorly, it really doesn't help how there's not much expressions in the game, for instance the beginning when you're in the hospital and talking to Josh, your character is really much looking at the void instead of showing any emotion, confusion of the world around him.

But I shouldn't expect much from the game, after knowing Pyramid Head, oops I mean "Bogeyman" was added to the game, why? Fan-service that's why, the game only added him in to lure in old time fans as-well as people that know of Pyramid Head. 
If you want to see Pyramid Head, go for Silent Hill 2. You won't be disappointed, unless you're a modern gamer that can't handle old graphics. But just know you're missing out. Once you break that mindset you will love it, trust me on that.

For anyone that sees this review and is new to the Silent Hill franchise, I and many others recommend playing 1, 2 and 3 that were developed by Team Silent. They're the peak of the Silent Hill franchise as a whole. 
If you can't afford a Playstation 1, 2 or whatever old platform that has it. Emulate it. I'm not sure if I'm allowed to link places to find them, but I recommend searching online how to set one up. (always search for popular videos), and find places to get the games.

Though I will say, this game has an amazing soundtrack. But that's not a shocker since it's composed by Akira Yamaoka, and has really made the Silent Hill games from Amazing to Masterpieces. If you haven't heard of them, I suggest listening to them, it has a unique soundtrack that many horror games can never compete with.

But other than that, if you want the Real Silent Hill Experience, stick with Silent Hill 1-3, and if you enjoy those and want more, go for Silent Hill 4: The Room. 
Though I suggest staying away from anything over that. But if you want to experience them all go for it, but I recommend not expecting much, maybe keep expectations REALLY low, to maybe get a kick out of it.

Rating 2/10

column8: Es un juego regular, tiene sus pro y contras, en lo que se refiere a historia esta dentro de todo bien lo que se podria esperar de un juego de Silent Hill,  pero en cuanto a las entregas anteriores se perdio ese elemento que te daba miedo, el no tener muchos recursos para defenderte y estar en constante tension, este personaje tiene muchas habilidades que hacen que sea mas un juego de accion que de terror como en sus principios. Lo recomiendo para jugadores casuales, pero no creo que sea de agrado para quien sigue a la saga desde sus origenes.

column8:
Love this game, I fondly remember playing this in my childhood. It has all the good aspects of a horror game, difficult puzzles, eerie maps, monsters that can demolish you, and a story that I find pretty interesting. I know that this game is a port of the console version, but with a bit of tweaking it is very much playable on today's technology. 

The only downfall about this game is that there are tons of glitches within the game because it's a pretty mediocre port. The game will sometimes randomly crash during a loading screen (and if you didn't save its pretty annoying). Also some resolutions that claim to be supported break the game in some way so its best to play the game at 1080p 30fps. Because I played this game at 1440p 30fps, the maps in game ceased to function, they were way too zoomed in or cut off at parts. 

(Keep in mind there are a lot of bugs i'm not denying that, but none of them are game breaking in anyway other than the resolution problem. Most of the issues are on the graphical side of things and shouldn't bother you too much) 

Overall if you can tolerate a little bit of bugginess there is a ton of content in this game making it really enjoyable and game I always come back to from time to time.

column8:
Certamente Homecoming não está no nível dos Silent Hills clássicos do PS2, mas ainda assim é um bom survivor horror.
Joguei ele muito depois de seu lançamento, então talvez minha visão pareça quase como um revisionismo, visto que na época o game foi extremamente criticado. Gosto da atmosfera do game, apesar do excesso de combates com monstros prejudicar ela um pouco. Na minha opinião é tem um dos melhores enredos da franquia e a forte influência que o filme teve nele é um ponto positivo. Dada a escassez de jogos de Silent Hill, acho que vale a pena dar uma chance a ele.

OBS: Sobre o tempo de jogo, eu terminei a versão "paralela" dele e me senti na obrigação de comprar-lo agora que tenho condições.

I normally don´t post reviews of games, but this one needed a review. I really enjoy horror games and I´ve played a couple of Silent Hill games in the past, but I gotta say that this one is the most frustrating and infuriating Silent Hill game of all times. Mostly because the dodging mechanics are crap, truly awfully bad dodging mechanics, you press the button and no matter if you do "dodge" you get hit; it´s even worse when you are fighting bosses. Another horrible thing was the LOADING screens, they take FOREVER to load (if you sum that with the dodging mechanics and keep dying when fighting a boss, this is a nightmare). Some of the dialogs are way too fast in some scenes and some others take too long. Overall I expected a nice horror experience and got delivered a maddening one.

column8: About half my playtime was either fighting this game to even open and the absurdly long load times and constant freezes, which happens almost anytime you enter a new area. Not to mention how many times the games would crash during certain parts, that it once took me over two hours to progress because of how long it took to get into the game as well as the game repeatedly crashing. Even if it weren't for the technical problems, this game is just not good and the fact that in 2022 it still costs $40 on steam is bullshit.

Mínimo si van a jugar este Silent Hill, cómprese una PC decente  para que no se estén quejando de los errores.
En lo personal no he encontrado ningún error. Debo admitir que no sigue en el mismo ambiente de sus predecesores, pero es bueno. Te amo KONAMI ♥

Este jogo é ótimo, ele pega todas ideias boas que Silent Hill teve com o tempo e junta em um só game, melhorando também o combate. Uma celebração para a franquia.

Eu tenho uma ressalva é que a rolagem é lenta, então, as vezes, apesar de você ter esquivado, você leva dano pois o personagem ainda não havia se deslocado para os lados o suficiente. Os gráficos também não são os melhores, mas são bonitos. A jogabilidade das armas de fogo são meio duros, e as animações delas também são bem mixuruca.

O jogo é bom, ao meu ver é o segundo melhor Silent Hill dentro dos que eu já joguei (Joguei o SH1, SH2, SH3, SH Origins, SH4: The Room e SH Homecoming). [b] Apesar disso, este porte do jogo não é bom. [/b] Está infestado de bugs, má otimização e o ESCAMBAL. Há patches feitos por fãs que melhoram um pouco a situação do game.

column8: Incrivel o melhor que joguei .

Silent Hill Homecoming...

 Genelde ilk dört oyunun altında kaldığı söylenir,evet katılıyorum.
Lakin serinin son temsilcisi,sadece müziklerini dinlemek için bile oynanır.Yerden yere vurulacak kadar kötü olduğunu düşünmüyorum.

Seriyi defalarca bitirmiş,sağlam bir Silent Hill hayranı olarak Homecoming'i tavsiye edebilirim.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=UlAaYPuqdTA



 Nostalji yapmak isteyenler eski Silent Hill oyunlarını ''my abandonware'' den indirip oynayabilir.Korsan sayılmaz ayrıca Konami lisans haklarını yenilememiş,site de sağlamdır.
Un juego buenísimo sin duda, deberían de sacar todos los Silent Hill para Steam ya que es uno de los mejores juegos de terror de la época.

Yıllar önce steamde görünce hemen almak istedim çünkü eski silent hill oyunları resmi olarak bugünün sistemlerine uygun şekilde satılmıyor. O mükemmel deneyimi tekrardan bugün yaşamak istediğinde ise zar zor eski oyunları bulup çalıştırma imkanına sahibiz.

Gel gelelim bu oyunun berbat ötesi steam versiyonuna. Oyun bir kere 30 fps kilidi ile açılıyor. Normal şartlarda bu oyunu 60 fps çalıştırmanız mümkün değil. Bir kişinin yaptığı mod ile tekrar şans verip oynamak istedim ve 30 fps kilidini kaldırıp oyunu 60 fps ye çıkartabildim. Birde oyunun çok eskiden yapılan türkçe yaması mevcuttu onuda kurdum dedim ohh miss...

ama gerçekten bu konami çok ağır küfürleri hak ediyor. oyun sürekli çöküyor. belli belirsiz ne zaman olacağı belli olmadan bir anda masaüstüne atıyor sizi. tabi doğal olarak bu tür oyunların save sistemi biraz zor. otomatik olarak sizin son anınızı save etmiyor. siz nerede en son save yaptıysanız oradan başlayabiliyorsunuz oyuna.belki yarım saat önce son save noktasından başladığınız zaman bir hayli can sıkıcı oluyor.

Üstüne birde etrafınıza yaratıklar çıktığı zaman anlamsız bir biçimde oyun kasılmaya başlıyor baya baya 20-30 fps ye geri düşüyor sonra bu sıralarda tekrar masaüstüne geri atıyor oyun. Zaten mekaniksel açıdan çok başarılı bir oyun değil ama hikaye ve atmosfer yılına göre genede hakkını veriyor.

bir firma elindeki bu kadar değerli bir markayı nasıl hiçe sayar ve yaptığı işe hiç mi saygısı olmaz... olmaz işte. lanet olsun sizin gibi firmaya konami misin ne bo,ksun adına lanet olsun!!!!

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=g4BPPdA60Os&ab_channel=SalihBal

[b]A versão para PC desse jogo só ressalta a indiferença da Konami para os jogos dela.[/b] Só comprei porque estava em promoção, mas mesmo assim não foi um bom negócio. 
Nunca vi um jogo da Steam que não mostra os comandos na tela durante o jogo (isso pelo mouse e teclado, porque o suporte a controle é praticamente de Taubaté, ou seja, não existe). 
É uma pena que a empresa não tenha corrigido esse e outros problemas até hoje, como a opção de alterar FPS ou resolução. Eu tenho esse jogo no Xbox 360 e só consegui zerar por lá, porque na versão de PC é impossível. Fico triste com a indiferença da empresa pois esse jogo, apesar de não ser um dos melhores da franquia, é um jogo bom.

column8:
After trying my best to fix the multiple game breaking glitches I give up on this game. Sometimes it just crashes and after a few tries it loads my last save.

I can't comment on the story that much other than it "seems ok". It mostly follows SH2 ideas but as I couldn't pass the 3h mark on the game I will probably go watch a longplay video or some breakdown.
The gameplay is some of the worst I have ever played. Enemies are unpredictable, they lock you in a stun easily and you can get stuck while under attack so you have no chance of survival. Hope you have a save point close. I can't stress enough how bad this is. A horror game that has combat with any enemy you see but the combat is so bad it loses all meaning. You can't even evade most enemies. Health items are rare enough and the puzzles are simple that don't excuse the lack of normal combat.
The sound design is also very bad. Even some voice acting is poor.
The character models are fine but their animation is off. Sometimes their mouths don't even open when they talk or just look weird. 

When you combine all the games faults you get one awful experience. One that will probably get you stuck on the menu screen because the game keeps crashing. Seriously, anything good that may have come out of this story is rendered useless because you can't even play the game. Even if you do manage to get it working you will probably just give up like I did cause of the "gameplay" itself. Such an afwul and unforgiving combat system that takes away from the experience so much I stopped playing.

Don't buy this "game".

This game has different gameplay than other installments, 1, 2, 3. Two times I have abandoned this game, left it to rot, but third time I have finished it, after watching some tutorials about gameplay, which I highly recommend you do.


It is worth to play this game. The setting features many hells that many characters in this game carry in themselves. After you beat the game you should read about characters and how monsters came into being.


Crashes first... This game knows to crash while loading. To avoid this, you can exit the game to windows after every save. My best guess being that this is a port game, probably written in C++, and being that port is bad, there are memory leaks. Exiting the game allows your system to recover memory.
Employing this I saved myself from crashes... for now. I did not install any patch.
Don't alt-tab.


Savegames can get corrupted but in a positive way.
By loading Hotel Atrium and City Hall saves three times, I got all my health items, Health Drink, Medkit and Serums doubled, which I did exploit.


Nasty bug happens when enemy grapple you and there you have context icon flashing with buttons to save your self.
This did not work for Ferals and Asphyxia on my machine, meaning it is game over for me if grapple happens.


You can watch "No Damage" gameplays on YouTube to see tactics in action.
So youtube for Silent Hill Homecoming no damage gameplay.


For what reason did development team mix Silent Hill with Mortal Kombat I do not know, but game stopped being a horror game for me when I figured out how to kill stuff with the Knife. All other weapons are slow and leave you open to attack. The hotel was most disturbing for me, then Sewers, but there you can use one doorway, to defend agains Needlers which you can see in "No Damage" walkthroughs on YouTube.


My full discussion about how to play this game.
https://steamcommunity.com/app/19000/discussions/0/3203748716340138190/
You have also other resources.

This is an inexcusably shitty port of a mediocre at best game.
 It's only really playable if you install some fan-made patches because Konami couldn't be bothered to properly port this game to pc. However, even with the patches, there's no guarantee that you won't encounter game breaking bugs. About five minutes into the game, I encountered an issue in which I got stuck on a door frame and could not move. I couldn't pause my game or return to the main menu, so ALT-F4'd and tried again. This time I tried opening the door without standing so close to the frame but the exact same thing happened anyway. After a couple more attempts the game would just instantly crash upon starting a new game (I encountered this issue before reaching any kind of save point), at which point any normal person would probably give up and ask for a refund.
If you want to play a Silent Hill game (that doesn't suck and was properly ported to pc), get Silent Hill 4 on GOG. Silent Hill 2 and 3 were also ported to pc and patched by fans, but those games are actually playable with the patches and are the best the series has to offer. It's a damn shame they aren't on steam and all we get is this.
If you're absolutely dying to play Silent Hill: Homecoming, play the console versions.

YAHU BU NE BİÇİM BİR OYUNDUR.
 
 Oyun, oyun değil resmen pc sorun çözme ve oyunlara unofficial patch atma simulasyonu mübarek. İki dakika korkacağız, depresif hikaye takip edeceğiz niyetiyle girdiğim oyunda şunu düzelt, buna fix at, ses driverı yükle, oyundan attı save gitti diye diye migrenim azdı, reflüm tuttu anasını satayım. Sırf bir Silent Hill oyunu oynamış olmak için bir de o kadar fix, patch vs. yükledim emeğim boşa gitmesin diye oynayacağım bu oyunu. Hırs yaptım artık. 

 Ama bu oyunu korku oyunu oynamak için satın alacak olan varsa kesinlikle almasın. Sadece oyunu akıcı oynamak için vereceğiniz emek, harcayacağınız süre, neredeyse oyunun kendi oynanış süresinden fazla. Değmez yani. Kaldı ki hepsini hallettiniz diyelim, oyun içinde oyunun kendi kontrolleri ayrı bir kanser, ne kadar denerseniz deneyin oyuna adapte olmanızı engelliyor bu durum. Sanki dışarıdan katılan gecikmeli bir izleyici gibi hissediyorsunuz.

 Herhangi bir oyuna olumsuz inceleme yazmakla uğraşmam genelde ki bu benim ilk olumsuz incelemem. Artık oyunun duygu durumumda ki etkisini siz düşünün. Eğer benim gibi sırf bir Silent Hill oyunu oynamış olmak için oynayacaksanız satın alın derim aksi taktirde alternatif korku, gerilim oyunlarına yönelin. Yoksa kanser olur, verdiğiniz paraya yanarsınız. Benden nacizane bir uyarı.

Homecoming jest, obok The Room, moją ulubioną częścią. Fabuła, a przede wszystkim jej prowadzenie, jest jak dla mnie idealne, sama rozgrywka jest relatywnie standardowym Silentem, chociaż w przeciwieństwie do poprzednich części - twisty tutaj są lepsze, bo bliższe realnemu światu, przez co immersja jest na wyższym poziomie niż kretynizmy które się pojawiały wcześniej.
Żeby nie było - gra od strony technicznej to PORAŻKA, ilość czasu potrzebnego żeby grę przystosować do ogrania na dzisiejszym sprzęcie woła o pomstę, a ilość fpscapów poukrywanych w różnych plikach to jakaś patologia. To powinno być poprawione PRZED wydaniem gry na steama, a nie "bawta się sami". Chociaż należy pamiętać że to w końcu Konami.
Jeżeli nie jesteś debilem (tak jak sporo osób które wystawiło negatywy z powodu własnego lenistwa) i spędzisz kilka minut na wstawianiu dosłownie pojedynczych linijek tekstu do plików ini i zainstalowaniu dosłownie jednego programu to grę skończysz bez żadnych crashy.

Look, I've seen the negative reviews - but a sale came up and I thought "Well why not.." you know, nostalgia and all. In any case, I encountered controller issues right off the bat (both joystick and keyboard/mouse) I can barely do anything - just not worth the battle. Can't say I wasn't warned

column8:
Cons: The combat ai is so broken that sometimes they will just hit you even if you dodge or stand behind them. The needler has a really broken attack that i can't get passed him so i can hit his  weak area. The nurse at first is fine but when you get to the hotel she somehow gets buffed hitting you really fast at the point that you can't even escape her the only way i can kill her is 1 or 2 headshots. The miniboss (siam) sorry if i misspelled the name is kinda hard to kill but if you continuously hit in the front he will falter taking the opportunity to kill hem. The bosses the first one is not that hard he is a decent boss, the scarlet doll boss fight was kinda hard she was bad died a lot, the centipede human thing was not a good boss fight i had no way getting to the weak point unless i dodge her grab attack witch was pretty boring, and the final boss was a bad i killed with the knife. 

The port of this game was so bad i only got 30 fps even worse the cut scenes audio was garbage I only could hear from one ear later on in the game audio gets muffled. I had to get unknown project lair patch so i can get more frame rates. I know this game came out 13 years and frame rates and resolution weren't the best. but man is 2021 is about time this game gets fixed. 

The judge holloway character is so confusing if you played the game you know. 

Pros: Overall This game has has a decent story, it has decent gameplay I really like the monster design, Atmosphere was good, and the visuals are good.

D tier silent hill not worth the 40$ wait for it on sale. the reason i got for 40$ was because I am a die hard fan of the silent hill franchise.

Мда…уж 

Я люблю серию игр Тихого Холма и «Silent Hill: Homecoming» - не стала исключением. 
Игра явна не для всех, особенно , если ты и вовсе не знаком с Туманным городом Сайлент Хилл. 
Ощущение, что это лишь дополнение, а не основная игра. Сюжет - средний. Оптимизация - её нет вовсе - это единственное, что дико басит. А так: Музыка/атмосфера - топ. Дизайн локаций и рядовых противников монстров - средний, но вот сами Боссы и то как они выглядят - прост огонь/жуть как круто сделано. 
Опять же скажу, что игра не для всех. Она имеет огромный потенциал , но хренрвый фпс , оптимизация всё портит. (Поставил бы 7) 
Оцениваю игру на 5/10

So let's start.

Minus

- The game is literally unplayable for most part (This includes Crashes , freezes , lose of progress , bad controls , framerate issues follow by a 30 fps cap despite having option up to 144 hz in-game)
- Crashes : mostly happen at any time but shepherd house is a guaranteed crash zone, Hotel have a few , Silent Hill have a lot of them and some others than can in any zone.
- Have some soft-lock : One of them is in the church area. If you fast forward the cut button prompt on the three paintings the game will both cut and examine the paintings. Resulting in a guaranteed soft-lock requiring to restart the game.
- Framerate issue : the game is capped to 30 FPS despite the fact that the game literally have a 144 hz options. This can't be changed and require a patch to bypass the limit. There's also a large amount of framedrop in silent hill among shepherd's glen.
- Some loss of progress : Can happen randomly (I recommand a patch to avoid this).
- Lack of 10 stars ranking from the previous Silent Hill
- Controls have some issues : mouse sensitivity and controller can bug requiring to restart the game.
- Firearm gameplay (Simply inferior to previous installment and still inferior to games from the same era)

+

+ Soundtrack by Akira Yamaoka is good.
+ the multiple endings the game offer.
+ I like the story not as good as the previous 4 but remains more in line with 1-3 than 4 in my opinion.
+ Melee gameplay (The dodge system and different combo per weapons) 

This game is underrated and way better than his successor SIlent Hill Downpour which doesn't have a PC Port. This game is good on many aspects Konami preserved the multiples endings choices , the unique unlockables and some costumes which one can be unlock with Konami code. However i'm very dissapointed
that the 10 stars ranking system was removed. hard mode was made meaningless you don't unlock anything with it except a extra bonus scene at the end.

To conclude : Without a fan patch this game is unplayable and in a very bad state. He shouldn't be even sold. I'm even surprised no one even asked Konami to either fix it or start a lawsuit about it. No games even on PC should be sold like that because not everyone like fan patch (Like myself). This game have nothing for him even speedrunner can't run it.

To @KONAMI this is an insult to your players.

Edit : Can someone make patch for the game that fix FPS limit, fix crashes and controller compatibility. Without altering the game in any way like (Like the creatures health , difficulty , or costume making no damage like the change UnknownProject did.

I want the game working and no changemade to core gameplay at all.
bom D+

Whew boy. Where do I begin?

This is a TERRIBLE port of an at best mediocre game. If you are so inclined as to be a Silent Hill completionist, and you want to experience Homecoming, please pick this up for the console. I played it back when it came out on the Xbox 360, and I certainly do not have memories of struggling so hard to control Alex during combat - I tried on my keyboard and on my controller. 

The game is prone to crashing. Alt tab out? Crash. Watch a cutscene during the game? Crash. And if the game doesn't crash, it WILL freeze and you will think for a moment "Oh crap, did I have a recent enough save?" and then it will return to normal. I lost count on how many times this happened during my recent playthrough. 

Silent Hill has never been known for amazing combat, and there were MANY times while playing (due to this game deciding to lag or freeze) when I would release the trigger control (to aim with my weapon) and Alex will still be in attack mode like a total dope and it will take a while to get out of that stance.. but in the meantime enjoy some cheap hits from the different enemies in the game. It's dangerous because there are a couple who can one shot you if you stink at quicktime events with button pressing. 

The amount that this game is listed for is ballsy. I picked this up on a sale of 75% off (I think) and I still overpaid. I should have just ebayed a 360 copy. Seriously - play this on console, not this terrible PC port.

And if the game doesn't crash, it WILL freeze and you will think for a moment "Oh crap, did I have a recent enough save?" and then it will return to normal. It's dangerous because there are a couple who can one shot you if you stink at quicktime events with button pressing. 

The amount that this game is listed for is ballsy. I picked this up on a sale of 75% off (I think) and I still overpaid. I should have just ebayed a 360 copy. Seriously - play this on console, not this terrible PC port.

Silent Hill Homecoming é um jogo feito pela Double Helix Games e publicado pela Konami em 2008 para Xbox 360, PlayStation 3 e PC. O jogo conta a história de Alex Shepherd depois de voltar a sua cidade natal, Shepherd's Glen, a partir daí ele descobre que seu pai e seu irmão desapareceram sem deixar nenhum rastro, e a partir daí, ele precisa reencontrar os dois, no entanto, coisas estranhas vão acontecendo na cidade, e aí a história começa a se desenrolar, com ele parando em Silent Hill tempos depois, e começando de verdade o jogo.

O jogo é até bacana, apesar de sua jogabilidade e controles terem mudado muito em relação aos seus títulos antecessores da franquia, com agora o jogo lembrando até mais o Resident Evil 4 do que os Silent Hill's (minha opinião), isso não faz do jogo ruim, só o faz diferente dos outros, principalmente no aspecto de câmera, com agora a câmera seguindo o jogador, ao invés daquela câmera fixa que ia alternando quando você mudava de um lugar para o outro. A trilha sonora, assim como a dos outros jogos, é sensacional (Akira Yamaoka é Akira Yamaoka né pai?). A história é até bacana, os gráficos, apesar de pra época já serem meio meh (levando em conta que era um jogo para a 7a geração de consoles), ainda sim dá para relevar, no entanto, há alguns (no caso muitos) problemas.

O jogo em si é até bacana, no entanto, para um jogo que é da série Silent Hill, esperava mais. O jogo não me deu susto algum, diferente dos outros que chegavam a me dar pesadelos. Algumas coisas da história são bem previsíveis, no entanto, o jogo continua sendo divertido mesmo com essas coisas. Agora, o que mais me incomodou foi a otimização dessa joça aqui: O JOGO É MAL OTIMIZADO DEMAIS, E CHEIO DE FALHAS!

Esse jogo é completamente injogável no PC (diferente das versões dos consoles que dá para jogar tranquilamente), o jogo crasha quando você dá alt+tab e volta para o jogo, as vezes, quando você coloca um fix e consegue executar tamanha vigarice, o jogo cai de 60FPS para incríveis 7FPS. O jogo crasha quando eu mudo para a minha resolução nativa não sei porque, aí eu preciso ficar jogando o jogo em 720p (isso aconteceu comigo, não sei com outras pessoas), o áudio do jogo as vezes só funciona de um lado do headset, isso incomoda E MUITO em muitas ocasiões, mas o pior mesmo é a questão de saves do jogo: as vezes, quando você coloca um patch fix para consertar o jogo e inicia ele, o jogo simplesmente crasha. Mesmo no new game, a mesma coisa acontece, é um negócio bizonho. Enfim, o problema do jogo é que ele não só é mal otimizado, como também ele é cheio de bugs e crashes bizarros.

Enfim, o jogo é até legal, tem pontos até desafiantes (apesar do jogo ser beeem mais fácil que os primeiros), mas fica bem abaixo dos outros da franquia (obviamente), mas dá até para jogar de boa se for num console. O maior problema, no entanto, é a versão de PC. Não pegue esse jogo para PC de jeito nenhum, o jogo tem texturas que ficam piscando (flickando) em alguns lugares, o áudio dos diálogos só funciona de um lado do headset, os loadings são bem demorados (bizarramente), e também há muitos bugs e crashes que persistem mesmo com fixes (inclusive se você der alt+tab durante o jogo, o jogo crasha ou a framerate cai drasticamente durante a gameplay). A Konami nem se importou de otimizar esse jogo para PC. Além disso, é uma grande tristeza que não tem os outros Silent Hills para Steam, deveria ter, pois faz muita falta.

Minha nota para o jogo é: 5/10 (levando em conta sua otimização e que eu perdi 2 horas de jogo devido a crashes, vlw Konami, sua preguiçosa!)
Da miedo.

Um Silent Hill com um enredo até interessante, uma jogabilidade razoavel, porque sistema de combate horrivel ja é tradiçao nessa franquia. Mas infelizmente o que o jogo tem de bom pra oferecer foi totalmente arruinado pelo port completamente ridiculo pra PC. Simplesmente um tapa na cara dos fãs, o responsavel por trazer essa versao imunda ao PC deveria perder o emprego. Inumeras vezes meu jogo crashou longe do ultimo save, engasgadas a todo momento, bugs de travar no nada e morrer por conta disso, enfim. Nao sei como o jogo esta nos consoles, aqui voce tem que ser muito fã Mesmo pra conseguir zerar e fazer valer seu dinheiro, com muito rage eu to chegando no final... E boa sorte pra quem for comprar, se voce nao ama silent hill nao compre, serio.

One of the most horribly broken PC ports I've ever had the displeasure of dealing with, even with patches.

The above sentence is what I initially published out of sheer frustration, before finishing the game. Now that I have finished it, I can safely say that this is one of the worst Silent Hill games, to the point where I feel repulsed even calling it one. It misunderstands a great deal of what the series stands for, and doesn't bring much new to the table.

Let's start with the graphics. They look noticeably worse than Silent Hill 3, a game that came out a whole console generation before this one. Most character models have something off about them, and not in the uncanny horror sense. There were also some scenes where the lighting was really messed up, which to my surprise was not just a byproduct of this PC port. I guess some of the environments are fine, but I never really got the same feel from them that I did from the original Silent Hill games.

Even if we disregard any technical aspects, the presentation is just weak. The devs clearly took inspiration from the Silent Hill movie, and some of its visually interesting aspects are faithfully recreated, but everything else pales in comparison to what the series was doing nearly a decade prior. The series' signature otherworld sections have this weird metallic lava aesthetic which is more akin to Bowser's castle than the psychological hellscapes of previous entries. The enemy design is also very hit or miss, with only some of the boss designs being truly remarkable. The story is not only mediocre, but it could actually dampen your enjoyment of other SH games if you choose to play this first.

The gameplay is probably what separates this the most from the older games in terms of deliberately doing something different, but all it amounts to is a clunky, exploitable combat system and a heap of late 2000s gameplay tropes. So if you're a huge fan of QTEs, sloppy item wheels that make you accidentally waste items, and dodge rolling, then I guess there's something for you here.

In closing, I want to acknowledge the one truly good thing here: the music. Series veteran Akira Yamaoka's soundtrack may make you momentarily forget how bad of an experience this is. That is, if you can hear any of it, because the audio mixing is also terrible.

I was going to give the game a fair shot before calling it shit even though I already knew it was, but I was literally unable to progress due to how poorly this port works. Certain graphics don't display properly (I could only see a quarter of the map at any given time), the controls are unusable to the point where I pressed every button on the controller and still couldn't open the inventory, etc etc. 

As for the game itself, it's a Silent Hill game that opens with a prompt for you to mash a button to break lose from restraints. That alone should tell you the game sucks. (Worst part is that choosing not to press the button has no consequences whatsoever...)

I actually wanted to play this mess since I'm a big fan of Silent Hill, but it's actually unplayable. Don't even buy it as a joke.

column8: Toda vez que um Silent Hill é lançado, levanta a seguinte dúvida: é um Silent Hill legítimo? No caso desse SH Homecoming sim, temos todos os elementos que fizeram o sucesso da franquia. Ambientes fechados, sombrios, cheio de portas trancadas, puzzles para acessar outros ambientes, criaturas estranhas, ruas sob neblina, terror psicológico e enredo misterioso. Até a música é característica da série. Eu diria que depois do terceiro SH, esse é o que mais faz jus a série, até mais que Silent Hill 4 : The room. Mas nem esses detalhes salvam o jogo de alguns problemas, e o primeiro deles é o inovador sistema de combate, focado bastante nas armas de ataque corpo a corpo. O que era pra ser uma evolução na franquia, acaba se transformando, por vezes, num fator de frustração. Contando com um sistema de esquiva e ataque mais forte (e também mais lento) muitas vezes mais atrapalham que ajudam. É preciso ter um "time" mais apurado pra se beneficiar desse sistema, sob pena de sofrer dano antes de acertar as criaturas.  Por conta desse novo sistema de combate do protagonista, a curva de adaptação a ele pode ser um pouco mais demorado e frustrar a jogatina, já que os ataques das criaturas também foram aprimorados. O outro problema são os gráficos. Não por ter uma paleta de cores quase monocromática, mas por ter texturas e detalhes muito pobres, principalmente se comparado a outros jogos da época. Quanto a história, nada excepcional, onde temos um a volta do filho pródigo a cidade natal, e a busca por parte desse, pelo seu irmão desaparecido. O jogo sofreu forte (e positiva) influência do filme lançado em 2006 - baseado na franquia - chamado "Terror em Silent Hill". Recomendo aos fãs, já que nos faz lembrar de bons e saudosos momentos da série. No fim das contas é um bom jogo, mas pra quem não conhece o universo de Silent Hill, não é o melhor cartão de visitas.

column8:
Szkoda, że nie ma oceny "gra taka sobie", bo właśnie takie jest Homecoming. Widać, że za tą część odpowiada inne studio. Po prostu gra odstaje od poprzednich części. Nie jest to gniot, ale gdyby w nazwie nie było SH pewnie i oceny byłyby niższe..  w każdym razie- fabuła jest całkiem ok, nasz bohater wraca do rodzinnego miasteczka i od razu odkrywa, że coś jest nie tak. No i przede wszystkim zaginął jego młodszy brat..

Oprawa audiowizualna jest ok, o ile mamy w pamięci, że gra ma ponad 10 lat.

Na pewno irytuje system walki.. jak i ogólnie sterowanie. To nigdy nie była mocna strona serii, ale w tej odsłonie, niby projekcja płaszczykiem innowacji w zakresie ruchów bohatera, gra się momentami naprawdę topornie.

Po napisach końcowych miałem wrażenie, że Homecoming to delikatna kopia SH2. Jasne, można napisać, że Double Helix inspirowało się początkiem serii, ale ja bardziej odniosłem wrażenie braku pomysłu i ogólnie wtórności. Dlatego ta gra jest.. średnia. Po ukończeniu jej kilka lat temu już do niej na pewno nie wrócę. Ale biorąc pod uwagę plusy i minusy tej gry ostatecznie daję kciuka w górę.

Za pełną cenę odradzam zakup. Będziecie zawiedzeni, nawet jeśli jesteście wielkimi fanami Cichego Wzgórza. W promocji za ok. 30 zł- już tak.

Jakby nie było, konkurencja w postaci Resident Evil chyba wygrała. Co prawda są jakieś plotki o wskrzeszeniu serii, ale ostatecznie kończy się to niczym konkretnym. Mimo wszystko, liczę na to, że Konami jeszcze raz zaprosi nas do Silent Hill. Do tego czasu pozostają nam wyprawy do Racoon City..

As a years long fan I rushed ahead and bought Homecoming without reading through the reviews.....big mistake. Only once I started to encounter freezing, boots to desktop and black screens did I take the time to read some of them and did find some partial fixes to the problems on the community page, but ultimately it is just a bad port as has been mentioned in the reviews for years now I see, after reading some reviews. Such a shame really, Silent Hill has always been one of the best titles of it's genre but this version is faulty, as well (I can only assume) is known by those at Steam. Which in turn makes the refusal of a refund an even more bitter pill to swallow, I can't believe they are unaware of the games state. No more money from my pocket, period. My advise is don't waste your money, not because it's a bad game in itself, solely because it is in a broken state, purchase on a different platform if at all possible. How Steam can host and sell products in this so obviously broken state as many others have stated in reviews and still get away with refusing refunds is a testament to the quality of service offered. Not impressed.

Je ne vais pas juger cette version pc ultrabuguée, sans commentaire au passage.
Je vais me concentrer sur le jeu en lui-mêrme, et honnêtement je dois avouer que le jeu est une belle surprise.
Je l'ai par exemple préféré à SH4 et Origins.
Le scénario est sympathique, un nouveau gameplay un peu innovant (bien que pas toujours efficace), mais l'essence de la saga est toujours là.

Seul petit bémol : les monstres qui s'acharnent vraiment, et des munitions un peu trop discrètes.

Mais um caso de um port extremamente mal feito, a história não é ruim, agora a gameplay é triste, é necessário instalar um patch não oficial pra conseguir jogar pois o jogo fecha sozinho e mesmo com o patch não resolve todos os problemas que esse jogo possui como:

-Quedas de FPS absurdas
-Bugs extremamente feios
-Armas que não funcionam e entre outras coisas

Mais um verdadeiro descaso da Konami em relação aos consumidores, foi um sacrifício terminar esse jogo, portanto não recomendo caso você queira manter sua sanidade mental, recomendaria pela história por que ela até que é boa e o jogo possui vários finais mas essa versão de PC não recomendo e o pior de tudo é que esse é o único Silent Hill disponível para compra aqui na Steam, cadê os outros? que estão bem melhores do que esse mesmo sendo mais antigos mas não oquê nós jogadores de PC merecemos é essa porcaria.

column8:
I played this when it first came out on PS3 and even then I wasn't blown away, but I'm a sucker for all things Silent Hill so I decided to replay it on PC.  

Before complaining about technical issues I want to just push all of that aside for now and talk about the game itself.  It's quite clear, especially looking back, that this was a cash grab with very little effort put into making it a good game.  Example: you need two halves of a symbol in order to unlock a door.  The second half of the symbol is literally found mere feet away from the locked door.  Why not just have the door require one item if that's where you're going to put the second half?  Lazy design.

Combat is clunky and difficult.  You're supposed to be able to dodge enemy attacks and then counter attack but it's much harder in practice than in theory.  

Atmosphere: the game simply isn't dark enough.  You're given a flashlight but you'll hardly need it.  This robs the game of the atmosphere and of revealing the unknown with your light.

Level Design: not good.  The game is extremely linear even though it presents a facade of being open.  For example in the hotel there's basically just one path forward, sometimes there are rooms you can enter but they're almost always empty and every room looks exactly the same as the others.  "This bed is really dirty" is the protagonist's thoughts with every bed in the game, etc.  I understand technical limitations probably limit creativity but at least make some of the rooms look different or throw in a couple of health drinks for those that took the time to explore.  I realize Silent Hill 1 and 2 did this but they were dealing with hardware limitations that this game shouldn't have been so hamstrung by.  

Sound: Terrible.  Even while wearing a headset you can't locate enemies by sound alone, it'll either sound like they're coming from the left side or the right side even if they're dead ahead of you.  Also applies to cut scenes.  Very poorly optimized sound.  

On to technical issues, I didn't get the crashing that so many others experience as long as I didn't Alt-Tab.  If I did Alt-Tab the game would crash.  For some reason my down movement key didn't work, at all, which became a real problem when I encountered the first boss.  Didn't care enough to troubleshoot or find a workaround.  Game ran fairly smoothly other than that, with settings turned up high, occasional hitching during cut scenes but nothing major.  

Disappointed that I bought this because I'm past the refund window but I'm also just done playing.  It isn't fun or atmospheric, the story is somewhat interesting but I don't care to slog through the awful combat and controls to unearth more of it (since I've forgotten most of it after 13 years).

On to technical issues, I didn't get the crashing that so many others experience as long as I didn't Alt-Tab.  If I did Alt-Tab the game would crash.  For some reason my down movement key didn't work, at all, which became a real problem when I encountered the first boss.  Didn't care enough to troubleshoot or find a workaround.  Game ran fairly smoothly other than that, with settings turned up high, occasional hitching during cut scenes but nothing major.  

Disappointed that I bought this because I'm past the refund window but I'm also just done playing.  It isn't fun or atmospheric, the story is somewhat interesting but I don't care to slog through the awful combat and controls to unearth more of it (since I've forgotten most of it after 13 years).

column8:
Este Silent Hill es de los que lamentablemente salio en la época en la que muchos de estos juegos empezaron a perder parte de su calidad, debo decir que despues de jugarlo nuevamente es un Silent hill muy bueno, su historia es entretenida y tambien tiene ese carisma que tanto tiene esta saga, mucha gente en sus reseñan lo tachjan de malo o que no da miedo y bueno en parte es cierto, pero este es uno que me transmite la sensación de incomodidad además de sentirme acosado por sus monstruos en casi todo momento. lo recomiendo para fans de la saga, asi como para personas que esten interesados en entrar a la misma como su primer Silent HIll.

pasando a los puntos en contra, lamentablemente si es un muy mal port para la pc, en este caso si hay ocasiones en las que el juego se congela por momentos en especial a la hora de guardar o cuando pasas en algunas secciones, no puedes minimizarlo porque de hacerlo este juego inmediatamente se cierra y bueno si no guardaste tendras que pasar todo de nuevo, sin embargo es jugable puede que algunos dado su constumbre a que los juegos vayan fluidos todo el tiempo les puede ser frustrante pero siendo sinceros tengan algo de paciencia y dejense sumergir por su mundo.

como pequeño dato adiccional jugue esto con un control de XboxOne, recomiendo mucho jugarlo con control desconozco como es con el teclado y mause pero se que es algo incomodo, asi que por su comodidad jueguenlo con control

otra cosa más es que disfruten del juego y den gracias que tengamos una version para steam, esperemos pronto  o de alguna manera podamos seguir jugando más titulos de la franquicia legalmente gracias a Steam, sin más que agregar se los recomiendo  mucho aun con sus contras, vale la pena totalmente este titulo, solo dejense llevar y disfruten del mismo
ME GUSTA PORQUE  A  HORA SE PUEDE GRABAR CON OBS Y HACER DIRECTO!

El juego es bastante bueno en historia y jugabilidad,pero funciona muy mal en la version de pc los controles no se configuran bien y tiende a sufrir de congelamientos de pantalla y crasheos a pesar de que mi pc sobrepasa los requisitos requeridos,si el juego hubiera sido arreglado con un parche valdria la pena pero la verdad la version de steam es igual de mala a la pirata,si vas a jugar este juego mejor juegalo desde una xbox 360 o ps3,ya que el port de pc es un mal port de las versiones de consola e ahi la razon por la cual el juego tiene tantos fallos.

si no tienen otra opcion y quieres jugarlo en pc,les recomiendo mucho utilizar un control los controles se configuran mejor que en teclado y es mas comodo de jugarlo,tambien se pueden acostumbrar a los congelamientos,dependiendo de su maquina no duraran mas de 1 segundo.ademas no pasar de resolucion 720p si se sobrepasa esa resolucion el juego tendra mas probabilidad de crasheo,hay un parche que se le puede aplicar al juego haciendolo mas jugable en pc con 60fps,resolucion 4k,solucionando los problemas de los congelamientos,pero tiene errores en  las texturas de algunas zonas,si quieren probarlo lo encuentran en silent hill homecoming unknown projectla primera pagina.


Lo recomiendo por el hecho de que es un buen silent hill,y si el juego esta bien configurado podra sufrir menos congelamientos,crasheos y problemas.
for a Silent Hill game, this is the least scariest game ever made

Technical issues aside, it is a fun and atmospheric game that is somewhat fulfilling my desire for a new Silent Hill. I love the series but have never played this one because of all the hate. If you install the fixes mentioned in another review, it runs mostly without issue.

Pros:
+Enemy design is good
+The atmosphere is well done
+Combat feels nice
+Seems to be pretty well written for the most part. The documents and whatnot feel like they are from a silent hill game.
+Has music and sound effects by Akira Yamaoka, which is part of what makes the series IMO. 
+I’m not sure if the OG art director Masahiro Ito was involved, but judging by what feels like clear inspiration from Jacob’s Ladder, they must have done their homework.  

Cons:
-Not developed/written by the original Team Silent
-Technical Issues
-Not quite the same vibe as the originals
-No auto saves, which normally would be okay but since it can be prone to crash, it can be a pain.
-Seems like a little too much focus on combat
-$40
 
I may have more pros/cons as I progress through the game. But all in all it seems like a good horror game, even if it’s not as good of a Silent Hill game. I would definitely not spend $40 on it, wait for a sale or find another way to acquire it.

Man what do I even like about Silent Hill Homecoming. Honestly not that much. I only made it about two hours into the game. I had nearly 30 crashes, two of which were hard crashes. The game is locked to 30 fps on PC. Unacceptable for a pc game in 2008. The combat system is easily exploited. The story so far makes no sense. I usually don't review a game until I have beaten it, but this game is literally unplayable. Also their was a glitch that caused my game to not register my keyboard or mouse imputs. And by alt tabing to fix this the game would crash additinally. Just a mess of a bad game. 2/10

column8:
[h1]Você sabia que para interpretar um personagem tão deprimido quanto o Coringa, o ator Joaquin Phoenix jogou a versão do Steam de Silent Hill Homecoming?[/h1]

O que eu quero dizer é: Não paguem por esse port, baixem p1r4t4 ou joguem outra versão. Eu tive dores de cabeça ao longo de toda gameplay, desde o cemitério de Shepherd's Glenn, nos Sewers e a parte final foi a que mais me irritou de longe por causa de inúmeros crashes, só pra ter uma ideia eu tive que matar a p0h4 do último boss 3 VEZES. Acredito que 3 horas do que joguei foi só porque tive que refazer os cenários, a sorte é que tem bastante saves no jogo. 

Já vi que a coisa ia ficar tensa nos primeiros 2 minutos de gameplay quando percebi que o framerate estava limitado a 30 e só tinha 2 opções pra perfomance de jogo. Medium e High. Nem preciso dizer que em vários lugares esses frames caíam abruptamente, chegou a bater 9 fps nos Sewers essa é de longe a pior parte do jogo, trava muuuuito e infelizmente é obrigatório passar por lá, mas por um lado é uma parte curta. 

Outra coisa negativa: O jogo crashava sempre que eu mudava de janela. Pelo menos acontecia com frequência, então eu evitava ao máximo. Eu não podia pausar o jogo e ir dar uma olhada no twitter, por exemplo, se não o jogo podia crashar e isso é extremamente irritante e chato.  

Eu ainda não te convenci a não comprar? vamos lá...

Comandos do jogo NÃO funcionam direito. As vezes é preciso mais de um click pra se ter uma resposta, eu passei perrengue por causa de um quick time event onde o jogo não contava o botão direito do mouse, as vezes o personagem não desviava dos golpes (apesar de que parte desse problema é culpa da hitbox dos inimigos) e você precisa sair do "shift" pra acessar o inventario, acredite isso vai fazer você perder vida se tiver em combate. Também os puzzles ficam mais confusos de se resolver, eles não foram bem adaptados pro mouse então clique onde for e reze pra mover alguma peça e saber o que está fazendo.

Falando sobre o jogo, eu até gostei dele. Esperava menos e algumas coisas me surpreenderam positivamente como a história que é simples, porém boa, trás referências diretas ao primeiro jogo e também segue a fórmula de simbologias e tem uma atmosfera mediana, dá pra ficar tensa com o ambiente em certos lugares e isso foi o que eu mais gostei nele. 

E é isso, apesar de ter mais pontos ruins que bons, esse port tem concerto por causa de toda a paciência e boa vontade de terceiros. A Double Helix não deu a f0d4 pro jogo e lançou essa bomba aí de qualquer jeito. Então meu conselho é esse, baixe em outro lugar, aplique o patch de correção e ai você não precisa mais perder a sanidade jogando. É isso.

column8: I've played a lot of games with awful PC ports. However, I've never played one that is as broken as Silent Hill Homecoming. From the constant crashes, broken graphics, and audio issues, SH Homecoming is an absolute nightmare to play on PC. Even with community fixes, such as the one by unknown project, the game is still pretty much unplayable. In fact, if you don't have surround sound headphones, eighty percent of the audio will only come out of your right speaker. While there are "fixes" for these issues, all of them come with major downsides: unknown project's patch removes quick-time events and film grain. Still, though, if Silent Hill Homecoming was as good as the first three SH games, it might be worth the trouble. However, SH Homecoming is easily one of the worst in the series. Personally, if you want to play SH Homecoming, I'd recommend buying it on the Xbox marketplace; it's also backwards compatible and twenty dollars cheaper. Unless you want to experience one of the most broken ports of all time, I'd stay away.
column9: I've played a lot of games with awful PC ports. However, I've never played one that is as broken as Silent Hill Homecoming. From the constant crashes, broken graphics, and audio issues, SH Homecoming is an absolute nightmare to play on PC. Even with community fixes, such as the one by unknown project, the game is still pretty much unplayable. In fact, if you don't have surround sound headphones, eighty percent of the audio will only come out of your right speaker. While there are "fixes" for these issues, all of them come with major downsides: unknown project's patch removes quick-time events and film grain. Still, though, if Silent Hill Homecoming was as good as the first three SH games, it might be worth the trouble. However, SH Homecoming is easily one of the worst in the series. Personally, if you want to play SH Homecoming, I'd recommend buying it on the Xbox marketplace; it's also backwards compatible and twenty dollars cheaper. Unless you want to experience one of the most broken ports of all time, I'd stay away.

column8:
Não me leve a mal, o jogo em si é divertido, mas esse port é tão meia boca que é triste.

O áudio do jogo é zoado, tem hora que só sai de um lado ou do outro, não é uniforme como um Stereo legal, por exemplo, você tá caminhando e dependendo do ângulo da câmera o áudio dos passos só saem em um lado, é agoniante.

Os monstros, principalmente os Lurkers, fazem barulho DEMAIS, o que além de doer os ouvidos faz o rádio ser um item praticamente inútil, eu não o liguei praticamente o jogo todo. E, se depois da parte da boneca, você tiver ele ligado na rua, prepare-se pra enfrentar uns vinte bichos ao mesmo tempo, até porque os Lurkers spawnam mais do que inimigo de MMO.

O jogo também tem um balanceamento meio pobre, depois que você pega a adaga cerimonial você só precisa de umas munições de shotgun pra um inimigo específico e bem raro, isso porque apesar da adaga dar "pouco" dano, TODO ATAQUE DO JOGO CAUSA HIT STUN, isso quer dizer que desde um lurker até o chefe final podem ser combados com a faquinha sem problemas.

Mas o maior problema que eu tive foram os absurdos slows durante várias partes do jogo ou quando ia salvar, meu Deus as vezes se passavam MINUTOS antes de conseguir destravar.

É um jogo que diverte quem gosta de jogos de terror e não liga tanto pra qualidade geral, até porque como um Silent Hill em termos de ambientação é bem legal, mas todos esses fatores me levaram a ficar um pouco chateado e eu joguei ele bem vagarosamente.
Works only on either Windows 7 64 Bit or Win 10 32 BIT versions...not sure about Windows 8.1.

I hand't played a Silent Hill game since 2012. The only ones left for me to play were this and Downpour. I can't play the latter because it hasn't been re-released, so this one had to do. I'm aware this game isn't as good as SH1 through SH4, but at least it scratched that itch, and after 8 years, that's all I needed.
El juego me gusta, lo malo es que no esta bien el codigo, por lo que no puedes pasar de la primera parte, he visto que hay que bajar muchos parches y la verdad eso esta de hueva

I have never before played a game that is so relentlessly frustrating in every single area of production. Every single aspect of this game: gameplay, visuals, narrative, overall presentation, et cetera, is so deeply flawed that I struggle to even grasp for straws of positive traits. The fact that some in the fanbase continue to defend Homecoming perplexes me. Knowing that Konami canceled Team Silent's Silent Hill 5 for this infuriates me. Naturally, all of this is a result of Konami commissioning Double Helix Games, a studio that had never made a game prior, to do the job, alongside Konami's demands that they modernize the series to fit with industry trends. Of course, this is not entirely Double Helix's fault, but also due to total mismanagement of the project on Konami's part. This is a spoiler review, so please be warned.

Firstly, the story. You are Alex Shepherd, a soldier coming back from the war to his town of Shepherd's Glen, a town neighboring Silent Hill. Strangely, your hometown is shrouded in a thick fog and people have gone missing. This isn't to mention the numerous ripped-off and unoriginal monsters roaming the streets. He finds his mother in a catatonic state and she tells him that his brother Joshua has gone missing. Unfortunately, this interesting premise is utterly wasted by the dumbfounding writing in this game. The game does absolutely nothing interesting with the soldier premise, never bothering to explore the trauma that could arise from fighting others in a war-torn nation. Alex's PTSD is never explored and the monster designs, manifested from his subconscious, never reflect this. More on this later. The supporting cast isn't much better, with love interest Elle Holloway being little more than that, a childhood love interest with no depth or development. Deputy Wheeler is little more than a minor black cop stereotype who sometimes helps out in combat. Margaret Holloway, the game's main antagonist doesn't even show her true colors as the villain until the cutscene you kill her (in a quick-time event, naturally). The only character I found interesting was Adam Shepherd, Alex's father. Adam naturally is a horrible person, but I feel like he had the most depth of the cast. When you do learn of the situation he was forced into and how he speaks of it afterward, it does make you consider if he genuinely feels remorse or is simply trying to save face. Adam isn't a great character by any means but he's the only one with some sort of depth. This lack of developed or memorable characters makes it hard to connect to the game's narrative and as a result, I found myself not really caring whether Alex and company survived. This isn't even to mention how the game just drops a braindead plot twist on you at the last minute. Alex was never a soldier and just came up with this ridiculously convoluted backstory to cope with Joshua's death. I find this to be the most egregious part of the game's narrative since it wastes the only interesting part of it: the premise. Throwing out a genuinely interesting story hook for a stupid bait-and-switch plot twist is the biggest mistake of this game. It makes all of the symbolism in the game feel completely disconnected from Alex and they feel like monsters in a void rather than manifestations from his psyche. It's just poorly written, predictable, and boring.

Homecoming was the first "next-gen" Silent Hill title, so naturally, at the very least you would expect some pretty visuals to go with it. This is false, unfortunately. Homecoming just reeks of budget constraints, and almost every part of this game's visuals feels cheap. Environments are generally rendered fine. They're large and detailed, even if they suffer from poor texture work. Character models are really ugly and suffer from a severe uncanny valley effect. They tend to have puppet facial animation and chunky, polygonal hair that seems to have matted together into one giant clump. The game also suffers from a severe case of asset reuse. I wouldn't be able to count on one hand the number of times the same corpse model is used over and over again. The game also has next to no graphics options, with only a resolution setting and a general quality option, the former of which is a bit redundant for me as the map and inventory break at resolutions higher than 1080p. The lack of any real video settings such as anti-aliasing or anisotropic filtering is unacceptable for a PC game from 2008, even if you can force them externally. The game is also unoptimized as all hell, even on a modern PC rig. Firstly, it's capped at 30fps, but using mods to unlock it produces an unstable framerate that goes from 165fps to 20fps based on the area. The game is also very unstable even with mods seeking to alleviate the issue. It has crashed on me numerous times and while I never lost a significant amount of progress, that didn't make it any less unacceptable.

From an art direction standpoint, Homecoming feels uninspired. It feels like Double Helix's art team diluted Silent Hill's aesthetic to the most Hollywood-esque marketable style, and makes it feel more like fire and brimstone rather than a surrealist hellscape. The monster designs feel uninspired, the ones that are new that is. Plenty of them are almost entirely ripped from previous games. The smogs are just lying figures. The nurses are just from the film. Believe it or not, Pyramid Head even makes a brief yet frustrating experience. Even if you ignore Homecoming's cheap technical appearance, it doesn't even offer interesting visuals on paper.

Double Helix set out to make Homecoming's combat more intuitive than the previous five games, all of which were criticized to some degree in that regard. Comedically, they somehow made it even less intuitive! Homecoming's combat is incredibly frustrating. The simple fact that the game's main mechanic is stunlocking, something which is considered an exploit in most games, is so hysterically absurd. Hysterical, of course, until you actually have to play it. I played on hard mode, as I usually do with games, and was surprised with how little room the game gives for failure. Enemies have much quicker reaction times than you do and have a much easier time stunlocking you than the player can ever hope to achieve. Enemy attacks are also poorly telegraphed, making it hard to determine when it's best to attack and when it's best to retreat, which is especially frustrating since the nurses have an instant one-hit-kill attack. Dodgerolling isn't as useful as it should be, as some game designers thought it was an absolutely brilliant idea to give the player no invincibility frames, defeating the entire point of an evasive maneuver. Enemies are also total bullet sponges, eating up your ammunition and taking absurd amounts of melee attacks to kill. That would be fine in a survival horror game, but Homecoming is action horror, and therefore it feels counterintuitive. Puzzle-wise, the game puts in little effort. It feels like they're just there for the sake of it rather than genuinely wanting to make the player think, as they are all insanely easy. Some of them are even sliding block puzzles. Yeah.

Silent Hill: Homecoming spits in the face of everything the franchise stands for. The story is generic and poorly written, the gameplay is frustrating and unintuitive, and the game itself is held together by duct tape. It's really not worth playing at all, even if you're a diehard Silent Hill fan. If you absolutely must play it, play it with Unknownproject's Patch, or on a console where crashes are less of an issue.

推荐一首游戏专辑里的歌《one more soul to the call》。

sinceramente no se como de niño me llego a gustar... una decepción, e encontrado mas bugs que en cyberpunk 2077, a este juego le falta desarrollo.. como se nota que lo sacaron muy pronto.. el modo combate es pésimo, le das a esquivar a la derecha y te esquiva hacia la izquierda, gastas mas botiquines de lo que deberías por eso  el timing es malo no.. lo siguiente. le doy 3 estrellas no merece la pena a no ser que quieras experimentar nuevas sensaciones solo decir que en la parte de la comisaria de policia cuando terminas con el primer boss en la segunda puerta que abre se queda pillado el agente caminando hacia la puerta sin poder abrirla, tuve que empezar de nuevo la pelea con el boss.

Lejos el peor Silent Hill de la franquicia, en serio, juego culiao malo. Para rematar, el port a PC es asqueroso. Tan así que un ruso tuvo que darse la paja de arreglar todo el juego con parches. Si lo tengo acá por dos razones: la primera, porque encontré la key en 300 CLP; y la segunda, por nostalgia. Lo peor es que a Konami le gustó... bueno, que podemos esperar de ellos.

Si tengo que rescatar algo es su OST y el diseño de los bosses, todo lo demás es basura. Gracias Konami por occidentalizar la franquicia, eternamente agradecido con sus increíbles decisiones

column8: good

You know, generally I'm not hard on a game for being a little buggy compared to other ports and let that slide. As far as Silent Hill: Homecoming, I can't. The game just has too many issues. Half the time, I'm fighting how to set my controls and can't play the game because it doesn't recognize my right stick in the right ways for me to move the camera around. The game crashes far too easily, so if you made progress? Be sure to cry over the fact that you did and lost it. I think I've spent just as much time in this game playing it as I have setting my controls. Even when I do manage to set my controls, they still manage to do something ridiculous. I had my left D-Pad button set as switch weapons and somehow, it managed to become R1. I thought "Maybe I screwed it up", but nope! I kept trying to do it and realized "No, I'm just screwed and this is what it's gonna be on my controller no matter what I set it to." which was annoying to say the least. There were times I'd lose important items I wanted to save up, just because I pressed a button that I didn't even know was suppose to be the item button since I couldn't set my control. I had to constantly adjust. If you minimize the game, make sure you save.

It's not like the game's not that bad. It's not the best Silent Hill, but it seems like it'd at least be kind of fun to play IF you can manage to get it working. And one last note? The sound in this game plays out of ONE side of your speakers and it's annoying on the ears.

column8:
Ok.. so lets be real. 

The combat system is shit. Dodging is just a 50/50, and most of the time you get hit anyway even though you dodge. I tried so many times to figure out the time'ing when to dodge, but sometimes it worked and sometimes it didn't. Like there's no fucking rule? 

Like that wasn't enough the game crashed soooo many times and I had to replay. And I bumped on to a lot of lags as well. Like people say the pc port is trash. 

If you are a hardcore Silent Hill fan I would give this a chance, otherwise dont bother. 
I gotta give them though the bosses were memorable and the story was ok. Thought it kinda lacked the depth of the og Silent Hill games.

column8: There are a lot of bugs that sometimes interfere with gameplay.

Não é o melhor silent hill em quesito historia ou gameplay, mas o porte pra pc ficou horroroso, tive diversos problemas de travamentos e até mesmo de crash do jogo, perdendo assim meu save, simplismente desisto de tentar zerar esse jogo, to só me frustrando com ele, não recomendo a experiencia, ela tende a ser mais negativa do que positiva.

Los pros:
* Buen Silent Hill que por momentos recuerda a los clásicos de la saga
* Gran historia que la calificaría como uno de las mejores entre los Silent Hill

Los contras:
* Mal port, por momentos se traba y en raras ocasiones se cierra
* Al contrario de los demás juegos de la saga, se basa más en el combate que en el terror
* Precio muy elevado si no se compra en oferta, especialmente para un juego de hace ya 13 años
My girlfriend bought this game for me right as I was talking about how bad I heard it was, so that I could see if it really was that bad. It was.
column9: My girlfriend bought this game for me right as I was talking about how bad I heard it was, so that I could see if it really was that bad. It was.

column8:
I'm enjoying it very much, its definitely Silent Hill... maybe not quite as good as 2 or 3, but what is?

The game does run for me at 1080p but certain items like the in-game map (which if you know Silent Hill, is at least a little important) don't work right.  So I'm running the game at 720p, still a big upgrade from console.  I did have to edit the cfg file to set the resolution without crashing, if you know nothing about computers that might scare you, but it took me less than a minute to fix.

I have had a couple of crashes (other than changing the resolution in game) but only 1 was during any kind of gameplay and the others were when the game went to reload the save after my death. Took 2 seconds to restart the game and continue playing.

I have been getting a few lag spikes, usually when first entering a new area, I did have one of those crash but I was also spamming buttons which might have triggered a "not responding" crash.  The other spikes I've managed just to wait out 1-2 seconds and then there's no more trouble until the next area.

These tech issues might bother some but I routinely play games that are "old" and almost none of them work 100% correctly and there are some even on GOG that require some workarounds, so they don't bother me any.

Another "old game" issue is the controls... I've always called these "tank" controls... because it feels like you are driving a tank, pretty similar to things like Resident Evil 1,2 and Silent Hill 1,2,3, and well a lot of games at the time. So with a gamepad at least I'm not really having any trouble with the controls, mouse and keyboard probably is worse... but I don't see it as a unique problem to Homecoming.

As far as the game it self, I personally think for the age that it looks great, runs decent and is an underrated game.  Sure its not any of those fantastic games I mentioned earlier... but I would still call it a good game.  While I wouldn't say it does anything perfectly, it does very much look, sound and feel like a Silent Hill game.  

Homecoming is certainly not Resident Evil, it's not Outlast, it's not Amnesia, it's not Evil Within... and to me, that's a great thing because there's just nothing else out there with this very specific Silent Hill style.

I could live with that if the save system wasn't through sparse check points.

in the state that this game is in, i cannot recommend the PC port of this game.

runs great, except for the fact that even after installing the fan-made audio fix and the unknownproject fix, 80% of the audio still only comes out of the right ear no matter what i do.

however, this game is still a great game on console. not my favorite Silent Hill game, but it's still a pretty enjoyable experience once you get past the clunky controls.

unless someone has a fix for the audio balancing, i can't play this game and that's really disappointing because it's the only available Silent Hill game on steam.

column8: merci Monsieur Akira Yamaoka!

This is not only the worst Silent Hill but just a terrible game made with no talent. Its worst that a bad fanmade SH rippoff. 

Designs are terrible, all women, no matter how old they are, mother, daughters, etc... all look 18 with no wrinkles, i actually confuse a mother and daughter, they even have the same hairstyle.

The combat its broken, sometimes you dont even make damage at all, enemies can take between 20 or 70 hits, no problem. Some regular enemies can take two full shotgun loads, no problem either.

Dodge system is broken, most of the times doesnt even work.

The story is terrible, it makes no sense. The dialogues are embarasing... you get into town, you kill a bunch of monsters (no introduction or whatever... dude knows he is a silent hill character) you arrive home "sup mom? whats for dinner?"

Puzzles are dumb or impossible, pick your fave! The last puzzle its impossible unless you are the developer, makes no sense. 

The "city" its only two short streets, thats it. Forget about exploring, finding empty random shops or gas stations, you know... the usual feeling of being in silent hill? Forget about that, just from ugly point A to ugly point B.

Loading times takes from 50 to 70 seconds and there is one after the other, the loading time to save game its 30 seconds each time... have fun!

The game its broken as hell so have fun too fixing it! You wont fix it all but it will be playable... with crashes and everything but not so many.

It has nothing of the talent, nothing of the dark beauty of the good Silent Hills, nothing.

But for no reason, explanation or anything, Pyramid head shows up a couple of times! Dont you like that? Also the truckdriver from Origins, who doesnt like cameos for no reason?!

It was a chore and i would play Book of Memories a thousend times before getting into this sht again.

column8: Le plus mauvais des silent hill, le niveau zero du level design et le jeu freez regulierement + crash, une nulité malgré quelques bonnes idées ici et là.

Olha, primeiro de tudo, sou fã da saga (poderia dizer órfão?) e já joguei todos os jogos. Na minha opinião, este é o último Silent Hill que bebe naquele estilo do 1, 2 e 3 e Origins (o 4, o Shattered Memories e o Downpour têm propostas diferentes). Aqui você vai se sentir em Silent Hill de novo.

Homecoming não é o melhor dos jogos da série, mas a sua maior qualidade é ter a essência da saga nele. Vagar pela cidade sem saber para onde tem que ir. Sirenes. Silêncio. Olhar para o mapa milhares de vezes. Correr de alguma criatura bizarra que apareceu do nada. Este jogo pode ser considerado um Silent Hill "raiz". 

A história é interessante: o soldado Alex Shepherd volta à sua cidade natal para descobrir o que aconteceu com o seu irmão e, bem, sua mãe está... estranha quanto a isso, e seu pai sumiu. Acontecem reviravoltas, encontros e desencontros e Alex acaba em Silent Hill.

A jogabilidade, agora reforçada por controlarmos um soldado, é mais focada na pancadaria, nas esquivas, nos tiros - Alex é o personagem mais badass da franquia - e pode não agradar algumas pessoas. Eu particularmente achei legal essa nova maneira de encarar Silent Hill.

O único e principal problema desse jogo são os CRASHS. Eu quase desisti de terminar esse jogo por isso. É crash no salvamento, é crash na troca de ângulo da câmera, é crash em batalha com boss. Faltou um fio de cabelo para a minha experiência com o jogo ter sido arruinada. A única coisa que salvou minha gameplay foi baixar um patch que ajudou um pouco nos problemas. Dá uma procurada pelo Google que você acha ele fácil - ele é essencial para você jogar.

No mais, é um bom jogo. Na minha opinião, o último decente da saga. Silent Hill Homecoming me fez voltar àquela sensação de ter 16 anos novamente jogando Silent Hill 1 em meu PSOne. Que saudade.

Silent Hill: Homecoming is the most broken, pathetic, and vile entry in the Silent Hill franchise. Words simply cannot begin to describe the sheer pain and agony I have felt from playing 8 minutes of this absolute atrocity. This complete jumble of code, scripts, and models. If it were up to me and I had the power to change one point in history, I would most definitely travel back to the point that this game was in production and destroy every single one of the files. 

Don't play Silent Hill Homecoming.

Don't.

column8:
[h1]Un Silent Hill indegno del suo nome.[/h1]

È stato il primo della serie che giocai. Ero ancora piccolo e inesperto, e non avendo ancora giocato gli altri all'epoca mi parve un bel gioco con una trama carina e delle atmosfere horror da paura. Rivedendolo adesso, con la consapevolezza maturata negli anni, quello che posso dire è che è un gioco che non si merita assolutamente il nome di Silent Hill e che non consiglierei nemmeno al mio peggior nemico. Il videogioco si discosta molto dai canoni originali della serie in quanto è stato sviluppato da un team americano. Ispirandosi enormemente al primissimo film di Silent Hill hanno tirato fuori un prodotto con del fanservice ingiustificato, inserendo all'interno del gioco mostri come [i]Pyramid Head[/i], il quale non ha nulla a che fare con il protagonista, giusto per far urlare il pubblico più generalista che magari si è avvicinato al videogioco proprio dopo aver visto il film.
Il [b]level design[/b] è scandaloso, aree composte interamente da corridoi da far percorrere ai giocatori che tolgono totalmente quel brivido di scoperta dato dall'esplorazione. Per non parlare della città poi, molto più vuota e noiosa da esplorare rispetto agli altri capitoli della serie. 
Ma ora parliamo del tasto più dolente del gioco a mio parere, il [b]combat system[/b]. A differenza degli altri giochi qui troviamo un combattimento più action, cosa non per forza negativa se il loro scopo era quello di attirare gente fuori dalla nicchia già creatasi. Il problema è che andando avanti sempre di più nel gioco e incontrando nuovi mostri ci si accorge che l'unica cosa che ne ricaviamo da esso è frustrazione. Schivare correttamente i colpi dei nemici sembra più sia dovuto a pura fortuna che altro in quanto gli attacchi dei mostri sono spesso poco prevedibili e le hit box sono poco precise. E questo non porta ad altro che frustrazione e rabbia, più che alla paura che ci aspetteremmo da un gioco simile, ogni qualvolta ci si presenta davanti un mostro da sconfiggere. Parlando del [b]comparto tecnico[/b] invece troviamo sia cose positive che negative. Graficamente il gioco si presenta discretamente per il tempo in cui è stato sviluppato. Purtroppo però le animazioni facciali dei personaggi non risultano sempre convincenti, risultando spesso legnose e finte.

Andando invece ora a parlare dei pochi lati positivi di questo titolo possiamo dire che la [b]trama[/b] ha qualche sprazzo di originalità. Infatti seppur la messa in scena non sia assolutamente delle migliori, la storia risulta un minimo coinvolgente e interessante. 
Altri fattori positivi sono le [b]musiche[/b], composte dall'amatissimo Akira Yamaoka, e i [b]design[/b] dei mostri, alcuni a mio parere molto ispirati e spaventosi (come ad esempio il boss [i]Asphyxia[/i]).

Infine, parliamo del [b]porting[/b] per PC: l'ho rigiocato utilizzando direttamente la patch di [i]unknownproject[/i] in quanto avevo provato la versione vanilla anni fa e ne ero rimasto disgustato. Paragonabile al porting originale del primo Dark Souls. Una vera porcheria buttata qui su Steam giusto per.
Fortunatamente esiste la patch sopracitata che risolve la maggior parte dei problemi (non tutti purtroppo). Grazie ad essa ho potuto giocare in 21:9 in 1440p con un framerate sbloccato. Purtroppo però sono presenti numerosi cali, soprattutto nei momenti più concitati, anche utilizzando hardware assolutamente performante. In più i crash sono ancora presenti, sia quelli randomici sia quelli fissi che succedono ogni qualvolta si decida di alt-tabbare il gioco.

In [b]conclusione[/b], seppur non sia completamente da buttare, ne sconsiglio assolutamente l'acquisto.

column8:
Oyunu 66 dakika oynamış görünebilirim ama bu sizi yanıltmasın. İnternetten kurduğum fix pack yüzünden Steam oynama süreme ekleme yapmadı yoksa oyunu bitirdim. 

Olumlu özellikleri
+ Her ne kadar Team Silent ekibinin yaptığı oyunların hikayesi kadar iyi bir hikayesi olmasa da gayet güzel ve sonu süprizli bir hikayeye sahip.
+ Müzikleri çok güzel.
+ Bazı bölümlerin tasarımları ortam sesleri ile karıştığı zaman insanı ürkütüyor. 

Olumsuz Özellikleri

- Fan pack kursanız dahi hatrı sayılır miktarda bug ile oynamaya mecbursunuz. Ben pack kurmadan steam hali ile oynamak istiyorum diyorsanız kolay gelsin. Oyundan atma, grafik bozulması, özellikle puzzle sırasında fare algılamaması ve save algılamama/silme gibi hatalar ile başa çıkmak zorundasınız. Pack sadece karşılaşma ihtmalinizi biraz düşürüyor o kadar.
- Save noktaları birbirine çok uzak. Normalde sorun etmem ama bazı zamanlar oyundan atınca hatrı sayılı bir zamanı tekrar oynamak zorunda kalıyorsunuz.
- O nasıl bir combat sistemidir ya. Canavarla boğuşmaktan ve mermi/can ayarı yapmaktan çok combat sistemi sizi yoruyor. 
- İlginç bir şekilde bıçak ile baltanın ve diğer yakın dövüş silahlarının hasarı aynı...  Bari bunu düzgün yapsaydınız.
- Komik bir şekilde yanınızda çok az mermi taşıyabiliyorsunuz. Örnek olarak tabancanın içindeki dahil 3 şarjör merminiz oluyor.

 fix:  https://unknownproject.github.io/silent_hill 

Basta baixar executar o launcher, baixar as atualizações do jogo e substituir os arquivos pelo do jogo na pasta ''Silent hill'' localizada em ''Steam apps''. Após isso basta abrir o jogo pelo novo launcher ''Bin v:30''

Edit: Obrigado pelos pontos <3

Es cierto que el juego tiene algunos problemas, en especial el crasheo puesto que es el que mas se presenta (amenos en ''gama media'', probablemente los de ''gama baja'' presentan los problemas de audio como diálogos y efectos de sonido o audio atrasado) pero en si el juego es muy bueno si exceptuamos este problema, y para mi fortuna tan solo presento de vez en cuando el problema del crasheo.
