column8:
Possibly the worst Silent Hill game of them all, certainly worse than any of the numbered entries (my play time is largely down to the amount of time I left the game paused and walked away).
The level design and plot are definitely the weakest of the series, with many of the enemies being poorly though out or rip offs from other games in the series and the puzzles are also sub-par. The only exception to this is the prison which really deserves to be part of a better game. 
A large part of the combat is also built around a dodge mechanic, which might have been enjoyable if the engine was responsive enough for it to work properly, or the enemies attack speed was based on the actual dodge system rather than what the designers wanted it to be. Instead you will almost always get hit when dodging and many enemies will repeatedly dodge or block your attacks. Ive died several times in boss fights getting stuck in a loop of attempt doge, get hit, attempt dodge, get hit, attempt dodge, fall down and repeat until dead.
This game is also horrifically optimised for PC, items and maps dont render correctly above 720p despite in engine support. Despite playing on a high end system load times seem to be the same as on PS3/360 and the game freezes for a few seconds 95% of the time when: opening the save menu, closing the save menu, loading a video, exiting a video, loading a new area and having loaded a new area, as well as random freezes throughout. The game also has a habit of crashing on death, making the games checkpoints useless.

Instead of wasting £18 on this game, try to track down a PS2 and Silent Hill 1-4, even at 10x the price it will be better value for money. Alternatively pirate Silent Hill 1-4 and play them that way, as Im sure serving 10 years for copyright infringement would be more enjoyable than playing Homecoming.

Maybe not the right game to get introduced to the Silent Hill franchise, but surely not the worst of them
Silent Hill Homecoming can be considered a good game when it comes to the story, atmosphere and puzzles; sadly, the combat controls aren't very responsive and the stun lock can be very punishing, enemies don't telegraph properly the attacks, the weapons feel clumsy to use (the melee ones in particular) and avoiding enemies isn't always an option.

Overall, i feel that the game experience can be expressed with a 7.5: there are good aspects in it, if you can bear with the defects i cited early

Give it a try and see if it fits for you

Honestly, this game isn't as bad as people say it is in terms of what the writing and gameplay could be, it's just not as good as the original games. I can see what they were trying to do, the more involved combat mechanics are quite fun sometimes. Clues for puzzles could be a bit easier to spot at times, and I really don't get what was happening in the last puzzle.

The main issue is that the PC port is not good. I had a relatively glitch-free play through and didn't get any of the game-breaking problems, but there were times my weapons would just stop damaging enemies, and the game would sometimes just close randomly and I'd lose a whole chunk of gameplay.
If it wasn't for the glitches, it would be a mediocre-to-fair action horror, but with the glitches it's just not really worth the frustration of having to play the same twenty minutes of game over and over because it keeps crashing.

column8:
Já completei esse jogo há mais de 10 anos atrás, antes mesmo de ser disponibilizado para a Steam.

Sou grande fã de Silent Hill e mesmo esse SH Homecoming sendo um dos mais odiados pelos fãs, eu gosto do game, possui uma ótima ambientação e ótimas músicas.

Porém não recomendo que gaste dinheiro comprando essa versão de PC, ela é extremamente bugada, sendo necessário a instalação de diversos patchs de correção criado por fãs para que seja possível ao menos jogar.

Esperando a Konami ter um pouco de vergonha na cara e disponibilizar na Steam os outros títulos da série (e sem bugs).

Ne vous fiez pas a mon temps de jeu, j'ai du supporter ce scandale pendant près de 4h. C'est juste que le jeu ne fonctionne pas si vous ne le lancez pas avec une version patchée, donc pas par Steam.

Malheureusement, si le pauvre patch fait ce qu'il peut, le jeu se refuse obstinément a son propriétaire. 
Le support manette ne fonctionne pas nativement, le jeu crash systématique en cas de alt tab, la sauvegarde vous ramène 30min avant la supposé sauvegarde. Un festival qui ferait passer Deadly Premonition pour un jeu bien optimisé !

Je pense sincèrement que Silent Hill Homecoming est doué de conscience, et vous implore de ne surtout pas l'acheter.

Pour en venir a ce que nous raconte ce Silent Hill vu par les Américains, vous incarnez un golmont type "j'ai fait cette putain de guerre et je rentre chez moi " (il a un drapeau Américain sur l'épaule), et qui a oublié un truc. 
Oui, comme dans Silent Hill 2 mais en vraiment très con. 
Double Helix s'est sûrement dit que si les Japonais pouvaient le faire, alors eux aussi.

Du coup notre brave soldat parle a des gens chelou dans la brume, il y a des infirmières a la poitrine généreuse et de de la psychologie PMU a tour de bras. 
Un pur cauchemar, mais pas le bon.

ABSOLUTE GARBAGE PORT. Had to use multiple outside sources for the game to run properly, and still it was terrible. Crashes constantly, inputs don't work (dodging is near impossible) and it's not worth your time.

Ancak Homecoming seriye pek yakışmıyor, keşke Konami biraz daha üzerine düşseydi, tadından yenmez bir yapım olabilirdi bizler için. Silent Hill olduğu için isminin hatrına olumlu not  veriyorum.

Son olarak sevgili Konami güzelim seriyi heba etmeyi bırakın artık, en kötü Capcom'un Resident Evil serisine yaptığı gibi sizde bu seriyi ele alın bir Remake yapın, lütfen.

Do not let the Silent Hill "Elitists" Deter you from trying this out
This game has the atmosphere and spirit of a Silent Hill game along with an Amazing soundtrack and the last game composed by the great Akira Yamaoka
But the story and characters are heavily flawed,boring and flat at their best and unoriginal and lacking at their worst.
For the first American Silent Hill game you can tell that they try their hardest to pay respect and homage to all the work that came before and that is no easy task to say the least
People seem to have a problem with this games combat for which i genuinely cannot understand especially if you've played the original trilogy it's still as stiff and clunky as before
It's a different take and can be fun,An improvement though? I'm not so sure.......
Thanks to a fan who is passionate about fixing this abhorrent PC port the game can now be played in 4K resolutions and at 60 fps but CAUTION
ONLY PICK THIS GAME UP ON SALE OR THROUGH A SITE but that shouldn't really have to be said hahaha but still its one  of the reasons people could be detracted from trying it out but you could do something worse with 5 dollars (on sale) ,Konami sucks and its a shame
All ramblings aside,Hope you check it out.

column8:
En başta belirtmeliyim ki, Silent Hill'den çok Silent Hill'e benzeyen bir yapım olmuş. Bu ismi kullanmak yerine farklı bir isimde çıkış yapsalardı, eminim daha çok sevilen bir oyun olurdu.

Karakterimiz Alex Shepherd savaşta yara almış bir özel kuvvetler askeridir. Yaralarının iyileşmesi için hastanede tedavi gören Alex, doğduğu yer olan Shepherd's Glen'e babası ve kardeşinin kaybolduğunu duyduktan sonra geri dönme kararı almıştır. Ancak eve vardığında annesinin de garip davranışları ve nörolojik bir takım bozukluklarının olduğunu fark etmiştir. Annesinden istediği cevapları alamayan Alex, Shepherd's Glen içinde kendi çabalarıyla kardeşini aramaya başlayacaktır.

Çıktığı yıl göz önünde bulundurulduğunda oldukça tatmin edici bir grafik yapısı olduğunu belirtmeliyim. Çevre ve karakter modellemeleri oldukça başarılı. Oyun atmosferi hissettirmeyi başarıyor. Ayrıca çevredeki bir çok ögeyle etkileşime girebiliyor olmak da, oyunun ayrıca artılarından biri olmuş.

Oynanış tarafıysa aslında bütün sıkıntının başladığı yer olarak karşımıza çıkıyor. Silent Hill oyunu olmasını bir tarafa koyacak olursak; bir psikolojik gerilim oyunu için fazlasıyla aksiyon bulunduruyor. Bu durum, toplamda 5-6 yaratık modellemesi ve vuruş hissi kötü olan bir oyun için oynanışı oldukça rutinleştiriyor ve en önemlisi korku hissiyatını oldukça azaltıyor. Hal böyleyken bir de mücadele tarafının basitliği ve geri kalmışlığı durumu iyice kötü bir kıvama getiriyor. Çoğu yaratık ile savaşırken sadece öldürene kadar düz vuruş yapmanız gerekiyor; karşılık veremiyorlar ve öldürmenizi bekliyorlar. Bazı yaratıklar ise fazla güçlü olduğu için anlamsızca fazla zaman harcamanızı gerektiriyor. Şahsen bu şekilde bir aksiyon tarafı yapacaklarına, hiç bir aksiyon ögesi olmadan sadece yürümeye yönelik bir oyun üretselerdi, olduğu halinden daha başarılı bir yapım olacağını düşünüyorum.

Oynanış tarafında ayrıca yeni bir özellik var ki, diğer serilere göre kendini farklı göstermeyi başarıyor. Oyun 'metroidvania' tarzına bürünmüş. Edindiğimiz silahlar sayesinde, önceden önünden açamadan geçtiğimiz kapıları geri dönerek açmamız ve oradan ilerlememiz gerekebiliyor. Şahsen oyuna farklı bir tat kattığını söyleyebilirim.

Oyundaki bulmaca sayısının az ama basit olmadığını da belirtmeliyim. Bu konuda serinin önceki oyunlarını aratmıyor.

Silent Hill Homecoming için söylenebilecek en can sıkıcı tarafsa, bir çok bug ve optimizasyon sıkıntılarının bulunmasıdır sanırım. Baştan sona uzun bekleme süreleri, durduk yere olan takılma ve çökmeler ve tabii ki buglarıyla yapım, fazlasıyla diken üstünde oynamanıza neden oluyor. Kayıt noktaları arasında genel anlamda fazla mesafe olduğu için, bir süre ilerleyip kaydetme noktası bulamadığınızda; herhangi bir çökmeye denk gelmemek için endişelenmeye başlıyorsunuz. Bu durum da oyuncuyu, oyunun dünyasının hissiyatından çıkarıyor.

Oynanış tarafı ve yapısal sıkıntıları bir kenara bırakıldığında, oynadığınız oyunu önceki serileriyle karşılaştırmadığınız sürece hikaye ve atmosfer açısından istediğinizi bulabileceğiniz bir oyun olacaktır. Türkçe dil desteği bulunmuyor olsa da, internet üzerinde Türkçe yaması mevcut. 7-8 saatlik oynanış süresi ve tekrar oynanabilirliğinin düşük olmasına rağmen yine de fiyatını hak ettiğini düşünüyorum. Ancak indirim dönemlerinde oldukça uygun bir fiyata düştüğünü belirtmekte de fayda var.
Optymalizacja jest tragiczna mam stałe 20 fps ;< a gra nam daje limit max do 30

column8:
Maybe not the right game to get introduced to the Silent Hill franchise, but surely not the worst of them
Silent Hill Homecoming can be considered a good game when it comes to the story, atmosphere and puzzles; sadly, the combat controls aren't very responsive and the stun lock can be very punishing, enemies don't telegraph properly the attacks,  the weapons feel clumsy to use (the melee ones in particular) and avoiding enemies isn't always an option.

Overall, i feel that the game experience can be expressed with a 7.5: there are good aspects in it, if you can bear with the defects i cited early 

Give it a try and see if it fits for you

I really wanted to play this game. I played it a long time ago back when I had a PS3, so it's really just the nostalgia that drove me this far for what's otherwise a pretty subpar horror game. But even after all that, I physically can't play the game. I've put so much time, effort, and patience into fixing the issues that come with this port. 
After defeating the first boss of the game, I'm stuck because in order to progress I have to follow the AI. But the AI is broken; just walking in circles. I would go see if there's a fix for this, but I'm sure yet another technical issue is just gonna pop up even if I do manage to get him to open a door for me. And because of the game's reliance on manual save points, you can't save right after you defeat the first boss. So in order to test, I'll have to fight that thing every single time. It's just not worth it for me.
I'd rather not say much about the game itself because I haven't gotten to finish it, so this review is really just for the Steam port.

column8: Jeden z lepszych Silent Hill w jakie grałem  , jednak na PS3 optymalizacja była nieco lepsza.

Truly awful PC port. I was able to get through the game with the help of a fan-made patch, but still had issues with controller support, totally busted audio, and messed up lighting and brightness in certain areas. Beyond the port quality, the game is just ok - I think the dev's heads were in the right place but they didn't have the time or talent to execute at a high level. The combat for example has promise, but in practice is just extremely jank. Most enemies can just be stun-locked by mashing attack - BUT you too can get caught in stun-locks. Still, the creature design and atmosphere is on point at times so it's not all bad, but can not be recommended due to the low quality of this port.

column8:
you cant play this game as is from steam. i mean that literally, you cant. the game is such a mess you would think it was an alpha build. im talking about messed up audio and frame rate in the single digits.

now, if you install the unknown project's fix ( https://unknownproject.github.io/silent_hill ) along with an audio fix ( https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1295856698 ) then the game actually works pretty damn flawlessly. 

there was 1 instance of crashing for me and it was when leaving the police station so when you get to the police station make sure you save. the only solution was to open the game up and play through it again and i was able to get passed it.

so now, with these fixes in place how is the game? well, story aside, its pretty damn good. if there was a fix for the crash id say this was the definitive way to play it. 

if you dont install the fan made patch then dont play it on pc, play it on the xbox series x with the higher resolution.

column8:
Silent Hill: Homecoming não foi um bom jogo, é como se o jogo estivesse a subir para um muro chamado "neutro" enquanto estivesse quase a cair para o lado "mau".
Os gráficos são "meh", a jogabilidade é má, o PC port deste jogo não foi bom, muitos bugs, a história é má, os modelos dos personagens parecem água de cão, tudo é tão esquisito parece que tudo é castanho com cinzento. Konami não deveria de ter mandado este jogo para a Double Helix Games, por favor, é demais pedir para o Team Silent fazer um bom jogo? Eu sei que eles já sairam da empresa mas ainda dá para junta-los, e eu não acredito  que eles acham que é isto que é um jogo de terror, porque acredita, não é, Konami por favor ponha os jogos de Team Silent no Steam, há o Silent Hill 4 no GOG se alguem quiser jogar. Mais uma vez, vai te foder KONAMI.
Pallaringas no!
column9: Pallaringas no!

column8: Compensa jogar esse jogo.
porte horrivel de nojento passa longe disso se você tiver amor próprio pelo seu dinheiro e por sua sanidade mental

Não é o que eu gosto mais da série, mas a premissa me fez gostar, por colocar você na pele de uma personagem diferente dos demais da série. Os gráficos da geração do PS3 envelheceram bem, e a jogabilidade é bem dinâmica, infelizmente encurtaram bem o jogo comparado a outros Silent Hills, mas ainda assim recomendo, principalmente comprando em uma promoção.

column8:
这是一个能让我通宵推进根本停不下来的游戏，现在看这体量也许不算什么，但在当年是绝对的大作，剧情也是好得没话说，直到末尾我在了解到了全部的真相之后，一阵寒意不禁从我心底泛起，令人寻味良久，寂静岭的恐怖不仅在于充满未知恐惧愿的迷雾，还在于主角在层层揭露黑暗而残酷的事实的过程中带给人心理的冲击和震撼，这些是一般恐怖游戏中的jump scare所远不能比的。值得一提的还有游戏配乐，逃出医院后Alex搭查韦斯的车回家，途中卡车上放的音乐仅几句就惊艳了我，特意去网易云上找到了，叫《Alex Theme》，无论是曲调还是歌词都十分贴合游戏背景。

再说说缺点吧，优化太差以至于游戏时常卡顿，以及偶尔会闪退，所以请多存档。还有就是bug非常多，比如在家中自己卧室的床上拿到手电筒后，床对面有一书柜，将三本书往左挪开后会发现一个开关，但在1080p下点开关没反应，此时可以先存档，调低分辨率后再进游戏就行了，或者接手柄操作也可以。打开开关后能进入柜子后的密室，在里面可以拿到一张家里的地图，但是你不拿也没关系，反正没有任何收集成就，家里就这么大想迷路都难，对剧情也没有任何影响。

 游戏共有5个结局，6套服装，每达成一种结局就解锁一套对应的服装，在二周目开始新游戏时可更换服装，但第二套年轻的Alex的装束需要用其他方式取得，方法为进入游戏后在标题界面不要按其他键，按↑↑↓↓←→←→Esc和Enter。具体达成各个结局的方法网上搜一下就知道了，如果想打全结局的话，建议第一次先打出UFO结局，这样二周目回家后就可以在自己卧室里拿到一把无限子弹的激光枪，之后游戏通关就会很轻松。

最后再说一句，这部归乡是寂静岭系列中唯——部上steam的，虽然时隔十几年我才玩到，但依然感觉可以称得上是神作。只可惜这个系列已经很久没有新作了，而科乐美现在沉迷柏青哥无法自拔，所以只要这个IP还捏在科乐美手里，就会一直被雪藏下去，真心希望卡普空这些大厂能把寂静岭的IP买下来重启。

I absolutely loved this game from my childhood, i really wanted to run back through it to see what i remembered, too bad it doesn't function. There is effectively no actual PC version of the game, this is a very very terrible port of the xbox 360 version, if you want to download and run a bunch of different programs to try to trick your computer into running like an xbox it might let you play it for more than 30 seconds without crashing. It runs smooth as butter in the tutorial, but the moment you get to your house it just crashes repeatedly, you have no hope of actually playing the game, you're better off just trying to get a copy of an actual 360 disk off of ebay and playing it with an actual xbox.

column8:
You know I actually managed to get this game working and I can say it is one damn good game but this port is is a fucking nightmare.
I think ill do some pros and cons first

Pros:
The game feels like a Silent Hill game (which certain other game didnt achieve) 
Alex is a good character
The graphics are pretty good for 2008
The characters are all well written and are all used well in the plot
The plot itself is a bit of a copycat of 2 but I think it changes stuff up enough.
The Levels are pretty good
The Puzzles can sometimes be pretty good.
The Pacing is really good you always feel like your making progress and the game rarely slows to a crawl or has a dull moment
There's a decent weapon variety 
The Acting is Superb
Writing is excellent

Cons: 
The PC port sucks for a variety of reasons I will cover
It requires a (Unkown Project is what I used) patch or else the game will crash constantly 
Even when patched the game still crashes when loading saves 9/10 times and thats not an exaduration i literally spent at one point 20 mins just loading a save and then the game will crash sometimes it wont but its a huge pain in the ass. 
The facial animations are roboticy when in regular gameplay (in cutscenes their great)
I think this is a just me thing but if I go to 1080p everything 2d (map, text, Steam Notifications) will look fuzzy.
The Loading screens are atrociously long
The Combat is a mixed bag. You can stunlock most enemies with the basic knife and usually its way more useful than the Pipe and Fire Axe. And the nurses who are one of the first enemies you come across are the hardest in the game who use scalpels and like the Knife have no Startup animation meaning they can whup your ass. 
There is no autosave and save points are few and far between

The Plot:
Alex Shepherd an army man has returned home to Shepherds Glen (A neighbouring town of Silent Hill) after he was told his Brother Joshua and Father have gone missing. It soon becomes apparent however that not everything is Normal down in Shephards Glen. Fog appears, there are very little people left in town and the people that still remain are either as confused as you or acting to suspicious and Monsters roam the streets

The Game:
The game is great and at first I thought this was going to be real shit. Ive heard from so many different people this game was garbage and didnt hold a candle to the previous four. While I can say this isnt good as the first three entries. I can definetly say this is my fourth favourite Silent Hill game (though I have only played this and the first four entries). Even though you can see the big twist coming a mile away there is other twists and turns that caught me off guard and the acting and writing really made me almost cry you really get feel Alex's history with Shepherds Glen right from the get go. The game isnt too scary though there are moments like the otherworld and especially the scene in the otherworld Clinic (I wont spoil). 
Anyway my point is you got a real good game here just one thing to keep in mind is if you have an Xbox 360/ONE/Series X/S or PS3 or even have a good enough pc that can emulate PS3 or 360 games then go for it since the PC version is by far the worst way to experience this I have already told you alot about this awful PC port just look at most of the reviews. People are pissed off that they cant even start the damn thing. Plus I didnt get to play this sometimes since the game would often crash when I try to load a save though once I have succesfully loaded a save the game will not crash at all unless I quit and then open the game up again. Still if you have other options use them but if you love silent hill at least give this one a go.

column8: This game is literally unplayable, schiet me af.

O jogo já é um pouco velho e talvez a jogabilidade não seja das melhores. Mas o clima clássico de Silent Hill ainda permanece, fazendo com que valha muito a pena ser jogado, principalmente pelos fãs dos clássicos de jogos te terror / sobrevivência.

vanno fatte due recensioni distinte per questo gioco, "liscio" (così come viene fornito da Steam) e "patchato" con la Unknownproject's patch (non ufficiale, ma che rende il gioco fruibile, ottenibile quì: https://www.pcgamingwiki.com/wiki/Silent_Hill:_Homecoming)

liscio: provato per pochi minuti ma mi fido delle recensioni tremende, anche nei pochi minuti in cui l'ho provato, mi sono ritrovato con la risoluzione bloccata a 720p giusto per dire il problema forse minore ma visibile fin da subito

unknownproject's patch: decisamente meglio! già ad un primo impatto, come scritto sopra, ho notato un visibile miglioramento dell'mmagine impostandola a 1080p (non garantisco, ma se avete un monitor 4K forse rende ancora meglio), capita saltuariamente che i caricamenti durino almeno un minuto (quando poi in caso di morte e riprovando durano meno, come dovrebbe essere solitamente) e che il gioco vada in crash (apparentemente il grand hotel e la stazione di polizia sono i posti più a rischio per entrambi i problemi sopra riportati, l'hotel stesso da problemi anche ad altri giocatori, con la patch applicata o meno, con un po di pazienza comunque, (non troppa, per fortuna), il titolo è giocabile, divenendo a tutti gli effetti una "versione potenziata" di quanto giocabile su Playstation 3 ed Xbox 360, se al contrario siete disposti a sacrificare un po di resa grafica, potreste optare per una di queste ultime due versioni, la prima ha espressioni facciali leggermente peggiori ma migliora il resto della grafica (in questo caso mi baso su esperienze altrui).

nel caso, consiglio di ottenere come primo finale "UFO", in modo tale da ottenere la pistola laser che renderà qualsiasi partita successiva "imbarazzantemente facile", per compensare il livello di difficoltà più alto selezionabile ad inizio partita e gli eventuali crash e caricamenti lunghi che dovessero capitarvi.

altro consiglio: il gioco ha due scelte importanti, dopo la prima partita con il finale UFO, alla seconda salvate prima di fare la prima scelta dopodiché fate quattro salvataggi distinti, due dopo aver scelto la prima opzione e due dopo aver fatto la seconda, a sua volta progredite in ognuno dei quattro salvataggi fino alla seconda scelta importante e sovrascrivete la prima coppia con le due scelte diverse e fate lo stesso con la seconda, (c'è una terza scelta praticamente alla fine del gioco, influenza solo due finali, ma in tutti gli altri ho comunque voluto scegliere la prima opzione) in questo modo potrete ottenere quattro finali su cinque senza ricominciare il gioco altrettante volte, infine ripartite da zero a livello difficile e ricordatevi la pistola laser dalla stanza del protagonista e di Joshua; (scegliendo di fare una partita in più potrete usarla anche per ottenere tutti i finali al di fuori dello stesso UFO) l'unico collezionabile facile da mancare è una foto ottenibile dalla bacheca dei dispersi, che apparirà come per magia dopo aver sconfitto il secondo boss (dovrete quindi prima tornare in questo posto dove avete incontrato Elle per la prima volta e poi andare a casa vostra, altrimenti non potendo tornare indietro sarà persa per sempre nella partita in corso se salvate).
infine, assicuratevi di mantenere un salvataggio distinto per ogni finale, il fatto che vengano controllati anche quando iniziate una nuova partita mi fa dedurre che il gioco controlli quanti salvataggi con una partita completa ci siano sbloccando i relativi costumi a seconda delle scelte fatte, trovate una guida su come ottenere i vari salvataggi quì, senza spoiler sul contenuto dei finali, ma per ovvi motivi vi anticipa comunque parte della trama:

https://silenthill.fandom.com/wiki/Silent_Hill:_Homecoming_Secrets_and_Unlockables; 

giocando è facile capire quali sono tali decisioni importanti, quindi alla prima partita potete evitare di guardarci (per il finale UFO scegliete la seconda opzione alla prima decisione, date risposte ostili alla seconda ed alla terza decisione la prima opzione), l'unico errore di questo sito è che  in realtà, come già scritto sopra, la terza decisione influenza solo i finali "no dogs allowed" (UFO) e "judgement" mentre negli altri è ininfluente, il resto è corretto.
ultima considerazione: usando la patch dovrete "scarificare" la lingua italiana, ma per quanto mi riguarda il gioco è perfettamente comprensibile lo stesso in inglese, inoltre la configurazione del controller può saltare ad ogni singolo avvio del gioco, consiglio quindi di scaricare reWASD (per poco più di 7 € potete comprare la licenza d'uso una volta scaduta la prova) e mappare i tasti della tastiera e mouse impostati come metodo di input sul controller

column8: This game was amazing on ps3. I loved the heck out of it. But the steam version is a brindead excuse for a game. It lags randomly for a minute straight, and at save points. The sound quality is trash in comparison and the gameplay? The gameplay is a poormans excuse for a properly released game. When they released it, it was pathetic on steam. A SAD excuse. There is one boss in particular. I beat it first try on console. But on here, you cannot DODGE it. And when the one hit kill attack comes, you cannot dodge AND you cannot tap the buttons. I checked five times to see if i pressed the right button and i damn sure did and it did NOTHING. You CANNOT beat the boss therefore make NO progress and the idiots that released this piss poor excuse for the original game needs FIRED. F-I-R-E-D FIRED. If YOU CANNOT BEAT THE GAME AT ALL, THEN IT IS NOT WORTH BUYING. I want my money back. This was highway robbery

Yes. Absolutely, $40 for this half-hearted port, in the year 2021, is quite a disgusting gimmick. Otherwise, I am playing in 4K with 144HZ on High settings and it runs fine. Have gotten to the third save point with no glitches or crashes. Will check back in and change recommendation accordingly, but as of right now: If you can find this game cheap as fuck, try it out. Do not spend $40, though.

It's not bad as most people in reviews say it is, but it's far from perfect. Overall a pretty dull and mediocre action, and a bad Silent Hill game. Gotta say, as a fan of the series i do understand the frustration that most of the people feels but objectively it's not a bad game for its time. As i say that, there is no reason to play this if you're not a fan cuz there is nothing special about this game other than some good enemy design choices and few soundtracks. For fans tho it's a bit complicated cuz there is actually an intruging lore behind the main story but the main story here is a bit simple, at least for a SH game, so you'll probably end up don't liking the overall story. So it is a don't buy for fans too. Still tho is it a bad game? No. You know what's bad... technical performance of the game. I installed 2 mods for stabile gameplay and it still feels like barely holding it together. I for example encountered broken QTE's for entirety of the game. All those cons aside i am happy with the time i spend on Sh Homecoming, i wish they could have been succesful like re4 as they were trying something new for series as well but gg next time i guess.
Overall 6/10
column9:
It's not bad as most people in reviews say it is, but it's far from perfect. Overall a pretty dull and mediocre action, and a bad Silent Hill game. Gotta say, as a fan of the series i do understand the frustration that most of the people feels but objectively it's not a bad game for its time. As i say that, there is no reason to play this if you're not a fan cuz there is nothing special about this game other than some good enemy design choices and few soundtracks. For fans tho it's a bit complicated cuz there is actually an intruging lore behind the main story but the main story here is a bit simple, at least for a SH game, so you'll probably end up don't liking the overall story. So it is a don't buy for fans too. Still tho is it a bad game? No. You know what's bad... technical performance of the game. I installed 2 mods for stabile gameplay and it still feels like barely holding it together. I for example encountered broken QTE's for entirety of the game. All those cons aside i am happy with the time i spend on Sh Homecoming, i wish they could have been succesful like re4 as they were trying something new for series as well but gg next time i guess.
Overall 6/10

column8: Where do I start? Key bindings continually mess up, sync to other key bindings and are super buggy. The amount of times this game crashes with no cause is literally insane. It's so bugged out that when you kill with special move on nurses, the nurses head stretched under her body and look like really low hanging balls. If you kill a bug with a heavy attack, sometimes it sticks to your head like a hat. The guns don't actually work at all, you can shoot them and hear and see the animation from your side, but it doesn't affect the other party what so ever. The monsters don't even flinch when you shoot them or take any damage. This game should not exist, period. I don't recommend spending forty bucks, let alone five to play this game.

column8: Dopo che Silent Hill 4 tentò di stravolgere le atmosfere classiche del SilenT Hill trilogy, Homecoming riporta le atmosfere malsane della saga al loro posto, peccato però che il tutto sia condito con il peggior combat system mai provato in un videogame. Aldilà del fatto che tale combat system sia già di per sè fuori contesto, risulta ingestibile rendendo il gioco stupidamente difficile. Peccato poichè Homecoming poteva assurgere a classico della serie ma, cosi com'è, resta solo un'opera fallimentare da cui stare alla larga...

column8: I'm really upset that I encountered a bug (even with the patch) that meant I could no longer continue the story as I was having a lot of fun streaming this game to my boyfriend and his friend. While it may be the black sheep of the franchise, the absolutely broken nature of the port is what makes Silent Hill Homecoming a blast to experience at least once. The unofficial patch fixes most of the problems that the game suffers with on PC and is a near necessity to have installed if you want any chance of playing. If you're looking for a non-serious game that you can pick up and have some laughs with I'd definitely recommend grabbing this game when its on sale but otherwise I'd say stick to emulating the earlier games in the franchise. Not a good game but definitely a fun experience.

When I first played this game, not long after it came out, I really couldn't get on with it. There was a certain point where the presentation, the gameplay and the difficulty just became a brick wall. 
Now, a bajillion years later, I decided to give it another chance and I'm glad I did. Even with the complete lack of optimisation, the map that doesn't show properly, the rubbish controls, the QTEs that sometimes just don't work and the outright game-breaking bugs, it still kinda works. It's quite an unnerving game, as it should be. It's Silent Hill.

column8:
Silent Hill: Homecoming is a game that I really wish that I could like.

It nails the classic silent hill vibe perfectly: Creepy, tension-ramping environments and a huge mind-screw adventure through the foggy gates of a hellish otherworld. Combat with deadly monsters while trying to uncover the dark secrets of a quiet little town. In concept, it's an amazing idea.

In execution, it leaves MUCH to be desired.

The main reason to dislike the game is the combat. It's very clear that a LOT of work went into polishing the combat and making it interesting and dynamic. It was very clearly a labor of love, with excellent combat animations, a dodge and counter system, and even a Coup De Grace system that lets you finish off an enemy quickly if you meet certain conditions.

SO WHY IS IT SO FREAKING BAD!?

Enemies often have wide, sweeping and long-reaching attacks that render your dodging worthless. Readying for a fight by entering your combat stance slows you to a crawl, leaving you MORE vulnerable than if you JUST KEEP RUNNING and try to avoid combat altogether. Certain enemies also have very, very short windows where you can actually harm them, and the game does not IN ANY WAY telegraph ANY of this. You have to learn it through the loading screens after dying. That's right, AFTER you're killed by something and have to sit there waiting a full minute for the game to load in again, you get... a vague tip on how best to off an enemy.

As I said before, enemies often have wide, sweeping, long-reaching attacks that render your dodging worthless. That much is already bad enough in a game that puts so much focus on its combat. But it gets worse, somehow--you also get thrown into tight, cramped spaces where you CAN'T EVEN DODGE AT ALL. Suddenly one of the core mechanics for your survivability are taken away from you and there isn't a thing you can do about it except pray that you have enough ammo in your gun to take out the enemy the easy way.

Presumably, the idea here is that you're supposed to learn how to handle each enemy through trial and error. Which, WOULDN'T be a bad thing, if the game actually gave you the resources to trial! But, you have so little health and so few opportunities to make mistakes that you're inevitably going to die, which is often very punishing and sends you back anywhere from five to ten minutes of gameplay, while leaving you none the wiser on how to approach the enemy. Adding to this problem, there are several enemies that can staggerlock you, leaving you reeling and struggling to escape from the enemy's attack chain and chewing through your health items to have any HOPE of fighting back.

I'm a big fan of the Silent Hill series, so I'm incredibly disappointed to say I will not be finishing this game. What spooky, creepy atmosphere is there is completely ruined by how godawfully punishing and frustrating the combat is. It tries to be Dark Souls in a Silent Hill title, but falls painfully flat.

All of this so far hasn't even gotten into the bugs present in the PC release. So, I'm going to suggest you pass this one up and never look back. If you want to experience it, then watch a Let's Play on youtube or some such.

column8:
Vorrei raccontare la mia tragicomica esperienza con questa meraviglia tecnica:

Apro il gioco, risoluzione fissa a 720p, cap a 30 fps: cerco su internet una patch, esiste, la installo.
Riapro il gioco, provo a fare Alt-Tab, il gioco crasha. A quanto pare è un problema comune, trovo una fix, la installo.
Lancio il gioco, come mai in inglese? cerco tra i file, scopro che è possibile cambiare la lingua dai file di configurazione, ma questo fa sparire alcune voci del menu perché la traduzione è assente. Vabbé.
Riapro il gioco... perché si sente tutto da destra? Mi informo: a quanto pare il software è compatibile solo con una scheda audio 5.1. E' necessario installare un driver che aggiri il problema facendo riconoscere le tue cuffie come un sistema surround, ma anche così c'è un problema: tutti i suoni sono traslati a sinistra di una cassa (fonte: ore e ore di ricerche su google per rendere vivibile questa meraviglia). In ogni caso, esiste una patch, la installo, finalmente gioco.

Numero di crash durante il playthrough: 10
Numero di ore ripetute a causa di crash in punti lontani da save points: 3 stimate

Segnale un bug notevole su cui non ho trovato nulla online e che sono riuscito a risolvere per puro caso, potrei essere d'aiuto a qualcuno.
In alcune sezioni del gioco gli npc vi guideranno verso una nuova area, e saranno loro ad aprire le porte. Potrebbe succedere che sbaglino mira ed invece di aprire la porta camminino all'infinito contro il muro accanto.
Signore e signori, la soluzione esiste, e non ci credereste mai: bisogna entrare nelle opzioni e modificare la modalità di input da controller a mouse e tastiera finché non smettono di farvi da Ciceroni.

CILIEGINA SULLA TORTA
Finisco il mio PRIMO playthrough facendo le mie scelte morali, salvando chi riesco a salvare, perdonando chi riesco a perdonare...

... E BECCO IL DANNATISSIMO FINALE UFO

Se volete punirvi per qualcosa di grave, questo è il gioco che fa per voi.

column8:
A pesar de los increíbles fallos técnicos que se puede apreciar desde el menú del juego, fallos que no se puede justificar el egoísmo puro por parte de Konami, pueden ser arreglados casi en su totalidad (se puede buscar fácilmente por internet), será engorroso al principio pero de todas formas te comerás el mismo garrón si decides bajarlo de forma pirata, tendrás que instalar los mods para corregir la mayoría de los fallos.

Superando ese obstucalo, es un buen Silent Hill metido en un mal juego, el lore es bastante interesante llenando cabos sueltos del contexto de Silent Hil así como el desarrollo de algunos personajes , pero las mecánicas de combate están mal llevadas, hasta el punto que tendrás que leer las pantallas de carga para entender (si, están en todas las pantallas de carga esos consejos). Los combates contra jefes son muy pocos satisfactorios, las formas de los monstruos así como su lore son increíbles, pero las peleas siguen siendo hasta comunes. 

Lo recomiendo si hay un buen descuento o gratis, no vale pagar todo el precio por un juego roto que su creadora le da igual corregir sus problemas

column8:
Homecoming to gra ciężka w ocenie nie tylko dlatego, że dostępny tutaj pecetowy port jest bardzo daleki od ideału. Nawet gdyby było inaczej to dla największych fanów serii będzie to co najmniej lekki zawód. Tytuł ten nie został opracowany przez Japończyków, tylko Amerykanów i i jest to wyczuwalne. Brak tutaj tajemniczości oraz pewnej subtelności, które cechowały poprzednie odsłony cyklu. Historia jest prostsza (ale wciąga i ma niezły plot twist), a postaci bardziej płaskie. Na szczęście klimat momentami jest zbliżony do oryginałów, w czym na pewno pomaga muzyka Akiry Yamaoka. Grę polecam przede wszystkim miłośnikom horrorów, ale radzę zainstalować fanowskie patche, które można znaleźć w necie (odnośniki do nich są na pcgw).

edit: Grę da się wreszcie ukończyć prawie (zdarzył mi się tylko jeden) bez żadnych crashów dzięki fanowskiemu "Unknownproject's Patch". Dalej nie jest idealnie, ale mod wciąż jest rozwijany.

column8: Acabei de comprar o jogo, achei o gráfico lindo, mas travou logo no início não consigo movimentar o personagem para o lado logo quando o garoto empurra a cadeira-de-rodas escada a baixo. Etahh !! Quero meu reembolso.

This is a horrific, poorly optimized port. This shouldn't even be sold on the Steam Store. The audio is terrible, the game crashes, and god forbid you want to use a XBOX controller on an XBOX game's port. This is miserable. I'd rather spend my cash elsewhere. And unlike a LOT of Silent Hill fans, I liked this one when it came out and beat it at least half a dozen times - it still has some of the best Otherworld visuals in the franchise. The combat focus is weird, but I got over it; I just pretend this is a game INSPIRED by Silent Hill, but not Silent Hill. But dear GOD stay away from this port. 

I'm usually a very forgiving guy when it comes to bugs and weird ports of games I liked, but this one? Hell no. Just... no. I'd rather naked mud wrestle with Pyramid Head* and deal with THOSE consequences than play this port again. 

*And why is Pyramid Head even in this game other than "oooooh mascot" garbage? Pyramid Head was a critical plot component tied to a specific story line. He's not just strolling through Silent Hill chillin' with whomever rolls through.

column8: Péssimo Port para PC. Tive diversos problemas de travamento, slowdown, números nos lugares dos botões (não personalizado para o controle encontrado). Ve hře jsem se dostal jen k prvnímu souboji a tam jsem skončil jelikož i po přeřazení kláves jsem nemohl útočit, navíc vám hra neukazuje co máte mačkat pro otevření dveří, otevření inventáře a podobně takže musíte jí po intuici nebo koukat pořád do nastavení.

I'm a big fan of the original silent hill games, and so I got this, to see how it was. But after just a few hours of playing, I quickly realized why so many people were leaving bad reviews. While the overall story and characters are pretty boring, and uninteresting, I'd say the biggest issue with the game, is just the performance. The FPS drops badly, often, and the game itself tends to crash, every few minutes for seemingly no reason. Along with that, I've found that the gameplay itself, and action sequences, are pretty dull, and other times downright frustrating. The controls in this game, (especially for combat,) are the most infuriating I've encountered since 'I Am Bread.' A rage game that purposefully had bad controls to frustrate the player.
 
Unlike what you see in the original 3 silent hill games, I didn't find most of the enemies that scary or interesting. Most either just had bad design, or were completely recycled from old games. I thought that decision was both lazy, and just an easy cash grab, to fans who wanted to see their favorite old characters reimagined. If you're one of those people, however, I need to warn you away from this game. It isn't worth the money, or the experience to see a lesser version of originally creative, and thoughtfully designed monsters. 

Overall, would not recommend this game to anyone who's looking for something: nostalgic, scary, easy to play, or fun.

Worst PC port in existence... Game has been out 12 years and still $40. Never on sale.

If you enjoy gambling for a 50% chance of crashing during any loading screen then this game is perfect.

Controls feel like trying to play chess with pieces made of broken glass and barbed wire but only using the suction of your nose to move them around, not good and potentially dangerous.

column8: Purtroppo il gioco presenta problemi di compatibilità con i sistemi operativi attuali... Questo provoca malfunzionamenti e crash continui! Attenzione.

Çıktığı yıllarda oyunun mekanikleri aksiyonun bol olması nedeniyle çok tartışılmıştı. Üstüne piramit kafanın oyunda yer alması tüm serinin anlamını bozduğu gerekçesiyle hayranlarını da kızdırmıştı. 

Aslında sırf popüler kültürün etkisi nedeniyle oyuna eklenen piramit kafa meselesini kenara atarsak Silent Hill serisinin ikinci oyunundan itibaren en ters köşe yapan, insanı şaşırtan ve her sahnesi düşünülerek yazılıp hazırlanan bir oyun. 

Müzikleri çok güzel. Atmosferi harika. Oynanış, vuruş hissiyatı güzel. Ama oyunun ciddi manada optimizasyon sıkıntısı var. Aniden oyundan atmalar, donmalar yaşanmakta. 

Konami keşke bütün seriyi steame getirse.

Falaram muito mal desse jogo, contudo considero uma boa experiência em se tratando de silent hill.
A história não deixa a desejar, trilha sonora, puzzles, estética, temas são seus pontos mais fortes. Contudo posso salientar que os gráficos não são dos melhores, nem as atuações dos dubladores, bem como a trama um tanto corrida e sem a calma necessária para degustar as cenas nas cutt cines. O jogo perde um pouco da imersão quando mostra os botões na hora da interação com os itens e objetos, quick-time events mal elaborados e bem difíceis de conseguir passar, caso você não estivesse pronto para eles e o PIOR de tudo: TRAVAMENTOS, CRASHES E BUGS. Estes ultimos acredito que por se tratar de uma versão para PC que saiu um bom tempo depois da oficial podem  serem piores que o próprio Piramid Head em sí. Porém ainda acredito que seja uma boa jogatina de Silent hill, posso dizer que está um pouco abaixo do Silent Hill 4 mas acima do mesmo em alguns temos técnicos.

Hra je nehratelná, protože nerozezná Xboxový ani Playstation ovladač..v nastavení jsou pouze ikonky Button 1, Button 2 atd a i když si nastavíte tlačítka, tak ve finále se to chová úplně jinak, než tak, jak jste si to nastavili...Dobře, říkám si...zkusím to na klávesnici..A tam je ten stejný problém.nějak si to nastavíte, jak by vám to mohlo jakžtakž fungovat, a pak zjistíte, že je to celý rozházený..Tak nic zkusíme dát Default nastavení..AHA ONO TAM NENÍ..takže máte nehratelnou a rozesranou celou hru, a to jste se podívali jen do hlavního menu..Patch neexistuje, když chcete jít na stránku podpory přímo k vydavateli a vývojáři, tak stránky už neexistují..Tohle byl určitě nejhorší nákup na Steamu za celou dobu..bohužel jsem koupil klíč z herního obchodu, takže hru nemohu ani vrátit..Rozhodně se této hře vyhněte, jsou to vyhozené peníze :(

ENGLISH :  
Game doesnt support Xbox and Playstation Controllers, so you see only Button 1, Button 2 to Button 16..great..the worse problem is that you cant remap your buttons to work well how you want to...That same problem is with keyboard and mouse..you can remap it here, but it still doesnt work and you cant play it..its unplayable..also you cant use Default control setting because it ISNT THERE..Why? 
There are no Patches, Fixes, Updates to remove this kind of problem?
If you want to contact support it says the page is unavailable..really great buy :(

The last remnant of my childhood. The series that got me into horror. To put it simply, this port is a nostalgic cup of coffee that has been sitting on the kitchen counter for 12 years. I know it's bad for me, but it's still my last cup of coffee, and I'll keep sipping on it until they let me buy a new bag with a label of 1, 2, 3, and/or 4.

I yearn for a bag of my favorite psychological coffee.

[h1]A TENER EN CUENTA [/h1]

*Por el contenido que ofrece y la calidad del port recomiendo comprarlo en oferta, si es posible solo al 90% off.
*Crasheos al cargar partida, cargar zonas nuevas o minimizar el juego.
*Tirones de más de 5 segundos al cargar zonas nuevas que te hacen rezarle a Viracocha para que no se crashee y pierdas tu progreso.
*Buena ambientación y sonidos,
*Historia bastante buena.
*Controles un poco toscos.
*Juego limitado a 30 FPS.
*Problemas al usar un mando, no me reconocía algunos botones.

So if you are like me, you are probably interested in this title as it is the only Silent Hill on Steam. I recently decided to give Silent Hill a go, so I started with SH2, then played through 1, 3, and 4. I got a bit obsessed with the series to say the least - however this title was off-putting due to the negative reviews and ... $40 price? I'll be straight, I got this 90% off for the Halloween sale, so I picked it up. I didn't even attempt to boot this game up vanilla, I installed all recommended mods on PCGW and to my surprise, got it running 3440x1440p at 60FPS. I encountered 2 random crashes in the beginning of the game (which was very annoying, and from that point forward, I was more scared of it crashing again than I was of the game). It stopped crashing after that though, not sure why. 

This port does have a lot of bugs (weird lighting artifacts, scuffed QTE, lack of graphical settings, crash potential) even with applying fixes to it. Like others have pointed out I had to change my sound to 5.1 stereo, which required more work than I thought to dig through Windows 10 settings to find it because without 5.1, most sounds only play through the right side of your speakers/headphones. I am fairly certain enabling Discord overlay crashes the game and I know for a fact that alt+tabbing or hitting your windows key also crashes the game (with the fixes). But mind you, for $4, I wasn't too mad at the hour or two I spent configuring everything to be good to go. So value wise, wait for this to get a deep discount before buying - solely just for the quality of this port.

Quality of the game? As a Silent Hill game? Really different from the classic 4. I was getting tired of the tank controls of the first 4 games, but this one right off the bat had a great movement feeling with a controller. Controlling Alex really did feel great, I liked moving around with him, it made traversal and combat more satisfying and less frustrating. Combat does feel good in my opinion (although parrying is incredibly difficult, dodging and rolling doesn't have i-frames, and also requires intense precision). With those additional elements, I can see why people dislike this combat because it is more complex than just bashing or spamming fire. You have to aim with your guns, you can do combos with melee, enemies can easily one shot you (because there are no button prompts for various situations...). It's much faster; and on that topic, enemies, while not greatly varied, are really cool. I liked their designs, reminded me of the other games. Bosses? Awesome - a blast to play the bosses. Music? Great as expected. Atmosphere? Oh man - particularly, when in the Other World, the sets are awesome. Gross, mechanical, orange, rusty - a pleasure to traverse and look at, especially with the nice filter they have on it. That's when this game feels like a Silent Hill game, when you are in the Other World. The transition in real time is nice to watch as well. When you are in the normal world, this game doesn't really feel like a Silent Hill, almost more like Resident Evil than anything - just an action/kinda spooky game. I didn't really care or mind, just as long as I enjoyed myself. For the most part I did. The story invested me enough to want to finish the game - but definitely had some weird/annoying parts in the second half of the game. I suppose I'd recommend, but do know, it's a gamble, because it could totally not work.

Not even gonna touch on the fact its missed the point of every Silent Hill before it.
Its a garbage port, bugs crashes the works. doesn't even have proper button prompts so your forced to work it out yourself.
Save point pacing is terrible so a crash or death in the terribly buggy combat will set you back ages. Sometimes if you save it'll still throw you back to the beginning of the area.
Even spent 10 minutes trying to solve a puzzle that that it turns out had bugged out and was impossible to solve until i reloaded.
Even if your a die hard Silent Hill fan and you just want to check every entry off your list just don't its trash

Y nada más empezar noté que iba como a saltos el juego, a trompicones... efectivamente FPS super bajos.

He tenido que recurrir a un parche externo para poder jugarlo.

No veo el sentido a pagar por un port TAN mal, cuando el juego no es ninguna maravilla tampoco dentro de la saga SILENT HILL...

Completed this game was a quite a hard one. I never been a fan of Silent Hill series but why not give it a next change. Well I am disappointed badly. This game has a potential to be much better than it is, but it 's fails. First of all it's bugged like a bug nest. How could this game jump or froze even  if you have a powerful configuration, in one moment it has a HUGE problem it one of the riddle, one mistake and our hero is not moving and good bye restart. Sometimes game throws you to the windows without any reason. I hoped it be a good time to chcek the Silent Hill but it  was a waste of time. If you would like to paly it do not spend so many money on this game buy it only on sale. Sorry Silent Hill Raccon City is much better than you. And that why you are so alone in fog/mist.

column8:
5 minute unskippable cutscene near end of game, ends in QTE with no button prompts. Fail cutscene? Brains drilled out. Restart that 5 minute cutscene. Failed again. Brains drilled out again. Third time cutscene started. Crashed. Loaded game... loaded well before this cutscene and another long cutscene was in the way.

Quit.

Uninstall.

Write negative review.

Hope neighbors didn't hear swearing.

Glad only paid $5. Hope you didn't pay $40.

Go play SH 1 through 3. Good. Already beat them? Play them again. Better.

column8: O jogo em questão de jogabilidade, para época (2008), não é tão ruim. No entanto, a versão de computador apresenta muitos problemas de optimização, como queda de quadros, congelamentos e o mais frustrante: fecha sozinho nos loadings da metade para o final da campanha e também quando você dá alt+tab  (sim, se você não tiver salvo, perderá tudo pois o sistema de save do jogo é antigo e não possui a funcionalidade "auto save"). Vale ressaltar também que os controles são um tanto quanto confusos para quem optar jogar pelo teclado/mouse. Em relação a história, ele é mediano para baixo comparado aos outros jogos da franquia Silent Hill. Portanto não recomendo você comprar este jogo em seu valor normal (R$34,99) e sim na promoção.
retourner au source du bon vieux jeu video dur dur que du bonheur
una mierda

It's sad to say that 'Silent Hill: Homecoming' for PC is one of the most terrible PC-ports out there. Koonami obviously doesn't care for this franchise anymore (or for videogames in general) and they never patched this rip-off of a port even once. Yes, Its even worse than the 'Silent Hill 4: The Room' PC-port, which was already a terrible port. I am 4 hours into the game, 4 hours spent dealing with very frequent crashes (resolution crashes and loading crashes), frames freezing and stuttering often (on a modern mid range gaming PC) , confusing button mapping when you play with keyboard and mouse, etc. The community patch I found online does not fix the crashing for me and the game remains unplayable. Don't buy this, not even in a sale, and save yourselves the frustration and money.

Je n'ai jamais fais de Silent Hill de ma vie. Oui, c'est honteux. Et pourtant je me considere tout de même comme joueur ayant acquis ses classiques. Alors pourquoi commencer directement par Homecoming qui est selon les joueurs : un crachat au visage de la saga ? Steam + solde = j'ai craqué. Et je me voyais pas vraiment refaire les anciens premiers sur émulation par peur d'avoir un jeu trop vieillot entre les mains. Mais je peux vous l'affirmer tout de suite avant même que j'eu commencé le jeu : c'est une horreur d'optimisation.

Déjà, le jeu se lance pas. Problème de mon pc ou d'installation ? Aucun des deux, il se lance une fois sur deux et en qualité immonde en 800x600. Il faudra trouver un patch fait par la communauté pour le mettre en 1080p et un deuxième que je vous conseille pour pouvoir mettre le jeu en fenêtré si vous êtes habitué aux alt + tab pour répondre à vos potes sur discord. Ça a failli me dégouter du jeu et j'ai failli demander le remboursement, mais première épreuve réussite.

Deuxièmement, chez moi le jeu n'est pas en stéréo et c'est même la première fois que je remarque un soucis pareil avec un casque sur les oreilles. Le son est mal fait. Parfois on entend le personnages parler que dans l'oreille droite et les bruitages des monstres qui sont derrières nous envahissent l'oreille gauche. Je sais pas ce qu'ils ont foutu, mais la spacialisation du son est une catastrophe. Bordel, on entend les ennemis à gauche, mais ils sont devant, on entend quelqu’un parler mais la voix résonne que du côté droit et en tout bas, mais comment on peut sortir un jeu comme ça ? J’aurais pu chercher un patch, mais il en faut combien pour jouer à un jeu correct ? Pourquoi ils ont pas corrigés tous ces soucis à la con ? Mais ce n’est pas tout.

Pendant tout le jeu, j’ai eu le jeu qui « ne répond pas » à chaque début de chargement. En fait, c’est ce qui fait le plus flipper dans ce jeu : les chargements. Vous avancez dans une zone, chargement qui bug le jeu ne répond pas, vous trouvez une sauvegarde, chargement qui bug le jeu ne répond pas, vous entrez dans une maison, le jeu ne répond pas, vous avez une cinématique, chargement qui bug le jeu ne répond pas....... un enfer, j’ai jamais vu ça.

C’est con, parce qu’à part ces soucis j’ai plutôt aimé le jeu même si c’est censé être le plus mauvais Silent Hill. J’ai été pris dans cette spirale des enfers et cette ambiance lugubre d’une ville fantôme, des créatures horribles difformes (et sans aucun sens par la même occasion), de l’angoisse des environnements et tout le tralala qui marche bien pour ce genre de jeu flippant. En fait, je pense que je l’aurais beaucoup mieux apprécié s’il était bien optimisé sur steam et ça m’aurait encore plus envie de connaître les autres jeux mythique de la franchise.

Je retiens tout de même une histoire qui paraît sans logique, mais qui tient tout de même la route si on s’y intéresse et quelques moments légèrement stressant parce qu’on va pas se mentir, il suffit de courir tranquillement pour éviter 80% des ennemis, sauf combats obligatoires. D’ailleurs le gameplay contre les méchants est plutôt dynamique et simple à prendre en main. On peut esquiver, taper avec un combo... mais la dague de fin de jeu est très vite craquée. J’ai fini la plupart des boss avec celle ci. Puis eux, les boss, sont vachement cool : flippant et chelou qui collent parfaitement à ce que j’attendais d’un Silent Hill. Outre ces mobs difformes tout degeulasse qu’on rencontre en jeu (en plus que le bestiaire est relativement pauvre), les quelques boss ont plutôt une bonne tête et ont un design que j’ai trouvé très réussi !

En vrai j’ai quand même passé des bons moments dessus malgré que le jeu a crash lors de la cinématique finale (et que je l’ai desinstallé derrière et maté la scène de fin sur youtube ha - ha ntm). Pour le prix pendant les soldes d’halloween, j’ai satisfait ma curiosité. A part que j’ai trouvé le jeu vraiment facile et tous ces soucis d’optimisations, j’ai bien aimé, mais je ne le conseille pas du tout. Pas sûr steam en tout cas, ou faites attention aux modalités de remboursement sur steam pour pas vous faire enfler de quelques euros.
Muy buen juego , se crashea algunas veces ; pero la pena jugarlo . 9/10

El juego corre HORRIBLE en mi PC. que es bastante decente. Esta bloqueado a 30 fps ademas de que en resoluciones mayores a 720p el juego a veces se rompe y los objetos del inventario aparecen "mochados". Incluso el audio tiene problemas. Lo he podido arreglar gracias al parche de project unknown, pero es una lástima que pongan a la venta esta clase de productos. Ademas este juego desgraciadamente es de lo peorcito de Silent Hill aunque en su tiempo me encantó. No ha envejecido para anda bien, sobre todo en el combate. Si lo encuentras muuuy barato como yo, adelante, si no mejor juega otra cosa.
Derangeant, Formidable, histoire interessant!! malgre aux bugs, le jeu est genial!!!

column8:
2/10. Literally SO incredibly broken. 

I thought the reviews on this was just people whining and genuinely complaining for no reason so I had to see for myself if it was genuine and BOY the reviews are correct. I crashed 13 times before I even loaded up the initial game & settings solved. 

Played just under two hours, had a few more crashed and lost 40 minutes of progression. Disappointing. Play this on consoles, not PC apparently.

column8:
Don't let my 30 minutes of official Steam gameplay fool you, I've played this game on other consoles to its completion on multiple occasions, and am a veteran Silent Hill fan. 

Having known what the game is supposed to be like from the PS3 and X-360 standpoint, I can say that this PC port of a game is subpar in its quality. If you were to ask me if you should pick between the PC and console version, I would immediately tell you to buy the console, hands down. 

I bought this on special for a few dollars instead of its $40-something AUD pricetag it is normally, and if I hadn't I'd be asking for a refund. 

Game mechanics continuously break, and there doesn't appear to be any upkeep from the developer itself (Since it's a 12 year old game, that's no fault of theirs), but I am not the only one that has had phenomenal issues just trying to get the game to run properly. In my case, item images are warped (Not an issue, this is cosmetic), half of the informational files you pick up don't even have any text, or half of the content is cropped out altogether (serious issue, because you have keypad combinations and the like in these) and worst of all, maps do not work, which as any Silent Hill fan will attest, can be a deal breaker, especially if you have never played the game before. 

It's possible to play without the maps, I've done it on other games (And I believe some players pride themselves on doing so), but it makes an already blue-key blue-door game mechanic far more tedious than it's worth if you're in it for the story rather than boasting rite. Others in the discussions have had other issues that they have attempted to fix themselves, others have made specific patches to try and help others play this game (Some more questionable than others if you read their readme's) and ultimately, it boils down to whether you can tolerate the batch of issues this game will show depending on  your hardware. 

Those are the critical faults I have seen in my short time of playing, and I've perused the discussion boards for a few h ours trying to find a remedy to it (And most don't seem to work in my case. It doesn't mean it won't for a different make and model PC/Laptop).

Now, as to the game content itself outside of whether you own it on PC or Console.

This entry into the Silent Hill Franchise is, in my opinion, a sturdy, but not true Silent Hill in contrast to the ones beforehand. It's a little more action-paced than the standard Survival Horror that the previous five have been, which is a good thing if you're not so big on true survival horror but want to dip your toes into the Silent Hill Universe to see if you want to plunge your wallet into the void.

-- The Music is fantastic, as is typical of Akira Yamaoka's work. 

-- A lot of people complain about the facial animation of characters in the game, and that's fine, but I personally haven't seen it all that detrimental. It's a 12 year old game, so it won't be state of the art graphics or quality. 

-- Story-wise there isn't that much in connection to the previous five games, and this game itself is more of an "it's own story" kind of entry. You won't learn much, if anything about the events of the previous games, and this game doesn't even take place in the mentioned town itself. If you treat it as its own game with no links to the previous games, it's more enjoyable. 


Conclusion: Ultimately, if you were to buy this game on Steam, I'd honestly wait until it's at a price you're happy to waste if you want to take the plunge. There are too many issues with this PC port to validate it's price-tag, but if you have the opportunity to buy it on Console and want to take the plunge into a Silent Hill game, then I would definitely go for that Console copy.

column8:
It crashes.  At first not so much.  But as I fought the first boss it got worse.  I beat the boss and tried to beat it again without using any meds.  This was a mistake because now it crashes as I fight the boss.

You can't quickly move through dialogue.  Some scenes can be skipped but some cannot.  Extremely frustrating to have to deal with the same conversation before a boss battle a dozen times.  

Parts of the map wouldn't render.  It would just be a fog that I could only see some lights in.  When I reloaded it was fine.

The fighting is twitchy.  You lock onto enemies but your character sometimes misses.  Dodging is most effective when you anticipate the attack.  If the attack has already begun you ain't dodging it.

If you are thinking of getting it to complete your play of the Silent Hill series then don't pay full price.  Halloween sale had it at 2 or 3 dollars.  Still a rip off.

column8:
SPOILER FREE

What should I say about this game that wasn´t already said?

The story is great. But at the same time, it feels like it´s an unnecessary addon on a story that was already both vague and complicated at the same time. It´s not as much a Silent Hill game as it´s a spinoff. The exploration is minimal, and even through maps are big, they are extremely linear. The combat system is absolute trash, and the puzzles are easy to solve.

Also, we have to talk about Konami and how they fucked this game up, and not only this game, but also SAW. They messed SAW up so to the point where it got unlisted from Steam due to the end of license, but it had trash combat and interaction system, otherwise it´s a fine game. But why is this game still up on the store if it is a trash port that never got fixed?

There is a ton of issues in here, only present in the PC port. Widescreen is messed up, audio channels are all over the place, Alt+Tab crashes the game, sometimes the game crashes at random spots during gameplay, (and this is probably the first issue you´re going to encounter) the game crashes after starting. It´s an absolute nightmare to fix it, and it took me about 4 hours to find all the fixes outside of the game (with about 3 reinstalls & several game file integrity checks). And it added 2 hours of game time to my counter while I was trying to fix it, restarting the game so many times I´ve lost the count. 

Overall, I can´t recommend this game, unless you are a masochist and like going through grueling pain while trying to make your games work.

column8:
Portage PC vraiment très médiocre. Jeu bourré de bug. Impossible de jouer plus de 20 min sans que ça crash (j'abuse pas), encore plus frustrant quand on n'a pas eu le temps de sauvegarder.

Je l'ai eu à 2€ seulement en promo, je préfère me le faire rembourser et le racheter 15€ sur console.

Quel dommage car le jeu a l'air vraiment très bon artistiquement parlant, on replonge immédiatement dans la bonne vieille ambiance des premiers silent hill de la série dont je suis fan. Très glauque et déconseillé aux fragiles. La BO est excellente. Mais techniquement une honte. J'espère que la version console rattrapera le coup.

Pese a mínimos crasheos que he tenido, por lo general, no me he encontrado con ningún otro problema dentro de el juego, teniendo una experiencia agradable, (aclaro que no estoy usando, ningún parche). Dicho lo anterior, respecto al juego, me parece un gran titulo, y que este ha sido infravalorado injustamente. Es cierto que no esta al nivel de la trilogía original, pero tiene lo suyo y, es una experiencia diferente, que personalmente a mi si me ha gustado.
El juego se crashea en ciertos momentos, no se puede jugar de manera fluída.

Decent horror but frequent crashes even with an unofficial patch to try and help fix issues have ruined it for me. I am now stuck unable to progress due to crashes and can't refund due to amount of play time. I'm really disappointed and can not recommend even if you can get it dirt cheap :(

column8:
The worst port ever in PC history. Yes it manages to be even worse than the infamous Sourcenext PC ports of Resident Evil 4 and Devil May Cry 3. 

It has everything a masochist could ever ask for: 

- 720p resolution, 30 fps. 

- Frequent and random crashes during gameplay because of memory leak. Trying to run the game at anything higher than 720p/30fps with mods will break it. 

-Audio problems with Stereo systems that causes missing sound effects and dialogues. 

-HUD scaling problems with different resolutions breaking the maps and 2D images in the game. And the map mechanic is crucial for progressing in a Silent Hill game. 

-Gamepad problems: button bindings may reset itself to default after crashing or quitting the game improperly. The button prompts are completely nonsensical and lacks proper Xbox/PS layout. Couple that with broken QTE timings in case you're at 60 fps, will lead to unavoidable deaths and this game has no auto-save feature.

 -Oh and speaking of saving: save file corruption. YES you may even lose your progress after 10 hours of gameplay because the savefile can get corrupted.


If you're the kind of person who is obsessed with fixing broken stuff and loves headaches , then this is the perfect product for you!

Dar una opinión decisiva a este juego puede llegar a ser algo complicado, por lo que comentaré los detalles a destacar de este producto.

El juego: El juego es bastante aceptable, sigue teniendo la clásica esencia de los Silent Hill pero ahora mas orientado a la acción, lo cual es totalmente justificable, ya que el personaje, a diferencia de los protagonistas anteriores, esta vez cuenta con experiencia en combate cuerpo a cuerpo y con armas,  lo que otorga una nueva experiencia a la hora de matar monstruos. Ahora el personaje cuenta con postura de combate, lo que solo permite enfocarse en un enemigo a la vez, sin embargo, hay que tener cuidado que aún pueden atacarnos por la espalda. En la postura de combate el personaje puede atacar, esquivar, contraatacar y rodar para esquivar los ataques de largo alcance de los enemigos; los cuales por cierto, se redujeron notablemente a comparación de juegos anteriores, tanto en cantidad como en variedad, sacrificandolos por una mayor profundidad de combate a la hora de enfrentarse con ellos, ya que cada uno tiene diferentes patrones de ataque y estrategias para enfrentarse a ellos. Se recorre una variedad interesante de escenarios, sin embargo no se pasa tanto tiempo dentro de estas locaciones, ya que son bastantes lineales y sin puzzles como solía hacerse, basicamente los objetivos son: llegar a x punto, conseguir la llave / objeto y regresar a una puerta que ahora podras abrir. Lo mejor es ver el cambio que sufre el escenario cuando entras a la dimensión infernal, y la historia, la cual se podría considerar como una secuela spin-off de la trama original sobre el pueblo contada en el primer Silent Hill.

Esta versión del juego: Lo mas trágico aquí es el pobre port que nos otorgaron, lleno de problemas y fallas, y no son pequeñas como glitchs o texturas, hablamos de que el juego inesperadamente te va fallar y se va cerrar sin dar ni previo aviso, durante mi partida constantemente guardaba los datos para evitar tener que repetir un gran tramo de juego cuando sucediera, y ocurre en cualquier momento, ya sea abriendo tu mapa, caminando, y mas comúnmente en las pantallas de carga, 3 veces tuve que vencer al enemigo final porque el juego se trababa en la pantalla de carga, y si, tuve que ver las cinematicas todas la veces, ya que hay videos que pueden saltarse y otros que no. Me gusto el juego, pero estos bugs te desmotivan de que desees rejugarlo para obtener los demás finales, si vas a estar con problemas de estabilidad cada partida vas a terminar prefiriendo jugar una sola vez por tu cuenta, y buscar el resto de finales/secretos en internet al igual que yo.

Porque lo recomiendo? Porque el juego en si es bueno, como ya comente, lo disfrute, y es bastante decente en gameplay e historia. Pero los problemas técnicos del port hacen que muchos jugadores lo abandonen o lo pasen por alto, y no los culpo. Recomiendo jugarlo, pero de ser posible consiganse las versiones que salieron para alguna consola, en pc solo lo jugaría como ultimo recurso, y solamente si lo compran con descuento.

el juego trae problemas tecnicos, pero la mayoria se puede arreglar con el parche adecuado, es un juego infravalorado. pasa lo mismo q con dark souls 2, no se compara con el 1 pero sigue siendo un buen juego, con este pasa igual. si lo comparamos con la trilogia original queda detras, pero como juego es "divertido", la historia no es tan rebuscada y tiene sus momentos de "silent hill". es un juego que merece una opotunidad. ademas esta barato.

Silent Hill: Homecoming é um bom jogo. Não há grande história nem uma jogabilidade envolvente. O seu papel é alimentar os fãs de Silent Hill com mais detalhes dessa série fantástica. Com essa premissa, ele é um Silent Hill bastante regular - longe dos clássicos, mas serve como um aperitivo. Como um jogo de aventura (sim, difícil enquadrá-lo como survival horror), ele é divertido, com bons puzzles e algumas batalhas interessantes. Tem uma dublagem boa e a trilha sonora é adequada. O enredo é fraco em comparação as demais Silent Hill (impossível não comparar todo o tempo!). Fala um pouco da cidade (passa-se em uma localidade próxima - Shepherd's Glen, uma cidade do outro lado do lago Toluca, que banha Silent Hill) original, cita um outro personagem dos jogos anteriores...mas as relações terminam por aí. Portanto, é um Silent Hill "não-silent-hill". Talvez se valesse como um spin off...
Em outras palavras, é um bom jogo que, estando barato, vale a compra - principalmente para os fãs de Silent Hill que jogaram os 4 primeiros jogos e desejam mais um pouco do seu enredo. Mas não esperem tanto...
Crashando na primeira parte do jogo, reembolsar gg.

Mal Port Empezando por el hecho que va 30 fps, Si minimizas el juego se cierra, pero es el unico Silent Hill en Steam por el momento asi que le doy positivo porque el juego es bueno, osea no tan bueno como SH2, pero tampoco es una desgracia.

column8:
Silent hill homecoming es buen juego, tal vez no tan bueno como las primeras 4 entregas de la saga. La historia original presente en los primeros juegos esta cambiada, el tipo de juego que a lo mejor agiliza las cosas le quita suspenso al juego. El personaje principal es un poco soso y es olvidable dentro de la saga. Como juego es aceptable, es entretenido, los enemigos tienen su dificultad hasta que les encuentras el punto y si te descuidas morirás muchas veces.

Sin embargo, lo peor de este juego y por lo que tiene tan mala calificación es el apartado técnico que incluso para la fecha de lanzamiento era poco memorable, esta versión para PC es mala pero no injugable. Con menos de 6 horas de juego se me ha crasheado el juego, se congela la pantalla de vez en cuando, diversos glitches como: enemigos muertos flotantes, balas que no hacen daño al enemigo y el mapa recortado si lo tienes con la resolución mas alta; sin mencionar que no se puede ajustar los gráficos manualmente. 

Si le quitamos el nombre de silent hill es buen juego, pero si te desespera jugar sin un buen apartado gráfico y con problemas técnicos ocasionales ni lo descargues.  Le doy un 6/10 a esta versión.

I've been on a Silent Hill Marathon sorta and had a great time with 1-4 and also Origins. But Homecoming killed all of the joy I had gotten out of this franchise to this point. Not only is the port absolute garbage and unplayable at times the game itself is just so bland, boring and absolute forgetable. 

Linear levels with no insentive for exploration, a focus on combat with a broken and unresponsive combat system, broken sound, frequent crashes, constant framedrops for no reason other than bad coding, Alt Enter is a crash most of the time, language has to be set in the cfg file, the list goes on and just like the game goes on and becomes tedious and boring.

Play SH1 and Origins on an emulator of your choice. Get SH2 and SH3 on MyAbandonwareDotCom with community fixes. Buy SH4 on GoG. Just don't waste your time with this.

I'm the 1% that the game actually worked for. 

Bad port, but SOMEHOW works for me. 
Yes, this game will still crash alt tabbing.
Yes, it is still locking at 30fps even on 144hz.
Yes, the map and picked up items still show like it's in a 600x400 resolution. 

I was able to change keybinds fine, and sound was fine. 

I will post my build down below so people can compare, due to the nature of the terrible port... Even though I really had no problem launching and playing, I cannot rid of the fact that there are hundreds of people, if not thousands, having issues without a patch.

Windows 10 Pro Version 2004 (Installed Early Sept 2020)
Ryzen R7 3700x
RTX 3080 
1440p 144hz G-Sync.
Logitech G933.

This is the game I got steam for, lol (how tf is this game still $40, jooooooooooooooooookes).

Boring characters, dull and confusing story, and some terrible combat that you can totally cheese by [spoiler]using the ritual dagger[/spoiler]. Homecoming's worst sin is that it isn't scary, but there's enough faults in this one game to fill three more games and then some. The reason for progression isn't convincing, the game runs poorly, and the second half of the game just nosedives hard and makes you fight, in a Silent Hill game, [spoiler]normal dudes[/spoiler].

Save yourself the time by looking up the third(?) boss, looking up the lore on the dogs, and uhhhhhhh that's it.
