[h1][i]"There was a picture here, but it’s gone now..."[/i][/h1]
[i]Silent Hill Homecoming[/i] is a third-person "survival horror" game and the fifth in the series. You control Alex Shepherd, and you come back to your hometown of Shepherd's Glen to visit your family and friends. You find out that its residents, including your younger brother, disappeared during your absence. Your goal is to find out what happened and investigate the truth of this forsaken town. I am a massive [i]Silent Hill[/i] fan, and I consider the first four my all-time favorites, and I can honestly say, without a shadow of a doubt, that this is the worst one in the entire franchise.
 
[h3]Pros[/h3]
✔️ Bosses are great and memorable.
✔️ For a 12-year-old game, the graphics still look decent.
✔️ Topnotch soundtrack. 
 
[h3]Cons[/h3]
❌ Mediocre story, with uninteresting characters and subpar writing.
❌ Poor combat system.
❌ Reused enemies from previous [i]Silent Hill[/i] games.
❌ Less horror, more action-oriented.
❌ Mixed bag puzzles.
❌ Bad facial animation.
❌ Unoptimized port, constant FPS issues.
 
[h1]Story[/h1]
You play as Alex Shephard, a soldier returning from war to visit his family in your hometown, Shepherd's Glen. You also meet some of its residents, such as Elle and Curtis, only to find out that people have gone missing over the years, including your little brother, Josh, since you left for the military. You start to search the town, trying to find him, which leads you to a town called [i]Silent Hill[/i]. It is up to you to find out where your brother is, discover the truth about Shepherd's Glen and how it ties with the town of [i]Silent Hill[/i]
 
The game starts with you having a nightmare about your little brother in a rusted-metal world before waking up in the cab of a truck (coincidently driven by the main protagonist of [i]Silent Hill Origins[/i], Travis Grady). I liked the intro sequence; it was intense and almost captured the previous games' horror atmosphere.
 
However, all the characters, including Alex, are boring, uninteresting, and sometimes idiotic. The only names that I remembered after completing the story were Josh and Alex; the others were just that forgettable. The game mainly drew inspiration from the first[i]Silent Hill[/i] [b]movie[/b], and barely from the previous four games. Overall, the story itself is mediocre and forgettable, with lots of weird and dumb moments that make you scratch your head out of confusion, with a lousy cliche twist at the end.
 
[h1]Gameplay[/h1]
Exploration and survival horror clearly weren't the main focus here; it felt more of an action-focused game with very few scary moments (such as the intro sequence and some of the bosses). In my opinion, It didn't feel like a [i] Silent Hill[/i] game; it just wasn't scary, since it relies on cheap jumpscares rather than the atmosphere, and completely missing the psychological horror aspect of previous titles.
 
[u]Combat[/u]
The combat systems in previous games are somewhat outdated, yet they serve their purpose; they create that sense of dread and tension every time you face an enemy, making you decide whether or not to confront it or run away to save ammo. [i]Silent Hill Homecoming[/i], however, probably has the worst combat system in the franchise; you can easily stunlock the enemy with multiple attacks, and vice versa, making those enemy encounters frustrating and infuriating rather than scary and intense.
 
There's a good variety of weapons that you can use, such as a pipe, axe, handgun, rifle (with limited ammo for some reason, and the aiming is somewhat clunky), and so on. Also, instead of using fixed camera angles that the series is known for, the game utilizes a third-person view. The flashlight and radio are back, as you will visit some very dark areas, and the radio alerts you of nearby enemies by emitting static noise.
 
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2219771662
 
[u]Enemies and bosses[/u]
The monsters in [i]Silent Hill[/i] games are always unique; everyone usually represents an inner fear, insecurities, sexual urges, or something dark lurking in someone's psyche. It's been theorized that every person who visits the town sees the monsters differently. There's a good variety of monsters in this game, but the new ones look mediocre and unimaginative. 
 
They even managed to bring some iconic monsters from [i]Silent Hill 2 & 3[/i], and the most infamous one being Pyramid Head (the game likes to call him Bogeyman). The Bogeyman only appears in 2 scenes (and one bad ending), which you can cut out of the game, and it won't affect the story at all; he is entirely pointless. However, there are a total of 4 main boss battles in the game, and they are pretty good and memorable, especially with the help of Akira Yamaoka's great music.
 
You can't run in this game, and you'll be spending a lot of time walking from point A to point B. They added QTEs for some reason, and they feel out of place. Luckily, you can install a mod that can disable that feature (go to the [b]Technical[/b] section for more info). Puzzles were a mixed bag; some were fine, but the rest were just lazy and too easy. 
 
[h1]Graphics[/h1]
For a 12-year-old game, the graphics still look decent, with good fog and great lighting. However, it has its problems, such as blurry textures, bad facial animations and sometimes poor lip-sync. The transition from the regular world to the nightmarish one looks great and very similar to the movie.
 
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2217053484
 
[h1]Technical[/h1]
[u] Laptop: Omen HP 17t, GTX 1070, Intel I7-7700HQ, 16 GB RAM, Windows 10 Home[/u]
This isn't a great PC port, so I suggest following the guide below; it contains patches and graphic enhancements, and it fixes the constant crashing and other technical issues. Despite installing the necessary patches and files, I still experienced low FPS in some areas (especially in the penitentiary).

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1280019463

[h1]Soundtrack[/h1]
The series veteran, Akira Yamaoka, composed the soundtrack. It's what you expect from a [i]Silent Hill[/i] game; amazing, yet terrifying music that creates an unsettling atmosphere, filled with horror and despair. I especially love the boss battle themes. Akiro does not use strings in his music, like every other horror game/movie. Instead, he uses electronic instruments and sometimes noisey grindings to build up the intensity to make the player feel uncomfortable.
 
[h2]Additional Details:[/h2]
[table]
[tr]
[td]Total playtime[/td]
[td]8.5 hours[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]Recommended difficulty[/td]
[td]Medium[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]M&K or Controller[/td]
[td]M&K is preferable[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]Offline mode[/td]
[td]Yes[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]Achievements[/td]
[td]None[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]Trading cards[/td]
[td]None[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]Games Saves[/td]
[td]Manually (certain locations)[/td]
[/tr]
[/table]
 
[h1]Final Thoughts[/h1]
Even though it has a few good aspects, this isn't a good [i]Silent Hill[/i] game; feels more like an action game rather than survival horror, the story is bland, the characters aren't likable, the enemy design is lazy and it's poorly optimized. I suggest buying the recent [i]Resident Evil[/i] games instead of this, and [i]Silent Hill 4[/i] from GOG, if you are looking for a good survival horror game.
 
[url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/37072886][quote]If you're looking for more quality reviews like this, follow our curator page, [b]Devils in the Detail[/b].[/quote][/url]

You control Alex Shepherd, and you come back to your hometown of Shepherd's Glen to visit your family and friends. You find out that its residents, including your younger brother, disappeared during your absence. Your goal is to find out what happened and investigate the truth of this forsaken town. I am a massive [i]Silent Hill[/i] fan, and I consider the first four my all-time favorites, and I can honestly say, without a shadow of a doubt, that this is the worst one in the entire franchise.
 
[h3]Pros[/h3]
✔️ Bosses are great and memorable.
✔️ For a 12-year-old game, the graphics still look decent.
✔️ Topnotch soundtrack. 
 
[h3]Cons[/h3]
❌ Mediocre story, with uninteresting characters and subpar writing.
❌ Poor combat system.
❌ Reused enemies from previous [i]Silent Hill[/i] games.
❌ Less horror, more action-oriented.
❌ Mixed bag puzzles.
❌ Bad facial animation.
❌ Unoptimized port, constant FPS issues.
 
[h1]Story[/h1]
You play as Alex Shephard, a soldier returning from war to visit his family in your hometown, Shepherd's Glen. You also meet some of its residents, such as Elle and Curtis, only to find out that people have gone missing over the years, including your little brother, Josh, since you left for the military. You start to search the town, trying to find him, which leads you to a town called [i]Silent Hill[/i]. It is up to you to find out where your brother is, discover the truth about Shepherd's Glen and how it ties with the town of [i]Silent Hill[/i]
 
The game starts with you having a nightmare about your little brother in a rusted-metal world before waking up in the cab of a truck (coincidently driven by the main protagonist of [i]Silent Hill Origins[/i], Travis Grady). I liked the intro sequence; it was intense and almost captured the previous games' horror atmosphere.
 
However, all the characters, including Alex, are boring, uninteresting, and sometimes idiotic. The only names that I remembered after completing the story were Josh and Alex; the others were just that forgettable. The game mainly drew inspiration from the first[i]Silent Hill[/i] [b]movie[/b], and barely from the previous four games. Overall, the story itself is mediocre and forgettable, with lots of weird and dumb moments that make you scratch your head out of confusion, with a lousy cliche twist at the end.
 
[h1]Gameplay[/h1]
Exploration and survival horror clearly weren't the main focus here; it felt more of an action-focused game with very few scary moments (such as the intro sequence and some of the bosses). In my opinion, It didn't feel like a [i] Silent Hill[/i] game; it just wasn't scary, since it relies on cheap jumpscares rather than the atmosphere, and completely missing the psychological horror aspect of previous titles.
 
[u]Combat[/u]
The combat systems in previous games are somewhat outdated, yet they serve their purpose; they create that sense of dread and tension every time you face an enemy, making you decide whether or not to confront it or run away to save ammo. [i]Silent Hill Homecoming[/i], however, probably has the worst combat system in the franchise; you can easily stunlock the enemy with multiple attacks, and vice versa, making those enemy encounters frustrating and infuriating rather than scary and intense.
 
There's a good variety of weapons that you can use, such as a pipe, axe, handgun, rifle (with limited ammo for some reason, and the aiming is somewhat clunky), and so on. Also, instead of using fixed camera angles that the series is known for, the game utilizes a third-person view. The flashlight and radio are back, as you will visit some very dark areas, and the radio alerts you of nearby enemies by emitting static noise.
 
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2219771662
 
[u]Enemies and bosses[/u]
The monsters in [i]Silent Hill[/i] games are always unique; everyone usually represents an inner fear, insecurities, sexual urges, or something dark lurking in someone's psyche. It's been theorized that every person who visits the town sees the monsters differently. There's a good variety of monsters in this game, but the new ones look mediocre and unimaginative. 
 
They even managed to bring some iconic monsters from [i]Silent Hill 2 & 3[/i], and the most infamous one being Pyramid Head (the game likes to call him Bogeyman). The Bogeyman only appears in 2 scenes (and one bad ending), which you can cut out of the game, and it won't affect the story at all; he is entirely pointless. However, there are a total of 4 main boss battles in the game, and they are pretty good and memorable, especially with the help of Akira Yamaoka's great music.
 
You can't run in this game, and you'll be spending a lot of time walking from point A to point B. They added QTEs for some reason, and they feel out of place. Luckily, you can install a mod that can disable that feature (go to the [b]Technical[/b] section for more info). Puzzles were a mixed bag; some were fine, but the rest were just lazy and too easy. 
 
[h1]Graphics[/h1]
For a 12-year-old game, the graphics still look decent, with good fog and great lighting. However, it has its problems, such as blurry textures, bad facial animations and sometimes poor lip-sync. The transition from the regular world to the nightmarish one looks great and very similar to the movie.
 
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2217053484
 
[h1]Technical[/h1]
[u] Laptop: Omen HP 17t, GTX 1070, Intel I7-7700HQ, 16 GB RAM, Windows 10 Home[/u]
This isn't a great PC port, so I suggest following the guide below; it contains patches and graphic enhancements, and it fixes the constant crashing and other technical issues. Despite installing the necessary patches and files, I still experienced low FPS in some areas (especially in the penitentiary).

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1280019463

[h1]Soundtrack[/h1]
The series veteran, Akira Yamaoka, composed the soundtrack. It's what you expect from a [i]Silent Hill[/i] game; amazing, yet terrifying music that creates an unsettling atmosphere, filled with horror and despair. I especially love the boss battle themes. Akiro does not use strings in his music, like every other horror game/movie. Instead, he uses electronic instruments and sometimes noisey grindings to build up the intensity to make the player feel uncomfortable.
 
[h2]Additional Details:[/h2]
[table]
[tr]
[td]Total playtime[/td]
[td]8.5 hours[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]Recommended difficulty[/td]
[td]Medium[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]M&K or Controller[/td]
[td]M&K is preferable[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]Offline mode[/td]
[td]Yes[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]Achievements[/td]
[td]None[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]Trading cards[/td]
[td]None[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]Games Saves[/td]
[td]Manually (certain locations)[/td]
[/tr]
[/table]
 
[h1]Final Thoughts[/h1]
Even though it has a few good aspects, this isn't a good [i]Silent Hill[/i] game; feels more like an action game rather than survival horror, the story is bland, the characters aren't likable, the enemy design is lazy and it's poorly optimized. I suggest buying the recent [i]Resident Evil[/i] games instead of this, and [i]Silent Hill 4[/i] from GOG, if you are looking for a good survival horror game.
 
[url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/37072886][quote]If you're looking for more quality reviews like this, follow our curator page, [b]Devils in the Detail[/b].[/quote][/url]

column8:
Silent Hill: Homecoming has been out since 2008. You already know this is a bad video game, so I'll be reviewing the state of this port instead.

Every single Silent Hill PC port is bad, but this one is the absolute worst of the lot. The sound is only designed for 5.1 surround systems and cannot be changed without a fan made patch, (which may or may not work, depending on who knows). On a regular stereo (2.0 or 2.1 system), most sound effects only play through the right speaker. The game's sound effects and music regularly cut out during game play. Enemies get stuck in attack animation loops that you can not get out of, causing many cheap deaths. You cannot run this game in any resolution beyond 720p without another fan made patch. The game crashes if you try to alt+tab to your desktop (fixed by downloading 3rd party software and injecting it into the game's EXE). There are regular freezes during loading between scenes and levels that last up to 5 minutes. There is a game breaking bug during one of the very final acts that is impassable because the QTE system is broken (again fixed by a fan patch but doesn't always work - I ended up quitting in frustration and uninstalling before reaching the ending). If you die during a boss battle, you will restart the checkpoint but cannot skip the proceeding cut scene. Input is severely delayed at times making traversal and combat clunky and frustrating. Many times, clicking to shoot your weapon simply will not work. Many times, facial textures don't load in.

Want to experience Silent Hill: Homecoming? Buy it on 360 or PS3, where it actually works properly.

Or better yet, avoid it altogether and just listen to the incredible soundtrack online. It's the best part of the entire experience.

column8:
Silent Hill: Homecoming is by no means an awful game, but it is a pretty miserable Silent Hill experience. The game focuses way too much on action and fighting rather than creating a sense of dread, and some of the puzzles are a little lacklustre. The game’s story also left much to be desired. It begins interestingly, but really shits the bed towards the latter portions of the game. Not all is bad though. The game has a fantastic soundtrack, composed by the legend himself Akira Yamaoka, that really helps to create a distinctly Silent Hill-esque feel and the environments look great. In fact, Homecoming has one of my favourite depictions of the Otherworld in the series, and some of the creatures, most notably the bosses, have some of the best designs out of any of the games.

All in all, Silent Hill: Homecoming feels like a game that is tied down by roots it clearly doesn’t want to be confined to. It’s easily the weakest of the 8 main entries, but it’s not awful. If you’re a fan of Silent Hill, and you’ve never played it, I don’t see any harm in giving it a shot (though I’d strongly recommend picking up either the PS3 or Xbox 360 version as the PC version has a number of issues). Just don’t go into it expecting a masterpiece.

column8: Uma das melhores historias da trama Silent Hill \o/

I bought this originally and had issues on my old PC. Flash forward, I now have a really good gaming PC and decided since it's October and I'm a horror game fanatic I would give it a shot. 

This game is still so buggy it's virtually unplayable. Want to change the keybindings? Nope, anything you change them to, suddenly you lose the ability to actually do anything or use your weapons, so you can run in circles while being carved at by psychotic nurses, but good luck attacking back. Want to try and use an actual controller instead since it has that feature enabled? Nope! the only thing that works is the walking controls, none of the other buttons actually do anything. 

I'm beginning to think that the game wasn't really working on my old PC because of the GAME not because of my PC, if I could return this, I would, but sadly it's way past its expiration date.

column8:
On me l'avait pourtant dit. Ce serait un portage PC à l'arrache !
Mais c'est le seul SILENT HILL sur Steam et, en fan de la 1ère heure, j'ai quand même voulu essayer.
Attention - j'aime beaucoup ce jeu. Mais je ne recommande pas la version PC fournie par l'éditeur sur Steam, qui, tous les deux, cautionnent la présence d'un truc mal configuré.
Mon pouce rouge sanctionne le portage que j'ai acheté, que vous allez peut-être acheter, car il est inadmissible.
Par contre, "Homecoming", lui, s'avère très prenant, et il possède tout de même l'âme de SH, notamment avec cette intention de rendre hommage directement au premier par le retour du brouillard.
Alex est aussi un Harry, quelque part.
Pour suivre les instructions afin d'y jouer proprement, scrollez directement en bas de l'éval'.


Cet opus, réalisé par un studio en sous-traitance via KONAMI, ne bénéfie pas du talent de la fameuse Silent team. Seul reste à bord Akira Yamaoka, qui signe une musique à la hauteur -comme toujours.
Le single est juste superbe, comme à chaque opus et toute la partition est digne de la série.

Si l'ensemble fait très vieillot, son charme prend cependant, via une direction artistique correcte, un doublage agréable et la musique de mister Yamaoka. L'ambiance du jeu, bien qu'orientée vers les combats, n'est pas le point faible. D'ailleurs la caméra à l'épaule façon Resident Evil n'est pas désagréable, et le gameplay se montre plutôt nerveux (avec esquives, contre-attaque et combo !).
Quant au côté "fan-made" et fauché, il a son petit effet vintage / old school / Playstation plutôt sympa, au final..! (en attendant un remake ?)
Le scénario est assez scolaire, les auteurs & développeurs ayant scrupuleusement aligné, sans grand génie, les éléments de Silent Hill. C'est efficace cela dit.
Et ça reste très valable.
En même temps, qu'aurions-nous pu faire de plus, après tant de jeux passés (c'est le 6e) ?

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2244252441

Non, ce qui fâche, c'est la partie purement technique : en l'état, vanilla, "Homecoming" présente une interface buggée où les touches requises n'apparaissent pas, des problèmes de sons, ou de saccades visuelles, des temps de chargement fous, et surtout, entre 2 sauvegardes disséminées ça et là, on peut subir un crash à chaque loading. L'angoisse vient donc d'avantage du retour-bureau aléatoire que de l'atmosphère proprement dite.



MAIS!
Si vous ne le prenez pas sur console...
... Un travail étonnant a été fourni par UnknownProject, un russe un peu allumé qui a concocté un patch complet.
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1280019463
 Mais malgré ça et autres fixes faits par des joueurs dévoués, rien n'y fait, ça plante, de temps en temps.
Il faut donc ensuite tenter de le lancer en tant qu'administrateur depuis le fichier exe.
Et prier. Ensuite, tout marche enfin.

Alors si vous êtes un disciple, un fanatique hardcore de la première heure...
Prêt à retrousser les manches...
Prendre 5-10mns et la peine de bidouiller le jeu...

Et retourner là bas. 
Se perdre dans la brume.
random crashes, broken combat and the most horrific part of this game is the performance. wasted money

column8: This is a double whammy for me. I'm a huge Silent Hill fan, especially of the first four Team Silent titles, but this is a cheap imitation by way of poor quality rip off of Jacob's Ladder with an unbearably predictable "twist". If the game itself was just mediocre but functional I wouldn't care but this PC port is [i]very[/i] broken. You will need mods if you'd like to play this game as it was originally intended. The most egregious problem is the audio, but even five years ago it should have been no issue to have this game capable of being run at a native resolution above 720p at 60fps and yet you will need mods for this as well. If you're a diehard Silent Hill fan and are willing to be patient enough to get it modded so that you can play it properly then go nuts but if I'm being honest, it's not worth the full $40 even if that is the case.

Do not buy this game. It is a broken mess on PC. Game crashes, mouse and keyboard errors, and some puzzles don't work. For example, in the beginning of the game you have to click a button to get into the room. Because of resolution problems in the export, the button doesn't register the click. You have to click randomly on the screen to find the "sweet spot" were the game will actually work.

I enjoy silent hill games from the story, to the atmosphere but the PC version will ruin your experience with the game. Especially at $40, this game is a huge rip off. I wouldn't buy it for $5

Yeah it's kind of bad. And the port is actually almost unplayable. I literally had to install a sound driver because sound was only coming out of ONE EAR? That's definitely a first.

But for some reason I still enjoy the game, even though it is obviously nowhere near the quality of the originals. I dunno I blame nostalgia. Hard to believe that this is the only Silent Hill game that has shown up officially on steam, just a super strange decision. Wish they would port 2-4 since those do have actual PC ports. They require extensive patching but man this game makes those look like works of art in terms of port quality.

Honestly don't buy this, it's hard to recommend at all simply due to the fact that it's so annoying to even make this playable. Personally I've enjoyed way worse budget indie games that come out nowadays, so I still give this the thumbs up. It's just ok. The combat sucks, etc. but it's still playable and enjoyable to a degree.

column8:
The reason I'm not recommending this is not because it's a bad game, but because it's a bad port.

Despite using the fan patch I still experienced multiple crashes (however the game was still playable), and during cut scenes audio would only come out of one speaker when people were talking. The game itself was good, however I'm sure I would have enjoyed it even more if not for the above mentioned issues.

Alex returns from the army and learns that his brother is missing and that oh yeah, the town has become overrun with monsters. He goes looking for his brother, encountering those of the town's inhabitants who are still around along the way. And, as is usually the case with Silent Hill, there is of course also a plot twist or two.

The gameplay is fun. It's mostly about memorizing the attack patterns of the various enemies you encounter and learning how to counter them, and once you've mastered that [i]most[/i] of the enemies are easily defeatable using only a melee weapon. The difficulty of the puzzles is also just right, some being fairly easy while others providing a bit more of a challenge, but nothing is ever [i]too[/i] hard.

If they ever release a remake/remaster I'll probably play through the game again, but I can't really recommend this version as it's just [i]too[/i] poorly optimized. If you're a die hard Silent Hill fan then you'll probably still enjoy it (I did),however if you can get your hands on a different version of the game instead I highly recommend you do so.

bug bug and bug

Do not buy, broken sound. The movies are fine, but in the menus and during gameplay the sound only comes out of the right speaker, with the exeption of a few effects. I tried for hours to fix it using fan patches but to no avail. This makes it unplayable for me. A huge shame, I love Silent Hill. 

Edit: I finally managed to fix the sound by installing Steam006's patch: https://community.pcgamingwiki.com/files/file/1267-silent-hill-homecoming-pc-fix-by-steam006/ To use this patch you will run another executable, and this will create the disadvantage of steam not tracking your in game hours.

Edit nr. 2: Guess what... every time i load any save, from different locations mind you, I'm brought back to the beginning cutscene. Great! I can't progress! I guess I'll go to Silent Hill and end myself.

column8:
I really wanted to like this game and I am also a longtime fan of the Silent Hill series. I've played all the games over and over again with 2 and 3 being my favorites, but Homecoming is a letdown for me because of the clunky control. I played the game for 9 hours and the atmosphere simply got wasted by the frustration of having to kill something and the invisible walls bugs that break the immersion (enemies can be kitted to an invisible walls and farmed and the process of killing something is random - button spam). I uninstalled the game because I was only raging but maybe I will finish it in the future.

Tried to play it again today but the frustration I got from progress loss bugs and game crashes killed it for me.  Uninstalled it again.

column8:
Are you F***ING kidding me? This game is so far broken it's d**n near a scam. Even with community patches and sound fixes, it's hardly enjoyable. 


My low game time comes from the stupid amount of bugs in this game. Mainly audio, FPS, and resolution. 


If you do not normally use 5.1, good luck. Almost all the audio will come out of the right. This, of course, would be tolerable if you do have 5.1 but even then the audio just doesn't work. Talking to Josh caused all the dialogue to come from the LEFT instead! How hard is it to make a working game when you're a publisher releasing AAA titles? 


If you also don't want the game to look like completely underscaled dog-s**t then that's also a big F**K YOU too. This game CANNOT run at 1920x1080 at all. Community patch or not. It just caps out at 24 fps if ran at 1920x1080. 


Seriously, do not buy this version of the game. It shouldn't have been hard to port it over, but they messed it up hard. I'm tempted to say don't buy this game at all because who the hell knows what you're gonna get if they can release this pile of crap.


Edit: So I played through it and by god, it's even worse. There's no redeeming quality of this game, at all. Even the story was just... bad. Really bad.

column8:
As a game I really like it, I have loved the Silent Hill series for a long time and seen it's high points and low points, and honestly this game isn't awful to me.

The problem is the PC port. The game was never really difficult playing it on a console but on PC the difficulty is much higher because you have to run the game at 30fps with crashes if you decide you want to alt+tab. There is a patch for this game by unknownproject which fixes most of these issues, but you can only fix so much. A great game if played with a stable copy, a terrible game if you're just playing it as it arrives on Steam.

column8:
I was so bothered by this game for the last 3 hours that I want to write a review which I rarely do.
To put it in one sentence, you have to be a real SH fan to be able to finish it.
The difficulty of the game is not established on enemy AI, but by making the aiming and combat system so bumpy that sometimes there's simply nothing you can do but watch yourself die.
One other big thing is, killing an enemy won't reward you anything, so what the player really is doing is doing what he has to do to get to the next part, instead of enjoying it.
I just think playing this game would be unfair to "Silent Hill" and unfair to other games.
When I'm writing this review, I noticed the price -- what a joke.

I would like to start by saying that I am a huge Silent Hill (SH) fan and have played through every SH  game available. This game imo is the last decent SH story after 1,2 and 3. I wholeheartedly recommend this game, just not this port. If you can get this on another platform then you should. It has a great story and atmosphere even though it is quite dated.

Which brings me to this edition. This is easily the WORST port of a game I have ever played. My 14 hours in game is a single playthrough. This game can easily be beaten in under 10 hours but not on this port. This is not due to difficulty unfortunately, it is due to the amount of times the game will freeze/crash. At any save point or transition in the game, the game will stall and there is a 50/50 chance of it recovering or crashing. If the game does crash (high likleyhood), then it may take multiple attempts to relaunch from steam and may require reverification of files.

I would highly recommend this game, just not this port. I have enjoyed multiple playthroughs of Silent Hill 1,2,3 and really want to play this again for the alternate endings but will not be doing them on Steam.

column8:
Ekkora hulladék game-el rég nem játszottam..... A történet éppen hogy megállja a helyét, szerintem kifejezetten gyenge lett amúgy sok más Silent Hill game után. De ez még a legkisebb gond vele. Hogy mi a tényleges gond a játékkal? A mentési rendszer valami botrány, hülye fix pontok...... és ez leginkább azért baj, mert a játék versenyt csinál abból, hogy mikor tud összeomlani újra. Nekem rendszerint 2-3. indításra indult el eleve. Az elejét 4X toltam végig a crash-ek miatt. A beszédhangok néha kb egyáltalán nem hallgatók mert olyan erősek az egyéb hangok. Medkit és lőszerfukarság van, ami nem lenne gáz, de divatot csinál abból is a game, hogy a nyakadba vág egyszerre több masszívabb ellenfelet. Nekem konkrétan az első Boss-t egy baltával kellett elverni mert addigra semmim nem maradt, máshogy odáig se jutok el.... A mozgás baromi darabos, látszik hogy konzolból lett átemelve, de nem igazán sikerült optimalizálni. A puzzle-öknél néha nem veszi be a kurzort.... hányás.... Arról nem beszélve, hogy egyes ellenfelek erőszintje is ugrál. A nővérkéket az elején pikkpakk szétkaptam, később meg jobban tartottam tőlük, mint akármelyik boss-tól....

Az egyetlen ami talán érdekes vagy pozitív a játékban az a zenei hatások, aláfestések.

column8: el juego me gusta, el problema es que tiene muchos fallos de optimizacion, pero bueno es disfrutable en PC

SH Homecomig je dobrý přírustek do rodiny SH, atmosféra je super, na ovládání si musí člověk zvyknout (to ale patří k sérii Sh už od začátku), jedná se o hodně podceněný díl, kde největší problém je optimalizace/technický stav hry (hra neustále padá díky minimální přítomnosti automatického uložení-člověk často přichází o 15-30 min herního času ) příběh je výborný. 

+Příběh
+Vylepšený bojový režim
+Atmosféra
+více konců

-padání hry
-časté dropy FPS
-někdy chyby kamery
-větší cena (díky stavu portu)

+-(Pro někoho bojový režim-není to typická hra)

Závěr: Je škoda jak moc špatná je technická stránka, avšak když hře věnujete čas a nervy nebudete litovat.
Příběh 8.5/10
Technický stav 3/10

column8: Eu amo esse jogo. Principalmente as músicas, em especial as gravadas pela Mary Elizabeth McGlynn, que contam a história do jogo de maneira sutil. Zerei este jogo anos atrás, e ainda hoje tenho muito carinho por ele, mas a versão da Steam já crashou na minha primeira hora de jogo, e pelo que eu li nas outras análises, isso não é incomum. Se você tiver paciência, jogue. Eu recomendo, mesmo com todos os problemas. Mas não pra mim, eu vou matar a nostalgia vendo um vídeo ao invés de passar raiva.

The game itself is not that bad, I actually enjoyed it, but it is ported very badly.
Combat is kinda difficult, but when u get used to it, it is fun; Also monsters are hella creepy and story is sad af.
The big minus is that u cannot change 800x600 resolution, and when you try to do it game will crash (Sadly I'm not the only one encountering this problem)...
All those negative reviews make me sad, it would be a great thing if they decided to re-port the game, because that is very much needed...

column8: Nem ajánlom. Egyszerűen nem működik. Folyton összeomlik, persze nincs quicksave, csak béna fix mentési pontok. Amúgy jó lenne végigjátszani, mert a történet érdekes lehet, de ezek az amatőr technikai hibák aláássák az egész játékot. Kár érte.

Pour commencer, je suis un grand fan de la licence Silent Hill ( 2, 3, 4 the Room etc.) quand les jeux étaient sur consôle (Ps2 et Ps3).

Silent Hill Homecoming est un jeu qui est pensé Survival horror comme pour les Resident Evil, en tout cas plus que tout les autres SH, son histoire n'est pas la meilleur, le gameplay est rigide au plus haut point et l'ai toujours sur Ps3.

Le défaut principal du jeu sur Steam c'est qu'il n'est pas fait pour les joueur PC (clavier souris, bon courage à vous car je sais je l'ai testé), car le temps d'avoir le réflexe pour switch le mode course avec le mode attaque, vous vous êtes pris des dégats des créatures et boss...

A côté de ça, de nombreux Patch devront êtres installés afin d'avoir un jeu à peu prêt fluide sans compté les multiples Bugs que vous croiserez. Pour moi ce portage PC n'aurait pas dû sortir sans la possibilité automatique de jouer avec une manette (même si dans les options ça propose de jouer à la manette, ça fonctionne pas de base et c'est rageant).

Je sais pas si ce commentaire est le plus pertinent, il ne s'agit que de mon ressenti personnel. En tout cas si vous voulez jouer à ce jeu, passez sur Ps3 ou Xbox360 si vous n'avez pas le courage de corriger le jeu vous même...
Péssima adaptação para pc. Baixo fps, bugs e travamentos que estragam a experiência. Zerei porque sou teimoso.

I tried to go easy on this game, but after 5 times attempting to play it on PC AND Ps3, I really don't like it. There's a lot I can say about it so I guess this is where I say it.

Judging this as a standalone title does it absolutely no justice. The monsters are extremely irritating to deal with, which ruins any scare factor. Most, ramp up in difficulty and cause me to want to just turn the game off after getting my health bar drained by the tacky movie nurses. Or refuse to piss off so running from them doesn't work. They're either way too hard or way too easy.
 The combat and control delay causes you to smash a bunch of buttons with little to no response and is infuriating. The over the shoulder mouse controlled camera seems to swing wildy no matter what mouse sensitivity I have it set to and gets WAY too close to the back of the characters head, taking up the whole POV.

The puzzles all the way through are completely infantile till the last two that seem to throw you into MYST, usually the item to solve it is just around the corner and requires no thought, just a trek through the hordes of Scissor feet monsters and a lot of doors. 


I am NOT someone who cares about graphics if the artistry of the game is good. However both are pretty yucky. The animation on all the characters (especially when they talk) is just BAD. Comparing it to Silent Hill 2 or 3 which came out on the PS2 in 2001-2003, its really ridiculous. They're extremely stiff and emotionless.
The entire color pallet of this game is, no joke, orange or gray. the items in every room repeat themselves and there is little to no visual interest anywhere. (besides the boss rooms)

The only things I can say that aren't negative is that the story isn't the worst. It has SOME value.
The bosses are pretty interesting compared to the weird flesh blobs running around usually. Each boss seems to fit a theme and its design corresponds to the story behind their creation, visually at least.
The music is decent, being composed by the series musician Akira Yamaoka.

That's it. its not fun to play. Honestly. I would watch a Youtuber play it if you really want to see it.

column8:
Unfortunately, the game runs better on the console port than the PC. Save often, this game crashes at the worst times on the new operating system.

The game in of itself IS a fun Silent Hill game despite the different tone and play style to other previous installments. Combat is fun, exploring is as well. 

If you are wanting this game, be sure to get it on the console. Runs far better on there than on here,

column8: This game won't even launch for me, all I see is a black screen. I have to restart my computer just to have access to my PC again. It's pretty sad that my machine won't run a game that has been out for 12 years. I have a AMD Ryzen 7 (3rd Gen) 3800X Processor with 16GB of DDR4 ram, Nvidia GeForce GTX 1060 6GB video card, with more than enough hard drive space. I have 4 hard drives (One of them is a 500GB Samsung Solid State, 2 x 1TB HDD, and a 4TB Seagate Barracuda. I tried changing my screen resolution from 1920x1080 to 800x600, and I still only see a black screen. Damn, I was looking forward to playing this since I never got around to playing it before. Re-port this game!!!!

column8:
Depois de quase 7 anos no meu backlog, finalmente dei uma chance a este que é o único Silent Hill ainda disponível em lojas digitais pra PC, visto que a Konami resolveu ignorar a existência dos ótimos ports de SH2 e 3, mas manteve esse péssimo port do SH:Homecoming. Ignorando o fato de que já é um jogo datado e portanto os gráficos são de mais de uma década atrás, o que mais incomoda nesse jogo é a quantidade absurda de defeitos. O jogo é instável, fecha do nada, tem travamentos constantes de até 15 ou 20 segundos, bugs bizarros com o inventário, loadings frequentes e demorados. O jogo é uma constante demonstração de como não fazer um port. Fora isso, assim como o Silent Hill Origins do PS2, é um jogo desinteressante, que de longe lembra os Silent Hills bons, mas no fundo é uma casca vazia que se aproveita do nome da franquia pra ganhar mais uns trocados. Jogar o jogo na dificuldade mais alta é outra demonstração de como não fazer. Limites ridículos de munição. Não basta as balas serem escassas e quase inúteis contra os inimigos, tem que limitar o jogador a carregar no máximo 15 ridículas balas de pistola. Passe longe. A Konami perdeu o rumo faz tempo. Tanto tempo que esse jogo já foi feito por terceiros, só foi publicado por ela.

NOTA: 5/10
Why does this game crash all the fucking time?
column9: Why does this game crash all the fucking time?

column8: muita queda de frame e jogabilidade bugada

Um jogo muito bom. Sou um fã de Silent Hill, mas essa versão de PC tem muitos bugs que atrapalham o gameplay. Vi muitos falando que o jogo crasha repentinamente, fazendo que perca seu progresso. Achei que fosse por causa das configurações do pc e tudo mais, mas acontece comigo e com uma gama de jogadores, então o problema talvez seja geral. É frustrante. 

Fora isso, o jogo tá de parabéns

Sendo Sincero,tenho esse jogo a algum tempo e resolvi jogar, mas qual foi minha surpresa ao descobrir que é todo bugado e tudo mais,mano,eu não conseguia bater nos mobs porque o jogo é bugado, achei que podia ser problema do mouse, mas não, é essa droga, pior q descobri que tem como desbugar mas é todo um trampo de baixar várias coisas e sinceramente...não sei se vale a pena

Port porco, repleto de bugs. Os 12 minutos que "joguei" foi pressionando o botão na inútil tentativa de sair da maldita maca onde o boneco do jogo começa. Já estou muito velho para tentar soluções criativas para um jogo que deveria funcionar sem maiores aborrecimentos ao usuário. Desinstalando (provavelmente para sempre). Passem longe deste amontoado de excremento digital.
买了不敢玩,我是怂逼

As much as I want to recommend this game the same amount i wouldn't recommend it but I will recommend it anyway :D
First of all this game can be called a horror cuss it truly is,story is amazing,so twisted and unpredictable which makes it an amazing game and it also gives you different game endings depending on choices you make trough the game.
Bad side of this game are glitches,low fps in some areas,sound not working as it should so it can really piss you off sometime as you play it,and old graphic which looks as it is an unfinished game.
So if you can get pass all of the bad sides this game is pretty amazing,I hope for an remaster or at least some patches to make it better.

column8:
To nie to samo co klasyki serii, takie jak Silent Hill 1, 2, 3... co nie oznacza jednak że Homecoming to słaba pozycja. Przeciwnie, bawiłem się przy nim doskonale. Gra wygląda świetnie, ścieżka dźwiękowa też robi swoje. Gameplay jest nowatorski jak na serię Silent Hill, bo skupia się na walce z potworami w sposób dotąd nie realizowany, przez co gra jednak traci dużo uroku i klimatu, ale za to zyskuje dynamiki i świeżości. Fabularnie też nie jest najgorzej, bowiem gra potrafi zaskoczyć i zainteresować gracza, jeśli już wciągniemy się w jej świat na dłużej. 

Największym problemem zdawały się błędy techniczne, często zdarzało się grze zaciąć, bardzo długo ładować albo nawet w ogóle się nie załadować... może wynikało to z mojego starego sprzętu a może gra jest źle zoptymalizowana na PC. Wtedy to byłby duży minus.

Mimo wszystko warto zagrać, Moja ocena to 7/10.

Eu gosto demais de jogos de terror e da franquia Silent Hill. E esse jogo não me decepcionou. o unico problemas foram os crashes. Fora isso é um bom jogo. E se voce gosta de jogos do gênero e da franquia, eu recomendo esse jogo.

column8:
Control in game is buggy (I have to make mele attack every shot...), I died because of it and lost 30 minutes of gameplay, because saves are rare. Then I decided that I don't have time to replay it and lost next half an hour as auto saves are not shared between different runs and normal saves are allowed only in special places.

The fight is very poorly realized, therefore is frustrating.

Game never crashed (for me), tho.

It also looks good, and seems interesting. I may decide to end the game one day, and maybe I will change my opinion, at this moment I'm disappointed.

column8: Я думал, что это была хорошая видеоигра, отдаленная, но довольно интересная.

Leider muss ich all den schlechten Kommentaren recht geben.
Ich als jahrelanger Silent Hill fan hab mit das Spiel voller Vorfreude gekauft und wurde sehr enttäuscht.
Das Spiel an sich ist gut, nur leider ist es mir innerhalb einer Stunde 5 mal abgeschmiert.

Silent Hill Homecoming is the only Silent Hill game available on steam and the only one I played, though I did watch all the movies.

In my understanding, Silent Hill not just refers to a ghost town and also refers to a supernatural phenomenon that summoned by humans[spoiler]cult[/spoiler]. Place where Silent Hill happens is covered with heavy fog and inhabitants there gradually disappear. There is an outer world and an inner world where Silent Hill happens. The outer world is the same as the normal world, with monsters crawling around. The inner world, besides the lurking monsters, the world mutates into a mixture of red blood, scarlet flesh and rusty iron. 

It is a very cool concept. It set a wonderful tone for a mysterious theme horror game. However, Silent Hill Homecoming does not execute the idea well. While it did create a horrifying atmosphere with scene-setting, lights and spooky sounds, the story is very plain and the gameplay is boring, failing to be an immersive game. You basically just walk from points to points, kill some monsters and experience some stuff that you don’t feel anything. There is no surprise twist, indulging plot or truly horrifying scene to match the creepy atmosphere. It is not even a good storyteller, with lots of inconsistent cutscenes and unnecessary and ambiguous choices to make. Besides, although it is a good idea to use melee attack as a conventional attack to replace gun shooting commonly seen is a good idea (but you do have three guns with very limited ammo), the combat is poorly designed. It adopts a very strange camera angle for melee attack that different from the one in walking and an even stranger gun shooting angle that provides a very limited field of view. Control in combat is very unhandy as well. You have to press shift which I often forgot to do, to enter the fighting mode that has a very limit dodge range compared to normal walking mode, causing even more difficulty in combat. Overall, combat is hard, not fun and even frustrating and the game is very hard to keep playing.

Even worse, this game is extremely poorly transplanted from console to PC. I watched videos on YouTube showing this game run far better on console than PC. In PC version, the control is bad, requiring longer response time for the character to react; some scenes are so dark that I basically could not see anything even in maximum brightness; optimization really sucks as frame rate is super unstable and averagely low; glitches happen pretty often in the form of game crashing for multiple times (and my game was not saved); and generally poor transplant (the game does not show left/right mouse button icons). It makes this game a disastrous playing experience. 

To fix most of the issues (except brightness and optimization), I recommend checking the following link. But using this patch will lead to the disappearance of dodge warning signs during combat, slightly upgrading the combat difficulty.

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1280019463

This game has multiple endings. Read this guide if you don’t want to have bad ending like me.

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=118509269

I don’t recommend playing this game because the plain story doesn’t live up its name, and also because of the extremely terrible transplant. If you are really interested in this game, I suggest you watch a video instead.

column8:
Apesar de ser um jogo da série que tem uma história meia boca e forte influencia dos filmes (que não são as melhores coisas feitas com a franquia), a jogabilidade e os gráficos dele não são tão ruins e a jornada não é tão longa ao ponto de você se sentir mal de jogar (ao menos não se você tentar zerar em uma tacada só)... 

Um adicional é que você vai precisar do patch do "unknownproject" (https://unknownproject.github.io/silent_hill.html) para deixar o jogo minimamente jogável, visto que a Double Helix cagou para a otimização da versão de PC...

Na minha opinião, faltam muitas coisas que melhorariam o jogo ou que poderíamos considerar parte de um Silent Hill de fato... Como: 

- Otimização real para PC.
- Localização para português brasileiro.
- Melhores controles de Câmera.
- Modo de câmera fixa em determinados pontos do cenário.
- Profundidade na história.
- Conexões reais com os fatos de entradas anteriores da série (e não somente nomes nos arquivos e menções rápidas).
- Coisas explicadas subliminarmente (deixar o jogador aprender e perceber sozinho, sem pegar na mão).
- Sistema de Conquistas (presente somente no XBOX pelo motivo de: preguiça da Double Helix)
- Mais "unlockables" e dificuldades

Alright, first of all it's buggy as HELL! (playing on Windows 8.1)

Here is my list of opinions:

1. The story is meh

2. The sound and audio quality is sometimes good, but it will most of the time be out of sync

3. The combat is interesting, it features executions on stunned enemies and a few human enemies

4. The graphics is standard 2000, nothing special

5. Overall an average Silent Hill game that is available on Steam (and is the only official Silent Hill game on Steam)

column8:
O jogo é bem bacana. Eu tinha expectativas baixas, mas confesso que me surpreendi positivamente com ele... claro, não supera os primeiros, mas achei bem melhor que o 4, por exemplo. Alex é um personagem bacana, o voice acting de todos é muito bom, tem o barulhinho do rádio, fog, enfermeiras deformadas gostosas, versões macabras dos cenários, referências aos outros jogos... enfim, vários elementos clássicos da série estão ali, ainda que meio mal encaixados, afinal não é uma produção do Team Silent.

PORÉM

O port do jogo pra PC é tão ruim, que a experiência é um terror a parte. Seguramente uns 20% do tempo total de jogo vai ser com carregamentos, já que os loadings são bem demorados. Procure salvar sempre que possível, pq muitos bugs e crashes farão vc se obrigar a fechar e abrir o jogo novamente, isso quando ele não fecha sozinho. Aliás, isso até inclui um elemento extra de tensão e suspente, pq nunca dá pra saber se o jogo vai "crashar" depois um loading.

É uma pena realmente, eu estava curtindo bastante, mas depois que perdi umas 2h de progresso por causa de um dos muitos crashes (eu estava longe no jogo até), me sobrou apenas o lamento e botão de desinstalar :(

No se puede ni ejecutar tras ser descargado en steam, el juego necesita un path externo hecho por un fan y aun asi sigue sin ser jugable. Tiempo de cargas excesivos, se congela o tiene bajones de FPS apenas se puede jugar por no decir que es casi imposible de lo mal optimizado que esta. Se puede cerrar el juego en cualquier momento, al usar el comando TAB+ALT y incluso cuando estes faseando de un map a otro map se puede quedar colgado o cerrarse. Si no fuera solo eso los "SAVES" o "Partidas guardadas" se pueden dañar o perder.
Conclusion: no recomiendo esta compra ningun jugador ni seguidor de la saga Silent Hill.

Hra se dá dohrát naprosto v klidu pokud nejste degeni. Na ovládání jsem si zvyknul poměrně rychle. Bohužel optimalizace na w10 je pěst na oko a flusnul bych nejradši Konami do držky za to jak moc srali na Silent Hill. Bez fixu, kterej je, ale lehce k dostání neskutečně padá. Po fixu mi spadla jen párkrát. Sice to nasere jelikož hra nemá autosave po cutscéně ani po boss fightu, tak se občas opotite až na vám pot z koulí půjde rovnou přes hráz do analniho otvoru, najde si cestu vašim vnitřkem a objeví se na čele. Ale dá se to přežít. Hra těžké není jen se stačí naučit pohyby enemaku a jejich slabiny. 
Občas backtracking a hledání píčovin a občas nesmyslnej puzzle, ale já s ničím dlouho neseru a pokud už jsem měl chuť rozmlátit hlavu o zeď, tak jsem si našel návod. Nehraju to přece kurva kvůli puzzle, ale kvůli příběhu. Většina enemaku se dá jen oběhnout a už vás srat nebudou. Příběhově docela fajn, ale zdá se jak, kdyby ještě aspoň půlka chyběla, abych dostal ten pravdu feel Silent Hillu. Jo a jeste to využiju, proto abych poslal Konami do útrob jejich vlastní prdele :)

column8: Příběhově povedená hra s motivem Silent Hill, postupně zajímavější příběh s několika možnými konci. Hra nabízí hezké strašidelné prostředí, skvělé ozvučení a soundtrack. Líbil se mi design save pointů, kdy je musíte hledat všude okolo, protože kolikrát nejsou úplně na očích. Také si hráč kvůli tomu musí plánovat další postup. Naopak se mi ale vůbec nelíbily automatické save pointy před boss fighty, protože když umřete (a to se stává často), musíte si znovu prohlédnout několikaminutové nepřeskočitelné cutscény. Hlavní problém této hry je, že je to hodně špatně provedený port z konzole. Nízké FPS učiní hru v některých částech sotva hratelnou, bojový systém je s klávesnicí a myší pomalý a velmi nepřesný. Hra má jinak mnoho bugů a já osobně jsem jich i hodně zažil, často zaplatíte smrtí v souboji, který jinak není možné skoro prohrát. Nebo hra jednoduše crashne a vy ztratíte veškerý postup od posledního uložení. Ačkoliv se mi příběh nakonec velmi líbil a boss fighty a hádanky kolikrát představovaly solidní výzvu, celkový dojem ze hry jako takové je zkažen právě technickou stránkou počítačové verze.
La historia es bien buena y los diseños de los jefes!

its a shame to say the xbox version is better than this in its base form, but it is. You can make it playable with "UnkownProjects Patch" So you can bump up the 30fps cap to 60 (With some screentear for me anyways), apparently there is a 120+ fps patch for this game as well but i couldent find it when i was searching. Is this game worth $40? Absolutely not especially to someone new to silent hill, its worth 15 under MAX. Audio dosent work right unless you use 5.1 surround and even then audio dosent come out of the correct ear cup at times but it is far better than using standard stereo. Regardless of the bullshit i still love this game mainly because i played through it years ago on xbox and fell in love with the atmosphere and alone feeling you get roaming the streets of the town and im currently getting that again through my current playthrough. Just wait for a sale and look up "Unknownprojects Patch" to save you from the shit port.

column8: Se crashea cada 5 minutos...

Wow this game has not aged well.

Which is very unfortunate, as I was looking forward to playing the only Silent Hill game on Steam. I first played Homecoming many years ago on the PS3, and at the time, I had a decent amount of fun. I'll admit it was no where near close to the standards set by the original Silent Hill trilogy, but this game was good. I never got around to finishing it though, and now that I've revisited the game, I doubt I ever will. You see, the PC port has many many problems. The controls are awful, the graphics haven't held up at all, and there is a major sound issue. All of this aside, I would recommend you get this game on console. At least there you can enjoy it for what it's worth, and while not even coming close to the original games, it is worth at least one play-through.



Sound fix: set your PC's sound to be in 5.1 surround. Otherwise, the game's sound will be in one ear and it makes the games virtually unbearable.

column8: Silent Hill: Homecoming é um dos melhores jogos dá franquia seu enredo é muito bom e preservou muito bem a atmosfera e as características dos Silents mais antigos, o enredo é bastante misterioso e profundo, a ambientação inspirada do filme é muito boa e a transição de mundo é muito bem feita, mas embora o jogo seja ótimo o porte dele para o PC é muito mal feito, e se vc quer jogar terá que ter paciência, para jogar com apenas 30 fps nativos e alguns congelamentos que acontecem qnd vai ter uma cutscene, se vc tiver paciência com isso terá uma ótima gameplay e se divertir bastante com o jogo, e se prepare para um grande plot twist.

Jestem świeżo po ponownym przejściu i... dalej uważam, że jest to jedna z lepszych odsłon serii SH. Historia jest mocno skomplikowana i podawana w małych kawałkach (co również jest wadą logiczną, ale o tym później), ale dzięki temu brniesz dalej. Ortodoksyjni fani będą narzekać na mało treści pozostawionych do własnej interpretacji, przeciętny gracz będzie z tego raczej zadowolony. Gameplay w stosunku do części 1-4 został mocno odświeżony i przystosowany do dzisiejszych realiów (nawet po 13 latach od premiery nie zauważyłem większych archaizmów), przez co nawet pod tym względem nikt nie powinien się odbić. Ale gra jest przecież hejtowana. Dlaczego?

Przede wszystkim port PC. Z poziomu aplikacji nie masz żadnych opcji graficznych, klatki są na sztywno ustawione na limit 30 (nie zmieniaj tej wartości w plikach jeśli chcesz przeżyć QTE z bossami). Same klatki sporadycznie potrafią spaść do poniżej 20 (Ryzen 5 3600, 16 GB RAM, Radeon 5600XT. WTF?!). Pal to licho, da się zacisnąć zęby i przeżyć. To nie Crysis, ta gra dziś nie będzie wyglądać. Gra się crashuje. Rób często save, nigdy nie wiesz, kiedy kolejny raz zobaczysz pulpit. Jest wiele sztuczek "zmniejszających częstotliwość występowania crashy", ale nie pozbywają się ich w 100%. A, co jakiś czas gra robi "checkpointy" na wypadek śmierci i na moment gra się freezuje.
Ok, za co jeszcze by grę zbesztać? Za balans trudności? Ok. Psychiatryk jest banalny. Cmentarz też. Hotel - &^$@&*%$, czemu te potwory dostały takiego boosta? Komisariat? Jeszcze trudniej! Kanały? Nuda. Więzienie - nuda. Finałowy boss? Może zawiążecie mi oczy, żeby miał jakieś szanse?
Druga sprawa to przeciwnicy - potrafią zapędzić Cię w róg i wyprowadzać takie combo, że będziesz pić toniki jak alkoholik denaturat. Albo nie dadzą rady wyprowadzić żadnego celnego ciosu.
System walki? Później będziesz jej unikać, ale na początku będzie trudno. Na szczęście 95% starć to 1 vs 1 (jak jest więcej to nadmiarowi wrogowie >zwykle< czekają na swoją kolej) i da się wyjść z sensownym zdrowiem, ale walka z bossami irytuje. Sepulcher i Asphyxia wymagają celowania w konkretne części ciała i 
automatyczne namierzanie "głównego punktu" mocno to utrudnia.

A co z fabułą? Miejscami nie ma sensu. Pyramid-head i Travis Grady są tu wrzuceni na siłę, a sam fakt, że nikt nie mówi Alexowi, co się stało i to wszystko nie ma sensu uniknęłoby wielu ofiar (chyba że za kanoniczne uznamy zakończenie Hospital albo Drowning). Poza tym historia jest bardzo dobra, osobiście stawiam ją wyżej niż Origins czy Downpoor.

Podsumowując: jeśli masz stary komputer, który nie będzie crashować gry albo duże pokłady cierpliwości gra sprawi całkiem sporo frajdy. Do poziomu SH 1-4 co prawda jej brakuje, jednak w moim przekonaniu nie dużo. Ze wszystkich gier nie stworzonych przez Team Silent dla mnie jest to najlepsza pozycja.

Just finished the game twice (look at my play hours), and here is my review. I have seen players complaining about this game, so here I´m will be honest with you:

1. Yes, this game has one of the worst PC ports, please fire the guy who made this thanks.
2. Yes, welcome to Glitch Hill.
3. The combat mechanic is tricky, but you will get used to it, I promise. Also, it´s not bad, each enemy has a different way for being defeated. Patience is the key.
4. The story is not bad, is actually quite interesting. You will need to look at the wiki to understand things better though.
5. There are many health drinks and ammo in this game, for real. If you don´t feel like you have enough, then it´s not the game fault but yours.
6. Better buy the PS version
7. LOVE YOURSELF, BUY IT ON SALE

I will allow comments if someone has any questions.  (Yes, I recommend you to play this game even with all the glitches, but remember, wait for sale)

column8: Pas le meilleur des silent hill mais pas mal

Probably one of the worst PC ports of all time.

Sound is broken, graphics are borderline mid-90s low-res and blurry even on max details. The control scheme is god-awful, can't really find any other words to describe it; combat should work on a dodge-counterattack basis but it's almost impossible to defeat the enemies when the input lag is off the chart.

I also experienced many glitches and bugs in just a handful of hours of playthrough, like enemies hitting you through the wall and random hard-crashes, especially during combat.
Be aware that, being an old-school survival game, you aren't allowed to save your progress at your convenience, but only in certain spots, so the risk of losing potentially hours of gameplay due to the crashes and bugs of this horrible port is even scarier than the monsters themselves.

The only way to enjoy the rather intriguing storyline without losing your sanity is either watching a longplay made by someone else or speedrunning and cheesing your way through the boss fights.

El juego de Homecoming no es malo , para nada que es malo, pero siento que es mucho mejor el invertir buscando otros juegos de la franquicía y como ya aclare no es porque el juego sea malo , si no porque hay algúnos aspectos que hay que pulir como la historia , ya que siento como si apenas y hubiera sentido lo que hubiera sido una gran historia para Silent Hill, la atmosfera como siempre es aterradora y la sensación de falta de recursos para pelear siempre están presentes lo cual vuelve al juego tan divertido y entretenido pero como ya dije antes , sus puntos negativos a veces parecieran superar a sus puntos positivos , también debo de dejar en claro que encontre muchos errores en la inteligencia de los enemigos, ya que comprobe muchas veces como hay ciertos enemigos que al entrar en una habitación diferente a donde se supone que fueron diseñados para estar, solo se quedan parados en el marco esperando, expuestos para atacar, lo cual aproveche para poder avanzar en partes que me resultaban muy difíciles aunque siento que hubiera sido mucho más retador todo sin estos errores.

I didn't believe anyone on how glitchy this game truely is... I only bought it because I was looking to fill a silent hill itch and this was the only game I could get a copy of... If you buy this game expect fighting crashes and menu glitches that force you to figure work arounds to complete a task, namely the item menu glitch... at some point during your run through the ability to go straight into the item menu will break and puzzles that require you to select an item will have to go through the weapons menu... which can't be done will on the interaction screen... It's hard to believe that they allowed a game with as many glitches and crashes I experienced made it to market...

column9: Great for fans of horror. A few gameplay niggles but would recommend.

column8:
It's sad when a great franchise is shifted to hang on a poor movie's "hype" to try and bump up the advertisements. This is obviously an attempt to cash-in on the movie as well as the second installment via fan service and call-backs. There's not a whole lot about this game that is original to itself, and some of WHAT IS isn't very good. 

It's been stated by anyone who talks about this game that mechanically, the gameplay is sound and intuitive, and throws out the tank controls for a better experience, but takes away from the horror when you're far more likely to survive because your character is a quote/unquote -badass-. 

I'll agree that it isn't the worst, and manages to at least stay somewhat true to its roots when being transported to the nightmare realm, unlike Downpour with it's -black hole- of death chases that got very tiresome, very quickly.

Speaking of Downpour, here's the thing. I liked Downpour more than this game overall. The character was stronger, and the story was more interesting to me. In fact, THIS game is one of the weakest as far as stories go in the games. It just felt bland and mostly forgettable. Alex's bemoaning of his lost brother, the generic female love-interest that I couldn't care less about, token black-guy, and the terribly over-the-top murder cult that basically showed the studio wanted to work on a SAW game than a Silent Hill game (The SAW games were garbage, too, so no surprised there). 

I guess if you're a Silent Hill fan, you'll pick this up regardless. 

Well, BUY THE CONSOLE VERSION. Whoever ported this over to PC didn't know what they were doing, or were rushed to get it "kinda" working on PC. It runs like crap and frequently crashes. I don't know if there's any patches to make it work BETTER on PC, so buy at your own risk.

column8: Jako gra fabularna nawet ok ale jako horror to niezbyt polecam. Jeżeli szukasz horroru to najprawdopodobniej chcesz się bać, a w tej grze mało strachu uświadczysz. Jeżeli sprowadzają cię tu poprzednie (jedne z najstraszniejszych gier) części Silent Hill to pod względem strachu będziesz zawiedziony. Ale jako zwykłą grę polecam.

As much as it pains me to downvote a Silent Hill game, I just cannot recommend it. I've tried to like it, I've tried to be forgiving, but this game is so very broken in so many ways. 

For starters, the sound quality is the most bizarre thing. There are times when you feel as if you are underwater, all the sounds muted and distorted. Other times sound effects say ''hi there, screw you'' and just don't appear at all. For example, you can force the door open in perfect silence. Or you can listen to a recording that just cuts off the sound, but you know it should be still ongoing, as the subtitles are still there for a couple of sentences. Oh, and subtitles don't always match the pace of the voice acting. Obviously, lip-syncing is a big 'no no' most of the times, too. And do you know that some characters speak with their mouths closed, while others have a strange habit of speaking with a lot of awkward teeth action? What the heck is going on there?

Next, regarding level design... Why are there so many places that have absolutely no purpose? These places are like a random alley that ends with a wall, nothing to see there. Or a ladder you can climb for absolutely nothing. Or a corridor to another wall. Or a drop where there is (you've guessed it!) - nothing. It's just straight bad level design, I say. I could understand if the gamedevloppers wanted the player to feel disoriented or lost, but that's not the case here, or doesn't seem to be - the game is awfully linear. Usually, I don't have a problem with linear games, but in SH:H it was just another thing that had my feathers ruffled.
And are you seriously blocking a door with a mattress? A MATTRESS? Are you SERIOUS? Does the protagonist have arms so frickin' frail that he can't lift it off the floor? Or blocking a way with a swing chair - really, game? It's unmovable, I catch your drift. Not.

Also, I've been really irked by how many things have been 'borrowed' from the previous games and - if I'm correct - also from the movies. I can understand a tribute here and there, but it doesn't feel like a tribute - it feels like having no ideas for creating a unique gaming experience. Although, I will admit that there WERE a few things that seemed... well, maybe not fresh, but well-made and sort of memorable. But certainly not enough to overcome the general blandness.

And... the controls. They feel so stiff and awkward. Also, perhaps it's just me and I just couldn't get the mechanics down, or perhaps I've screwed myself because I've dived into Hard mode right away, I just couldn't get dodging to be perfect. No matter how many times I've tried to figure out why it keeps happehing, no matter how hard I've tried for perfect timing, sometimes Alex will lose health despite performing a dodge, or just get blown away during a dodging action. Other times he will dodge right into enemies or an incoming attack. I've done my best to make him dodge in other directions by pressing A/D or tilting the camera, by changing his position in regards to his foes, anything, but NO, he will dodge however he wants to, consequences be screwed. The only 100% successful option seems to be dodging backwards, but then he will be too far away from his enemies and he will need to take his sweet little time to walk back up to them, so VERY slowly. Sure, just take your time, Alex. No problem at all. It's not like other surrounding enemies are trying to claw your insides out or just screw you over. Go for a stroll, why won't you.

Also, this is the very first game I've seen where guns and more than half of other weapons are almost useless. The very first weapon of the game - the knife - is the holly grail of SH:H. It's hands down the best combat option for most of the time. And that's just... disheartening.  

You know what else is disheartening? The constant CRASHING. 
I have never had anything else crash as often as SH:H. Sometimes it will crash while trying to start it, sometimes going back to the desktop, but more often than not making the whole computer freeze and forcing me restart it, over and over again. Other times the crash will happen during loading time, while switching in-game locations - and how lovely is that when savepoints can be quite rare at certain places! Imagine my joy crashing and losing all the progress, then trying to start the game again and having it freeze while launching, so that you need to restart the computer, sometimes once, sometimes multiple times.
I'm not counting all the in-game little freezes.
So just... no. This game frustrated me so very much. I wanted to like it. I mean... it's a Silent Hill game. One of my favourites. There were some upsides, too - like some of the music (for example Scarlet's theme), neat monster design, truly quite a few things that were done right - but I'm so overcome with all the downsides, that it can't be anything else but a downvote from me. Sorry, Silent Hill Homecoming.

column8: Très bon jeu d’horreur angoissant et vraiment flippant à certain moment on est vite sous tension et la paranoïa prend rapidement le dessus. Je recommande !!
O jogo tem alguns problemas de travamento (mesmo com a configuração adequada), mas faz parte da franquia Silent Hill, para os fãs de "survival horror" com certeza vale a pena.
Um dos melhores games de terror com certeza :D

Realmente un juegazo, la historia no decepciona, a nivel de cualquier otro Silent Hill. Tal vez deja inconclusas alguna que otra cosa.

Por otro lado, en cuanto a jugabilidad, es donde decae. El juego está bloqueado en 30 fps, hay muchísimos problemas de rendimiento, muchos crasheos, caídas de frames, problemas de guardado, etc. Hay que tener mucha paciencia para jugarlo. Sin embargo, los controles me parecen muy buenos. Cabe recalcar que es el único port que tenemos de Silent Hill en Steam, así que si realmente queremos jugar a un SH de forma legit es nuestra única opción.

Todos sabemos que este es la sexta entrega de Silent hill, aunque no fueron los mismos desarrolladores ( Team Silent ) es un gran juego para la saga de Silent hill, tiene la misma trama como los anteriores, un poco de los puzzles y entre mas cosas que pueden encontrase de los anteriores juegos. Muy RECOMENDADO si quieren pasar un buen rato

In a nutshell, GREAT game, BAD Silent Hill game, HORRIBLE port albeit playable. I recommend, but only for casual horror fans. For hardcore Silent Hill fans? There's just a lot that doesn't live up to the originals, but it's still worth a playthrough in my opinion. Only buy if on sale or if given as a gift.

column8: Esse jogo não vale nem um centavo, simplesmente o jogo crash o tempo inteiro por qualquer motivo, só para ter uma ideia da situação tem crash durante o combate, diálogos com NPCs, cutscene, loading, na hora de salvar o jogo, enquanto você anda normalmente pelos cenários e nem pense em dar Alt-Tab pq o jogo fecha instantaneamente, um port podre que a Konami fez desse jogo para PC, sem contar que o combate desse jogo é um lixo de mal feito, só um exemplo do tão lixo que é o combate quando você tá usando arma de fogo você não pode simplesmente mirar, você tem que dar obrigatoriamente um ataque físico para ai sim depois mirar o que leva uma eternidade por causa da animação extremamente lenta do personagem e ainda levanto em consideração que os inimigos são muito rápidos e correm pra cima de você que nem uns malucos várias vezes você vai tomar dano (e as vezes até morrer) e não vai conseguir dar um tiro por causa desse sistema de combate nojento de mal feito, além de não ter coisas básicas na steam como salvamento em nuvem e conquistas que aliás existem na versão do xbox 360 mas a Konami nem se deu ao trabalho de colocar na steam, sem contar que em questão de historia é um dos Silent Hills mais horríveis e menos assustadores que eu já tive o desprazer de jogar, não recomendo jogar nem a versão pirata desse jogo, muito menos comprar isso aqui com o preço cheio ou em promoção, passem longe dessa bosta colossal.

column8:
I'm that one person, who read about the story of the SH games, but only had the chance to play SH2 so far (and I liked it), so that's what I can compare this to at the moment. It would be possible to review the game by itself, but I'm still going to compare it to SH2, simply because it copy-pasted a lot of stuff from it. 
SH:H was a mixed product for me, it's not necessarily horrible, but it's not amazing, either. 
The good: The graphics are mostly okay, except some character models. Some things look very nice, some things look like utter trash. Some monster designs are pretty cool and freaky. The atmosphere is nice, I really liked it. Some parts of the plot are nice, sad and dramatic. The voice acting is ok, it's nothing special. The puzzles are fine, but you cannot choose their levels like in the other one. 
The meh: Combat system. I didn’t hate the combat, but this game is mostly action based, not really psychology based. It is possible to run past some enemies, but not all of them. There is barely any ammo for the guns. In SH2, I had literally 200+ ammo at the point I reached the last PH boss fight, but here I usually had around 15 ammo at most, if I even had any. I didn’t like the melee fight, because the stun time is way too long and gets you killed easily. There was a point, when I used the game’s stupid flaws to fight. One type of enemy couldn’t get through doors, so I stood at the door and killed it with the axe, because I could hit it from there, but it couldn’t hit me. Then I found a way to always win in melee fights: there is no need to use tactics, just mash the dodge button and the quick attack button at the same time like crazy. Nothing could kill me like that. It made the game way too easy, not even the bosses could kill me. 
Other meh thing for me is the rare save points. I hate that anyway, because you may even miss them, if you don’t check everything. I like exploring and checking everything, but even so, I think there are not enough save points during some levels. But the main problem about this comes later in the review. 
The endings and the sountrack are also in the meh category. There were so many songs from SH2 that I loved, the background music was so emotional and nice, here, I don't even remember any of them, except one main song. The endings are nothing special, they didn't make me feel anything and I don't like the way you can achieve them. I liked SH2's way of achieving endings more, here, it's more like choose between good or bad actions, like kill this guy or don't kill this guy. 
The bad: Even though I liked some parts of the plot, I noticed that it stole stuff from SH2 and the main plot twist was very predictable. The characters are horrible, boring and flat. I didn't care about any side characters. They were just kinda there to be there, while I pretty much liked everyone in SH2 (Well, I probably would have accidentally shot Laura after the hospital, if her scenes weren’t cutscenes, but I liked everyone else.) The main guy, Alex, isn't that bad, at least he made me feel something, but I think he could have been a much better character with more dialogues or inner thoughts or something. 
Then, there are the monsters. The bosses have meanings behind them and that's pretty cool, some of the smaller monsters have, too, then there is one that is a complete copy of the Lying Figure from SH2 with a different skin. There are also human enemies...? Then, the main problem, Pyramid Head and the nurses appear for whatever reason. Mostly because it's fanservice and they are iconic and all, but they don't belong here, at all. I guess PH was supposed to be scary, but I laughed so much, when he literally appeared only to look at Alex and then left, like „Meh, this dude ain’t worth my time. Where is my man, James?”
Also, this game doesn't take place in SH, it's some other completely different town that kind of has the same power...? Anyway, only the last 25% of the game takes place in SH. I'm not sure about the other parts of the franchise, but I found it weird.
I also didn't like how the monsters were introduced in the game. Almost all of them have long cutscenes the first time they show up and I think that makes them less scary. If I remember correctly, in SH2, only the first monster had cutscene, other than that, all the others just suddenly appeared somewhere with no introduction and you had to react to them immediately, there was no time to observe them well during a cutscene. I think that's scarier. 
The worst: Crashes. So, about those rare save points I mentioned… Manual save or a lot of save points are needed in a game that has random crashes. At first, I didn’t understand what everybody was talking about in the reviews, because I didn’t have any crashes during the first two hours, then this happened: I fought a boss, then came the loading screen. The game crashed, I had to fight the boss again. Next scene came, I fought my way through it, then, at the next loading screen, the game froze and then crashed. I loaded it again, the gun or the enemies were bugged, because I couldn’t shoot them at all. I loaded the game three times, it was always the same result, then, after restarting the game a few times, it finally worked again. I loaded the game, started fighting my way through that part for the 6th time aaaaand the game crashed. I decided to quit. Fanmade fixing exists and normally I would think it's worth a negative review to be forced to install fanmade patches to fix a game... But I didn't end up installing the patch and this was the only time the game was such a crashing mess for me, other than that, it only crashed once later. So, in the end, it was not as horrible as I first thought it was going to be after that one point, I didn't lose any more progress and the game worked well. But I can imagine this being the worst problem for people who had many more crashes.
In the end, I think the game is an „okay” category. It's a mixed bag, it has stupid mistakes and flaws, it would have needed more original stuff and better characters instead of copy-pasting way too many things. It's certainly not that great, but I don't think it's utter trash. I understand that everyone is upset about PH chilling there for no reason and the crashes, but I think it gets more hate than it deserves. I was still interested in the plot and in finishing the game and it took around 10 hours. It's not worth the full price, (because crashes, that's why) but on sale, it's ok.
