I like exploring and checking everything, but even so, I think there are not enough save points during some levels. But the main problem about this comes later in the review. 
The endings and the sountrack are also in the meh category. There were so many songs from SH2 that I loved, the background music was so emotional and nice, here, I don't even remember any of them, except one main song. The endings are nothing special, they didn't make me feel anything and I don't like the way you can achieve them. I liked SH2's way of achieving endings more, here, it's more like choose between good or bad actions, like kill this guy or don't kill this guy. 
The bad: Even though I liked some parts of the plot, I noticed that it stole stuff from SH2 and the main plot twist was very predictable. The characters are horrible, boring and flat. I didn't care about any side characters. They were just kinda there to be there, while I pretty much liked everyone in SH2 (Well, I probably would have accidentally shot Laura after the hospital, if her scenes weren’t cutscenes, but I liked everyone else.) The main guy, Alex, isn't that bad, at least he made me feel something, but I think he could have been a much better character with more dialogues or inner thoughts or something. 
Then, there are the monsters. The bosses have meanings behind them and that's pretty cool, some of the smaller monsters have, too, then there is one that is a complete copy of the Lying Figure from SH2 with a different skin. There are also human enemies...? Then, the main problem, Pyramid Head and the nurses appear for whatever reason. Mostly because it's fanservice and they are iconic and all, but they don't belong here, at all. I guess PH was supposed to be scary, but I laughed so much, when he literally appeared only to look at Alex and then left, like „Meh, this dude ain’t worth my time. Where is my man, James?”
Also, this game doesn't take place in SH, it's some other completely different town that kind of has the same power...? Anyway, only the last 25% of the game takes place in SH. I'm not sure about the other parts of the franchise, but I found it weird.
I also didn't like how the monsters were introduced in the game. Almost all of them have long cutscenes the first time they show up and I think that makes them less scary. If I remember correctly, in SH2, only the first monster had cutscene, other than that, all the others just suddenly appeared somewhere with no introduction and you had to react to them immediately, there was no time to observe them well during a cutscene. I think that's scarier. 
The worst: Crashes. So, about those rare save points I mentioned… Manual save or a lot of save points are needed in a game that has random crashes. At first, I didn’t understand what everybody was talking about in the reviews, because I didn’t have any crashes during the first two hours, then this happened: I fought a boss, then came the loading screen. The game crashed, I had to fight the boss again. Next scene came, I fought my way through it, then, at the next loading screen, the game froze and then crashed. I loaded it again, the gun or the enemies were bugged, because I couldn’t shoot them at all. I loaded the game three times, it was always the same result, then, after restarting the game a few times, it finally worked again. I loaded the game, started fighting my way through that part for the 6th time aaaaand the game crashed. I decided to quit. Fanmade fixing exists and normally I would think it's worth a negative review to be forced to install fanmade patches to fix a game... But I didn't end up installing the patch and this was the only time the game was such a crashing mess for me, other than that, it only crashed once later. So, in the end, it was not as horrible as I first thought it was going to be after that one point, I didn't lose any more progress and the game worked well. But I can imagine this being the worst problem for people who had many more crashes.
In the end, I think the game is an „okay” category. It's a mixed bag, it has stupid mistakes and flaws, it would have needed more original stuff and better characters instead of copy-pasting way too many things. It's certainly not that great, but I don't think it's utter trash. I understand that everyone is upset about PH chilling there for no reason and the crashes, but I think it gets more hate than it deserves. I was still interested in the plot and in finishing the game and it took around 10 hours. It's not worth the full price, (because crashes, that's why) but on sale, it's ok.

column8:
Pire Port PC que j'ai pu voir en action.
Multiples crash et fuites mémoire... les résolutions supérieurs à 720 défonces les perspectives et les ombrages.
Faire un alt+tab est le pire ennemie de ce jeu et le stress est produit par la peur d'avoir une fenêtre de crash a n'importe quel moment.
Aucun patch officiel fournit mais pourtant le jeu est laissé tel quel en vente sans une once de respect en mode "débrouillez-vous".

Pour ce qui est du jeu : Ce n'est pas le meilleur Silent Hill, néanmoins, l'ambiance est toujours là. Beaucoup de choses illogique notamment les ennemies du jeu comme les infirmière et le retour d'un némésis qui ne fait pas sens dans la psyché de ce personnage, les fans de SH peuvent être déçu, alors si vous êtes fans il faut éviter ce jeu, 100% vous allez être déçu.
Les combats c'est du 4/10 et les contrôles du 2.5/10.
Le Silent Hill le plus flippant sans le vouloir... 10/10

column8: estou voltando jogo do cão,agora parece que tem correção de bugs graças ao mods,konami de merd
La brutta copia di SH2.

Tiene los mounstros mas aterradores de todos los silent hills, la historia es algo confusa pero mientras mas juegas mas comprendes lo que esta pasando y la jugabilidad es muy buena, tiene mucha accion en comparacion con los otrso SH y los graficos no son buenos pero si se ve aterrador.

El que conoce algún juego de la saga de Silent Hill sabrá de antemano algunas cosas que se tocarán en la reseña.
En ésta ocasión nos tocará ser Alex Shepherd, un pibe re fachero que la tiene re clara gracias a nosotros y como es militar sabe varios tipos de combate cuerpo a cuerpo incluyendo la manipulación de todo tipo de armas de fuego tales como pistolas, escopetas, rifles, un capo el shepe.
Cuestión, Alex es herido en batalla y se lo translada a un hospital medio pelo en donde más temprano que tarde nos damos cuenta que hay algo raro en ese lugar. Lo llevan a su habitación pero Alex cagado de miedo se escapa y empieza a tener delirios cósmicos con su hermano menor, Joshua. Pim pum pam, nos encontramos un cuchillo y empezamos a fakear enfermeras a lo loco (O esconderse en la oscuridad que es más divertido y le da un toque más de suspenso) hasta volver a encontrar a Joshua que se vive encerrando en habitaciones y solamente abrirá la puerta si le damos su muñeco de peluche. Le damos el muñequito pero el pibe dice "No pará bro, éste no es mi muñeco, nos re vimo' logi" y se nos vuelve a escapar. Mágicamente se abre la puerta, tomamos un ascensor anda a saber a donde y de la nada sale una tremenda espada que nos perfora el torso. Y se despierta nuestro protagonista en el camión de Travis (Protagonista de Silent Hill Origins), éste nos llevará a la ciudad en donde comenzará nuestra "aventura".
Una vez habiéndonos despedido de Travis y éste mirándonos con una mirada que nos dice "Uh papá, te van a romper el esfinter acá, yo ya pasé por esto" comenzamos a vagar por el pueblo "Shepherd´s Glen," en donde podemos notar que una densa neblina nos priva de nuestra visión siendo éste sentido afectado y disminuido, la ciudad, sin sospecharlo demasiado entendemos que quedó desierta por algo que nos va a hacer re cagar en el futuro y cuando no podía pasar nada más raro nos topamos con la jueza Margaret Holloway, una rubia media come pebetes que nos dice que somos re facheros y que las cosas en la ciudad han cambiado para peor, nos recomienda ir de visitas a casa y tomar unos mates con nuestra madre. Nos vamos para casa y al ingresar podemos notar varias anomalías que nos hacen sospechar de que algo no está bien, después de estar media hora dando vueltas por la casa nos encontramos a la madre de Alex y ella nos explica mejor la situación. Ocurrieron cosas cuando Alex estaba en el servicio militar y Joshua desapareció, ante ésta situación el padre de Alex (Que también es medio militar y por lo visto era un sorete con Alex) salió a buscarlo pero tampoco volvió. Al obtener información de lo ocurrido nuestro protagonista lo relaciona con el sueño del hospital y ahí se da cuenta que su hermano está en peligro con lo cual decide salir a buscarlo. 
Durante el recorrido por las ciudades (Shepherd´s Glen y Silent Hill) encontraremos muchos personajes que serían sobrevivientes de lo que ocurre ahí y éstos nos darán una oportuna ayuda en distintos momentos del juego que ayudarían a complementar algunos baches de la historia o dar información complementaria que está re piola. Además de personajes encontraremos un sin fin de momentos de terror y suspenso, muchos monstruos, muchos puzzles típicos de las sagas de Silent Hill, típico soundtrack épico de las sagas, que si bien a mí me gustan menos que a comparación de los silent hill 1,2,3,4, siguen estándo muy buenos pero lo que hace genial a este juego y todos los silent hills (subjetivo) es la historia acompañado de los momentos que nos hacen vivir, ese hueco en la historia que se va completando lentamente por deducción o por cierta información complementaria que se puede lograr interpretar a medida que avanzamos en el juego y resolvemos los problemas que se nos atraviesan. Si bien en el final se nos aclara todo en todo el gameplay vivimos con la duda y nuestra única herramienta para entender la trama es nuestro poder de deducción y a partir de ahí se hace un poco subjetivo el juego (Sin contar las millones de simbologías que éste posee).
En mi opinión Silent Hill Homecoming no es el mejor Silent Hill que se creó pero porque las entregas anteriores son obras de arte, éste juego también es una obra de arte con tremenda historia y soundtrack por lo que se me hace media odiosa la comparación, los giros argumentales que posee, cómo todo lo que venimos deduciendo se nos cae a pedazos y la forma en que asimilamos la nueva información hace que se nos venga el mundo abajo ahre.
Para aquella persona que jamás jugó Silent Hill se lo recomiendo, es un juego de terror con una gran historia, una gran experiencia si se sabe interpretar y entender la situación en donde nos plantea el juego. La soledad y convivir con el temor del personaje hasta haber terminado su misión en el pueblo maldito.
Comprar esta parte de la saga depende de cada uno, yo lo compré en descuento ya que me sale 1.500 pesos argentinos y yo no cago guita pero se puede descargar de cualquier lugar sin tener que gastar una moneda.

Adquirí el juego hace tiempo, porque soy fanático de los Silent Hill que hizo el "Team Silent", y me hacía ilusión tener un SH en mi biblioteca y la verdad que este Homecoming de "Double Helix Games" me ha parecido un juego decente, pero me dio varios problemas... El más importante es que se crashea a veces, y para jugarlo a 60 FPS tuve que instalar un parche... 

El juego tiene una trama que a mi me enganchó, la ambientación está OK, pero su sistema de combate me pareció horrible, además estuvo mal que incluyeran enemigos del SH 2, pese a todo ello, me pareció un juego digno y no me pareció malo como algunos dicen. Lo que sucede es que si se compara a sus predecesores japoneses, no tiene nada que hacer, sobretodo si se le compara a Silent Hill 1 o el Silent Hill 2, que tienen una historia y ambientación que son sublime, y que además son verdaderas obras maestras y de culto.

Recomiendo el juego con las justas.

PD: Los de KONAMI fueron unos idiotas al disolver al Team Silent.
Um bom jogo, mas um péssimo port. Os gráficos apagados e os infinitos bugs deixaram o jogo quase injogável. Ainda bem que os modders existem.

Muy buen juego, la trama es excelente.
RECOMENDADISIMO.

column8:
I thought you guys were exaggerating, how can it crash THIS much?!

My review is... Though criticised as the worst entry in the entire series, not only do I fail to see that, but I also fail to see it as a bad game full stop. Honestly, it's like everyone is biased against this entry just for being from an American team, could you really not have enjoyed it for what it is? Even if it was still the original team, would you really want every single entry to be exactly the same? 

Every single moment was entertaining to me! In fact, if I didn't wuss out, I would've had even more fun with the higher difficulty option! Yes, some monsters are unfair, such as the Schism having an instant-kill move, Needlers being undodgable (Seriously, I kept doing exactly what the game showed me worked and it didn't the moment I was halfway through the Hotel and it never worked for the rest of the game, is this a glitch? Needlers are the reason why I wussed out by the way), Ferals also being undodgable(?), Nurses having a stun-lock which essentially acts as an instant-kill move (though that's only if you try to kill them the wrong way, so it's fair), Smokers being outright annoying, etc. People complain that dodging as an option is fundamentally flawed in a Silent Hill... Unpopular opinion on my behalf, apparently, but no, it really isn't. In fact, this is where I take massive issue with the previous entries, a lot of monsters will continually drain resources if not dealt with so the least the game can do is test my skill so that it isn't being taken out on my Health and Ammo every single time if I simply prove as good at playing the game. Puzzles were very satisfying, except the birthstone puzzle requiring knowledge of gems, that the game doesn't provide, not even as a riddle, meaning looking it up or spending way too much time guessing. And both the 'match the 5 plates' and 'spinny circles' part 1, 2 and 3 puzzle having answers that, even after looking it up, don't make sense? Seriously, how is something that 'a man buys but doesn't use' NOT poison, yet somehow IS a coffin?!

Want to know what I would change about the game?

1) Fix the Laziness - Despite already making the code for achievements in literally every other version of this game, they were absent from the version I played on PC. Especially strange due to the rightful reputation for PC versions of games in general to be definitive. PC players also had to fix frame rate locks, graphical bugs, crashing and game-breaking glitches themselves, rather than a simple update being made. So, I would've made it so that these fixes came with the game and wouldn't strip features for no reason! This is the reason alone that my review isn't positive. If they wanted a positive review, they would've at least tired.

2) Add riddles for the birthstone puzzle so that it's actually possible to solve without outside knowledge! The riddle for the Sapphire could've been, as an example. "The stone that makes a transcendence from hot summers to frigid winters (referencing September). The brilliant colour twinkles like a newborn eye (referencing the colour blue). Some say that the sky and ocean is God's blue blood, but in truth, it is the deprived (symbolising the tragedy)."

3) Dedicated block button - The amount of times that I wanted to block but there was no option, only occurring out of luck, wasn't good game design. It would be good game design if the unused right trigger button was given purpose as a block button! Now, in a future entry, blocking wasn't overpowered because of 2 reasons: weapons can break and you took damage anyway, just less than normal. In Homecoming, weapons don't break and I think taking damage anyway for successful blocks is bad game design. My solution around this is that some attacks can't be blocked, such as the heavy slams the Siam does. Others have counter attacks to blocking if you hold block for too long or the wrong moment entirely, perhaps the Schism could hook its axe-nose around your pipe and swipe you with its claws until you push it off with a few button mashes? Some enemies can be so fast that they can evade around you, such as Ferals. 

4) More endings - Ignoring that a lot of decisions don't affect the game as it unfolds or ends, the 3 choices that did should result in 9 total different endings, not just 5. Examples of endings that could exist and the conditions could be: 

'Soldier All Along', obtained by giving Alex's Mom mercy, his father no forgiveness and saving Wheeler. It will be like the good ending, until interrupted by an Order Enforcer (bad person), who almost drives a pipe through Elle, but is abruptly stopped by a gunshot to the head. This is revealed to be one of a handful of Alex's soldier friends because it wasn't a delusion, it was real! Alex rests a shoulder on his friend, relieved that he wasn't insane, at least the way he thought. The scene zooms out as he explains who his new pal and girlfriend are to his army mates before finally going black and credits rolling. He lost his blood brother, but he has brothers in the force!

'Josh Lives' - Obtained by forgiving the Dad, not giving mercy to the Mom (which will be out of weakness instead of resentment depending on how you build Alex's character prior to the decision. Needs to be out of weakness specifically.) and save Wheeler. Because of the forgiveness and pure-heart Alex shows despite who he once was, the evil force of the town gifts back Josh, as well as the many other sacrificed children. Elle, Alex and Wheeler establish Shepherd's Glen Foster Home! The scene ends with a group photo of all the kids and adults. 

'Josh Lives, at a Cost...' - Obtained by not forgiving, mercying mom out of wanting her to die by your hands personally rather than kindness and not saving Wheeler. Alex realises how much of a bad person he is and uses the sacrificial dagger to kill himself. He then falls beside Josh and apologises. Alex's blood touches Josh, and thanks to the town's magick seeing this as redemption (just to a lesser degree), Josh has his life given back. We see him wonder out of a Shepherds Glen that's been restored from the curse, picked up by the trucker guy from the beginning of the game. The trucker asks questions, but Josh doesn't remember anything about anyone or himself, he's a fresh slate who doesn't have to be tormented by his past! They drive off to an orange sky, night approaching.

'Party' - This ending is achieved not by the 3 major decisions, but by the character building decisions. If Alex's character is morally neutral, not kind or fussy, this ending will be triggered. It will feature him killing himself, but this time he goes to a purgatory that looks like a half-decorated party room, with characters from across the entire series being featured. James Sunderland, a fan favourite, will explain that everything's good and that they're setting up for the release of a friend of all of theirs. This is in reference to Murphy, the protagonist of Downpour, and this is to tie all the games together as a canonical ending, even if silly.

column8: An often looked down upon game in the Silent Hill Franchise, this game is good, even with being different then the previous games (mostly being more combat oriented). If you truly want a bad SH game, look to Silent Hill: Downpour. SH 5: Homecoming has a good story, creepy enemies and encourages combat often.

I would like to start by pointing out that there is no "perfect game" in existence. There are always areas of beloved games that could be improved upon in retrospect. That being said, if you invest a little time and patience into playing Silent Hill: Homecoming, you will have a worthy Silent Hill Experience.  The story, the atmosphere, the music, and the enemies all bring together that special blend of Silent Hill uneasy and isolating gameplay that fans have grown to adore.  With a little practice, the combat is quite fun as well.

This is a great little game, I had a blast playing and replaying this title. If you are a hater or a troll, of course you may find tons of imperfections in which to place your focus. If you are interested in a worthwhile experience despite imperfections, this game is for you.

column8:
Je vois pas ou les gens se plaignent de bug , perso j'y ai joué 3 heure dans une soirée et je compte bien finir le jeu 
ce Jeu est enorme 

l'ambiance est impra prenante la nuit ,  même si on peut pas dire que le jeux est hypra beau ,  les musique , les bruit environnementaux et le monde semi ouvert vas vous  emporté  dans l'univers du jeu

au tout début on se dit .. Mouais , on pourrai se faire un peut chier mais quand on commence a exploré ce monde on se plonge dans l histoire  tres intrigente de  notre personnage qui cherche juste des réponse  et acomprendre les choses

ce qui fais le charme de ce jeu c'est surtout la rareté des ennemie , on ne sais jamais quand ils arrivent et contrairement a des jeux ou as des enemi justement tout les 5 metre sa te met en alerte constante entre les bruitage et la musique   on se demande de par ou sa vas arriver  , on reste sur nos garde  et c'est la que la richesse du jeu prend son sens 

le systeme de combat est asses mauvais en sois mais c'est minime par rapport au sensation ressentis

 n'etant  qu'a 3 heure de jeux ,  je completerai cette evaluation  progressivement .

[code]As there is a [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1280019463]patch by unknownproject[/url] that fixes most of the crashes and graphical bugs in this port, I will not be discussing the game’s technical issues in this review.[/code]

Let me just say that I’m a huge Silent Hill fan. Silent Hill 2 was the game that first got me into the horror genre, and I have never been the same since. But I’m not here to discuss what makes one a “true” fan, I’m here to discuss why Silent Hill: Homecoming isn’t a good Silent Hill game. Perhaps it might be considered good horror by some, but for anyone who has played and loved the first 3-4 titles in the series, and perhaps found themselves obsessing over the depths and intricacies of the stories at one time or another, they’ll get none of that here. Homecoming is a shallow interpretation of what Japanese horror is, and it fails horribly at almost every single thing it attempts to accomplish.

The story itself starts off promising enough with our protagonist, Alex Shepherd, waking up to find himself in a hospital where patients are horribly tortured and mutilated, their remains tossed about like so much meaningless flesh. Upon waking from what is clearly a nightmare, we find Alex in the cabin of a trucker (Travis from Origins), who is giving him a lift back home to Shepherd’s Glen after having just been discharged from military service. There he discovers the town isn’t exactly how he left it, nor is his family. 

One would think uncovering the mystery behind what happened to Alex's little brother would be terrifying, but it’s not. Almost every horror trope in the book is summoned forth here, at least when the lore from the previous games isn't being bastardized.  Homecoming is what Japanese horror looks like if you shove it through the lens of a Western game developer; the symbolism is blatant, everything is over-explained, and there is a reliance on action over atmosphere, which is the biggest mistake a game in this series could possibly make.

Silent Hill is not about combat. It never has been. It’s about the dread of what you’ll be witnessing next. It’s about the unknown and what horrors it holds. It’s about seeing fucked up shit and trying to understand how, or why, that fucked up shit even exists. It’s not getting bombarded by monsters. It’s not fighting through gauntlets of fiends. It’s not fighting bosses over and over and over again because the combat system doesn’t allow you to attack something unless you’re locked onto it. It’s not having to dodge attacks with absolute precision in order to avoid them. It’s not having an artificial limit on how many bullets you can carry even though your melee weapons are 9 times out of 10 the better option.

Even the soundtrack feels bland and phoned in. Sure, the vocal themes are great, mostly because they’re held up by Mary Elizabeth McGlynn's fantastic performance, but there are few memorable tracks outside of the ending and opening themes and a couple of melodies we hear repeated throughout the game. The rest of it is all just…forgettable noise.

I could honestly continue on for several more paragraphs going into how much I hate that they ripped several things straight out of the first movie, how embarrassingly “wink wink, nudge nudge” all of the game’s Easter Eggs are, how much I abhor that Alex is basically another James Sunderland, but I just want to be done with this garbage and move on. No, I would NOT recommend Silent Hill: Homecoming to anyone who loved the earlier games in the series. But if you were to find yourself compelled to play this train wreck, even out of morbid curiosity, make sure you install that patch, adjust your sound settings, and go in with your expectations duly deflated. Maybe then, if you’re lucky, you’ll get some fleeting enjoyment out of it.

column8:
First of all, let me be clear about something: the technical issues are completely irrelevant due to the amazing patch made by Unknownproject and his collaborators. It takes literally 5 minutes to install, and I've had 0 crashes or other problems throughout my whole playtime after installing it.

Now, on to the game itself. I must first say that I haven't played the early installments in the series too much, but have mostly resorted to watching walkthroughs of them, which may have affected my perception. But gee, didn't I find this game amazing! I loved almost everything about it, beginning with the ambiance, the soundtrack, the monster design (which is really diverse and cool), the story, the weapons, all the way to the diverse environments and the transitions to the Otherworld.

The only real issue I've had with the game is that it has ridiculously few save points, and they are placed at a freakin' gigantic distance from one another (I once had to play for a whole f***ing hour without saving, holy fuck). This makes the game incredibly frustrating if you die.


PROS:
+AMAZING ATMOSPHERE AND STORY
+diverse environments
+incredibly scary and tense at some points
+lots of plot twists
+diverse, creepy, and original monsters
+diverse and neat weps
+exploration is encouraged, as there are a lot of secrets to discover

CONS:
-save points are ridiculously few and far between
-I haven't checked properly, but there doesn't seem to be a proper in-game checkpoint system either


NEUTRAL:
~combat might seem a bit weird in the beginning, but it's not that difficult to get used to (dodging and targeting is a mess though, I admit that)
~nothing impressive about the graphics, but I believe it's also not really expectable from such an old game


Overall, I'd say the game is a must-buy (yes, even the Steam version. In fact, I do recommend you to buy it here, as it might give Konami an idea that the PC community is also important. You may never know).


TL;DR: It's Silent Hill through and through. Ignore the complaints about the technical issues (they're very easily fixable with a community patch) and just buy it already :D

column8:
I see these other reviews and wonder: How the hell are people running into bugs??


I've not run into ONE when i played this version of the game. People let me tell you something, This may not be the Best game in the series compared to it's shining glory Silent Hill 2. But the game is still fun to play and had a decent story! I still enjoyed this game when i was younger (Less than i did it's older sibling but still enjoyed it where i could) and in a way this being here on the PC is just one step closer for the series staying Alive in some way.

If you've had issues with bugs I'd say uninstall and reinstall Because your files got corrupted, it's not the port it's Your PC not agreeing because a file got messed up so Start There.

It's one thing if there's Actual bugs in the game (There were very few in initial launch) But when you scream and cry about bugs on a port, you stopped taking in mind that your PC is One By One downloading the files and they can easily get corrupted or messed up, Reinstall and Try again. Don't review bomb just because your PC didn't get it working.

column8: Jogo muito bom!

Recomendo Silent Hill (5) Homecoming só por fazer parte da saga Silent Hill que eu amo muito.  Mas também recomendo a versão de console, porque a versão de pc tem bugs! Acontece uns travamento que não tem a ver com seu computador, é da versão do jogo mesmo. O jogo fica uns 20 segundos +- travado e aí volta ao normal. Mas é só em alguns momentos raros. Melhor comprar a versão do PS3

Pontos positivos desse jogo: a trilha sonora é bem bonita em alguns pontos e, em outros, a trilha é assustadora / sistema de esquiva e cambalhota + técnicas de combate. Como o Alex não é um simples civil, então ele tem habilidades que outros protagonistas da saga não tem. /  Esse jogo é o mais "violento" da saga. É o que mais tem gore, sabe? As cenas de morte são mais explícitas.

Quanto aos pontos negativos, existem vários. Eu não sei nem por onde começar.
Acho que os produtores, num modo geral, não souberam desenvolver um jogo pra recem então plataforma da época, Xbox 360 / PS3. 
É engraçado porque eu conheço outros jogos que pegaram o comecinho dessa era do PS3 e parece que os produtores não souberam desenvolver os jogos de um jeito decente. 

Começando com o lip synch. Olha, é estranho, mas os Silent Hills de PS2 tem um lip synch melhor que o Homecoming. Rostos inexpressivos.
Os gráficos também são estranhos. Por incrível que pareça, os do PS2 tem um gráfico, uma textura mais bonita que o do Homecoming. O SH3 e o SH4 por exemplo, se atualizassem as texturas pra HD numa remasterização, eles ficariam mil vezes mais bonitos que o Homecoming. E não é só isso, é os cenários também... os antigos tem mais detalhes, iluminação, profundidade e sombras mais trabalhados que o Homecoming, sei lá... 

Eu não sei se isso é ponto positivo ou negativo, mas nesse jogo, tudo que o Alex esbarra, o objeto é jogado pros lados/pra trás. Tipo: cadeiras tombam, se arrastam, caem... Ás vezes isso assusta, mas às vezes irrita.

Outro vacilo, que chega até ser cômico, é o símbolo dos comandos kkkkk Aparece lá o mesmo símbolo pra tudo! (Que é o símbolo do save game). Você tem que memorizar os comandos pelo menu, porque quando aparece lá "menu / inventory" ta tudo com o mesmo símbolo. E até hoje não sei direito qual é o botão de voltar no file kkkkk

Acho que a posição da câmera, sempre atrás da cabeça do Alex, piorou a situação. Como nos outros a câmera ficava mais acima, em vários ângulos, aí dava uma perspectiva melhor ao jogo.

Outro ponto negativo é a atuação de voz. Putz. Às vezes os personagens falam de um jeito como se tivessem lendo um papel.  Não souberam dirigir os atores, e em momentos que os personagens estão correndo, os atores falaram de um jeito bem normalzão.

A câmera de combate também é péssima. A câmera se posiciona exatamente atrás da cabeça do Alex, mano. Não dá pra enxergar o bicho na frente dele às vezes. A batalha com a Scarlet (boss fight) foi triste porque eu comandava o Alex pra esquivar  pra esquerda e ele esquivava pra direita e vice-versa. Às vezes o Alex fica esfaqueando o ar também. Mas não sei se isso acontece na versão de console.
Quando você saca a arma, você não pode acessar o menu direito. Então você tem que desligar a opção de combate/sacar a arma. Se fosse ligado à pressão de um botão, seria mais dinâmico, né. Não da pra acessar nem o mapa assim. E como o Alex fica olhando pro monstro como o centro da atenção, não tem como voce virar o alex pra correr pra direção contrária sem antes desligar o modo combate/sacar arma

Os saves são escassos comparado aos dos anteriores. Senti que tive que percorrer um caminho longo até achar um save, várias vezes. Rola uma travadinha básica na hora de salvar também.

Tive a sensação que esse Silent Hill foi o maior de todos. Se não é, então ele dá essa impressão. 

Outro ponto negativo é a limitação de munições. Tipo, se você pega uma quantidade x de munição, você não pode mais pegar! E isso é bem chato porque não é sempre que aparece munições. O jogo nem te permite economizar bastante.

Quanto à história, eu não posso falar muito sem dar spoiler porque esse jogo tentou preservar muitos detalhes para poder entregar o plot twist no final. Acho que por esse motivo, o jogo ficou meio arrastado, sabe? Você vai jogando, jogando... sem saber o que está acontecendo, sem saber o porquê das coisas, sem pegar a lógica de tudo... O problema é que tantos detalhes da história foram preservados que você joga de 50 a 70% da história do jogo sem entender o que está acontecendo, o porquê... Pra falar a verdade, só entendi por completo no final.

Nesse jogo, os files não são colecionáveis. Isso pesa muito pro entendimento do jogo! Às vezes você não pode parar pra ler um papel com um bicho pulando em você. E o conteúdo do papel faria mais sentido sendo relidos no final, né.
Os comentários dos lugares são contínuos, sem pausa. Significa que você não consegue ler os comentários/pensamentos do Alex sobre um banco, por exemplo, sem ser atacado por um bicho porque o jogo não congela como no SH1.
E os desenhos do Josh são a mesma coisa que nada. né.

Esse e o Silent Hill 2 são os únicos que tiveram plot twist e o Pyramid Head. O Pyramid Head apesar de ter uma fama na fandom e na saga, ele não aparece muito em ambos os jogos. E no Homecoming, ele aparece menos ainda que no 2. Ele nem tem um papel decente nesse e sua aparição fica misteriosa (pra não dizer mal explicada).

A história, mesmo após a revelação do plot twist no final, continua confusa. E apesar dos vários finais que existem (típico da saga), não da pra saber direito qual é canon! Eles são muito distintos uns dos outros! Porque, por exemplo, no SH1, SH2 e SH4, os finais seguem uma linha, uma lógica. A diferença é sutil  e pertinente. No Homecoming, alguns finais envolvem personagens que já morreram, finais sem lógica (?). Até o final UFO, coitado, que serve como alívio cômico na saga, foi simples e mal feito. E pela primeira vez, ele vem como possibilidade de ser pego de primeira (diferente dos outros que é um final bônus que você só pode pegar na segunda vez que jogar e fazendo algo especial)

Pra ser sincera, eu acho que a própria história do Homecoming é tão confusa que cria um plot hole desnecessário. No Silent Hill Origins, 1 e 3, houve um enredo sobre pacto. Aí chega o 5 e mete uma outra história de pacto que fica inevitável se perguntar onde o Zero/1 se encaixa nisso tudo. E afinal de contas, qual é a verdadeira história do Alex no final? O pai dele estava certo? Olha, eu acho péssimo quando uma história é mal explicada a ponto da gente precisar ler wikia na internet. 

Esse jogo possui escolhas de diálogos pela primeira vez na saga. Porém, diferente do que imaginei, as escolhas dos diálogos não afetam muito o gameplay em 97% dos casos. E nos outros 3%, momentos que são decisivos pra modificar o final que você vai conseguir (e você não sabe quando que é sem um walkthrough ao lado), o jogo não deixa claro no diálogo, como uma dica, do que se trata aquela decisão. Tipo no confessionário (SH3 feelings), você escolhe uma fala (já que as duas opções pareciam normais de conversa e não escolhas) e de repente o diálogo segue um fio de discussão que automaticamente te forçou numa decisão que as vezes nem era aquela que voce queria. Ou quando aparece fulana e aparece aquelas opções e você fica perdido, porque o jogo ta mandando você escolher mas sem uma explicação do tipo "olha, x vão fazer y, então voce precisa me ajudar porque [spoiler] não tem outra escolha[/spoiler]. Tipo isso. Aparece a cena e você fica perdido, o diálogo é raso e não entrega informações importantes pra decisão.

O jogo também tentou introduzir elementos do filme (que teve uma adaptação podre). Eles copiaram o efeito do lugar ficando alternativo e as enfermeiras.

Eu não queria dar "sim" nem "não" nessa análise. Só fico chateada com a quantidade de erros que os produtores cometeram.  Se você é fã da saga, logico que, como eu, você tem que/ vai jogar. Mas esteja preparado.

column8:
o jogo é bom  mas o fps é travadoem 30 fps e tem mts crash e problemas  de mapeamento de botoes se quiser resolver o problema de crash a solução esta abaixo:

COMO RESOLVER O BUG  SILENT HILL.EXE PAROU DE FUNCIONAR: pra resolver o problemas de crash instale o directx 2008 q esta na pasta raiz do jogo resolve varios problemas ao instalar o jogo parou de crashar e da tela preta porem ainda mantem os 30fps uma pena mas pelo menos agora ficou jogavel

Cool

Waited this much (11 years) to finally play this game for many reasons: I was silly enough to listen to some negative opinions and because of the bad PC port scared me away from trying it but I eventually giving in a while ago and bought on a very good sale (4$ I believe) and with being a fan of the series and after actually playing it I would have paid full price at launch and not regretting it (set aside the bad PC port though, that justify alone the wanting to pay less for it lol).

Anyway about the gameplay and the story itself this is what I think...


THE GOOD:

- I loved SO much that in this SH your main character actually feel trained to FIGHT back and DODGE, I don't think it takes out anything from the style of SH because it's meant to be that way because it's him, Alex. It's not James Sunderland, it's not Harry Mason and so on... it's Alex!
- The locations OVERALL were really appealing and (most of) the monsters hold up to the past SH.
- It DOES feel like a SH game, in case you were worried because of some reviews that pushed you away, the atmosphere is well done, the monsters surprise you but always with the our fan beloved radio eheh (hate and love for it!)
- On Normal Mode ammo are plenty but just if used with cautions, I held back a lot on fire weapons and still ran almost out so... (but for me it's a good thing in horror games, especially SH lol)

THE NOT SO GOOD:

- Wish it was longer BUT 15 hours is average for many horror games I loved and it's not a fault but I feel like pointing it out because it saddened me to have finished it already eheh 
- I really felt like I wanted to be able to explore more buildings, the one available are good and all but they were less unique compared to the previous SH in my opinion.
- The puzzles were very easy besides some that required a little bit more reading and attention (maybe three or so out of all).
- the only character design that really stands out for me it's Alex, the main character, for some reason the others just look a little bland and forgettable (look wise, not talking about their personality!)



Well, that's all. Do I suggest this game to a SH fan (a not TOO PICKY one though :P)? YES. Do I suggest this game to people who don't know much about SH and never played any of the old ones (or played them and hated them)? Probably not, because despite the good graphics and a better camera control etc it is still the same kind of pace of every other SH games and I know many people can't stand the slow walking (Alex does run pretty good though compared to other SH characters) and "emptiness" of SH...but when you love the series you know exactly that that specific thing is what adds to the SH experience. 

Should you buy it full price? Honestly just because I had to go patch it myself with a fan made fix (which worked really good for me and I'll be forever in debt with that user!)...no but up to 10$ it's still a good deal imho.

column8: I'm a huge fan of Silent Hill and of course I saw reviews for Homecoming before I got to play it so I was a bit nervous. Everybody is different and some games just don't do it for them which is not the case for me with Homecoming. It was everything I love about Silent Hill-The atmosphere, the creatures, the puzzles, the soundtrack, the story and just how deep Silent Hill always goes with their stories. I can go back and play this and feel emotions every time, along with all other Silent Hills. It's not only a game but stories that go deep and are filled with emotion and that's what makes Silent Hill great it gets inside you and haunts you within then next thing you know you're asking yourself if you too are in Silent Hill, am I really living between that foggy mysterious town and the bleeding, rotting, rusting, dark, yet intriguing beautiful Hell?

column8:
A franquia Silent Hill sempre foi conhecida por sua rica história e aterrorizantes inimigos. Entretanto, no quinto título da serie essas características foram deixadas de lado, abrindo espaço para "fan service" e pataquádas (como a aparição do Pyramid Head). 
O jogo realmente envelheceu mal, sua jogabilidade é digna da década de 2000, inegavelmente se baseado em outros títulos da mesma época(Resident Evil 4).
No entanto, o enredo é bem amarrado na medida do possível.
Por mais que o Game apresente tantos defeitos, vale a pena para quem é realmente fan da franquia e não se importa em "perder" 8 horas de sua vida.

Jogue sozinho de madrugada.
O jogo possui alguns bugs e erros de estética, mas para o fan  da franquia, pode ser uma experiência incrível :3.
It's a fun game, when it doesn't crash for no reason.
column9: It's a fun game, when it doesn't crash for no reason.

column8:
Esse jogo não para de crashar!!! Alt+tab, esquece.. Crashdown na hora. Fora q no full hd está bugando bastante!

Solução que encontrei pra jogar fluidamente, foi instalando um patch. Disponibilizado pelo user ''unknown project'' só dar um google ai que vc acha o canal dele e seus respectivos mod's. Neste momento, estou jogando em full hd, 60 fps.

Me dói ter que negativar esse game, pois eu AMO a franquia. Uma pena a Konami, ter dado um port tão porco pro msm.

Personnage mou (ne réalise pas les esquives), plantage et retour bureau sans cesse (frustrant lorsqu'il n'y a pas eu de point de sauvegarde), demande de remboursement refusé alors que c'est le jeu qui a des soucis de fonctionnement, quelle honte.

column8:
*DO NOT BUY THIS VERSION OF THE GAME*
Silent Hill: Homecoming does not deserve the hate it gets. The soundtrack is amazing, the combat isn't great but what can you expect from a Silent Hill game, the story is one of the best and is masterfully told, and the game is beautiful for the time it came out. However, purchase the PS3 or the Xbox 360 version. The PC version is horrendously broken and not worth the purchase. The map won't display properly, its a chore just to get the game to launch, and it can really mess up your system. Often requiring restarts. Do not skip out on Homecoming, it is definitely worth a playthrough. The PC version is not.

Deixando de lado o péssimo porte e qualidade de áudio mais ou menos. 
Silent Hill Homecoming é para ser jogado por todos fãs da saga, sua mecânica para a época é excelente, mas jogar em pleno 2019 é um grande desafio. O enredo é muito bom, sua trilha sonora nem se fala, sua dificuldade é balanceada (pouca munição e poucos kits), sua ambientação é muito boa. Deixe de lado as críticas, esse jogo é muito bom!
Neskutečně mizerný port z konzole. Hra neustále padá na plochu. Mezi save pointy jsou neskutečné mezery,

column8:
[h1][b]Во многом плохая, странная, кривая и дурная, но такая притягивающая. Необычная. Даже захватывающая.[/b][/h1]


[h1]Смотря на кучу клонов Резидента эта игра кажется верхом необычности.[/h1]

Ну у нас формула Сайлента в основном. Иди туда-то, сделай то-то, побей и так далее. В отличии от собратьев Хомкаминг более линейный и считай лишился открытого мира, есть конечно более менее большие локации, но смысла в них не сказать что бы много. Лишь небольшой эксплоринг. Но основной замес у нас в коридорах. Наверное почти вся игра это длинный коридор с врагами и загадками простыми.
Боёвка лучшая в серии это точно, ближний бой наконец-то стал похож на что-то нормальное и больше не возможности забить бедного монстрилу люстрой или вообще запинать. Тут разработчики видимо подумали больше чем 5 секунд и попытались хотя бы сохранить хоррор элементы. Ближний бой у нас основа, 3 разных оружия, с разными статами и монстры, которые по разному будут реагировать, а то и в ответ пропишут за не правильный выбор. Сам ближний бой из-за тактики, разных монстров и из разного количества, которые не стесняются атаковать толпой, становится весьма адреналиновым и напряжённым, а это учитывая что монстрилы и выглядят пугающе. В отличии от какого нибудь Калисто Протокола здесь как то и побыстрее и интереснее и хоррор атмосфера остаётся на месте.
Огнестрел отошёл на третий план. Его не много, не надо использовать часто и не всегда полезен. Иногда удобнее в ближний бой, чем палить с дробовика. Но что хорошо так это некоторые типы врагов, которых эффективно убивать только с далека, а кого-то наоборот. То есть нельзя прям забить на всёидти на пролом. Хотя боссы преймущественно огнестрелом.
Врагов хоть и маловато, но сойдут. От собак, то чертовщины с клинками которая блокирует постоянно. Есть где разгуляться в боях, хотя если 1 на 1 то весьма скучновато.
Боссы вот весьма не дурные, кроме некоторых. Вполне оригинальные идеи для битвы и весьма для хоррора необычные приёмы.


[h1]Сюжет ультра кринж, но при этом завлекает.[/h1]

Сама история по началу и правда интригует. Но чем дальше в глубь, тем больше вопросов. Что происходит, почему, почему персонажи тупят, шо за бред и главный: а где тут Сайлент Хилл? Конкретно Сайлент Хилл тут больше привязан нитками, чем по факту есть, хотя это проблема серии начиная уже с 4 части. Тип он есть, но забейте.
Основа сюжетки хороша, из этого можно замутить классную историю и сценарист правда пытается, есть хорошие моменты, крутые повороты, которые реально запоминаются и желание узнать что же будет дальше. Но это рушится об кучу дурацких моментов, глупых и самое плохое: персонажей. Более тупых персонажей найти ну очень сложно. Они почти всегда творят дичь. Особенно меня добила сцена с главным героем который разговаривает с батей почти под конец игры, кто знает тот поймёт. Ну нельзя потенциально хорошую историю, с хорошими моментами и твистами так сливать. Это просто вау, так себе в ногу выстрелить.


[h1]Атмосферная плохая оптимизация.[/h1]

У игры весьма хорошо выдержана атмосфера. Потерянности, непонимания и тихого ужаса. Визуал прекрасно способствует этому, как и во всех играх серии, а музыка и звук шикарны, без них это было бы уже не то. Тут идеально.
Дизайн локаций хороший, конечно не всегда смогли дотянуть, но почти всегда на хорошем уровне. А вот дизайн монстров и боссов вау, прекрасно, причём это не просто с нифига, каждый имеет под собой что-то. В отличии от всяких зомби и мутантов тут и правда жуткие создания, даже медсёстры.
Графика для своего времени нормальная, как и сам порт в плане управления.
Но оптимизация плохая, всякие зависания, вылеты, вылеты во время сохранения (!!!) и просадки ФПС. Ну и баги конечно же. Очень неприятные.


[h1][b]Итог: и близко неидеальная игра, особенно ПК порт. Но она и правда затягивает, впечатляет и запоминается. А по среди кучи однотипных игр жанра эта прям лучик света.[/b][/h1]

-

column8:
El juego es bueno por su historia, pero la versión de PC es una lastima, si de verdad tienes ganas de Jugarlo, compralo en su versión de PlayStation 3 o XBOX 360 ya que en PC tiene la peor optimización que he visto.

1.- Crasheos randoms que llegan a bloquearte el acceso a windows y tienes que reiniciar el PC
2.- Crasheos por usar resoluciónes muy altas(Ni se te ocurra ponerlo en 1080)
3.- El juego está bloqueado a 30FPS, y aunque lo puedes cambiar directamente en el archivo de configuraciones, su mala optimización hará que baje a 7FPS en ciertas zonas sin importar tu tarjeta grafica.
4.- A veces se queda cargando para toda la vida
5.- El audio tiene un "bug" el cual hace que la mayoría de sonidos solo se escuchen a la derecha en tus audifonos o bocinas, si quieres corregirlo debes tener unos drivers de sonido especiales que sean compatibles con sonido surround 5.1 y creeme  encontrarlos no es fácil.
6.- Preparate para freezeos de pantalla randoms, que sin importar tu PC, pueden durar hasta 1 o 2 minutos.

NO RECOMIENDO COMPRARLO PARA PC, PERO SÍ PARA CONSOLA
el juego me gusta pero se crashea demaciado seguido y es aburrido pasar la misma parte una y otra vez, se cierra de vez en cuando cuando mueres o cuando carga una cinematica, una lastima

Presiento que este juego se inspiro mas en la pelicula que salio que en sus titulos anteriores.

No es mal juego en si, pero te deja una rara sensacion, aparte de que a veces tenia problemas de sincronizacion del audio con las escenas cinematograficas, por no decir que a veces se me congelaba la imagen.
Rezil kontroller, vasat performans. Kanser olmaya değmez.

Give us the Silent Hill collection

Silent Hill Homecoming is an impressive game from the Silent Hill series that brings the horror of the original to a modern audience. With excellent graphics, sound, and a thrilling story, it’s easy to see why Silent Hill Homecoming is such a success.

The story of Silent Hill Homecoming follows Alex Shepherd, a soldier returning home to find his family missing. With no leads, Alex does the only thing he can; he follows a strange trail that appears to lead to a mysterious place called the Silent Hill.

The graphics in Silent Hill Homecoming are stunning. The game is still a horror title, so the camera and artstyle evoke an eerie atmosphere. In addition, the dark and depressing environments contribute to the disturbing atmosphere of the game, making you feel uneasy the further you explore.

The sound design in Silent Hill Homecoming is effective as well. The sound effects are spot-on, making you jump out of your seat as enemies appear or strange noises occur. Paired with a stellar soundtrack that mixes spooky ambience with intense rock and metal, you really get into the spirit of Silent Hill.

Overall, Silent Hill Homecoming is a great horror game that captures the best elements of the original. It has a great story, beautiful graphics, and addicting sounds that make it a compelling experience. If you’re a fan of horror games, Silent Hill Homecoming is a must-play.

column8:
What can I say, I used to play Homecoming on PS3 when it came out, and was one of the first Silent Hill games I ever played. 
While the game is somewhat good and the story somewhat interesting, I wouldn't say you are missing out on this one.

And to save yourself the money, do not buy this game for the full price, the port is absolutely terrible, and the amount of crashes and bugs that has happened to me despite the so called "fixes" made by the community, the game is still terribly ported directly from the console. But if you are a hardcore Silent Hill fan and have yet to play Homecoming, I would say you should play it through once. 

I personally enjoyed the game because it felt kind of nostalgic to finally play it through. But I know for sure that I will never pick this game up again.

column8: Very good game. One of the more underrated in the Silent Hill series, but an awful PC port. Crashes, improper widescreen support, hard-locked at 30fps, frame rate dips, screen tearing, the works. It's sad, because I feel it's a worthy addition to the Silent Hill series and gets unfairly criticized for being too different, but if you're gonna play it, get it on console or wait for the price to drop significantly. It was worth the $5 price tag, that's it.

column8: Malheureusement non, je ne conseille pas ce jeu. Bien trop truffé de bugs. Ca me fait mal car la franchise Silent Hill à toute ma sympathie... L'ambiance est là, le gamaplay à l'air sympa aussi, mais être bloqué car une cinématique ne se lance pas ou bien avoir un mob qui vous pop dessus, je ne parle pas d'un mob caché pour l'effet de surprise mais d'un mob bien présent mais dont je n'avais pas l'affichage jusqu'à être le nez dans ses nichons (c'était une infirmière)... Bref, je rage, je quitte, je me calme et décide de lui redonner une dernière chance.... Plus de sauvegarde... Tu la sens ma déception? Passer + de temps dans les forums à rechercher les solutions des bugs plutôt qu'à jouer, non. Pour les courageux, lancez-le en compatibilité win 95 (pour être moins emmerdé par les blocages dus aux cinématiques) et ne mettez pas la réso à plus 720 (il me semble, pour avoir la map entière:/)

Defektní, odporně vypadající konzolový port, který se špatně ovládá i na controlleru. Ale i kdyby všechno bylo v pořádku, pořád by šlo o špatnou hru. Homecoming klade velký důraz na boj, jehož ovládání je ale strašné. Úhyby někdy fungují a jindy ne, postava je pomalá a neohrabaná, ovládání i kamera hraje proti vám a boje s více než jedním nepřítelem jsou vyloženě za trest. A checkpointy jsou tak daleko od sebe, že při každé náhodné smrti můžete přijít klidně o čtvrt hodiny postupu.
Jiné Silent Hilly jsem nehrál, ale toto je ostuda.

The game's fun when it works, but be prepared for lots of hang-ups, especially when there are enemies nearby.

Would leave a neutral rating if that existed, but since it doesn't I'll leave a positive.

So playing this game I really want to love it but this game and, specially this port feels god awful. I would have a really hard time recommending this to someone who doesn’t care about Silent Hill. Even though this is my first Silent Hill game this wouldn’t dissuade me from playing more. If you play this game specifically on a console I would think you’d enjoy this game a whole lot more than this PC port. Game-play wise the controls and the difficulty to re-wire your hands to hit certain buttons can make this infuriating. In addition to the difficulty of figuring out the button mapping you’ll find (maybe this is just me) but, hit boxes and general combat with enemies feels very sloppy. One of my biggest complaints with the combat though is that I typically found myself using only one weapon. The primary reason is ultimately because you can basically abuse the combat system. That one switch makes the Silent Hill Homecoming a cake walk to say the very least. From the so many cons of this game (poor combat mechanics, bad hit boxes, locked 30 fps, random crashes throughout,  unbelievably bad stuttering, you can not tab out and back in without a crash and, to finish it off poor scaling to 1440p) to the good. Overall Silent Hill does what everyone says it does which is great atmosphere and good story telling. Many of the main details in the story can be metaphorically found throughout the game. This is very evident in the fighting of each boss that things become a lot more clear when fighting “your demons”. Homecoming has a lot of decent twist that I wasn’t expecting, which is perfect for me nothing worse than a stale story that you can see coming a mile away. This wasn’t the case for the ending which I was very disappointed in but, it’s a very fitting end to the game and the story I can give it that. This game dragged me in through it’s lack of story telling and atmosphere the more you know the less you know. I’m glad though that this game wasn’t as vague as it could have been. To that I’m referring to places, items, puzzles, and general things that aren’t logically put together. Homecoming may be a sort of cookie cutter game compared to it’s brethren titles but, it’s not terrible by any means (besides the PC port version). Something that I think Silent Hill does better than other games is boss creations. Something about the way these games put together monsters and bosses is unnerving, from their movement to their stance. It’s very specifically done to look that way to give you a certain feeling. Overall I would recommend this game only if you play the console version.  The lack of PC optimization is pathetic to say the very least and, to charge $40 on top of that as it currently stands on Steam is BS. So in conclusion play the console version it’ll make for a much more enjoyable gaming experience.

[h1]Home Sweet Home...[/h1]

Silent Hill serisinin 6. oyunu olmasına rağmen, aslında bu oyun tam anlamıyla bir Silent Hill oyunu değil. Neden mi? Öncelikle oyun [b]Team Silent[/b] 'ın yaptığı bir oyun değil. Silent Hill serisinde korku-gerilim aksiyona göre daha ön plandadır, yalnız Homecoming'de durum böyle değil (Allah'tan dram var oyunda). Ayrıca Silent Hill'de ki yaratıklar gerçek dünyada değil, başka bir boyutta ortaya çıkar ancak bu oyunda karakterimizin kendi yaşadığı kasabada da durum aynı, herkes de kasabayı böyle göremez be kardeşim hiç mi bir Silent Hill oyunu görmediniz ya da oynamadınız be. Yaratıklar; insanların [b]korkularını, suçlarını, ruhsal bunalımlarını ve daha önceden yaşadığı travmaları[/b] temsil eder yalnız bu oyunda bu o kadar da etkili olamamış ne yazık ki -herkes suçlu olamaz mq kasabasında çünkü-. Silent Hill herkesin normal bir biçimde gidebileceği bir kasaba da değil, suçlu olan birinin bir şekilde Silent Hill'e çağırılıp en kötü korkularıyla yüzleştiği -ya da cezasını çektiği- ve bir gerçeği öğrenemeden asla ayrılamayacağı bir yerdir (bir nevi kişinin kendi cehennemi gibi düşünebiliriz). Gerçekte oyundaki protagonistler (baş karakterler), dövüşmeyi pek bilmezler çünkü ellerine ilk kez silah alan sıradan insanlarla oynuyorduk, yalnız Homecoming'de ise karakterimiz bildiğiniz asker, ki bu durum oyunun korku-gerilim olmasından uzaklaşıyor biraz daha aksiyona kayıyor.

Oyuna girecek olursam; oyunu bir süre oynadıktan sonra ya anlık donup geri geliyor ya da atmaya başlıyor ve taa eski kayıttan devam ettiriyor bana, tam yeni silahlar aldım derken oyun küt gidiyo ve sinirlerimi bozuyo (bunun çözümünü bulursanız bana da bildirin lütfen), ayrıca FPS 60 olması gerekirken 30 da kitleniyor. 

[b]Herneyse özete gelelim...[/b]

Yıl 2007, asker Alex Shepherd bir savaşta yaralanmış ve hastaneye kaldırılmıştır. Hastanede olduğu sırada hem kayıp kardeşinin peşinden gitmiş hem de anlam veremediği bir sürü olaya tanıklık etmiştir. Kasabasına geri döndüğünde ise gerici bir sessizlik, sisle kaplanmış ve yaratıklar kol geziyor (vay anasını). Eve vardığında da yalnızca annesi vardır. Annesi de katatonik bir duruma girmiş ve oğluna, babasını ve kardeşini bulmasını söylemiştir. Yolculuk sırasında ise tüm bu olanların perdesi aralanacaktır.

Silent Hill'in öyküleri hep baş tacı olmuştur, yalnız bu oyun Silent Hill'in kendisinden epeyce uzak. Müziklerine laf yok o dramatizmi bozmamış en azından, yalnız adamlar 2. oyuna benzer bir oyun yapalım derken iyice berbat etmişler. En azından oyunda [u]Piramit reisi ve Hemşire bacılarını[/u] gördük (ki bunlar serinin simgeleri).

Uzun lafın kısası... Oyun bir korku oyunu olarak fena değil yalnız bir Silent Hill hiç değil. Serinin o kendine has gerilim havası az, yaratıkları herkes görebiliyor, olaylar kendi verdiğiniz kararlarla değil oyunun size sunduğu seçeneklerle sonuçlanıp öyle sona ulaşıyorsunuz. Bu oyunu bir korku oyunu olarak önerebilirim ama bir Silent Hill oyunu olarak önermiyorum. Keşke Konami Team Silent'ı kovmayıp seriyi batılı şirketlere satmasaydı, şu anda Silent Hill en az Resident Evil kadar ilgi görebilirdi.

[h1]Kazandığın paraları hak etmiyorsun KONAMI bunu da bil![/h1]

[b]3.5/10[/b] (Yarım puan çok vermemin nedeni oyunun müziklerini Akira Yamaoka abimiz yaptığı için.)

[i]I'm not sure what it all means, but we need to get to Silent Hill.[/i]

Okuduğunuz için sağolun.
Una vergogna per il porting su pc......

I loved most of the previous Silent Hill games.
The fourth one was the one I played the most.
The controls are terrible and the port is awful.
After playing this: Only a headache will remain.
The older games are much better than this one.
I did enjoy the story and the overall atmosphere.
It's probably better to play this game on console.
This game just doesn't deserve a positive review.
But giving it a negative review would be overkill.
Steam should allow us to give a neutral review.
This game would really deserve the neutral one.

column8:
Muszę zaktualizować dawną ocenę. Pomimo tak wielu wad gra ma w sobie to coś, że chce się ją przejść do końca, nie wiem co, wkurza człowieka niemiłosiernie cały czas ale idziesz dalej, dalej by tytuł ukończyć... A o to w tym chodzi więc pomimo zepsutych nerwów muszę ją polecić...

Dawna recenzja:

1/10. Naprawdę, naprawdę próbowałem w to grać. Ale ta gra jest koszmarnie toporna. Sterowanie to jakiś dramat. Systemu walki właściwie nie ma. Do tego bardzo często łapie zawieszki, czasem wywala do pulpitu a savewów jest na lekarstwo. Żeby było lepiej każdy loading to minimum 3 minuty czekania. Szkoda, bo historia ciekawa, klimat jest zachowany, ale co z tego jak mechanika i optylizacja czyni granie prawdziwą udręką...

Just finished it. It was my first Silent Hill game. I enjoyed the game. It was immersive, suspenseful with great atmosphere. I liked the voice acting, characters, creepy enemies, survival aspects, combat, 5.1 sound on speaker system or at least it used all 5, music and timing of the music, and the unfolding story. I had too many crashes until I setup my own shortcut to run with admin privileges. After that I did have a few crashes and slow load times but they were easy to put up with because the game is just likeable. The crashes never broke the game. Only other technical issue I had was the map. I looked at maps offline if I needed to see the whole thing. I spent a lot of hours on this game. Steam says 3 hours but since I had my own shortcut the hours I spent didn't register. Must have been more than 20 hours. I had bought SH3 on disc years ago, now I look forward to playing that one.

column8: Comprei mais e o cagaço pra jogar essa porra. Mano pesadelo, ai, quem quiser vai na fé, se eu podesse devolver eu devolveria. Terror dele é mais psicologico, se tu nunca jogou antes vai ter que limpar a caganeira. Paguei 5 conto na promo. Valeu oque paguei, só queria poder jogar kkkkkkkkk
Somente uma palavra... crash! Jogo crasha todo instante, alem de ser obrigado a jogar em 720p se quiser ver o mapa. Mesmo assim, crasha em qualquer loading ao puro acaso. Lamentavel.

W pierwszej kolejności dementuję plotkę że gry nie da się ukończyć. Oczywiście da się, lecz jest to uciążliwe. Gra  lubi się zacinać czy co gorsza dość często craschować. Swoją przygodę ukończyłem w 13 godzin z czego ponad 5 godzin to zacinki (a te potrafią trwać od kilku nawet do kilkunastu sekund), przedłużające i częste loadingi czy co gorsze przymus powtarzania etapu po wywaleniu systemu. Każdy save spot to ulga a i te potrafią się zepsuć – dlatego nie należy nadpisywać tylko jednego i tegosamego slota na save. 

Sama gra jest w porządku i gdyby nie ta ciągła niepewność wręcz strach przed craschem to wystawiłbym łapkę w górę. Pomimo dekady na karku, produkt graficznie daje jakoś jeszcze sobie rade, gameplay jest znośny, fabuła znośna, całość potrafi utrzymać uwagę użytkownika, głównie za sprawą klimatu.   

Jeśli lubisz survival horrory i jesteś gotów przyjąć ze stoickim spokojem opisane problemy, to można poświęcić te kilka złotych (w czasie promocji) oraz te kilka godzin życia a po wszystkim tego nie żałować. Jeśli jednak nie masz na tyle cierpliwości to daruj sobie.

W grze wcielamy się w Alexa Sheparda, który wraca do swojej rodzinnej miejscowości Shepherd's Glen, aby odnaleźć swojego młodszego brata, po tym, jak zaczęły go nękać koszmarne sny. Po powrocie okazuje się, że mieszkańcy miasteczka giną w tajemniczych okolicznościach, całe miasto osnuwa gęsta mgła, a na ulicach spotykamy makabryczne potwory, które nie mają wobec nas przyjaznych zamiarów.
Alex postanawia zrozumieć, o co chodzi i odnaleźć brata, niestety nie wie, że nie będzie to łatwe. Całe miasteczko powiązane jest w swój dziwny sposób z Silent Hill i kryje mroczną historię, w którą po części zamieszana jest jego własna rodzina.
Fabuła jest dobra, zdecydowanie chce się ją śledzić i poznać zakończenie, zwłaszcza że oferuje mały plot twist.

Homecoming to standardowy survival horror, który nie oferuje może nic oryginalnego i przełomowego, jeśli chodzi o serię czy gatunek. Ot, chodzimy, bijemy, rozświetlamy sobie drogę latarką, rozwiązujemy zagadki i dbamy o zapasy zdrowia i amunicji. Dużym plusem jest jednak o wiele wygodniejsze sterowanie w porównaniu do poprzedniczek, jak i całkiem dobrze działająca kamera.

Graficznie gra prezentuje się ładnie jak na 2008 rok. W niektórych momentach tekstury mogłyby być lepsze, ale ogólnie gra cieszyła oko. Były co prawda lepiej i gorzej zrobione modele czy pomieszczenia, ale nic, co mogłoby odstręczyć. Nie mam się naprawdę do czego doczepić.

Gra oferuje około 10 godzin rozgrywki i 5 zakończeń (w tym kultowe już z serii UFO), które po przejściu odblokowują nam nowe stroje i specjalne bronie w zależności od wyborów poczynionych w grze. A tych tym razem jest znacznie mniej i tu można się spokojnie domyślić co zrobić, żeby dostać to dobre zakończenie, żeby wszyscy ( no prawie ) żyli długo i szczęśliwie.

A kwestia muzyczna? To stary i dobry Akira Yamaoka, słychać wyraźnie jego ambientowe nuty i utwory wykonane w duecie z Mary Elizabeth, jednakże nie są one już tak mocną stroną serii, jak w poprzedniczkach. Utworów jest zdecydowanie mniej, a żaden nie przykuwa ucha na tyle, żeby puszczać sobie OST w wolnej chwili. Jednak podczas gry muzyka jest na dobrym poziomie i dodaje atmosfery doskonale tam, gdzie miała jej dodawać.

Podsumowując, uważam, że jest to dobry survival horror z unikalnym klimatem i wciągającą fabułą, którą zdecydowanie warto poznać. Zwłaszcza że dzięki poprawionemu sterowaniu gra się wygodnie i przyjemnie.

First off I would state that I really enjoyed this game. The atmosphere and enemy designs are great, the story was decent and the boss fights were unique. If you do play this game I suggest playing it on hard, you will die a lot but if you don't then you will just run through the enemies taking away most of the suspense which is really important for this type of game

However, the reason I don't recommend this is referring to the PC version specifically. I just experienced too many drops in frames or total crashes. (i5 GTX 1050) I originally played it on a PS3 well enough and would recommend playing it on that or 360 or Xbox one. Also if you want to use a controller like I did mapping the buttons is such a hassle and even then the button prompts don't match up

column8: bueno

Intense, gripping and disturbing survival horror game is a terrific experience. I have seen the two Silent Hill films (the second one was really bad) but have not played any of the games (with the exception of the arcade game) until now. I have gathered that fans of the series have mixed views on Silent Hill: Homecoming but I thought it was fantastic. I was very much reminded of the excellent Dead Space.

You play as Alex as you make your way around Shepherd's Glen in search of your missing brother. The place is almost a ghost town and is shrouded in a thick fog. Every now and then, you will come up against horrifying monsters. This is not an action game so expect the tension to build between encounters with creatures. The presentation is great as the game has a grainy look to everything. For the most part, the graphics are good but character animations during in-game cutscenes are sometimes poor and some of the textures on objects are a little underwhelming. Still, the game creates a very detailed environment and the atmosphere is chilling throughout. The eerie music helps make the game even more disturbing. You scavenge for items and try to conserve your ammo and health packs. The combat system may feel a little stiff but it suits the game well because this is a survival horror title, not an action game. There is some replay value as the game has multiple endings. Occassionally, I would encounter brief moments where the game would freeze and the loading times between areas are pretty annoying. However, I found the game ran quite smoothly overall.

Silent Hill: Homecoming is a brilliant survival horror game. I do not know if the other entries in the franchise are better but if they are anything like this game, I'm sure I would love them too. Games like this have to grab you with the atmosphere very quickly else you will get bored quickly. From the moment I started Silent Hill: Homecoming, I was hooked.

Gameplay: 8/10
Graphics: 8/10 (for the time)
Controls: 8/10
Replay Value: 6.5/10

On pourra marquer en épithaphe sur ma tombe : "Il a essayer"
Je vais nettoyer mes larmes de sang pendant ce temps....

O jogo apesar de ter uma história e ambientação interessante como todos os Silent Hill, este foi impossível de ser jogado no Pc devido a erros de tela preta e crashes inesperados a todo o momento, fui impossibilitado de avançar no game logo após o começo quando o personagem volta a sua casa e nos deparamos com o primeiro loading da entrada da casa que precisa ser passado mais de uma vez e sempre crasha na segunda.

I haven't played a lot of this game but I've made a decent amount of progress to warrent a review and write the insight to my experience of it. Silent Hill: Homecoming is a decent game that tried to continue on the franchise back when but it wasn't what we were all used to subsequently didn't make a lasting impression. The PC port? It was even worse, some even call unplayable.

PRO
- Interesting story but it feels somewhat cliche and doesn't have a big impact like 1, 2 or 3 did.
- The chilling and soothing music of Akira Yamoaka reminds us of the good days of Silent Hill.
- Creature designs are interesting if not a little less thought out and lacking symbolism than previous entries.
- Areas are classic looking Silent Hill with it's abandoned and foggy small town shrouded in mystery.

CON
- Audio is very unbalanced using a headset (and I assume speakers) where the speech comes out the left but sound effects and music comes out the right. Every other game works fine but SH:H is the only one that does this so I can only blame the game.
- Camera pans all over the place when interacting with certain items like it's not sure where to look.
- Long loading times occur when changing area's, preparing for a cutscene or even just spawning an enemy.
- Plenty of stuttering which occurs frequently.
- Facial animations just looks really weird and somewhat deformed giving everyone an ugly look.
- Fighting mechanics feel unfinished and annoying to use as some weapons are useless. For example, the knife is what you want to use mainly because you can stunlock enemies until they die. The pipe gives you a two hit combo with a slow cooldown so you'll most likely be hit straight after it.
- The physics can be weird and make enemies stretch and bounce as if made of rubber.
- Using an xbox pad makes the controls show up as numbers instead of it's corresponding symbol which gets very confusing.
- Sometimes the audio can be really quiet even with my volume as well as the game's at high levels. So I decided to put subtitles on...
- With the subtitles on they can show wrong dialogue. Little gripe I know but seems like something they could have easily checked.

It's a decent game for people who have a good interest in the Silent Hill series but if you're just looking for a classic survival horror game then maybe give this one a miss.

5/10

column8: Silent Hill Homecoming quiza no sea el mejor juego de la saga pero tampoco es el peor. Con un Soundtrack bastante bueno, un muy buen diseño de monstruos a decir verdad y con una historia decente, Silent Hill Homecoming vale la pena a pesar de ser el juego mas FanService de la saga. Vale la pena por su Historia, Soundtrack, Ambientación y Monstros (En mi opinión los Monstruos y su transfondo son una de las mejores cosas que contiene esta entrega exepto Pyramid-Head y las enfermeras, que a pesar de que son monstruos muy queridos en la saga no tiene casi sentido o justificación de que esten aqui. El Soundtrack tambien es muy disfrutable si ya venias jugando desde el SH 2 o 3 te sentiras nostalgico con dicha banda sonora, otro factor importante o a favor en mi opinión del juego.) En cuanto a desempeño sufre varios fallos desde tener varios bugs, una tasa de FPS bastante estable pero que se limita a 30 y pues a decir verdad no culpo a su calidad grafica puesto que para su tiempo era de admirar pero ahora se ve un poco minimalista pero es algo que la atmosfera misma del juego le tapa y lo pone a favor. Es recomendable adquirir este titulo solo en descuentos.

Dejando aparte el hecho de que es el único Silent Hill a la venta en Steam (lo que me parece muy lamentable) este Silent Hill es el primero hecho por desarrolladores estadounidenses lo que hace que sea muy diferente al desarrollado por el Team Silent (los desarrolladores originales de este juego que era japonés originalmente al igual que los Resident Evil). No da tanto miedo como los anteriores es más un juego de acción y gore. La historia es de Alex que vuelve luego del servicio militar a su pueblo natal y se encuentra todo cambiado. Alex debe encontrar a su hermano Josh que ha desaparecido y desentrañar una serie de misterios acerca de su pasado, su pueblo y el vinculo de éste con Silent Hill. Gráficamente esta mejorado de eso puedo estar seguro pero el modo de combate con los monstruos me resulto muy complicado. Eso de prepararse para golpear a un monstruo es enredado debido a que uno puede morir frente a un monstruo sin poder defenderse si se te olvida poner el modo de combate antes de enfrentarse al monstruo lo que en los anteriores Silent Hill no pasaba. Además, hay muy poca munición y pocas medicinas y eso unido al modo de combate lo hace más complicado. El diseño de los monstruos esta bien. Finalmente, deje para el final del análisis lo que más me molesto del juego: Las cargas extremas que cada vez eran más largas a medida que el juego avanzaba. Eso unido a las caidas de fps, los crasheos y las pantallas congeladas en los puntos de guardado o cuando empieza algo nuevo en la historia fueron deteriorando el gozo del juego. Sin embargo, lo recomiendo por la historia que es muy buena y por el solo hecho de ser un Silent Hill que valga la redudancia es el único disponible en Steam.

Soy fan de la saga de Silent Hill porque han sido los únicos juegos que me han causado terror de verdad. No había podido jugar este juego hasta ahora que tengo una computadora decente. Pero... el juego está muy mal adaptado a la PC. A cada rato se detiene, tiene problemas con el audio, se congela por momentos, los escenarios desaparecen... No puedo recomendarlo por eso.
Del juego no puedo decir mucho porque apenas voy en la parte del hotel, pero me lo terminaré a pesar de los errores porque he esperado mucho tiempo para jugarlo. Pero de lo que llevo la historia es demasiado superficial y no llegas a empatizar con ningún personaje, ni siquiera con el principal. Lo que sí puedo elogiar es el diseño de los monstruos y escenarios, además del sonido ambiental y la música (Akira Yamaoka es un genio).
Abajo me pregunta Steam que si recomiendo el juego. Le puse que sí porque soy fan de SH y este es el único disponible para Steam, pero me decepcionó mucho lo mal optimizado que está.
good

Este es un muy buen juego de Silent Hill pero Konami hizo aqui el peor port de su historia , es practicamente injugable en PC , menos mal que tambien lo tengo en XBoX  y ahi si va muy bien . Queria jugarlo a 60 fps pero lo tuve que dejar a las 6 horas porque es imposible entre la cantidad de crasheos y problemas que da . No lo recomiendo en PC . Pero el juego en si es muy bueno .

um péssimo port para PC
mas, tirando esse fator - que é crucial -, é um jogo divertido.
