column8:
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1280019463

最新的修正补丁可以解锁60帧，减少跳出，并且兼容汉化补丁。

En cuanto a este juego he de decir que me gustaría hablar de él desde dos puntos de vista. Uno desde el propio juego, y otro desde el punto de vista de la saga.

En lo que al apartado gráfico se refiere, el juego cumple con los estándares de su generación y es agradable de ver junto con una banda sonora que cumple con la temática ya que usa referencias de títulos anteriores. La historia no tiene un trasfondo verdaderamente interesante ya que Konami descuida muchos apartados de esta obra haciendo que al ver la fachada veamos un título serio pero que al jugarlo, se nota como va diluyéndose y mostrando sus grandes carencias.

Por mucho que Konami ha intentado exprimir sus sagas más icónicas como esta famosa y aclamada saga de juegos de terror psicológico, se ve a la legua que desde hace mucho, sus sagas tenían síntomas claros de agotamiento, debido a que como ha pasado con Silent Hill, usar clichés de obras anteriores hace que la gente siga interesada por tus nuevos lanzamientos. 

Sin embargo, si no se da un cambio importante por parte del equipo creativo, llegamos al punto en que se encuentra este Silent Hill Homecoming, a caballo entre querer formar nuevas historias pero tomando siempre como base las creaciones de obras anteriores. Esto provoca que el juego carezca de personalidad y acabe haciéndose tedioso y poco interesante al no tener una historia y una banda sonora que nos atrape ni unos buenos personajes que hagan que estemos espectantes de ver lo que sucede.

Como conclusión, este título no merece la pena comprarse ya que hay mejores opciones por el mismo o menor precio. Personalmente, yo compro este ya que si por casualidad algo de luz se hallara en Konami, quizás estas compras les anime algún día a sacar en la tienda de Steam los juegos anteriores de la saga u otros interesantes como los de la saga Metal Gear. Tristemente pienso que aunque esto se acabara dando, seguramente nos llevaríamos una mala adaptación como ya pasó con las remasterizaciones de Silent Hill ya que si algo nos ha demostrado Konami es que dinero y esfuerzo son ahora mismo dos cosas que no pueden ni quieren invertir.

[h1]Este es el mejor dark souls que he jugado...[/h1]

Más porque manejas al militar mamad0 de resident evil: Isaac clarke.
Siendo uno de los titulos menos comprendidos de una franquicia de survival horror queridisima por veteranos, es un port muy feito para pc el cual ni siquiera puede llegar a la calidad de vendible... pero bueno.

>A grandes rasgos: Homecoming es un silent hill que esta más basado en el gameplay, que a la ambientacion o historia bien planteada de anteriores entregas que nos dio team silent... asi que es un festival de accion/survival a la dead space, cosa que odiaron los puristas... porque aceptemoslo a nadie le gustan los cambios.

>Lo bueno:
-yay un silent hill en steam c:

>Lo malo:
-Es el "peor" de la franquicia >:c
-Es un port que ni con parches (hechos por los fans, porque la compañia es incompetente para arreglar su cagad3ro)puede estar 100% funcional; te va a crashear, te va a corromper save files, te va a tiltear.

[h1]Resumiendo:[/h1]
Quieres probar este jueguito? adelante, hazlo pero en consola; no aqui ni en esta plataforma ya que este port es de los peores que he visto en mi corta travesia en stim... es un 2/10: Te va a crashear si o si, te va a dar bajones de frames, el audio esta desfasado, y las cinematicas bugeadas... es un festival del horror, pero del horror tecnico por parte de konami y su incompetencia y poco amor a franquicias verdaderamente queridas por los fans.
Ahora que si lo que buscas es una calificacion del titulo en consola: es un solido 7/10, no es el mejor silent hill, pero el cambio de aires tampoco es pesimo, fue una entrega incompredida dado a la necesidad de innovar sin el equipo original; si eres fan de silent hill debes jugarlo y punto.

Pesima portabilidad tiene varios errores que dicicultan jugar, no puedo avanzar apartir del hotel por culpa de esos errores y lo que es peor el error tarda minomo 3 horas de juego en aparecer pero despues de 2 horas de juego ya no es reembolsable pesima experiencia.

Oq eu tenho a dizer sobre esse jogo? apenas fans mesmo da saga vao curtir...ue...voce esperava oq? que eu ia dizer que o porte é mais horrivel que o filho do gragas com urgot? nah nao é bem assim, vamos aos pros e contras

Pros:
historia boa
chefes altamente grotescos bem estilo silent hill mesmo
atmosfera bem medonha
personagens carismaticos com personalidades e pensamentos proprios
variedade grande de armas tanto brancas como de fogo
soundtrack LINDA

Cons:
como eu disse la em cima...o port... como eu posso explicar? o jogo sofre constantemente com crashes e freezings durante a gameplay, a otimizaçao do jogo tbm nao foi trabalhada direito isso sem contar os graficos...que se comparar com a versao de xbox 360...mds...uma lavada linda de balde d'agua mesmo se voce tiver jogando no maximo e olha que esse jogo nem pesado é da pra rodar ele de boas em qualquer pc.
o sistema de combate so por deus, de tanto inimigo que aparece voce fica sem folego pra fazer alguma coisa com arma branca, so arma de fogo e olha que o personagem usando arma de fogo é mais travado que estatua de madeira.
os sons do jogo sao TERRIVEIS diferente da soundtrack que é maravilhosa os sons sao tao desastrosos quanto o cancelamento de Silent Hills, a faca nem barulho faz direito quando voce acerta ela em um inimigo.
os inimigos do jogo dao uma dor de cabeça tbm pq tem alguns que nao param de defender e alguns que sao bem resistentes mas eu acho que eu to sendo frescurento pq os inimigos do downpour conseguem ser piores doq os do homecoming

Consideraçoes finais: se voce realmente nao quer passar perrengue no jogo recomendo voce instalar um patch que corrige os crash e os freezings do jogo, agradeçam aos fans por isso. eu so comprei esse sh pq ele é um dos meus favoritos.
se voce for fan de sh mesmo sinta-se a vontade e como eu ja disse instale o patch pra nao passar dor de cabeça.
agora se voce nao é tao fan assim cara passa direto. tu nao vai gostar desse jogo, bom se voce gostar eu nao sei, porem acho isso dificil por causa do port se for mesmo querer jogar ele recomendo jogar a versao do xbox 360 que é menos problematica

vlw guys :D
Un juego que descata mas la acción pero no deja de ser interesante e intenso de jugar, 100% recomendado

Original game is a very fine horror experience. 

However,

This PC port is fundamentally BROKEN.

A lazy (frankly incompetent) port and a huge missed opportunity to introduce a fantastic franchise to the PC.

Fan patches do help greatly with stability and crashing but I expect more from the actual developers. I may revisit this if issues continue to get fixed by the fanbase but until then the instability, graphical issues and game breaking bugs make it just to much like hard work.

Damn shame.

Nuff said.

column8:
UPDATED REVIEW:

After having bought a Steamdeck five years later, I was actually able to play this, so I can comment on the game itself. I'll try to sum things up with a few bullet points.

GOOD:

+ Great visuals that hold up really well for a console game from 2008. Enemy visual design is superb, especially the bosses.

+ Audio across the board is top-notch (voice acting, sound effects, music). The soundtrack of prior games returns with some new songs added with a few of them having vocals from Mary Elizabeth McGlynn. I think out of all of the games in the SIlent Hill franchise this one has the best soundtrack.

+ The plot has some inconsistencies but overall it's really good. It does not have the same depth that Silent Hill 1, 2 and 3 had, but it holds its own.

BAD:

- Terrible combat. True, prior Silent Hill franchise entries (and survival horror games in general) are known for this—for a lot of those other games the awkwardness manages to be more of a pro than a con, as it makes the player feel vulnerable, which enhances the fear factor. But something is just really off with this one. I'll do my best to elaborate...

Homecoming uses a stance system, where you manually activate a "combat-mode" with a button. Doing so with any melee weapon (what you'll be using most of the time) causes the camera to focus on an enemy. At this point combat sort of becomes like a beat-em-up/survival horror hybrid, where you can slowly circle-strafe around enemies, dodge attacks and perform combo chains. It sort of works when there is only one enemy on-screen, but the developers often like to throw two or three or more of them at you at the same time. Functionally the closest game I've played to this is Callisto Protocol (albeit Homecoming has a dedicated dodge button, while Callisto Protocol does not).

Dodging feels really clunky—hitboxes are not precise and enemies will sometimes land their attacks even if it looked like they should have missed. Larger enemies flail around, knocking you down repeatedly. On Normal difficulty it doesn't end up being all that challenging because health items are actually fairly plentiful. So if you're lazy you can just half-ass your way through combat and keep healing yourself up whenever you get too low.

On the topic of difficulty, enemies have way too much health, rendering them giant damage sponges, even on Normal. Sometimes you can just run past them but this isn't always an option—it seems the developers really wanted Homecoming to be more action oriented than other Silent Hill games.

- Human enemies. Near the end of the game, you fight [spoiler]cultists in hazard suits[/spoiler]. There aren't many of them, but they seem a bit out of place.

- Unpolished port. On my Steamdeck I was not able to take full advantage of the entire 16:10 screen resolution (1280x800) and instead had to settle for 16:9 (1280x720), resulting in black bars at the top and bottom of the screen. And while the game can set at 60 or 90 FPS in the main menu it is functionally it is locked to 30 FPS regardless of what you set. There are other issues I could mention, like the game locking up for a second when transitioning to certain areas.

VERDICT: Worth playing if you're a diehard Silent Hill fan and have a system that can actually run it, such as a Steamdeck. Otherwise, skip it.

It took me about 13 hours to beat—that is with some unnecessary backtracking, dying a few times, and getting stuck on a puzzle once. Playing through it efficiently (but not rushing) I would expect it to take around 10+ hours to beat. There are two difficulty settings (Normal and Hard) and multiple endings with corresponding outfit unlocks, lending the game some replayability.


ORIGINAL REVIEW:

This port is a total mess:

*It's locked at 30 fps (fixable with a fan-made patch).

*While it can run at high resolutions—I tested up to 4k—without any patches, selecting resolutions above 720p clips off sections of the in-game map (fixable with a fan-made patch up to 1080p at least).

*Controller icons default to generic 1-2-3-4 buttons (can swap these to PS or XBox buttons with a fan-made patch).

*If you are running the game on very modern hardware (I think more recent multi-core processors cause this but I'm not entirely sure) your character will just freeze when a cutscene is supposed to trigger. This happens to me very early on after putting in a passcode to open a door. This is not fixable with a fan-made patch. I tried wiping the game from my hard drive and all config changes that had been made by the patches and doing a complete re-install, but even then, this problem still occurs. At least I only wasted $5 instead of the normal asking price of 40!

column8:
The bad port of a very good game can be a bit frustrating, otherwise I do LOVE the game itself. It can often be found on sale and ON SALE it is a quite fun if you can handel to occasional irrtants due to the lazy port.  If they put in 3.00$ worth of effort in the port then you should only reward them with 3$...then laugh at them when they complain that lazy ports are due to poor PC sales. That's because most PC gamers expect more quality than console jocks. If ya gonna port it to PC at least put in the effort of the pricetag.

Still. the game is great fun and I experioenced only minor irritations here and there, but overall it was pretty smooth tech wise. It deserved a MUCH better port but is still playable and enjoyable if ytou like the genre.

The PC port gives this game a bad rep. Its a mess that works most of the time but can be game breaking.  What a shame, because Homecoming is fun, combat based silent hill that when it works is pretty satisfying. If you like the first movie you'll probably see through the crap and appriciate what we have on steam. Its not like the earlier games, and doesnt have the same replayablity but its better than later titles in the series. Dont buy on steam unless its very on sale the original price is insane.

column8:
Very good game but a with a terrible pc port.
Out of the box it was locked at 24fps and looked...well...not very good, it took some fiddling to get the best out of it but it was worth it (the reason why it looks like I haven't even played 2 hours is because of that, I had to run the game from a different .exe to get it to run at 60fps).
Nice story, nice setting and very cool enemies design, it's true that it's different from the others SL, but that doesn't mean it's necessarilly bad.

If you decide to play it try to get\do these things before starting:
1) 60fps patch
2) Custom buttons patch, so that you can have xbox or ps4 buttons during the quick events
3) Film grain patch
4) There are some nice SweetFx presets out there
5) Downscale the game from at least 2560x1400 to 1920x1080

It doesnt matter how powerful of a pc you have, when entering new areas your pc WILL freeze momentarily and you will get the occasional crash. Its very unfortunate. Love the game, hate the port

column8: O jogo em sí é muito bom,mas existe vários bugs que atrapalham na jogabilidade

Hometown horror at its finest, easily worth the on-sale price.

Many people consider Silent Hill: Homecoming to be the black sheep of the franchise, and perfectly understandably why. But it's personally one of my favorite games in the franchise and I believe is easily worth the on-sale price. (The game released in 2008 and the last time it was on store shelves it was only valued for $5 or less, hence not worth $39.99.)

column8:
Just say no. Your brain will tell you it is only £2 and that it is worth it. It isn't.

It controls like your character is trying to run through a swamp even when he is on dry land.

The game is basically linear and takes little to no thought to actually proceed unlike the well thought out puzzles from the original games.

The enemies are basically ripped straight from the movies which is just wrong. I personally quite like the movies but I also think the games are better and that the movies and games should be kept completely seperate. They clearly just wanted some busty nurses in the game because boobs sell.

Then you've got the bugs which range from annoying as hell such as the items and map images not showing properly so you see like one quarter of the top and nothing else.

OR they go straight to the number one worst thing that a game can do in my own opinion and that is it completely and utterly ignored my attempts to save the game and I was forced to start again after I closed it down.

Making me repeat parts of games I've already done is number one on my list of unforgivable problems. Which when we are talking about repeating this sack of shite......well there is only one solution to that. Uninstall it and never touch it again. 

Which is what I've done.

column8:
Buen juego pero no un buen silent hill por la mecanica de combate  , tremenda banda sonora de parte de akira yamaoka , los enemigos , sonidos de fondo , lugares , todo me hizo cagarme del miedo cada puto segundo , los jefes brutales sobre todo la scarlett una hija de su puta madre , tremenda jefaza , si eres FAN DE SILENT HILL COMO YO  COMPRALO , si solo lo quieres jugar por ser un juego de terror o survival horror para llevarte sustos no lo compres  , por el tema de los crasheos y mala optimizacion .

lo Bueno

-Banda sonora de hermoza y brutal de akira yamaoka <3
-Los jefes estan brutales
-Los puzzles que te haran romperte la cabeza 
-Situaciones de terror que te haran saltar y gritar 
-Historia no buena como las otras entregas pero me gusto mucho saber que hay un pueblo al costado del mismisimo silent hill 



Sus contras

-Se crashea en partes importantes
-Mal optimizado
-se le cierra ha algunos 
-casi al final se pone lento o se paraliza muy molesto

I've played for 40 minutes and came across a game breaking glitch where a key I picked up doesn't show in my inventory. Therefore, can't proceed anymore after the fourth or fifth area on the first level. Buyer beware.

column8:
Ce jeu me semble pas mauvais, par rapport au ancien silent hill, même si oui il est pas non plus incroyable, surtout qu'il est bloquer sur du 30 FPS, c'est quand même un jeux pc, et une manette qui fonctionne pas complètement, il existé déjà des jeux avec une config manette déjà préinstaller :/

Je le recommande quand même, je ne peut pas le comparé à ce cher silent hill 2 :D mais c'est un jeu qui reste jouable, ayant pour même thème, et surtout un principe comme toujours, une ville brumeuse, remplie de démons qui n'est qu'autres que SILENT HILL.

Honestly, like SH4 before, this game gets some undue hate.  It's a pretty alright entry into the Silent Hill pantheon.  The 'gut punch' at the end, isn't much of one, as it's telegraphed very early.  Still, has some surprisingly tense sequences and odd-ball SH characterizations that the series is known for.

To the technical side, on W10, this game is a nightmare.  It will crash, at least on my system, if you try and run the game at 1080p/144hz.

I'm running a 290x on an overclocked 8320@4.2 on a native 1080p 144hz panel, but the game will crash if you go above 720p or change the refresh rate over 60hz to 144hz.  This is a pretty common problem in W10, if you look it up.

There are a plethora of 'fixes', but I dunno that I would trust someone's rando executable proferred on the internet.

What I did instead:

There is an OpenGL wrapper called WineD3D for Windows.  Yes, that WINE.  Linux WINE has been ported to windows to provide an OpenGL wrapper for DirectX in a Windows environment.  Sounds crazy, but this game is a great example case for why this wrapper exists.

It's way simpler and safer than using weird executables from rando's on the internet.  You just put the WINE wrapper in the location of the executable, and you are off and running. 

In this case, you want to use: d3d9.dll, libwine.dll, wined3d.dll.  Put them in "\Silent Hill Homecoming\Bin".

There is probably a performance hit for doing this, but it should be pretty negligible.

column8:
[h1]WARNING: DO NOT BUY THIS ON PC![/h1]

[b][u]Full live stream of the game here[/u][/b]: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=VxUSRPXivfk

[h1]Pros:[/h1]
[list][*]interesting story
[*]crazy, unique, and bizarre enemy/boss types
[*]spoopy atmosphere, with a few good jump scares that got me pretty good[/list]

[h1]Neutral:[/h1]
[list][*]it's an older game, so expect dated graphics that not everyone will enjoy 
[*]poor lip sync, and sometimes lackluster voice performance
[*]no auto-saves, and you can only save at specific locations - at times they were spaced fine, but a few times a couple more locations would have been nice to prevent backtracking[/list]

[h1]Cons:[/h1]
[list][*]constantly crashes when alt-tabbing and also during loading, not to mention the very long load times (even running on an M.2) - [i]after installing a fan-made patch, the crashes seemed to be much less frequent though[/i]
[*]constantly experiences game freezing when trying to save, load, or anytime a cutscene is about to start playing,  as well as some other random frame drops here and there (Win10, GTX 1070 TI, i7-6700k, 32GB RAM)
[*]the audio is sometimes broken, and you can only hear it in mono instead of stereo; on top of that the soundtrack just feels very awkward and out of place during many of the dialog scenes
[*]combat feels incredibly sluggish and clunky, and it can be extremely frustrating on some of the encounters; this frustration can be even further amplified due to the VERY limited health and ammo in some areas[/list]

[h1]Conclusion:[/h1]
Seriously, whatever you do, do not play this on PC. The PC port is absolutely terrible. I am almost positive that I would have enjoyed it FAR more had I played on console. That being said, even without the sheer brokenness of the PC port, this game is bound to infuriate some people with the combat.

column8:
Long story short: It's like watching a good friend die of an incurable disease. Long after their death, just thinking about it angers you because you know there was nothing you could do...

Silent Hill: Homecoming is a 3rd-person survival horror. After a long military campaign, Alex comes back to his hometown Sherperd's Glen. However, when he does come back, the whole town is covered in fog, almost everyone is missing and dark creatures roam the streets. As you try to figure out what's going on, you'll be solving puzzles, fighting monsters and finding items to help you along the way.

For a game that was made in 2008, it didn't look so bad. Facial animations did receive a nice polish. Monsters were well designed. The map layout and decoration weren't over-done. The Otherworld, which was based on the movie, looked nice and provided a nice light show with decent shadows. Since this game was made with the PS3 in mind, I'm not sure the PC version can really do justice to what the devs wanted. It might look smoother on a PS3. All in all, I had no major complaints about the graphics.

Long time composer since the serie's start, Akira Yamaoka makes a rather lukewarm comeback after Team Silent's disbandment. Sound effects and ambient songs do sounds nice, but feels pale compared to his previous works. On a technical level, the PC port is fixed to use 5.1 surround sound. If you don't have that option on your soundcard or don't own  5.1 headphone/speaker, you'll be forced to play with volume playing only in 1 ear for 95% of every sounds. And of course, there's no ingame option for that or any possible INI tweaks.

From here on, it gets worse. This version of Homecoming is an exemplified rushed PC port. It was a datadump in an attempt to recoup the losses of the PS3 version selling poorly and receiving low review scores. Once it was released it never received any update whatsoever, even if the forums seemed to be flooded with problems back then.

One problem in particular was an UI bug that prevented progress because you couldn't interact with a certain object in Alex's house. The only solution found by the community was to use a controller just for this one time and then switch back to KB/M. Even to this day, the issue is still present in the game.

The game will sometimes hang for many long seconds before resuming, even if nothing note-worthy seemed to be happening. This happened during combat, often just before enemies attacked. This also happened in cut-scenes...

There's keyboard and mouse support, but you've got those button-mashing QTE's on every corner. Then you switch to controller, but controller support is pre-historic-tier XInput support. There is no button icon in the game. i.e. Push "BUTTON 1" to activate. Push "BUTTON 10" to open menu, etc. Lastly, there's no camera sensitivity option for joystick input and it's set to very slow. So yeah, you pretty much have no choice but to use keyboard, but you still need a controller to pass that UI glitch mentioned above. oof.

After getting over all those problems, I finished the game. The game in general is a far cry from previous entries. There's not much exploring to do, there's not much variety of weapons and enemy encounters feel far in-between. The very first ending I got was the UFO ending... This type of ending is supposed to be seen after your first playthough yet it's the one I got. The game ended on a silly note before I could see the serious side of the story. Finishing the game In previous SH had a stats screen which showed what ending you got, how much time you took, how many enemies killed, etc. There's none of that in Homecoming.

So, let's sum all that up real quick.
- Not-so-bad graphics and sounds
- Stutter/hangups everywhere
- Botched 5.1 sound
- Poor controls
- Game breaking UI bug
- Short and linear, shallow gameplay
- Silly endings possible right from the start
- No stats screen at the end, very few unlockables.
- Was never patched
- Still being sold at a high price on Steam, even if other websites sell it for peanuts.

Steam did not do refunds back then, so I was stuck with it. There was no pre-order option, so I bought this on day-1 for 45$ usd like a giant mongoloid SH fanboy that I am. You'd think that a company like Konami with game franchises like Metal Gear and Castlevania would uphold a certain quality standard for their popular franchise, yet they clearly dropped the ball on this one.

This is what happens when you disband the original serie developpers and outsource the game's right to foreign devs. With limited time/budget and different view on the source material, the game feels rough and almost unfinished.  And this botched PC port just made things worse.

I cannot recommend this game due to it being an horrible PC port and a shallow SH experience. I rate this a solid 3/10, loose ##ERROR## out of 10.

If you're interested in the history of the SH serie, watch the videos below.
https://youtu.be/V7apuW_2lIE
https://youtu.be/xbr_vyayk2E

Rest in pieces. ;_;

column8: Je vais pas répéter ce qui a déjà été mentionné dans les autres évaluations mais ce portage Windows est tellement chaotique qu'il est évidemment impossible de le recommander malgré les qualités du jeu. Si vous avez la patience pour installer des patchs fait par la communauté et bidouiller des réglages à la limite pourquoi pas, mais même là rien ne garanti le bon fonctionnement du bousin.

Great story, can't hate the controls more than i do, but it's a really nice game! The problem is that if you buy this version of it you will have to google how to fix the game before you can even play it! I've had to download a 500 MB patch that was comunity made, just to have the sounds in the game work. Then i had to download a custom file to be able to play it in my native resolution (2560x1440). This works wonders now that i've got it working, but still the game freezes often, mostly when you save, but also randomly. 

I'll leave everyting you need to fix this game to work for you here:
Link to PC Gaming Wiki, here you will find how to fix the game so you can play in 60 fps, also, you will be able to fix graphical glitches and other really nasty bugs that the developers didn't care to fix. https://www.pcgamingwiki.com/wiki/Silent_Hill:_Homecoming

To fix the sound you'll need to download a .EXE file to patch the game, it's 500 MB. Here is a steam forum thread on how to do this, also how to fix it if you are not using 5.1 which this game need in order to function properly in the sound department. I got a headset that is 5.1, but stil it doesn't not work, so you will need to use this patch if you have problems as well: https://steamcommunity.com/app/19000/discussions/0/2381701715732937446/

Otherwise i would say this game is really amazing in terms of sound, gameplay and just everything about it is great, except for the controlls, i play with a controller but it's really not that great cause you cannot do anyting about the poor sensitivit. 

I would give it a 4/10, this cause it's a crappy port, that the comunity had to fix, that's a shame, but i guess Konami really is a shit company.

column8:
Sou um grande fã de Silent Hill e já joguei quase todos os títulos da série, só falta o Downpour pra mim. 
Sou suspeito pra falar sobre esse jogo, pois SH pra mim é sinônimo de arrepios, sem dúvida é a série de games mais perturbadora que eu já joguei. Mas Homecoming deixou um pouco a desejar.

Peguei o jogo em promoção por 5 reais e por isso valeu bastante o pequeno investimento. O jogo é legal, mas não é a maravilha que se espera de SH. A começar pela péssima otimização. Mais horripilante que os seres que você enfrenta, são os congelamentos que o jogo te proporciona constantemente. Você tá andando e do nada o jogo CONGELA COMPLETAMENTE (no meu caso, por até 1 minuto), mas depois volta. Té dá aquele gelo e você pensa "putz, vou ter que passar toda essa parte de novo". Se isso acontecer, não se desespere, apenas tenha paciência e espere o jogo voltar ao normal. Acontecia comigo toda hora que eu ia salvar o jogo, mas também aconteceu muito em momento aleatórios.

Os gráficos de Homecoming são OK para a época, mas me pareceu que a dedicação nessa parte foi meio aleatória, tem horas que o seu personagem Alex parece muito bem feito, e outras horas ele fica zoadão, parecendo gráfico de PS2 (lembrando que esse jogo saiu na geração Xbox 360 e PS3).

O sistema de batalha do jogo é travado demais, tem horas que dá raiva lutar contra qualquer inimigo. Aliás, também achei que o design de monstros desse jogo ficou um pouco aquém. Alguns personagens icônicos fazem sua aparição como as enfermeiras e o Pyramid Head [spoiler](esse só dá o ar da graça mesmo, você nunca chega a lutar contra ele)[/spoiler].

Os puzzles do jogo são relativamente fáceis se você souber inglês. 

O sistema de inventário até que é bom, mas um pouco desajeitado, pois se você apenas aponta, por exemplo, para um "serum", que é um item que recupera sua energia totalmente, se você sair do menu de itens apontando esse item, ele é usado automaticamente. Aconteceu isso comigo várias vezes, quando eu nem queria usar o item, acabei desperdiçando vários. O item deveria ser usado somente após apertar algum outro botão confirmando. 

A sincronia das falas dos personagens e do próprio som em geral às vezes fica bem fora na hora das cutscenes, o que atrapalha um pouco a ambientação.  

A história não tem nada de muito original. O jogo tem 5 finais diferentes, que variam conforme algumas decisões que você toma no decorrer do jogo. As escolhas que eu tomei me deram o final pior de todos, na minha opinião.

Só falei mal do jogo, mas estou recomendando, porque afinal de contas ele possuiu todos os elementos que tornaram Silent Hill um sucesso. Ao finalizar o game e ficar vendo os créditos com o nome de toda a equipe que desenvolveu o jogo, fiquei pensativo, pois eles devem ter trabalhado muito pra lançar o jogo, mas ao mesmo tempo fico pensando que eles poderiam ter feito melhor.

Mas, novamente, paguei 5 reais, não posso reclamar muito.
No likey
column9: No likey

column8:
I wish I could give a sideways thumb here or a 'Buyer Beware' tag here. ONLY buy this on sale and if you have a lot of patience. 

Anyone who knows me, knows that I am one of the many diehard Silent Hill fans out there. I have the maps of the town memorized and sometimes secretly hope that they'll make a Lakeside Amusement Park for us all to geek around in with our pyramid head and robbie the rabbit swag. I'm a HUGE fan. 

But I digress. This version of the game is horribly ported. It crashes a lot and many people cannot even make it past one of the first cutscenes where you are riding with a truck driver. The game just dies there.

I've been able to make it past that part with a lot of patience and even beat the game!! It was not easy by any means as the game seems to fight you every step of the way. 

What I was able to play, I enjoyed. I liked the story and found most of the mechanics seems to work well enough. The only problem I had was with the creatures that have scissor/knife legs. No matter what I tried, they were just a huge pain to deal with. 

Overall, I liked it. But this game is really a huge mess and should only be attempted by people who can really take a lot of abuse from a game LOL. It's worth a once through, if you can make it to the end. <3

column8:
El juego está muy lejos de ser perfecto, por las siguientes razones: 
-La optimización es horrible. 
-Hay bugs, y no pocos. Aunque ninguno de ellos me ha obligado a reiniciar la partida o me ha impedido continuar. 
-Puede dar pantallazos que llegan a durar hasta 10 segundos. 
-Los fps son más o menos estables, aunque hay zonas en las que caen un poco. 
-Las pantallas de carga son interminables. Tendrás que tragarte unas cuantas 
,una y otra vez, si te atascas contra un enemigo que no hace más que matarte. 
-El sistema de combate es un poco raro. Puede llegar a ser caótico y frustrante si no te acostumbras. 

A pesar de todos estos errores, el juego vale la pena, sobre todo si te gusta el survival horror. 
La ambientación está muy lograda, llega a ser muy perturbadora. La historia está cargada de misterio, simbolismo, y metáforas. 
Me costó 3 euros en rebajas, y no creo que valga más.
Game keeps crashing and i don't know why
column9: Game keeps crashing and i don't know why

column8: Basura infecta, super mal optimizado, no para de crasehar NO COMPREIS ESTO.

Só compre este jogo se estiver afim de passar raiva.
Para citar alguns bugs: crash ao minimizar, crashes aleatórios, bugs em resoluções maiores que 720p, comandos resetam ao carregar um savegame, loadings extremamente demorados, FPS drop muito grande em um jogo que deveria ser leve na teoria, comandos de Quick Time Event aparecem errados na tela. 
Gostaria de fazer uma análise profunda da história do jogo, mas não consegui zerá-lo graças aos crashes, que vão se tornando cada vez mais comuns conforme avança. A única crítica que posso fazer da história é o fato do Pyramid Head aparecer, sério? Faltou criatividade para criar um personagem legal? Pyramid Head é uma representação da mente de James em Silent Hill 2 e só. É um personagem legal e tudo mais, mas não faz sentido a aparição dele nesse jogo.

EDIT (15/11/18): foi lançado um fix esses dias que corrige quase tudo isso que foi citado na análise:
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1280019463
Isso somado a colocar a qualidade de áudio do Windows na menor possível corrige no mínimo os crashes, deixando o jogo bem mais legal de se jogar e poder aproveitar ao máximo a experiência.
B R O K E N
MUITO BOM O JOGO, UM POUCO LENTO A MOVIMENTAÇÃO MAS DA PARA ACOSTUMAR.

After watching the movie, I was very enthusiastic to play the game, after years, on my computer. The game thrusts players into a shadowy world of chaos and scary nurses. 

After playing the game for a few hours I noticed some bugs (like walls that can’t be opened or monsters who won’t die), to fix the bug you got to close the game and restart it than you will get respawned at your last saving point. After a few times repeating the level did it got annoying. One of the other problems is that you must choose between audio or subtitles, do you choose subtitles than you won’t have any audio or sometimes you don’t have audio at all. The graphics are okay (shadows, details, etc.), but you can’t play it on big screen. Another detail that I missed was that whenever I cut one of the nurses with my knife, I did not saw any blood, but hey, that can be me. 

The game has a good storyline and the puzzles are not too difficult.

Každý ma na tuhle hru jiný názor. Je jasný, že na PS3 se to hrálo o dost líp než na PC, ale dohrát se to dá v obou případech. 
Kamera je trochu blbě nastavená, ale dá se to přežít.  Ze začátku mi dělala problém celkově hratelnost, ale po čase se do toho člověk dostane. Hru jsem dohrála a mile mě překvapila. Má skutečně zajímavý příběh a docela dobře na sebe vše navazuje. Ovšem jsou tam i nedostatky a pár věcí nevysvětlených.

Somewhat good story but awful performance, even the PS3 version was more stable.

Edit: There are some fan made patches that make this game somewhat playable. I recommend the one that doubles the frame rate (since this game is hard capped at 30 and still drops frames sometimes), and the button overlay mod.

Even with the patches the game still sometimes crashes out of nowhere, resolutions higher than 1080p completely breaks the UI, also QTEs are sometimes broken... if you get pinned by an enemy that requires you to press a certain button to escape, you can just watch your health get drained until you die because QTEs never prompted.

The dodge mechanic is a bit bugged. Even if you time it perfectly sometimes you still get hit, other times you dodge perfectly fine. Moving and shooting is wacky... like you can't adjust your aim while moving and vice versa.

By the time I finished this game, 100% of my deaths came from broken QTE prompts that never showed up so I was just pinned by an enemy and unable to escape until my character's health got drained to 0.

Oh stun locks are also a thing, if you're not careful you can easily get stun locked by an enemy. Trying to dodge away will result in you just getting interrupted mid dodge over and over, I recommend the knife or pipe if you're getting cornered against a wall and getting stun locked.

One last thing, the save file does not get backed up on steam cloud so if you happen to uninstall this game, then reinstall it you have to start all over again so if anything back up your game's save before uninstalling it.

Also for some reason this game is still 40$ and it came out in 2008... and it's a broken buggy mess. So avoid it completely unless it's like 90% off. Otherwise it's not worth your money or time because trust me you're gonna want to pull your hair out while playing this. You've been warned. Lol

Everything about this game is a steaming pile of feces. And the $40 price is an insult to basically the entire human race. I'd rather buy $40 worth of dirt cookies from kids in Africa and eat them in 1 sitting than try to play this broken garbage.

 It crashes, the little fatality animation with the saw when you stab it into someone and it makes a reving noise, stays in that spot like it's still happening for 30 minutes everytime you walk past it. 30fps cap, corrupted saves, worst of the worst keyboard controls, long load times on a $1200 PC all for $40, long drawn out saves to lose progess when you die, how lucky are we.

Soy un amante de la saga Silent Hill, lamentablemente mi experiencia con el juego no fue positiva.
No puedo creer la cantidad de bugs que tiene el juego, jamás pude jugarlo sin al menos tener 1 error, aún así teminé el juego. La historia es buena pero con un final predesible. 
Tiene aspéctos muy divertidos como: EL MODO DE PELEA
Jamás había experimentado esta satisfacción de golpear a los mounstros de silent hill, por lo general, en los juegos pasados, sentía un poco de temor o miedo antes los mounstros o jefes, pero en este juego el modo de pelea es muy parecido al de un BOXEADOR, dando golopes y esquevando con movimientos de cadera, esta parte es lo que más me gustó.
Pero al final, fue un juego que no disfruté, sentí que le faltavan cosas, el final no es tan bueno.

Puede que no sea mi Silent Hill favorito pero es el unico que tenemos disponible en Steam

Homecoming reune todo lo clasico y lo compacta para entregarnos un juego bastante completo, aunque su historia no sea su fuerte aqui encontraremos muchos guiños a las anteriores entregas de Silent Hill, asi los mas nostalgicos logramos ir conectando vinculos a medida que avanza la historia. Graficamente esta bastante bueno para ser del 2008, aun que este bloqueado a 30 FPS se puede arreglar descargando un parche. Hay ciertos lugares que estan mal optimizados ya que mezclan el efecto de transicion entre mundos por lo que genera una gran carga y lo que definitivamente no me gusto fue

- Analisis.exe dejo de funcionar 
- Restarting...

Lo que no me gusto de esta version de Steam es el port ya que es inestable y genera varios momentos de frustracion en especial cuando no as guardado en bastante tiempo, Konami tiene una gran deuda por no tener disponible la coleccion de Silent Hill aqui en Steam y espero que algun dia page esa deuda.

Recomendado!
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9OrS5Ym6vzU
column9: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9OrS5Ym6vzU

column8:
Neste jogo controlamos o protagonista Alex Shepard que desde o começo ja se vemos em um pesadelo mas que ao despertar estamos em um maior que aos poucos vem a tona com tensao e desespero em um busca de um irmao desaparecido nas entranhas de uma cidade marcada por uma maldição que logo nos damos conta que um desconhecido lugar denominado Silent Hill esta envolvido.

Konami e suas decisões(não basta e assim continua sendo):não é de hoje que vemos que konami nao esta nem ai para sagas como silent hill.Assim ja estao disponibilizando meros games para mobile pois querendo dispor do obvio propiamente dito arriscaram o todo por Silent Hill's dando o fim de uma marca que ja foi merecida por muitos.Espero muito uma coletana completa da saga na steam e Hideo Kojima compartilhando seus direitos de volta com konami mas infelizmente o abuso e a ira desta distribuidora sera a ruina no final de uma grande marca que fez parte de minha biblioteca do horror no passado e ainda hoje.

Silent Hill Homecoming admite ser um game dificil de dissolver com uma jogabilidade diferenciada de seus antecessores mas com uma historia crucial e elementar de seus ambos com o grande e ilustre compositor Akira Yamaoka que deu luz a atmosfera perfeita a este game que,assim sendo,composto por boas formulas mas formulado por pequenas rejeiçoes não partilhadas!

column8:
Konami 2004 yılında çıkan Silent Hill 4: The Room'un satış başarısızlığından sonra (Halbuki enfes bir oyundu) aptal bir karar alarak serinin yapımcılığını kendi ülkesi Japonya'dan alıp Amerika'ya verdikten sonra vasat Origins, Shattered Memories çıktı. Daha sonrasında efsane bestekar Akira Yamaoka'nın son kez bulunduğu bu yapım bizleri bekliyordu. Oyun, hikaye ve anlatım olarak efsane iken, kontroller, canavarların önceki oyunlara göre kötü oluşu, bir eksiklik bulundurması ile de kötüydü.

Oyun, Alex Shepherd adlı karakterimizin askeri üniformasıyla hastaneye ne olduğu belirsiz adamın getirmesi, Pyramid Head'in görünüşüyle başlıyor. Daha sonrasında eve geldiğimizde tüm kasabanın adeta yok olduğunu, neredeyse birkaç kişinin kaldığını, annemize büyük hüzün bastığını görüyoruz. Daha öncesinde hastanede gördüğümüz kardeşimiz Joshua'nın kayıp, babamızın da onu bulmaya gittiğini öğrendikten sonra biz de kardeşimizi bulma yoluna çıkıyoruz. Bu yolda genel olarak Babamız çok büyük günahkar olarak gözükecek ve neredeyse intikam nefreti duyacağız.

Medium is the message. Yani basit olan iyidir mantığıyla yazılıyor tüm Silent Hill oyunları. İlk oyunda bir araba kazasıyla kızımız kayboluyorken, ikinci oyunda 3 yıl önce ölmüş eşimizden mektup aldıktan sonra onu arıyoruz. Bunda ise kardeşimiz ve babamız kayıp. Her oyun Silent Hill kasabasında geçen iken ilk defa 4 (ki aslında Silent Hill olarak tasarlanmadı) tamamıyla farklı bir yerde geçmişti. Bu oyun ise kendi kasabamızda ve Silent Hill'de geçiyor ve aynı duyguları, korkuyu, gerilimi vermeyi de ihmal etmiyor. Origins'te ve Downpour'da çiğnenen Otherworld ve Silent Hill kuralları bu oyunda çiğnenmiyor olması da bir artı veriyor.

Tam bir Silent Hill oyunu olmasından bahsetmişken şöyle ufak bir spoiler verelim, gidişat ve final Silent Hill 2 ile aynı. Yani bildiğimiz Scripti sadece değiştirmişler diyelim. Nasıl ki Star Wars 7 ve 8, 4 ve 5'in neredeyse aynısıysa bu da aynen öyle. Bu, kötü bir şey değil hatta tam tersine bu oyun özelinde konuşursak efsane bir şey. Finali o kadar vurucu ki hem boğazınızda armut kalmışçasına üzülüyor, hem noluyor deyip olaylara anlam veremiyor oyunu bitirdikten sonra da niye böyle oldu diye düşünüp duruyorsunuz. İşte bu gerçek Silent Hill. Oyunu oynayın ve bu finali yaşayın derim.

Hem Steam'de hem başka platformlarda yaklaşık 300 kadar oyun bitirdim. Silent Hill'in havası her zaman farklı olmuştur. Steam açısından diğer SH oyunlarının bulunmaması büyük hata. Bu oyun ise PC'de gerçekten çok sorunlu. Laglı olması, kontrollerin aşırı kötü olması ve köstek olması, 30 FPS kilidinin olması vesaire vesaire. Bunlar oyun zevkinizi fazlasıyla bozacak özellikler. Ancak bunları bir yana bıraktığınızda ve hikayeye kitlendiğinizde (ki kitletiyor) fazlasıyla gizemli ve sürükleyici bir durumun içine kayboluyorsunuz.

Bundan sonrası SPOILERLIDIR.
[spoiler] Ailemizden izlere rastlıyoruz. Mesela babamızın silahı tamir edilemiyor, kardeşimizin "Beni affet" yazısıyla saatini bulunca aniden Silent Hill'e çıkıyoruz. Her şey birer birer geliyor ve sizi fazlasıyla merak ettiriyor. En son annemiz de babamızın yerini işaretlediğinde artık babamızdan intikam alabileceğimizi düşünüyoruz. Abinle oynama, o kendi arkadaşlarıyla oynasın deyip kardeşimizden bizleri uzaklaştıran ve belki de kardeşimizin ölümüne sebep olan babamızdan intikam alacağımız için mutluyduk ta ki finale kadar değil mi? Bu oyunu sevenler bu yapıyı sevenler Oldboy ve The Return filmlerine mutlaka ama mutlaka baksın. Finalde aslında kardeşimizi kendimiz öldürdüğümüzü, bir asker olmadığımızı, kardeşimizi öldürdükten (kaza ile de olsa) iyice delirip kafayı sıyırdığımızı, uyandığımızda da bir asker olduğumuzu sandığımızı anlıyoruz. Ve evet çok ürpertici değil mi?	[/spoiler]

8/10

Not only is this a terrible port requiring innumerous patches to make work, the game in general is a steaming pile of goats. The worst American SH game, but that's like comparing poop to slightly less smelly poop considering the low bar of quality shovelled out since SH3. Avoid falling into the trap of thinking maybe I was too harsh on it last time I played and just look at this steam page as something of a relic of a time gone by.
Even if Silent Hill continued past Book of Memories would it really have been worth it? Or would it have just been crap forever and a day later? I really miss Team Silent.... :(

Quel dommage qu'il soit énormément bugué :

- Stéréo très mal gérée, un coup le son est à droite, un coup à gauche.
- Il y a des sous titres inutiles qui commentent les bruits de fond.
- Le pad xbox360 est compatible mais à l'écran on a des numéro en couleur qui n'ont rien avoir avec les touches de la manette.
- Le jeux retourne au bureau parfois et obligé d'éteindre l'ordinateur puis tout redémarrer.

Bref une expérience de jeux catastrophique.

Quite often, people mistake Silent Hill as "the first" survival horror game. While it comes close, with the first game releasing on PSX in 1999, Alone in the Dark (1992) and Resident Evil (1996) had it beaten by several years. That doesn't make Silent Hill any less of an outstanding, classic series of the beloved sub-genre, but it is a franchise that has had severe ups and downs over the last 20 years. Sadly, the once cult classic has seen more of the bad times in recent years, though 2008's Silent Hill Homecoming is truly the last decent entry.

I would love to go in to talking about the story, and how Homecoming ties in to most of the other Silent Hill games (including Origins), but to be quite blunt, I'd rather not waste your time. This is a horrendous PC port. For the first 30-40 minutes that I was playing this title, I thought the reviews were, once again, greatly exaggerated; regrettably, this is not the case. After only 50 minutes of play time, I found that I was completely stuck due to the game-breaking bookshelf bug, and I was forced to restart from my last save point... which was roughly a half-hour earlier. After scouring the forums it seems that a lot of people get stuck in bookshelf-puzzle hell, as it's quite a common problem that Konami never bothered to fix.

The game-breaking puzzle bugs are the least of this PC port's concerns, though. The audio is just abysmal, and it's almost as if the dialogue, footsteps, and sound effects were all recorded in mono; they'll only come through one speaker. The beautiful, classic-styled soundtrack is fortunate enough to play in stereo, but it completely overwhelms the narrative. The controls are another downside here, and while you can use a controller or the keyboard + mouse, the remapping likes to take a dump back to the default map every now and then. For KB + M controls, multiple interactions are mapped to the same key in some instance, which is insane.

Amazingly enough, the graphics hold up extremely well for a game that's a decade old this year. For some reason, no matter what you do or what refresh rate you set the game at, it will cap at 30 FPS. Now, typically I am a FPS nazi, and I demand good optimization of all titles that I play. That being said, the game does run smoothly at 30 FPS, and it doesn't seem that bad. There are a few guides on how to work around this setting, but in the long run it's not that big of a deal. In fact, this is the least problematic aspect of this release.

Having played Silent Hill Homecoming on Xbox 360 back when it released, I can say with confidence that it's a decent title; just not this abhorrent PC port. Konami don't even care enough about this port to adjust the pricing, $43.99 CAD is utterly mad for a game that's a decade old, and has been on Steam since its release. If you have a console, be it Playstation 3 or Xbox 360, try to hunt this game down at your local used shop, I'm sure you can grab it for $15 or less. Silent Hill Homecoming is worth at least a playthrough for fans of the series, but be warned that it's definitely not the greatest entry.

column8:
La primera vez que terminé este juego fue allá por 2008, lo tuve de salida en versión retail, y habiéndolo terminado por segunda vez hace diez minutos, me animo a escribir estas líneas tratando de darle algo de redención a lo que considero un gran juego, pero un pésimo port.

Silent Hill Homecoming, como juego de terror es genial, ya que además de sentirte angustiado y en tensión a cada momento por la excelente atmósfera; también te sientes angustiado y en tensión en la vida real, ya que en cualquier momento te puede saltar un crasheo random, sobre todo en las pantallas de carga, para las que te recomiendo un rosario y todas las oraciones que te sepas... Es así, ¡la maldad de Silent Hill traspasa límites!

Ahora en serio, habrás leído muchos análisis negativos por allí donde se critica lo mal porteado que está este juego; y déjame decirte que no es así de malo: Es mucho mucho peor... ya que además de enfrentar estos 'sudden crashes' en esta versión de PC, lidiarás con defectos de port tales como que está capado a 30 FPS, tendrás que jugarlo a 720p si es que quieres ver completo el mapa, tendrás que aplicar un parche para ver los botones correctos si es que juegas con mando (algo que recomiendo encarecidamente), y tendrás que salvar OBLIGATORIAMENTE en cada punto de guardado que te encuentres, ya que el juego además que se te puede cerrar en cualquier momento, cuenta con bugs de diseño que te rompen la partida, y te pueden obligar a reiniciar todo si es que no tuviste la precaución de guardar en distintos slots. Estos bugs se encuentran también en las versiones de consola, y lo peor es que el juego está abandonado por parte de Konami hace mucho y no existen ni existirán parches que lo arreglen. Para sobrellevarlos, recomiendo revisar la guía de "Berserker" que se puede encontrar en los sitios de FAQs más populares, donde se enumeran detalladamente y se dan tips para evitarlos.

Ahora bien, los cierres inesperados no son tan frecuentes como lo pintan otros análisis, te darás cuenta que si te topas con uno de ellos (y créeme que lo harás, es inevitable), notarás que será muy improbable que te topes con otro en la misma sesión, o en las siguientes horas. Y si te armas de una santa paciencia, puedes manejar estas frustraciones de la mejor manera: Por ejemplo, si te topas con un cierre inesperado, y tu partida guardada más reciente está como media hora atrás, haz lo siguiente: Luego de mandar al carajo a los desarrolladores y a toda su familia, reinicias el juego, cargas la partida y recorres nuevamente el largo camino, pero esta vez, al haber ya aprendido la ruta a seguir, los patrones de los enemigos que te aparecerán y la forma de afrontar cada desafío de la mejor manera, al llegar al punto donde se te crasheó el juego, notarás... ¡oh sorpresa! que lo hiciste en el menor tiempo posible y optimizando al máximo los recursos de los que dispusiste hasta ese momento.

¡Ojo! Con estos consejos no estoy justificando la decepcionante optimización del juego, pero estoy tratando de salvarlo de la quema por una simple y llana razón: La historia y ambientación es una maravilla.

Si con todo lo dicho hasta aquí, estás dispuesto a empezarlo (cosa que me alegra sobremanera), verás que te encontrarás con un juego sobrecogedor; con un control mejorado con respecto a los juegos anteriores de la saga, a pesar de que las animaciones en los combates se vean torpes; con personajes bien escritos y con una historia magnífica, secuela directa de la saga principal y de las mejores de la misma. No por nada el protagonista comparte similitudes con el de SH2, el considerado mejor juego de toda la saga, y hasta 'Cabeza Piramidal' hace un par de cameos estelares, esto en parte porque  al momento de su salida se había estrenado en cines la primera película de la saga, donde dicho enemigo también hacía su aparición, y por esto mismo es que algunos aspectos audiovisuales se tomaron de la misma, tales como el sonido de la sirena y el efecto de degradación en cada transformación del mundo real al otro mundo, o el diseño del cartel de ingreso a las dos ciudades que visitamos en el transcurso del juego.

Para terminar, a pesar de todo lo mal optimizado que está, del muy mal port que es, de la casi obligatoriedad de tener que usar una guía para evitar glitches, recomiendo este juego por la maravillosa historia y ambientación. Eso sí, ni de cojones a precio completo, ya que se suele ofertar muy a menudo en todas las campañas que acostumbra Steam, y a muy bajo precio. (Yo lo obtuve a aprox US$ 3.00).

"Los viejos dioses... no han dejado este lugar".

ACTUALIZACIÓN: Con el parche de UnknowProject mejora notablemente mi calificación.

Silent hill is not worth $17.99 due to crashing on loading screens and for a game that was realised in 2009. In my opinion the xbox 360 version is much better. 

It crashed many times on different loading screens causing me to load in to my last save which is very disappointing especially when i have to go through the same stage of the game over and over again.

If you are wanting to buy this game i would recommend you have a lot of patience and you buy it from G2A because it is alot cheaper.

column8:
I wrote out a wall of text for this review but decided to scrap it. The game really is how the negative reviews describe it (I'm writing this review right after completion). It has not only made me mad but really sad too. If you don't consider the porting there is some potential in there but it is underwhelming in every aspect - from combat to story to game design. It would all be bearable and would be a simple mediocre experience if it wasn't for the bad port. The very few good moments and choices in the game unfortunately are not able to carry all this mess all the way along.

If you really want to experience a weak and sad homage to the Silent Hill [b]movie[/b] (very important distinction to be made) then make sure to get it on Xbox and definitely not on the PC. It is playable there (if I heard it right) and might provide some hours of entertainment but personally I find it questionable to support a publisher who releases this SH game of all on the PC as of now and especially in such a state. It is really sad and disappointing. Watching a walkthrough might be more entertaining than actually playing it.

I'll definitely never replay it again.

column8:
Optimizasyonu kötü bir oyun. Halihazırdaki bilgisayarım (Artık eski bilgisayarım: GT 320M ekran kartı, 4 GB RAM ve Core 2 Duo 2.4 GHz işlemcisi vardı) bu oyunu en düşük ayarlarda ve hiç değilse 640*480 çözünürlükte ve 30 kare hızında sabitlenmiş halde oynatmalıyken cidden acayip zorlanıyor bazı yerlerde. Oyunu PS3'te de oynamış olduğum için de bu belli oluyor benim açımdan, bu yüzden PC'de pek akıl kârı olmasa da fiyatı gerçekten ucuzdu aldığımda, ayrıca orijinal bir Silent Hill oyununun koleksiyonumda bulunmasını da isterdim, keşke Silent Hill 2-3-4'ü de ekleme olasılığımız olsaydı (Dördüncü oyun GOG.com'da 2020'den beri satın alınabilir durumda bu arada. Zaten geçtiğimiz aylarda ikinci oyunun remake'i de çıktı ve Silent Hill f de yolda). 


[h1]Hangi platformlarda oynanabilir?[/h1] 
Her neyse, oynayacaksanız eğer, ilk başta PS3 ve XBOX 360'a çıktı bu oyun, birincil tercihiniz bunlardan birinde oynamak olsun veya bunlar yoksa emülatör kullanabilirsiniz belki. Ama sadece bitirmek adına Youtube'dan walkthrough videoları da izleyebilirsiniz. 

Mutlaka kendim oynayarak tecrübe edeceğim PC versiyonunu diyorsanız da sisteminizin iyi olmasında (Optimizasyon sıkıntısını hissetmemek açısından) fayda var. Ayrıca PCGamingWiki sitesinde bu oyun için açılmış sayfaya girip Unknownproject'in yamasını indirip kurarak oyunu biraz daha oynanabilir hale getirebilirsiniz. Bir başka önerim de, oyunu tam ekranda oynamamanız çünkü tam ekranda Alt+Tab yapma lüksünüz yok, oyun direkt olarak çalışmayı durdurur (Sonradan Unknownproject tarafından çözüldü diye biliyorum). Optimizasyon problemi açısından döneminin diğer oyunları ile de ortak yanları var, anlayamadım gerçekten. Bana mı öyle geliyor, yoksa 2008-2010 döneminde nevri mi dönmüş oyun yapımcılarının PC'ye port etme esnasında? Gerçi olabilir böyle hatalar ama Konami'nin veya Double Helix'in herhangi bir düzeltme uygulamadan oyunu Steam'e koyuvermesi kabul edilmemeli bana kalırsa.


[h1]Silent Hill: Homecoming'e Dair[/h1] 
Hikaye, atmosfer, oynanış ve mekanikler açısından konuşacak olursam, Silent Hill serisinde şu 5 oyunun üzerine tanımam zor: Silent Hill 1, 2, 3, 4 ve Silent Hill Origins (Shattered Memories'e dair fikirlerim değişti, artık pek de iyi değil o oyun benim için. Hatta PC port'unu saymazsak Homecoming dahi daha öne geçti benim gözümde, en azından iyi bir deneme olarak). Hikayeden tut da, mekaniklere, silahlara, hele ki şarkılara (Akira Yamaoka ve Mary Elizabeth McGlynn demem yeterlidir sanırım) kadar... Tecrübe edilmeli ya, anlatmak, bilemiyorum... Tabi konumuz Silent Hill: Homecoming olduğu için ondan bahsedeceğim altta;

Karakterimiz Alex Shepherd, bir askerdir ve bundan dolayı oyunda yakın dövüş, ataklardan kaçma ve karşı atak gerçekleştirme üzerine kurulu bir sistem var, ateşsiz silahlarda diğer Silent Hill karakterlerine göre öndesiniz (Ateşsiz silahların çeşitliliği konusunda değil tabi). Senaryo ise şöyle başlıyor: İlk başta patlamalar ve sirenler duyuyorsunuz ve değişik bir mekanda birinci görüşte etrafı izliyorsunuz. Sedyenizi süren adamın tekinsiz suratını ve kanlı giysilerini görünce birden korkuyorsunuz ve orada başka kişiler üzerinde gerçekleştirilen psikopatça eylemler, bu korkunuzu artırıyor. En sonunda bir odaya bırakılıyorsunuz ve ellerinizi bağladıkları kemerleri zorlaya zorlaya kopararak kurtuluyorsunuz ve bir süre etrafı araştırıp, bir çocuğun peşine düşüyorsunuz. Hikaye böyle böyle devam ediyor. 

Grafiklere gelince, oyunun optimizasyon sıkıntısı bir yana, özellikle 1. ile 3. oyundan gördüğümüz Otherworld atmosferini yansıtması açısından resmen yiğidi öldür hakkını yeme durumu. Silent Hill Homecoming'de en çok hoşuma giden durumlardan biri buydu. Yani şu yazdıklarımı bir düşündüm de, aslında bu oyunu ne tavsiye ederim, ne de tavsiye etmem, kararsızım yani. Birkaç paragraftır yazdıklarıma bakın, istiyorsanız alın. Eğer alırsanız hemen PCGamingWiki'de bu oyun için açılmış sayfaya girin ve Unknownproject'in yaptığı düzeltmeyi bulun, indirin ve kurun, öteki türlü canınız gerçekten sıkılacaktır bu port'un rezalet oluşundan ötürü.


[h1]Son Sözler[/h1] 
Toparlayacak olursam; grafikler, detaylar, müzikler güzel; hikaye ortanın biraz üstü; farklı farklı sonlar var, bu sonlar size farklı farklı şeyler kazandırabiliyor. Aynı zamanda optimizasyonu kötü, sağlam bir düzeltme yaması kurmanız gerekmekte. İndirimde değilken de alabilirsiniz ama tavsiye etmem, büyük indirimlerde 4.65 liraya düşüyordu fiyatı galiba, kapın gitsin (Artık maalesef bunu yapamıyoruz dolara geçişten dolayı malum, oyun maksimum 3 dolara düşüyor indirimlerde), iyi de bilgisayarınız varsa düzeltmeyle beraber FPS değerini sabitleyerek veya sabitlemeyerek oynayın işte. Bir de, aynı benim gibi serinin delisiyseniz oynayabilirsiniz ama ilk dört oyun kadar sarmayabilir sizi.


[h1]Oyuna puanım: 7/10
PC portuna puanım: 2/10[/h1]

This game gets a bad reputation, as one of the worst in the series. In reality the game is pretty solid, I’m not saying it’s the best but it’s pretty good. I played this back on the 360 when it first came out, and remembered how scared I was playing it. To this day it still is a bit freaky. 

Story: Good with a nice twist 

Graphically: Doesn't hold up, but the environment and enemies look good. It is mostly the cut scenes that look bad.

Combat: This is where the game fails big time. They had the right idea, but combat becomes really frustrating especially towards the end. Mouse 1 does light attacks, and mouse 2 does heavy attacks, which you can combo together, that part is really nice. It's the fact that you have a separate button to go into attack mode. You can imagine why this gets frustrating. There is a dodge button that doesn't seem to work half the time. I do like the fact that most of the time you only face one enemy at a time. 

Time to beat: 8-9 hours with mutiple endings (5 endings determined by three choices during the game) 

Final thought: 

If you are a fan of the Silent hill series, give this one a try. Like I said before it is a solid title that doesn't get enough credit. Ignore the haters!!!! 

One more thing, if you are playing on a newer system or OS, It may run poorly. I got mine to run good by trying different resolutions in the options. With that said, SAVE OFTEN!!!! Because my game crashed a few times and to avoid having to play large parts of the game again, I saved every time I came a crossed a save point.
column9:
This game gets a bad reputation, as one of the worst in the series. In reality the game is pretty solid, I’m not saying it’s the best but it’s pretty good. I played this back on the 360 when it first came out, and remembered how scared I was playing it. To this day it still is a bit freaky. 

Story: Good with a nice twist 

Graphically: Doesn't hold up, but the environment and enemies look good. It is mostly the cut scenes that look bad.

Combat: This is where the game fails big time. They had the right idea, but combat becomes really frustrating especially towards the end. Mouse 1 does light attacks, and mouse 2 does heavy attacks, which you can combo together, that part is really nice. It's the fact that you have a separate button to go into attack mode. You can imagine why this gets frustrating. There is a dodge button that doesn't seem to work half the time. I do like the fact that most of the time you only face one enemy at a time. 

Time to beat: 8-9 hours with mutiple endings (5 endings determined by three choices during the game) 

Final thought: 

If you are a fan of the Silent hill series, give this one a try. Like I said before it is a solid title that doesn't get enough credit. Ignore the haters!!!! 

One more thing, if you are playing on a newer system or OS, It may run poorly. I got mine to run good by trying different resolutions in the options. With that said, SAVE OFTEN!!!! Because my game crashed a few times and to avoid having to play large parts of the game again, I saved every time I came a crossed a save point.

column8: Dobře, hra určitě není tak dobrá jako její předchůdci a je mi líto že zrovna Homecoming je jediný díl Silent Hill který se dá tak lehce koupit na PC. Celkem špatná kamera, neohrabaný bojový systém, hra někdy padá. Ale co udělala dobře, byla atmosféra, která vysoko vyvyšuje hru přes všechny nedostatky. Už prvních pět minut jsem se bál tolik, kolik jsem se ještě u žádné hry nebál. Udělal jsem dobře, že jsem hru koupil.

The game in itself is good, however the PC port is just unplayable.

Even after using a 60 FPS fix the sound issues didn't let me have a good experience, since it was made for surround (and even in surround it's messed up). If you really want to play this game I recommend buying the PS3 or X360 version.

60 fps fix, for anyone who wants it: http://steamcommunity.com/app/19000/discussions/0/1693785669855289684/

If you have a sound fix, please send a message.

column8:
LO BUENO, JUEGAZO, LO MALO, MAL PORT.

Éste y el primer Silent Hill son mis preferidos. Este juego tiene algo que te hace quererlo.

- JUGABILIDAD: Silent Hill 5 es un survival horror de verdad, no lo pasas bien porque la munición escasea mucho y la jugabilidad la tienes que enfocar en una buena combinación de esquivar y atacar con armas blancas. El sistema de combate me parece de lo mejor porque es jodido y te van a quitar vida muchas veces, lo que va a hacer que gestiones al límite tus botiquines de vida. Por otra parte hay checkpoints si te matan, pero tienes que guardar tú manualmente en puntos de guardado para continuar la partida, a lo vieja escuela. También tendremos algún que otro puzzle, pero salvo un par de momentos que quizas tengais que darle al coco más de la cuenta, son bastante sencillos.

- EXPLORACIÓN : Parte buena y parte mala. En Silent Hill 5 estaremos en exteriores e interiores, los exteriores serán segmentos de calles de Silent Hill, con zonas que explorar como parques, puertos, parkings, etc, mientras que en interiores seran normalmente lugares grandes (ayuntamiento, hotel, comisaria, etc) y algunas casas. El PUNTAZO de Konami es, como vienen haciendo desde el primer Silent Hill, que tendremos mapa para ir explorando, y conforme lo vayamos haciendo, el protagonista irá marcando con rotulador rojo las calles cortadas, sitios clave, puertas cerradas o abiertas, puntos de guardado, y demás indicaciones que hacen que no revisitemos sitios que ya hemos explorado, y que en resumen mejoran muchisimo la amenización del juego. La parte negativa es que hay mucho escenario vacío, lo cual acusa el hecho de que no hay tanto enemigo en el juego como hubiese gustado, pero realmente no entorpece el juego.

- AMBIENTACIÓN: Otro puntazo de Konami; poco que reprochar aquí. La sensación de agobio es constante, musica de piano deprimente, lugares absolutamente dantescos y grotescos, sustos, niebla, oscuridad, etc. Todo esto consigue que no juegues nunca cómodo que es exactamente de lo que trata Silent Hill.

- GRÁFICOS: Se defienden muy bien para ser de 2008, buenos efectos de luz, expresiones faciales, texturas y modelados.

- PORT: He aquí la cagada del juego. Si este juego tuviera un buen port seria indispensable, pero es probable que experimentes problemas a la hora de ejecutarlo. De primeras, puede crashearse en cualquier momento jodiendote el avance que llevaras, puedes tener problemas de mando si usas uno genérico, aunque el juego tiene mapeado de botones interno por lo que al final saldrás del paso. Por otra parte a veces pega unos tirones grandes que significan que el juego esta cargando un escenario, y ademas esta capado a 30 frames (por que sí), pero realmente puede disfrutarse igual.


Unos consejos rápidos para los que querais optimizarlo:

- Configurarlo para que se ejecute siempre como administrador y desmarcando la casilla de "compatibilidad para..."

- No minimizeis el juego o se os crasheara lo más seguro, además creo que si teneis doble monitor, el juego no llega a iniciarse, por lo que tendreis que mostrar escritorio solo en uno.

- Si podeis usar un mando de xbox one o 360, mejor que mejor.

- En el archivo de configuración de los parámetros del juego, quizás tengais que indicar la resolucion de vuestro monitor cambiando la que venga en el archivo para que se inicie el juego.

- Por último, auque Steam diga que no esta en español, SI LO ESTA. Tiene subtitulos en español así que 0 problema.



En rebajas suelen poner el juego a 5€, ahí es el momento de comprarlo. No os asusteis por el port ya que al final no da tantos problemas como puedas imaginarte. Recomendación especial que lo juegues en dificil. Es un autentico juegazo y un homenaje a los survival horrors.

Espero que os sirva mi análisis.
Waste of money
column9: Waste of money

column8: Bien vuelvo a reseñar este juego porque lo estoy jugando de nuevo 22-05-2019 pues el juego sigue presentando los fallos como que algunas texturas estan mal diseñadas o aparte de eso se tilda en cada cierto instante al igual que al guardar la partida , siempre se cierra al intentar minimizar el juego :)!! también otro punto que realmente es jodido es que la anterior vez que lo jugué en una lap llegue hasta una parte cerca del final donde debias de presionar click a cada rato cosa que aún sigo sin pasar pese a los intentos el juego no detecta en sí mucho el mouse , aún no lo he jugado con JOYSTICK , pero pienso comprar uno y a ver que tal van los controles, Pésimo PORT

Önceki Silent Hill'lere nazaran biraz daha sönük kalan ama serinin takipçileri için kaçırılmaması gereken atmosfer ve Akira Yamaoka'nın yine efsane müzikleri. PC portu tam anlamıyla sorunsuz olmadığından oynayacağınız zaman oyunun 'config' dosyasından ekran çözünürlüğünü 720p yapmanızı ve fps limitini kaldırmamanızı öneririm. Ayrıca güç tasarrufu modu entegre Intel HD Grafik kartlarıyla ilginç bir şekilde daha fazla performans vermekte kendisi.

There is no place like silent hill. I have been a big fan of silent hill for many years after the first 3 games and the prequal. But for games like this one and the few other silent hill games that’s don’t fully get attached to the original story I tried to stay away from them. So, when my random to play game generater picked this game from my entire library I was quite sketchy of how good this one will be.

This one talks about an army man awoken from a nightmare after he that got discharged from the service. Got out of the hospital he went back to his home Shepard’s Glen which is a neighboring town of Silent Hill. You can see the place already covered in fog in a state of a “fog world” just like silent hill. People are disappearing and there is much dark history regarding the four family that created this town. With some trigger the fog world will be easier pulled deeper under and became “other world” (hell dimension).

Story wise this game was written quite nicely with good plot twists here and there. Not that long for only about 8-10 hours of gameplay. Music and sound effect is decent and combat animation is awkward but not intolerable. All the enemy are quite hard to fight against and you are seeking a lot of pain and death if you decide to raise the difficulty at the beginning of the game. Take patience to learn how every type of enemy move pattern and dodge accordingly. 4 beautiful boss fights and each match one of the family that founded Shepard’s Glen. 

There are a few different ending you can get like regular silent hill game but I only have enough interest to go though the game once.(I got the hospital ending.)

Beside all the good things I said so far this game is filled with a lot of bugs and crashes. If you are wanting to try playing this game you will need to read those niffy steam guide and do some straight fixing before you can run this game properly. Save whenever you see a save symbol will save you a lot of time in the long run. There is sound looping glitch that will force you to turn off the sound from time to time if you want to keep your eardrum intact. 

Control is horrible for this game as the 3D third person view and button setting feels super unnatural and awkward. The game itself is already very hard with the enemy thrown at you. Even the weakest balloon head nurse can pack a punch if you are not careful. With the weird control system and camera, you are given make progression an absolute nightmare on its own. (get a controller helps, avoid keyboard and mouse. Don’t be like me…)

6/10 Overall, it’s still a decent game with some good fright and nice story. No where close to as good as the first and third silent hill game but still packs quite a good deal of enjoyment. Too bad you just must go though all the bugs and bad controls to enjoy them.

A wonderful piece of a game. As a person who started liking Silent Hill series as a teenager starting from SH1 (and who did sleep like 3 hours because of bad and weird dreams on a school night which were caused by playing Silent Hill 1 for the first time in my life back in the day using my old PlayStation 1 console) to SH2 which I played with my brother because he was too scared to play the game just by himself. 

I have own and played them all (favorite being SH4 The Room) Silent Hill: Homecoming certainly feels like a Silent Hill game, it has same elements which defines the SH series; the mist of course, the jammed (and locked) doors all around, the broken streets (I never really found out what caused that, maybe I should research the series more), gorgeous and often eerie but mostly calming music.

In my opinion Homecoming works well as a pc version, so far I haven't found out anything negative yet (except with the minor issue of navigating map because I need to use zoom to show where I am currently). The game has elements from the earlier episodes from the series such as SH1, 2 and 3 to name a few. Story is pretty similar to Silent Hill 1 because the main character searches a lost family member. The story is really good and the voice actors are talented and the game plays well. The nice rustic graphics work well and give the town an eerie and little creepy feeling. In the darkness nobody hears your scream. 

Enemies are smart and there is a plenty of variety ranging from classic dog to more dangerous monsters. Silent Hill: Homecoming is not scary in my opinion but it is very atmospheric and often creepy game but fun to play.

I wouldn't pay 20€ for it but if its on sale for a 5€ (or even lower) be certain to grab this game of a piece of one of the most loved game series in history. Sadly it is so far the only Silent Hill title currently at steam. I would love to see the others here (specially The Room).

D'ordre general il est interessant.
Mais O MON DIEU QUEL PORTAGE AFFREUX !
Il faudra regler le son en surround pour pas avoir un bug de son. Reduire la resolution du jeu pour pas que ça bousille les images de la map et des objets a l'ecran. 
Les chargements soooooont long, digne d'une PS1 et ça freeze regulierement vers la fin du jeu, pour le chargement des decors....
Si on oublie des ptit crash par ci par la. Ça fait quand meme mal.

J'ai mis le jeu en positif parce que j'ai tout de meme passer un bon moment, mais il a fallu faire la part des choses comme j'en ai rarement fait : supporter un portage bancal.

Sinon ça reste un bon silent hill, quoi que teinté par les films, mais juste un peu. ( si on oublie le debut pourri, qui sert de tutorial )

column8: I've never written a review for a game before because I never felt compelled enough to but, this is a time I need to. Silent Hill homecoming? I actually really enjoyed playing the Xbox 360 version of this a lot, not the best SH game in the series but still enjoyable. However the PC port? Is the WORST port for a game I ever seen in my life. I only played 10 minutes of it, and experienced so much nonsense. Such as the game lagging an insane amount, not be able to figure out what button it is to interact with things because it isn't telling me. (As far as I know I'm not seeing how anywhere) I got this on Sale for the winter sale for $5 I believe. But still this game wasn't even worth that in my opinion. Don't buy this game, I can't stress that enough. Not worth your time. So in conclusion the PC Port for this game is the worst.

column8:
I finished this game some years ago on the PC, I never played the Console version but I heard it's less buggy than this version. I think rumors might be true since this game is a little buggy and will not work at all without xinput, also the controls feel weird and the music gets buggy sometimes, not to mention some awkward slowdowns when fighting or in certain areas. I saw this game on steam and thought I would get it again since I love Silent Hill, just wish the other Silent Hills were on steam too. Anyway besides all the bugs and glitches this game is amazing.

Story: 10/10 very amazing best part out of this game IMO
Graphics: 8/10 not very silent hill or scary but good enough
Music: 9/10 great music like any other silent hill
Sound: 7/10 not too detailed but good enough
Controls:6/10 so hard to get used to
Gameplay 8/10 it's not like other silent hills but it's better than the room IMHO

OVERALL 8/10 not the best Silent Hill game but not the worst either, this game is above silent hill 4 the room but not by a long shot. I totally recommend this game and I consider it a true Silent Hill game, it feels like they wanted to make it into a resident evil 4 with all the actions and combos but it still feels very Silent Hill, although many people hate it I honestly like the game.
