column8:
Silent Hill Homecoming rappresenta l'ultimo pallido tentativo di tenere in vita un franchise leggendario e rimasto ineguagliato.
Purtroppo di ciò che furono i capolavori del passato (sh 1, 2 e 3) rimane solo il titolo e qualche effetto sonoro nei menù, e dopo homecoming sono riusciti a fare anche di peggio con Downpour.
Il gioco in sè non è tutto da buttare, le ambientazioni e il gameplay ricalcano vagamente quelle di sh 2, tuttavia non riesce ad avere la stessa profondità e spessore di trama (e ci credo), proprio il paragone con i suoi predecessori risulta il punto debole di tutti i titoli della serie usciti dopo il 3, ma se siete alla ricerca di un survival dai ritmi lenti e dalle ambientazioni lugubri Sh Homecoming potrebbe fare al caso vostro, altrimenti potreste rimanere piuttosto delusi, insomma da assumere con le dovute precauzioni soprattutto per i fan irriducibili della serie.

ps. la recensione è stata modificata dopo un' iniziale periodo in cui andava costantemente in crash.
pps. e comunque continua a bloccarsi

voto personale:5.5/10

This game is an unnecessary chore for most gamers, and outright abuse to Silent Hill fans. Its as if Konami and double Helix specifically designed this port to be as stunted and grating as possible so that only the most avid fans stand a chance of enjoying it.

Here are the bullet points:
[list]
[*][h1]Visual[/h1] Camera is atrocious and buggy during quick-time events. Constant freezes, crashes, and clipping slips make the game nigh unplayable in places. In most resolutions, your map is cut and fixed into a small segment, rendering it useless. Half of my time spent on this port was trying to figure out a decent configuration.

[*][h1]Audio[/h1] The equalization is horrible. Dialogue wildly fluctuates between a whisper and a boom, while ambience and sound effects compete in an effort to blow out your speakers. Soundtrack is as top-notch as ever, making the rest of the audio design all the more frustrating.

[*][h1]Gameplay[/h1] The controller support feels rushed and haphazard. Instead of mapping the Xbox controller interface from the console version, as is common for console to PC ports, they decided to make their own mess of an interface that serves more to confuse players than to help them. 
The combat system, in my opinion, is an improvement over previous entries, and for good reason. Whether by design fluke or genuine character background, like it or not, you are playing a protagonist that can actually fight half a damn (for a Silent Hill character). Once you have the mechanics down, most (if not the entire) game can be breezed through with the knife alone. The streamlined game mechanics and less convoluted progression (compared to previous entries), makes sense, considering the unique protagonist, different locale, and extended lore/Cult elements.

[*][h1]Story[/h1] If you're a die-hard Silent Hill fan, chances are you'll hate it. I would not blame you, the forced Pyramid Head cameo alone is grounds enough for execution. However, god help me, I like this game's story, its faults notwithstanding. The possibility of Silent Hill's influence spreading via extended Cult activities, sister communities, or the actions of past residents or "visitors" is enticing. This lends itself well to the game's central plot, and actually makes for a thoughtful and heartfelt horror story.

[*][h1]Conclusion[/h1] Having played every Silent Hill game to date, as well as having played this entry on the PS3 back in the day, I wholeheartedly condemn this port as a thoroughly-screwed, half-assed , god-awful mess that is an affront to the franchise, its fans, and gamers in general. Even at 85% off, I would only recommend this purchase for the most committed. Otherwise, don't waste your money.
[/list]

column8: Jogo muito bom, recomendo.

A thoroughly appalling port of a flawed-yet-classic "survival horror" game.

   First up, let's talk about the game itself. Sure, it pandered to the "torture porn" tropes made popular in its day by the likes of the Saw and Hostel franchises. Not that I have a problem with such influences, other than it being a bit "obvious" for the time, and perhaps thereby feeling a bit forced. And sure, it also made the combat a bit too action-y by adding in a dodge mechanic which saw you rolling around the floor like a super-soldier who's OD'd on twinkies (we're a long way from RE1's "tank" controls, boys and girls)!

   Such relatively minor criticisms aside, though, it still had some gob-smackingly atmospheric and scary moments, incredible monster designs, some decent puzzles, and on the whole still emerges as one of the last great gasps of what we could perhaps term the "first generation" of survival horror video games (beginning with the first Alone in the Dark, and ending around Amnesia: The Dark Descent).

   So that's the game. But what about the PC port?

   Two words: "shit" and "house", in roughly that order. A complete insult, really, to anyone who once loved this series and everything it stood for.

   The controls? Well, you can remap them, but best cross your fingers they don't just magically re-map themselves back again, and allocate two different functions to a single key at the worst possible moment. The sound? Frankly makes the controls look good. Dialogue and various sound effects - including your own character's FOOTSTEPS - are frequently hard-panned to one side of the speakers/headphones for absolutely no apparent reason, other than...well, I guess they just couldn't be fucked fixing up whatever minor bug occurred during the console to PC transfer..?

   Add to this a multitude of crashes, some of the most ludicrously long load screens you will ever have to endure, and a game-breaking puzzle in which you CAN'T EVEN CONTROL THE HANDS OF THE CLOCK YOU'RE SUPPOSED TO SET TO A SPECIFIC TIME (they move in whichever direction they want, and stop at whichever number they choose). And that's game, set and match for me, kiddies. Cheers for the hours of aggravation, Konami, but enough is quite enough.

   The whole port has a distinctly "that'll do, pig, that'll do" feel to it, with quality control thrown so far out the window you can't even see where the bastard landed. I now know what Phil Fish and Jonathan Blow are talking about when they say that Japanese games just ain't what they used to be (and they weren't even talking about HORROR GAMES, for fuck's sake)!

   In short, while I would easily consider this one of my Top Fifty Horror Games of all time, I sadly cannot recommend this port to ANYONE. Konami's business practices as regards Steam ports seem disappointingly similar to Capcom's, as neither company seems capable of releasing a truly decent adaptation of their older console games onto PC for reasons known only to themselves; and then invariably see fit to rub salt on the wound by refusing to fix anything for the fans. Meaning, in all honesty, they probably don't deserve any NEW ones.

   If you have this on PS3, just play it on that. Otherwise, take your chances and don't say I didn't warn you (apparently some have gotten past the clock puzzle, but ten minutes of fruitless farting about was indeed the final straw for yours truly).

   Honestly, just buy a second-hand Playstation 3...they're cheap enough by now, and worth it just to play this game and this game alone in the form it was first released. It sure does bring a tear to my eye, though, to think how my two favourite Japanese games companies of all time are apparently now run by hot-and-cold running wankers. Fuck you, Konami (we won't even mention that Silent Hills cancellation, which seemed to merely nonplus poor old Guillermo Del Toro), and fuck you too, Capcom ("HD remasters", my fully dilated arse-hole). Oh, how the mighty do fall...

Verdict: 4.5/10 (9.5 for the game, minus 5 for the piece-of-shit port).

column8: buceta de jogo bom

The great soundtrack and atmosphere are dragged down by bad pacing, frustrating mechanics and a lack of polish.

It's obvious that a better game could have been made out of what's here, but Homecoming holds little of note to anyone but hardcore Silent Hill fans.

Overall: 4/10

column8:
Strach obklopujúci mrazivým chladom prenikajúcim do morku kosti. Pocit neustálej neistoty sprevádzany tými najzvratenejšími predstavami, akých je ľudská myseľ schopná. Úzkosť dýchajúca Vám na chrbát za každým rohom a depresie z krkolomného ovládania budu vašimi vernými spoločníkmi počas celej hry.

Osobne chovám obrovské sympatie k Japonskému štýlu hororových hier. Musím sa ale priznať, že Homecoming, i keď je považovaný za najslabší diel úspešnej série, bol vôbec mojou prvou skúsenosťou z univerza tajomného Silent Hill. Mohol by som teraz na jeho adresu kľudne vytiahnuť množstvo negatívnych poznatkov o nepresvedčivom nadizajnovaní úrovni, slabšieho grafického spracovania, či spomínaného, nie zrovna pohodlného ovládania.

 Rovnako tak by som sa ale mohol rozplývať nad silným pocitom strachu, ktorý drží v napätí až do samotného záveru. Alebo nad silnou atmosférou, ktorá sa celou hrou linie rovnako, ako hustá hmla vznášajúca sa nad celým Silent Hill-om. S určitosťou však viem, že pozitívne vlastnosti by prevládali v takom rozsahu, že tie negatívne by sa v ich svetle vyparili, ako mlžný opar po chladnom rane.

Silent Hill je nekompromisnou, náročnou a desivou víziou zvrátených mysli. Je však hernými prvkami a mechanikami tak geniálne namixovanou záležitosťou, že Vám nezostane nič iné, než odpúšťať a odpúšťať. Faktom zostáva naozaj vyššia náročnosť súbojov aj adventúrnych prvkov spočívajúcich, nie vždy v úplne logických hádankach. S veľmi obmedzenými zdrojmi v inventari budete musieť často šetriť a dva krát počítať každý vystrelený náboj a dúfať, že už znovu neminiete.

Silent Hill môžete milovať rovnako, ako ho nenávidieť. Nikomu toto právo brať nebudem a ani sa o to nechcem nijak pokúšať. Niečo take nie je v mojej moci. Môžem Vám len napísať o tom, ako som sa do neopakovateľnej atmosféry Japonského hororového umenia opäť zamiloval...

You'll be glad to know the game rewards you with a classic Silent Hill 2 experience. No hand holding, the game doesn't assume the player is a dumbass like most games do these days. You will be rewarded with a pretty fun 30 FPS experience, that is if you're using a controller, which apparently the devs didn't account for. YES, the game has controller support. NO it does NOT have the correct button prompts. A, B, X, Y are  buttons 1,2,3 & 4. Why? No damn clue. You actually need to download a FAN MADE patcher to get a PROPER EXPERIENCE WITH A CONTROLLER. 
If you play this with a keyboard/mouse, goodluck.

Also, it's so lazily ported, you might as well just buy it for a PS3 or Xbox 360. If you do take the plunge into what is Konami's darkness, here's some tips.

1. In 1080p, the map doesn't fully display. You're literally playing blind. 
2. The game has many freezing issues, and clipping issues.
3. Some areas in the game completely crash the game. I shit you not, you actually need to CHANGE resolutions to LOAD some areas. 
4. This game in no way was QA'd and was ported by chimps that read the first chapter of C++ for dummies. 
5. Good luck!

column8:
Für meine Begriffe ist der Survival-Horror im Vergleich zu seinen Vorgängern etwas kurz geraten, auch die Rätsel waren eher einfach, aber von der Spannung und dem Gruseleffekt her fand ich diesen Teil sehr gut. Die ewig langen Ladezeiten waren eine Zumutung, trotzdem hinderten sie mich nicht daran weiter zu spielen. Silent Hill Homecoming ist für mich ein spannendes und anspruchsvolles Game, dem es an Abwechslung und gruseligen Gegnern nicht mangelt. Auch deren Handlung fand ich richtig gut und die 4 verschiedenen Enden motivieren mich das Spiel weitere Male durchzuspielen.  Es ist zwar ein kurzes Abenteuer, doch absolut spielenswert, insofern man Zeit  und Nerven hat, die Ladezeiten abzuwarten  :D
Ich zumindest, bin froh es gespielt zu haben!

Hier ein kleiner Einblick zu meinem Homecoming-Spieleerlebnis:
https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PL6bumfgng4wJ6glhOlutEig4YdO1Kybwy

La faccio breve: uno dei peggiori capitoli dell'intero brand.
Questa versione poi, o forse tutte le versioni per pc... non saprei... probabile, presenta una serie di problemi "tecnici" veramente assurdi e ridicoli (ad esempio per settare la risoluzione o il corretto funzionamento del joypad bisogna attivare la lingua inglese prima di avviare il gioco).
Se siete amanti della saga recuperate altri titoli, questo non merita attenzione neppure in ottica fan service.

A ver como os cuento esto... El juego en sí, bien, lo recomiendo porque es Silent Hill y hay que jugar la saga. La música te emparanoia, los bichos están puestos en modo H*jo de P*ta y algún que otro susto te llevas. Me quejo de lo siguiente, he tenido que descargarme un parche en el foro de Steam para que los botones fueran los correctos (lo he jugado con mando de XBOX), la jugabilidad en batalla es un poco pésima y he tenido que enfrentarme a un par de bugs casi al final del juego que no me dejaban avanzar y he estado a punto de abandonarlo. En general, recomendado, pero MUY mejorable.
Terrible game. Would strongly encourage anyone not to buy it. It may be called Silent Hill Homecoming, but it's not a Silent Hill game.
column9: Terrible game. Would strongly encourage anyone not to buy it. It may be called Silent Hill Homecoming, but it's not a Silent Hill game.

column8: este juego es muy bueno pero le faltan logros para investigar un poco mas por los mapas

I found this game very cheap and I said "why not?" Started playing and I got hooked with the story. I decided to buy the other silent Hill games after this. 

- Nice OST, story and enemy designs.
- Useless pipe bar but nice knives.

It seems to be buggy, but luckily nothing bad happened to me while playing.

Waiting for full Silent Hill series on Steam to buy them all.

column8: Nie polecam

Only recently of this year I've gotten into Silent Hill Franchise and I mean recently I started with Origin completed it two days ago, I just completed Silent Hill 2 4/03/2017 <-- England DD,MM,YYYY. I'm now playing Silent Hill 1, then 3, 4 and Homecoming once again. I completed Homecoming first, I've played Downpour if I remember correctly for the WII it was crap. I didn't complete it, but anyway this isn't why I'm writing the review. I'm writing to say, even though a lot of people say "This game isn't like the others, or crap" it's alright,  I don't see why people are having problems with the game, I got a Nvidia 750ti, Amd 6300 FX Black 3.5GHZ 6 Core, 16 GB RAM. My hardware is fine able to run the game and I don't get a single problem, I did in the past before I had this hardware but it was just because I had crap hardware. I got windows 7 64 bit, but anyway I think the game is fine, alright optimized etc. I just have one problem, my problem is the price, a game that came out 2009 2 March, 8 years ago and the company wants £17.99 That's a terrible and I mean terrible price for an old game. Would for 7.99 maybe 10.99 IF, the game was better optimized for people, easier for them to run and maybe allowed us to add mods. Also I would love to see the other franchises on steam/GOG. I'm enjoying the franchise, but would love it more on steam, being able to play "Silent Hill 1, 2, 3, 4, HomeComing, DownPour etc." The list goes on.

column8:
I think I should start this review by saying I played all the other Silent Hills except for Downpour. With that said, I can declare Silent Hill Homecoming as a great addition to the series. Despite the shabby pc port, this game is still worth your while, even more so considering it goes for really cheap during sales. A good game for SH fans and newcomers alike.

[h1] Pros	[/h1]
[list]
    [*]The plot is very good and differs itself from the other games enough for it to be surprising all the way through. I say differ enough because it still holds that "Silent Hill feeling" to it. It's just great all around.
    [*]The characters are well made and nicely fleshed out, so you will most likely get a connection with them.
    [*]The enviroment is superb. The (new) town of Shepherd's Glen is amazing, and so are all of the other places you visit. It is a little more linear than, say, SH2 for example, where you had a big city for you to walk around and figure where to go next.
    [*]As the first "next gen" (ps3 and xbox 360 era) Silent Hill game, it does a wonderful job of bringing the technology on par with modern games. The graphics are great, with a highlight to facial animation. Mechanics were reworked to bring them to the new age, such as combat, movement, camera control and shooting.
    [*]Great voice acting. The voices fit and don't have that "so bad it's bizarre" feeling past games had. This time they are properly acted.
    [*]The soundtrack is sooo good. Akira Yamaoka is just a god when it comes to creating music for Silent Hill games.
    [*]Enemies are well designed and, as usual, have a lot of symbolism.
    [*]One thing that I really like about this game is how the main character, Alex, reacts to what's happening around him. I clearly remember the first time I played a Silent Hill game (it was Silent Hill 2), and when monsters started showing up, the main character appears to just ignore the bizarre situation. Even when talking to other people, I was like "just tell them you are facing god damn monsters around this evil town", but that never happened. It was like, for the main character, it was all supposed to be that way. In Homecoming, however, Alex acts just the way I described above. I felt utter joy when a new monster appeared and Alex went "what the hell is this thing". Heck, you even tell other people you've met monsters and they say they have been seeing the same things. It's just a relief.
    [*]Nicely optimized, despite the questionable pc port. When not facing the random fps drops, I could run this really smothly on my very cheap build.
[/list]

[h1] Neutral	[/h1]
[list]
    [*]This game doesn't feature combining of items, and as so, it doesn't have the characteristic "combining of weird things" the other games had.

[/list]

[h1] Cons	[/h1]
[list]
    [*]Bad pc port. It glitches, crashes (a lot), has random fps drops and you need to set your sound system to 5.1 surround if you don't want to hear things only on your right ear.
    [*]Very little graphical options (you literally have only "medium preset" and "high preset").
    [*]This game crashes. A lot (as mentioned above). I don't recommend picking hard when starting a new game, because when you die and retry, that's when the game crashes the most.
    [*]Some puzzles require trial and error and some just don't make much sense.

[/list]
It's important to mention that, even being a bad pc port, this is not the worst. You can rebind keys, change mouse sensitivity, deactivate inverted aim, and the game doesn't have bs like mouse acceleration.

It's important to mention that, even being a bad pc port, this is not the worst. You can rebind keys, change mouse sensitivity, deactivate inverted aim, and the game doesn't have bs like mouse acceleration.

column8: One of the best SH experience I've made. Homecoming remains faithful to the SH mythology and unique atmosphere. Compared to the first games, of course, the gameplay is roughly easier and fluid, but that doesn't mean the game is not a true horror survival.
column9: One of the best SH experience I've made. Homecoming remains faithful to the SH mythology and unique atmosphere. Compared to the first games, of course, the gameplay is roughly easier and fluid, but that doesn't mean the game is not a true horror survival.

column8:
Quase toda vez o jogo morria e voltava pro Windows.
Tem algum memory leak que faz os loadings e os savings ficarem cada vez mais lentos quando joga.
As vezes iniciava mas os controles do XBOX 360 não eram reconhecidos, precisando sair do jogo e entrar novamente.
De-sync dos sons com as imagens em algumas cut scenes.
Combate é uma merda. É muito difícil desviar dos inimigos.
QTEs as vezes não funcionavam, por mais que eu malhasse os botões.
Alguns save points muito espaçados.

E mais...

O jogo é estranho, o terror é psicológico. Como um bom Silent Hill, mexe com problemas mentais.
Os bosses são animais (centopéia humana, uma boneca pernuda, um golum que cai de um saco, etc)
Animações bem feitas
Clima opressivo e depressivo
Bastante variação de ambientes

Então....bom jogo Silent Hill. Se aguentar os bugs acima, irá encontrar um jogo sólido com muito conteúdo.
ottimo horror! non ce ne sono più cosi! Lo consiglio a tutti, particolarmente a chi piace il genere e Silent Hill!

Clunky at best. Do not reccomend.
It was way better on the playstation so I advise you guys to not buy it on steam.

controls are horrible
you can't dodge properly
the loading times are super long

story is ok (same as playstation version obviously)
and the atmosphere is great for a sh game

column8:
El juego me ha gustado bastante porque soy un gran fan de la saga, tiene una buena historia, y unos cuantos finales que invitan a rejugarlo. Se puede jugar con mando (aunque no sea realmente necesario), y destaco especialmente la OST y los efectos de sonido, que hacen mucho porque la experiencia sea inmersiva.

Aunque Steam no lo indique, el juego SÍ está en castellano.

¿qué problemas he encontrado?

- Los FPS están limitados (30)
- Crashes de pantalla que surgen aleatoriamente en ciertas pantallas de carga.
- Los tiempos de carga no abundan, pero son molestos y elevados.
- Tiene pinta de ser un port cutre de la versión de consolas.

El juego lo recomiendo si eres fan de la saga y de los juegos de terror en general.

Before looking at any reviews, I started up this game and played through the first hospital/Insane Asylum area. I was playing late at night, with the lights off (the only way to play horror games), and that heavy on my heart feeling, the one a felt when I watched the first Silent Hill movie, started coming back. My chest was tightening up. I didn't know what was going to pop out at me. The whole twitching nurses with no faces, rigidly walking around the room in the dark definitely sent chills down my spine.

I'm a horror genre fanatic, so for a game to scare me or more accurately make me feel uncomfortable, is a big feat. It wasn't necessarily that it scared me, so much as that feeling of unease came over me. Especially when the sirens blared out across the city and the true face of Hell became apparent.

While, obviously not the best horror/thriller movie out there, Silent Hill did give me some uneasy-wtf moments. The part with Pyramid Head ripping off the girls skin particularly struck a cord with me. The point being, at this beginning part in the hospital, the atmosphere, the creatures, the music it all made me feel like I had stepped into that movie. It was awesome, and frightening at the same time.

I used an Xbox One controller for certain games such as this. But even after spending copious amounts of time tweaking the button options so that the onscreen picture of a specific button to press (such as a green button with a 2 on it) to match my controller, it was still janky. I got it to work fairly decent but there were still those moments when you had to guess which button the game wanted you to press.

After that first level, things started to go down hill. The town definitely had the feel of the silent Hill town, especially the Silent Hill 2 town. However, as other have stated, it just wasn't the same. It seems like the developers were trying to be more true to the movie than to the series.

Overall, the game wasn't horrible. I don't feel like that odd hell-bound creepiness of the movie and beginning sequence was ever correctly demonstrated througout homecoming. Nonetheless, the story was fairly interesting (though corny and predictable at times). The puzzles were not that difficult, which in my opinion was fine. 

I would recommend playing this game while it is on sale, and you are looking for a decent dark fantasy ish game. Think of it as the Resident Evil 6 of the Silent Hill series. And don't use a controller unless you really have to!

column8:
Where do I start?
This is a trainwreck. Not worth any amount of money, should have been free to play. 

1. logic is flawed
2. press [] for next press [] for back (prompts don't help)
3. Easy to break every puzzle
4. If you try to get in to Finch's flinches whatever his name is place you will have to walk the entire game
^5. I had to play the entire game walking ( rolling everywhere) 
and so forth, don't waste your money

column8:
Jako fan Silent Hill, muszę przyznać, że gra nie jest "najgorszą z serii", tak jak uważa sporo osób, ale nie jest też świetna.
Mam mieszane przeżycia, ale jeśli miałbym być szczery... Naprawdę mi się spodobała! :D Moim zdaniem jest dobra (ale bez przesady) i nawet miałbym o niej lepszą opinię, gdyby nie te laggi, które czasem występują. Tutaj macie moją listę zalet i wad:

ZALETY:
- Dobry soundtrack
- Kreatywne i dobre bossy, które mogą przestraszyć (np. mnie Scarlett o dziwo)
- Całkiem ciekawe postacie
- Plot twisty
- Klimacik
- Tajemnicze zakończenia, dzięki którym w głowie roją się teorie (jak dla mnie)

WADY:
- Laggi i czasem gra przestaje działać
- Nienajlepsza fabuła
- Lokacje z gry, które jakoś nie wpasowują się w Silent Hill (oprócz szpitala z początku gry)

W sumie to wszystko co mogę wymienić. Mogę polecić grę, jeśli lubi się surviwal horrory i Silent Hill, ale ostrzegam przed naprawdę irytującymi laggami oraz w niektóre części rozgrywki mogą się niezbyt spodobać... :/ Tak, czy siak moim zdaniem warto kupić, a tym bardziej na przecenie, czyli gdzieś za 5 euro. :D

Ce jeu possède un univers et un scénario solides, mais la réalisation est pour le moins paradoxale. Plutôt réussie sur une carte graphique intel integrée - à un niveau moyen de détail et en basse résolution ; calamiteuse sur des cartes graphiques plus puissantes, où sont impardonnables cette fois les saccades et les figements à certains endroits. Homecoming a-t-il été programmé pour fonctionner sur une PSP ? Je le recommande tout de même -en promotion. Les graphismes en soi ne gênent pas, les créatures sont bien dessinées - les personnages humains un peu moins, la ville est réussie dans l'ensemble et l'univers de Silent Hill vaut toujours le détour. Et puis l'expérience n'est pas si désagréable une fois qu'on s'est suffisamment familiarisé avec les commandes...

É um ótimo jogo. Uma ótima história e uma jogabilidade excelente. Gostei muito desse jogo.

Só que desisti de jogar por conta dos bugs. Ele trava do nada e fecha sozinho. Sem contar com o loading demorado. Quando está jogando até que funciona de boa, o problema é quando você morre ou passa pra uma outra tela. Aí ele fecha do nada, por conta dos saves ser longe um do outro, aí vc tem que voltar tudo de novo. Aconteceu várias vezes isso. Aí desanimou. Algum dia eu animo e volto a jogar.

El port de este juego es pésimo.
- Fallos de texturas. Dibujos completamente pixelados.
- Los diálogos están muchos desincronizados, y el volumen de las voces alterado.
- Tiempos de carga extremadamente largos. Un minuto para entrar o salir de una casa.
- Numerosos y desesperantes bugs que te obligan a reiniciar y empezar desde el último y lejano punto de guardado.

Podría encontrar más errores si hubiera seguido jugando, pero me he visto obligado a solicitar la devolución. Es injugable y no es debido al rendimiento del PC. Recomiendo no comprar por muchas ganas que le tengas al juego como se las tenía yo.

A história é muito boa, porém se você tem um pc cagado que nem o meu não recomendo comprar. Comprei (meu namorado me deu o jogo) pois já tinha jogado antes, e quis jogar de novo. O enredo é muito bom, surpreendente, mas me questiono que o protagonista só pode ter merda na cabeça. A cidade ta um caos cheio de monstros, mas ele insiste em ficar até o fim, claro, que ele está atrás do irmão e tal, mas eu sou cuzona e pensaria foda-se meu irmão, to dando o fora daqui. x.x Então recomendo comprar o jogo se tu tiveres um pc bom, pois o jogo está muito mal otimizado pra pc. Porém se você tiver paciência pra jogar um jogo que talvez em seu pc, fique um merda, o jogo vai rodar a 30 fps, no máximo, e vai diversas vezes bugar e você terá que fechar o jogo. Não consegui jogar o jogo com a resolução de acorodo com meu monitor. Jogar no teclado é uma merda, ou eu que sou ruim mesmo, ou as duas coisas. Porém repito, se tiveres paciência o jogo tem uma ótima trama e vale a pena jogar.

I really like this game and I wanted to recommend it but it's a terrible port and has too many technical issues. I ran this on both an AMD and nvidia system. It randomly crashes on both of them, it will not display in anything higher than 24hz on my TV, it's locked at 30fps, the resolution is terrible and it keeps minimizing from full screen every 30 seconds. I know it's a good game because I played it on xbox 360. You will probably be disappointed if you spend $40 on this and for some reason it never goes on sale.
column9: I really like this game and I wanted to recommend it but it's a terrible port and has too many technical issues. I ran this on both an AMD and nvidia system. It randomly crashes on both of them, it will not display in anything higher than 24hz on my TV, it's locked at 30fps, the resolution is terrible and it keeps minimizing from full screen every 30 seconds. I know it's a good game because I played it on xbox 360. You will probably be disappointed if you spend $40 on this and for some reason it never goes on sale.

column8:
This review comes from someone who considers the Silent Hill 2 as the best horror game and one of the best -if not the best- games ever created in general. Worth mentioning that Silent Hill 1 and 3 are awesome games as well. 
Homecoming is the fifth sequel in the series and it is rather clear that the francise is going downhill compared to the first three masterpieces. The original team is not involved in the development (except the music composer I think); the torch has been passed to a western team. 
The resulting game is definitely not in the same league as the original triad, but it has some good moments. 

Pros:
+ second part of the game (after sewers) is denser, better and more scary.
+ very nice design of some bosses.
+ good use of lightning and shadows.
+ music is excellent, perhaps the best aspect of the game.
+ some concepts of the main story are distrurbing and shocking (some may find them too disturbing).
+ the design of the Otherworld.
+ puzzles are reasonable.

Cons
- Not surprisingly a vey bad console port with numerous technical bugs: the loading times are enornous, sometimes the game freezes for a few seconds or (more rarely) it crashes. This can be very annoying especially as saves occur at specific places.
- The buttons of the controller seem to be wrongly mapped and I could not find a way to correct them. The map of the game is bugged in the zoom modes.
- Early in the game at some regions (especially Police Station) the game is too much action-oriented. Way too many enemies and combat. It is a bit strange as the difficulty seems to spike there and then it drops. Hint: avoid conformations while on streets, almost all enemies can be avoided. 
- Some maps are frustrating (Police Station) or boring (Sewers)
- There is a variety of melee weapons but it seems that the very first one you encounter is the most efficient.
- Some enemies are rather repetitions from past games (nurses, pyramid man). The element of the psychological horrors being mapped onto physical manifestations is simply not there.  
- the dodge system seems unresponsive as if there is some kind of lag. 

The current price of around 20Euros is too high. Buy at discounted price if you are willing to bypass the technical problems with the extra advice to have low expectations if you are a fan of the originals.

Another game for which I would pick the "neutral" option. 
Selected "recommend yes" just because the original trilogy has become "shattered memory" (nowhere to be found on steam or other platforms); at least try this to get a glimpse of the glorious past of the Silent Hill Mythos....

column8: Pretty broken as a port, I had heard that it was but it was on sale for barely anything. Trying to play it is frusterating because the controler doesn't work even though it has options for it. As I was playing certain controls from the keyboard would stop working and I had to re-map them. Was a point where I was stuck in a straff and had to shift-tab then go back into the game for it to work.You have to press shift to go into combat mode and it's not very intuitive. I'll keep working at different control configurations to get the game working better for me but I think I'll just try to borrow the game on console.

column8:
Great game for its release and personally my second favorite installment of this franchise

Killing monsters and great jumpscares are really great in this game!!!

you know those american remakes of japanese(or asian horror in general) horror movies that mostly ends up being abysmal ?(aside from ring)-if yeah,then you wont be surprised,if i tell you that that homecoming sucks pretty bad

story-Alex Shepard is coming home,but when he arrives,something seems to be off.most people seems to be missing,including your brother josh,who youre trying to find and town is covered in fog.so youre trying to find josh while trying to find out whats happening

And here comes first problem with the game-josh himself-this will be spoiler(but not that big)-big shock,he is dead-and thats the the plot twist at the end-it would be okay twist,if it wasnt so predictable.twist here is so predictable because for a)he always running away from you,when you run into him and for b)its been already done and better (in dead space with nicole)
i would overcome this if atleast characters were interesting,but theyre not.

enough about story what about gameplay?-its even worse-homecoming is more headed towards melee fights and i could forgive this if combat was good,but its not-its broken-fighting with some enemies(and bosses) can become frustrating chore-whenever enemy attacks and hits you,you dont have time to recover because enemies are faster  than you are,so you can get locked in place while enemy is attacking and dodge here doesnt work.this can be especially frustrating when youre fighting with more enemies at once.using gun can help sometimes,but even using a gun is kind a clumsy,since whenever you press button,you switch into free aim mode and since enemies are quick,they mostly attack you first,before you can shoot them.


give game some credit puzzles are actually kind a cool and they have that silent hill spirit in them

visuals-the games visuals are nice there isnt much say about it,aside otherworld transition thats been taken from the movie and some monster designs are cool particulary on the bosses

unfortunatly game has technical issues-game quite often freezes for aprox. ten seconds and sometimes crashes,plus there is a bug here and there

to sum up-pros
+visuals
+puzzles
+some monster designs
cons-
-way too combat oriented
-boring characters
-broken combat
-bugs here and there
-occasional crashes
-often game freezes itself

verdict
-silent hill:homecoming isnt good.i wouldnt recommend this game because of  its technical issues and combat,thats broken.if you want to try this game,wait til price gets under 5 dollars

4/10

column8: Ecellent game if you can get it on sale. I dont understand all the whiny negative reviews, game works fine so far. Was really surprised that my xbox 360 controller was compatible. I expected a broken mess! Resolution is fine (you can notice the resolution is a little low when pan the view close to wall, but this game is from 2008...) controls ARE clunky (but still very much playable) overall is a solid (not perfect) port. Steam reviewers can be a fickle bunch

column8: PC de saldırı tuşları kullanılmıyor.

oyundan bahsetmeme gerek yok.. silent hill yazıyorsa olay bitmiştir bilenler bilir.. bu oyun 20 serii de yapsa hiç bir zaman bir öncekinden kötü olmaz.. olumsuz verenlere hiç değinmek istemiyorum..bu tarz oyunlar  zaten klavyeyle oynanacak bir oyun değil.  hatalara gelecek olursak  win10 64 bit kullanıyorum  xbox one kontrolcüyle hiç bir sıkıntı yaşamadım en ufak bir sorun yok.. rahatça alıp oynayabilirsiniz.. her kütüphanede bulunması gereken bir oyun.

La verdad no entiendo el odio que se siente hacia este juego. Cierto es que no es el mejor de la serie, que quizá la historia sea la más floja y que se haya desvirtuado en mucho el tema del terror psicologico y el survival horror, pero en mi opinión y pese a que el port de las videoconsolas en ningún caso es perfecto (pero desde luego con bajo windows 7 salvo pequeños lags y el hecho de que volver al escritorio provoca que el juego se cuelgue no he experimentado ningún problema) me parece un buen juego, máxime cuando los usuarios de pc sólo tenemos este a nuestra disposición y no parece que Silent Hill vaya a ver nuevas entregas al corto plazo.
daha iki gün önce outlast 'ı bitirdiğim bilgisayarımda bu oyunu açamıyorum...
Genial, muy entretenido, dinámico, lleno de misterio, acertijos, horror, suspenso, drama y aventura ;)

Great game, love the story and the errie feeling you get from it. Survival horror games are a personal favorite and never got a change to play homecoming till now.  Only thing is some times my game will glitch and it's just a waiting period of a few seconds before the game is fine again. Has only happened in a few spots so it's not that big of a deal. Not sure if it's just my computer and it needs a better graphics card or if it's a bug that other players will experience so is adding the detail just in case.

column8: Mimo fali hejtu na tą część, bardzo mi się podobała. Zagadki ciekawe i trudne, bossowie zajebiści i fajny system walki :D

Jogo tinha tudo para ser exelente, mas a desenvolvedora fez um pessimo port.
apresenta varios Crash, Bugs, travamentos e etc, só compre se estiver em promoção e fique ciente dos bugs, que não são poucos, a KONAMI podia ter vergonha em ter distribuido um jogo com tantos bugs como esse, poderiam refazer a saga silent hill com suporte a nova geração, uma versão HD Collection com todos os jogos do silent hill, iria vender como agua na praia.

obs: precisa jogar em 1280x720, pois em resoluçõe maiores você só vê metade do mapa, mas o pior de tudo é quando você é atacado e precisa apertar algum botão repetidamente... o botão que aparece na tela nem sempre é o correto. Devo continuar jogando pois gosto da série, mas não recomendo a compra, a menos que esteja em promoção.

This is my first Silent Hill game and I like it
It is a solid surreal horror game and I do love the surreal ones.
Enemy designs are nice and there does exist some symbolism within the environments and enemy designs which does tease at the mind.
Story is good and complex enough to be interesting and I found most of the puzzles to be nice.
It's flaws include occasional framerate stuttering, lengthy load times, and sometimes the game will freeze for a full minute before continuing, expecially before saving, but that's about it. 
Suffice to say, since this is considered the worst Silent Hill game, I am now quite interested in playing the "better" ones :)

The soundtrack is amazing as always, and the story is not half bad. But the battle system is awkward, and why the hell is pyramid head in it?

Overall, needs some work, but it can still entertain.

6/10

column8:
A trama de "Silent Hill: Homecoming" apresenta um novo herói, Alex Shepherd, um soldado ferido em combate que está a caminho de casa, na pequena cidade de Sheperd's Glen. Assombrado por pesadelos que giram ao redor de seu irmão mais novo, Josh, Alex encontra o lugar tomado por uma estranha névoa e sua mãe em estado catatônico. Para tornar a situação ainda mais intrigante para ele, o ex-combatente descobre que o pai desapareceu ao sair em busca de Josh.
Logo Alex passa a ser atormentado por visões aterrorizantes de figuras célebres da franquia, além de outras referências ao passado que só fãs da série irão reconhecer. Tudo piora quando ele se vê explorando a cidade de Silent Hill, que é vizinha de Shepherd's Glen, e começa a desvendar um grave segredo ocultado por sua família a respeito das origens do lugar.

"Silent Hill: Homecoming" é mais ágil, mais intuitivo e mais simples que os anteriores. Tais mudanças, ao menos para certos fãs mais ardorosos, podem ter justamente acabado com o grande charme da franquia, o que não é de todo justo. Embora não seja especialmente inteligente ou tecnicamente corajoso, o jogo ainda preserva qualidades suficientes para intrigar uma boa parcela de seu público-alvo e manter a franquia respirando com dignidade.

Was a bit spooked when i saw the majority of reviews here, but i mentioned it to a friend and he got it for me. For the first 2 hours i was waiting for something to go wrong, now close to 4 hours I'm confident that a majority of the reviews arent quite the truth. I have a 2014 dell with a family graphics card, the only time this game crashed is when i tried to get back to my checkpoint because i didnt learn the combat yet, which to be honest i deserved to crash. Nothing else since then, there are rare moments when the game stutters but its only temporary. The combat is a bit strange at first but once you get the jist of using shift to enter combat mode its an instant breeze everything else is rudementery, you mainly use the mouse and the space bar aside some inventory but its all clearly laid out. Mouse 0 means M1 and mouse 1 means M2 thats all. The game itself is spectacular i havent felt this kind of fear in a long time, the fear of the unknown you start out knowing almost nothing. That is the beauty of this series, takes me back to times when i played Silent hill 2 on the old Playstation 2. All this to say, not that everyone has the same situation this game is amazing, if you see it on sale its worth the shot. Don't instantly belive all the negativity if your a patient person and love engaging games then give it a go. If it doesnt work its almost more easier to refund than it is to purchaching it, so dont feel afraid. Haha unless your playing! That is all : )

column8: Muy buen juego

O jogo em si é ótimo (no console apenas)
Os gráficos do PC até tem como elogiar, mas os controles e a câmera que sempre dá um jeito de bugar são os maiores pecados...!
claro que também tem a mal optimização, que para um jogo de 2008, ele é completamente travado, até o Resident Evil 5, que é da mesma época, com gráficos MUITO melhores, roda melhor que o Homecoming. 
Juro que eu elogiaria mais esse título se eu tivesse analisando as versões Console, mesmo! 
mas essa versão PC é uma completa cagada!  que a única coisa "Boa" é que dá pra instalar o Patch de tradução (que nem oficinal é) para entender melhor a história, porque tirando isso, NEM conquistas o jogo tem (coisa que no console ele tem)
Ou seja, Konami deveria vender o Silent Hill para uma empresa mais séria e respeitável. faria uso melhor dessa franquia, eu garanto.

Jogo muito bom mesmo, te prende facil, agora uma observação, se você tem console, jogue por ele, por que a versão de pc dele ta realmente bem bugadinha, com loadings demorados pacas e o fato dele crashar as vezes do nada, mas mesmo assim recomendo pq é um puta jogaço, e caso n tenha um console vale a pena jogar, só ter paciencia.

¡Injugable!

Soy un gran fan de esta saga y estoy seguro de que este juego me agradaria pero es un port patetico. Incluso Deadly premonition funcionaba mejor que este videojuego.

Los controles se cambian solos y dan fallos costantemente. El juego sufre costantes problemas técnicos como congelamientos de imagen o se crashea mandandote a windows y perdiendo todo el progreso. 

De momento la única tensión que sufro con este juego es no saber cuando se crasheara la partida.

Lamentable, Konami.

I can’t believe Im saying that I don’t recommend a silent hill game; but this one is just bad. 
Long loading screens, a combat system that’s clunky at best and broken at worst. 
Monsters that are much too strong would be fine in a horror game, except there are times where you are surrounded. 
This quickly leads to a cheap death, and another long loading screen. 
Perhaps the worst sin of this game is the fact that the over the top, stilted attempt to force horror down your throat, actually makes the game not scary at all. 
I love the Silent Hill games. 
I’ve played 1 through 4, origins, and shattered memories multiple times all the way through. 
But this one I didn’t even feel like finishing.

column8: This game is not what most will expect of a Silent Hill title. It features more action - splatter elements included. The atmosphere is great, though, I particulary liked the elements taken from the movie. A few puzzles as we know them remain, and they are good and also pretty hard, at least the ones I remember. I had a lot of fun fighting the monsters. So although it's not your typical Silent Hill, it's still a great game. I give it only 8/10 for not being very scary though.

不过我仍然要给好评，因为我是SH真爱粉，SHH也是steam上唯一一部SH作品，这就足够了！

Detesto los combates, LOS ODIO! Enemigos rapidos, personaje con movimientos lentos, estar cambiando a pose de batalla y luego a pose normal es un fastidio, la historia se ve muy interezante, pero tengo que estar luchando y luchando, aunque tenga la puñetera lampara apagada se me vienen los enemigos encima. el juego Crashea de vez en cuando de la nada, si minimisas el juego Crashea, aveces me aparece el puntero del mouse en pantalla completa. Lo unico bueno, es que aveces te aparecen enemigos cuando te das la vuelta y te pegas uno que otro susto.

I hate giving negative reviews, especially to games that have a good concept but I cannot in all honesty reccomend this game. It is a good game but a garbage port. I almost couldn't finish the dumb game because it crashed all the time and you have to play it on 1080-720 and medium graphics or the game won't run at all. The fighting is clunky, the ammo is scarce, the game freezes all the time and crashes. Your stuck with their crap checkpoint system and randomly sometimes enemies are immune to bullets. It's a decent game with a good story but it isn't scary which isn't good for a horror game and the ending is absolute garbage. There is a reason this game has mixed reviews. If you want to truly enjoy this game, play it on console but do not buy this game. This game isn't even worth it at 80% off. I wish I hadn't bought this game and saved me a lot of trouble. What a terrible game.

column8:
Gosto muito de poder jogar com um personagem que não seja tão vulnerável e sem habilidades de combate como são os primeiros protagonistas de Silent Hill. Isso deixa a experiência mais dinâmica. As lutas são mais divertidas, apesar de ainda valer muito a pena sair correndo em vários momentos ao invés de ficar e batalhar.

Em questões de história, ele é curioso e cruel, como um Silent Hill deve ser. Fui gostando a cada novo desenvolvimento.
Só realmente me irrita a quantidade de bugs. O meu jogo fechou sozinho mil vezes. Matei um certo boss 3 vezes e não pude avançar porque ele simplesmente fechava sozinho. Como consigo rodar jogos mais pesados nesse computador, só posso imaginar que seja um problema com o port dele.

É uma pena, só espero poder jogá-lo até o fim.
Someone should sue Double Helix for false advertising because this sure as hell isn't Silent Hill.
column9: Someone should sue Double Helix for false advertising because this sure as hell isn't Silent Hill.

column8:
[b]Ha nagy Silent Hill fan vagy, max csak akkor vedd meg, de ha nem vagy az, messziről kerüld el, nem akarsz idegbeteg lenni, hidd el.[/b]

4 euróért vettem a játékot akcióban, olcsóbban ennél nem lehet megkapni és mivel nagy Silent hill Rajongó vagyok, ki akartam játszani. Kezdem először magával a játékmegvalósítással, a borzalmas ürülékittas technikai hibák és bugok mellőzésével, ezt később írom le, illetve a tippeket, hogy ne kapjon más szálkás agy****t rajtam kívül majd.

-----
SILENT HILL:

A leggyengébbre sikeredett rész. A történet átlagos, megint keres egy nagy csávó egy gyereket (alias Silent Hill 1), a szereplők nem elég karakteresek, kevés az érzelmi töltet. Sőt, Alex egy hidegvérű gyilkoló gép inkább.

Sajnos hiányoznak a játékból a misztikumok, rejtélyek. Silent Hill 2-ben pl minden egyes helynek megvolt a maga története, lehetett agyalni és képzelegni, vajon milyen borzalmas dolgok történhetet minden egyes szobában. Itt nem fogsz semmi ilyet érezni. A szobák ismétlődnek, nem ijesztőek, az emberek megjelenése meg lazít a játék félelmetességén, nem érezzük eléggé egyedül magunkat. Túl sokat lazít.

Sok az értelmetlen történés is a játékban. Szóval a fiatal csajszi pakolgatja ki az eltűnt emberek képeit a falra, hm? Észre se veszi, hogy körülötte pár méterre förtelmes kutyák rohangálnak. Még ha egy megőrült nő lenne...
Alex-et nem érdekli egyáltalán, hogy mik azok a mentésként szolgáló szimbolumok a falakon? Nem hezitál belenyúlni a véres falba, beleugrani a sötét lyukakba... De legalább tudd 10 métert zuhanni a hátára, hogy aztán 2 másodperc alatt felpattanjon, mert jön egy szörny...

Ettől függetlenül talán azt mondhatom, hogy egyszer végigjátszható típusú game lehetne, de nem az, inkább... 

----
SZOFTVER:

...EGY NAGY RAKÁS, HATALMAS, BÜZÖLGŐ ....! Elmondom én mikkel lehet szembesülni a játék során:

- A felbontást 1024x768-ra állítva lehet csak grafikai hibáktól mentesen játszani (nagyobb felbontáson torzulnak a tárgyak modeljei, nem lehet a térképet látni, ect)
- Van, amikor elkezd a 30 cap-es játék szaggatni. Nem bírja biztos a 1060-as kártyám, gondolom...
- Nagyon hosszú töltési idők vannak, kb 20-30mp. Ezenkívül van, hogy a játék is megmerevedik 15 másodpercre
- Géptől függően nem jó hang. Ha szerencséd van, bizonyos jeleneteknél csak valamivel halkabban hallod a karakterek beszélését, ha peched, akkor egyáltalán nem (!) vagy fel kell tekerned 100%-kal a hangerőt, hogy valami sustorgást legalább halj.
- Véletlenszerűen kifagyhat a játék. Bármikor. Ritkán, de bármikor.
- Lövőfegyverekkel van, amikor nem tudsz lőni, hiába nyomogatod a gombot.
- Puzzle feladatoknál rosszul érzékeli a kurzort és a hajad téped, mire nagynehezen sikerül valamit beállítanod.
- Az egyik boss esetén, ha meghaltam, majd checkpointot visszatöltötte, gyorsabb lett a mozgása kb 15%-kal. 6x halálnál inkább visszatöltöttem egy régebbi mentést, mert lehetetlenség volt már bármit is csinálni ellene :D A második boss-nál volt ez.
- Az óra puzzle nem fogadta el a helyes feladványt!
- ...és még van egy halom glitch a játékban, ami megakadályozhatja, hogy tovább tudj játszani.

Ezenkívül a játék irányítása borzalmas, a kitérés nem igazán akar működni, mentéspontok nagyon ritkán vannak és hülye helyeken, a checkpointok szintén. A játékmenet lineáris, ha kinyitsz egy ajtót, akkor általában nem tudsz visszamenni, hiába láttál ott még egy tárgyat vagy fegyvert, rajzot. Á-á. Nem fogsz visszamenni barátom, majd ha újrajátszod. Én így hagytam ki valszeg a mesterlövész puskát, mert nem mentem be egy helyre érte, visszamenni meg már nem lehetett...

Ha a játéknehézségét szeretnénk egy görbével leírni, egy hatalmas kiugrást lehetne rajzolni a seriff irodája részétől a Fitch irodájáig. Tonnaszám kapod a legnehezebben megölhető enemyket (és nem egyenként jönnek, hanem kettesével minimum), elfogy a lőszer és az összes egészségcsomag. (Én ennél a résznél letöröltem a játékot és megpróbáltam refoundolni a steamnél, annyira felbosszantott. Ekkor már benne volt 6 órám, szóval nem adták vissza a pénzem. Másik taktikát alkalmaztam és sikerült túl lendülni rajta nagynehezen.

Szóval ez,... ez valami borzalmas. Én nem tudom, hogy képzelték, hogy így kiadják a game-t pc-re és kijelentik, hogy nem javítják a bugokat.

-----
Tippek, melyek segíthetnek elkerülni, hogy sokat szívj a játékkal:
- Mindig szeparáltan ments. Ha új épületbe érkezel, az a mentés legyen külön, ha egy puzzle megoldást megcsinálsz, legyen külön. Azért, mert ha behibásodik a játék, tovább tudj menni egy régebbi mentésből újra megcsinálva.
- Amikor csak tudod, kapcsold ki a lámpát
- Amikor lehet, fuss. Ha már sokadszorra kapod az áldást, pl seriff irodája rész, memorizáld a felvehető dolgokat és fuss el inkább az ellenségek mellett. Rengeteg med kitet és lőszert spórolsz.
- Clock puzzle, a szülők házában, miután bezáródik a bejárati ajtó: először ezt csináld meg, mert ha bármi más puzzle-t oldasz meg előtte, akkor nem fogja elfogadni a helyes választ, csak valami véletlenszerű értéket. Nekem végig kellett pörgetnem az összes óra összes percén, mire sikerült kitalálni (hiába na, kitartó vagyok)
- Használj kést. Minden nehezebb fegyver annyira lassú, hogy csak a med kitet pazarolod a használatukkal.
- Amint tudod használd el a szérumokat, hogy növeld az életerőd. Én nem tudtam mire való, mert semmi leírás nincs hozzá a játékban, utána kellett olvasgatnom. Azt hittem valami extra boost.

------
Végszó: Ez a játék tényleg egy rémálom. Csak ehhez nem kell lekapcsolni a lámpát.

8/10

wciągalność: 7,5/10 
grafa: 8/10 
audio: 6/10

i jedzie ciężarówką która prowadzi "Bobby" xD

+śmieszne nowe potworki
+Silent Hill xD

Avant tout, je tiens à préciser que je suis fan de survival horror, que j'aime la série des Silent Hill, mais que je voue surtout un véritable culte à Silent Hill 2.
Je n'ai jamais retrouvé ce que j'ai vécu avec Silent Hill 2, y compris dans les autres épisodes de la série, et je crois que ça n'arrivera jamais plus.

Bien entendu je n'en attendais pas autant de Homecoming, j'espérais juste un bon Silent Hill, mais devant les critiques mitigées, j'ai vraiment très tardé avant d'y jouer.
J'ai fait fi du fait que cet épisode ait été réalisé par une équipe différente, j'y ai joué comme j'aurai pu jouer à n'importe quel autre Silent Hill et avec l'esprit ouvert.

L'enthousiasme de mes débuts s'est malheureusement peu à peu étiolé, alors que j'identifiais la nature de ce jeu: ses points forts...puis ses problèmes.
Le gameplay est plus action, mais pour moi il fonctionne à peu près, et il s'explique par le profil du personnage principal.
Je n'ai rien contre un épisode de la série Silent Hill ou ce dernier sait à peu près se défendre pour une fois.
( même si je trouve que la première arme que l'on trouve: le couteau, est vraiment trop efficace de par sa rapidité comparé aux autres armes blanches).
Sauf que ce n'est pas une raison pour baser tout le jeu sur les affrontements !
En gros ce Homecoming emprunte la formule plus si nouvelle que ça des jeux AAA de maintenant, à savoir suivre un véritable couloir, rythmé par des combats obligatoires ou non.
J'ai vraiment été choqué par l’absence d'exploration, et je trouve ça triste que cela arrive aussi à cette série qui n'a rien à voir.
On pouvait presque toujours se promener plus ou moins librement dans la ville dans les anciens épisodes, ce qui était l'un des éléments clés de la licence.
Ici on a le droit qu'à un seul petit quartier minuscule en extérieur, et les niveaux intérieurs sont ultra linéaires.
Heureusement les énigmes, pas toujours évidentes, sont toujours là.
La difficulté a globalement été revue à la hausse par rapport aux autres Silent hill qui étaient beaucoup trop simples.
Dans Homecoming, on ressent vraiment le côté survival horror : peu de munitions et soins vraiment utiles.

Quant à l'ambiance et la dimension artistique, le résultat est en demi teinte.
On retrouve l’atmosphère à la fois malsaine et planante de Silent Hill: les musiques et les bruitages sont très réussis, et les designs des quelques nouvelles créatures font partie des meilleurs de la série.
Mais pour le reste, on a malheureusement l'impression que les développeurs ont bêtement suivi un cahier des charges sans ambition, sans aucune originalité, pour que cela "ait l'air de Silent Hill".
Ils ont repris tous les environnements et le bestiaire des anciens épisodes, quasiment du copié/ collé, sans oublier de plagier aussi un peu le film tant qu'on y est.
Homecoming reste inquiétant et stressant, mais le niveau de peur des anciens Silent Hill n'est jamais atteint

En ce qui concerne l'histoire, même constat.
Elle est intrigante, elle a du potentiel car elle est à la fois "sataniste" et psychologique, mais elle ne fonctionne qu'à moitié.
Elle s'inspire un peu trop du côté religieux de la plupart des Silent Hill et de Silent Hill 2.
Du coup on a encore l'impression que les développeurs ont cherché à mixer ce qui avait déjà été fait, mais de façon moins subtile et moins travaillée, au lieu de créer vraiment la leur.
De plus, une certaine incohérence m'empêche d'apprécier pleinement le scénario.
Il y a tout de même des choses à déchiffrer, et les monstres, dans leur designs torturés, ont vraiment du sens, ce qui est un bon point.

Il y a de la beauté dans ce jeu, et je mentirais si je disais que je n'ai pas apprécié l'expérience.
Le gameplay plus action est efficace, et l'histoire et ses symboles disséminés ci et là touchent et peuvent faire réfléchir.

Mais l'expérience est malheureusement gâchée lorsqu'on a déjà joué aux anciens titres.
Mon ressenti global, c'est que les développeurs ne se sont pas approprié Silent Hill, ils n'ont pas su insuffler une identité propre à leur Homecoming.
A la place, ils ont très scolairement appliqué une recette, sans grande inspiration, de ce qui a déjà été vu et revu dans les volets précédents et le film, comme une sorte de patchwork qui manque d'âme.

En tant que survival horror, il fait le taf, en revanche en tant que Silent Hill il est un peu décevant pour les raisons que j'ai expliquées.
Homecoming n'est pas un mauvais jeu, c'est juste un survival horror correct, et sans doute un des moins bons épisodes de la série des Silent Hill.
Il convient davantage à quelqu'un qui n'a jamais joué à un Silent Hill, et qui recherche un survival horror sympas sans prise de tête.
Je le conseil tout de même, mais pour un public averti.


* Points forts :

+ Graphiquement correct.
+ L'ambiance
+ Le design des nouveaux monstres
+ La modélisation et les animations des monstres
+ Le gameplay action des combat qui fonctionne
+ Le challenge (moins de ressources etc.)
+ Les énigmes
+ Une histoire qui a du potentiel...
+ Les nombreux commentaires du personnage sur les environnements
+ La bande son

* Points faibles :

- Pas aussi effrayant que les anciens Silent Hill
- Trop de réutilisations des anciens Silent Hill ( créatures, environnements, etc)
- Beaucoup trop dirigiste
- Un poil trop action
- Le couteau un peu cheaté ?
- Histoire pas assez travaillée
- Manque globalement d'inspiration
- Mauvais portage PC ( crashs, freezes, longs temps de chargements, etc)



13/20

column8:
I only recommend this game on a couple conditions:

1) If you love Silent Hill stories, you will like this game 
2) I really enjoyed the enemy design, very creative.

However, this game is riddled with bugs. 

1) Game will constantly freeze for a whole minute in mid-play during certain sections (it's not loading, it's unloading... its anus... on your face)
2) Graphics go from spectacular to 8-bit minecraft with no rhyme or reason (Elle's eyebrows turn into an 8-bit pixel mess which can and will ruin the aura)
3) Puzzles are fun to do, but not when the controls are making it even harder. Highlighting certain wires and selecting certain pieces of a moveable puzzle become tediously difficult simply because you can't select them or you lose your cursor and have to exit and re-enter the puzzle.

Those are just 3 out of many more that I'll save you the trouble of reading just surmise that - This game needs more work.

column8:
This game is terrible. Not the game itself but the production that makes it almost unplayable. 

The first problem is that occasionally it just "stops working" and exits to windows. It happend several times throughout the game randomly.

The second is that the game freezes for some time while playing or when you try to save or before cutscenes. When this happens the game doesn't crash but you see one frame for a while and you can continue after that. But this is very annoying since it happens a lot.

The third is the controls. I played it with mouse+keyboard. The movements are sluggish. You get killed while you're waiting for the character to stop a previous attack or when you exit the "fight mode" it takes time until you can dodge properly. 
Solving the puzzles with the mouse is a nightmare. Sometimes you need to click 10-20 times until it does what you want. You can highlight the item you want to move but it doesn't do anythig but gives an irritating sound. You try to solve a puzzle that nees concentration but the sh**ty controls and the fu**in sounds completely distract you and the only thing you can think of is the most violent uninstall that you've ever done.

I played it to the end and the game would be quite good and I still enjoyed it despite the frustrating errors but I wouldn't buy it again and I can't recommend it to anyone.

column8:
🔴 Giocato anni fa su PS3, non è il miglior capitolo della saga, ma rimane pur sempre un ottimo titolo nonostante qualche magagna tecnica e di gameplay.

Purtroppo la versione PC (italiana) ha un problema Fastidioso... 
In pratica nella schermata principale di gioco, non ti permette di selezionare ne il Controller Xbox, ne le Opzioni Grafiche (Non si vedono proprio).
Ma non disperate, perchè c'è una semplice soluzione...

Per risolvere questo inconveniente; avviate il Gioco da STEAM in lingua INGLESE e poi nelle Opzioni del GIOCO settate il Controller e la Risoluzione Video che preferite, uscite nuovamente dal gioco e rimettete la lingua italiana sempre tramite STEAM.

Ora il Controller funzionerà alla perfezione!. 

Buon Divertimento! 😉.

column8: I wish I could say Silent Hill: Homecoming is some kind of masterpiece, as it's the only Silent Hill game on Steam, but it is far from it. While not terrible by any means, the game is obviously inferior to its earlier counterparts in numerous ways, and the PC port's various issues - including completely locked 30fps and random crashing, often from alt-tabbing - make for a lackluster experience. The latter can also become particularly infuriating with the game's fairly sporadic save system.

column8:
Silent Hill Homecoming vuelve a retomar el verdadero estilo de la saga, luego de que en Silent Hill 4 viéramos algo enteramente distinto, colocando al jugador en el papel de Henry quien estaba encerrado en su apartamento, el juego tuvo una tremenda recepción aunque muy por debajo de los anteriores, pero no estoy para hablar del 4 (el cual es mi favorito de la saga), sino del Homecoming, el cual retoma los aspectos esenciales.

La jugabilidad es muy buena, aunque tiene sus fallos, el juego implementó un nuevo sistema de ataque con cuchillo, cuando se está cara a cara con un enemigo se debe esquivar y atacar cuando es debido, algunos adversarios resultan más difíciles que otros pero a la final si dominas sus ataques los terminaras venciendo muy fácil, no se puede correr, y para interactuar siempre se debe pulsar el botón izquierdo del mouse, se deben resolver puzles para avanzar en el juego así como también tomar decisiones e incluso elegir respuestas cuando ocurra algún evento significativo, de esto dependerá cual será el final.

La historia es compleja y para su entendimiento es bueno leerse alguna explicación, al igual que el simbolismo en los monstruos, etc; el juego se centra en Alex Sheperd, un soldado proveniente de la guerra que vuelve a su pueblo natal en Sheperd´s Glen. Alex encuentra el pueblo en un estado de decadencia, abandonado y frio, y a su pequeño hermano Joshua desaparecido. Mientras Alex avanza en la búsqueda de su hermano menor, descubre sobre la Orden –el culto de Silent Hill- así como sobre la historia del pueblo y de si mismo.

En mi experiencia debo decir que el juego es bueno, pero no más que eso, me encontré con cantidad de bugs, lags y se me ha crasheado muchas veces a lo largo del jueguito, cosa que no tiene nada que ver con mi PC, según he leído el juego estuvo muy mal desarrollado para PC, y mucha gente lo critico por eso, además el sistema de guardado es malísimo, hay que recorrer bastante para encontrar un punto de guardado, la historia es muy buena y, los gráficos son excelentes aunque pudieron ser mejores, el diseño visual y los escenarios son tremendos y generan esa tensión clásica de la saga, terroríficos monstruos y soberbio giro final.

7/10

[h1]Great installment[/h1]

A little backstory to begin the review: 

I've been exposed to Silent Hill since early childhood. My father would play and I would curiously watch but cover my eyes when the really disturbing moments happened. At about 13 years of age I took on my first SH game in the form of SH: Origins for PSP, which in my opinion was a very good game, considering the technical constraints of a handheld. Although not too scary, Origins possessed the desired atmosphere and a good story. I thought to myself that sooner or later I should explore the SH universe a bit more. 

Quite recently I noticed that Steam actually had Silent Hill: Homecoming up in the store. The $39.99 price tag, however, turned me the f*ck off, so I wishlisted it and patiently waited for a price drop that never took place. Thanks to a third party reseller (most of you guys know who I'm talking about), I bought this game for $9 and began the journey.

I originally owned this game for the PS3, and while my dad has beaten it before, I have not really paid attention to his gameplay nor the story, so I decided to tackle the game myself several years later. 

Firstly I would like to mention that I have started playing this Steam version on my desktop back at home, took the save files with me to college, and continued on a laptop there. I was able to select suitable settings and beat the game successfully from start to finish. I understand the disappointment of the people that bought it and were frustrated by graphical glitches, but it seems that this is merely a compatibility issue and not a universal game-breaking bug or anything of that sort. I am not going to defend the developers for poor optimization, which they should have surely worked more on, but if you aren't certain that it will work on your PC, don't spend $40. Grab a cheap copy for the Xbox 360 (~$5) and you'll be better off.

Now, there were definitely several issues that I experienced with this PC port:

1) Super long loading screens 
2) Long pauses during gameplay when Alex went from one area to the other and the map was supposedly loading very slowly in the background (which made you think that the game froze)
3) Several instances when everything turned white and I couldn't see where I was going, causing to restart from checkpoint
4) Alt+tab made the game crash

Although these issues can be very annoying, they personally have not affected my overall impression of the game, because luckily for me they all happened pretty close to checkpoints and I was able to start over. 

Putting the technical aspect aside, the story was pretty interesting. This was one of the few video games where I actually watched and paid attention to every single cutscene, as I usually just skip them over. I was sucked into the atmosphere for good, and to be honest, despite my current age, I was still a little scared to play through some areas and my gaming sessions would last a little over an hour as I needed a break from the horror. I am definitely aware that this game is not even close to being the scariest in the series, as the original four titles were the most iconic, however I still feel that it did not fail to impress with its setting, characters,  script, and unusually good combat. What I think slightly ruined the overall impression were the poorly animated facial features during close-up dialogues, considering it was not 1999 anymore and the technology was there, but maybe the budget was cut short and so there wasn't enough resources to execute everything to the max. (fun fact: the Japanese release for this game never happened.) In my opinion, release of Homecoming is the beginning of Konami's carelessness towards the franchise, letting it roll downhill ever since.

What I really wish is that the original four games get released here on Steam for a reasonable price and with several graphical improvements. I am quite confident that both hardcore fans and beginners like me would have a blast.

Overall, even despite all the bullsh*t, I really enjoyed Silent Hill: Homecoming and I am certainly growing more and more attracted to the Silent Hill universe (perhaps getting old enough to understand it.) If you guys can find a cheap key - try this game out. If you still have console versions of the older games - replay them. The atmosphere is amazing.

[b]7/10[/b]

column8:
Très très grand fan de Silent Hill j'ai eu envie de relancer le jeu dispo sur steam à ce jour. Et mes vieux souvenirs qui vont avec ! 

Côté scénario, le jeu est très bien, même s'il est en dessous des originaux de la silent team et de ceux de Climax UK. Le jeu prend appui sur des idées reprises du film de Gans (et pas les moins bonnes) et ressort surtout sur un côté Stephen Kingien (La Brume) avec un côté Hostel (qui plairait selon les gôuts)

Côté gameplay, ça fâche un peu. L'orientation action est trop soutenue pour des combats très inégaux face à certains Boss et Mobs (Le bon de fin est d'une facilité par rapport au premier !!) Les saves sont inégalement réparties et font très souvent RAGER. (jamais après un boss...)

Enfin, ce qui me fait avec désespoir râler, c'est qu'il m'a fallu parcourir le net en son intégralité pour le faire rouler. Car oui, SH Homecoming est un portage PC pitoyable. et Konami n'a jamais pris d'attention pour l'améliorer.  Le jeu crash souvent et des freeze de plus de 20 sec arrivent souvent quand on va sauvegarder ou avant/après des cut scenes. 

Au désespoir des joueurs, qui espère trouver des save pour ne pas avoir à tout refaire le temps que le jeu ne PLANTE PAS ...

Au final, faites si vous des nerfs d'acier et que vous êtes un fan de la saga.... ou allez sur PS3 / XBOX 360 si vous voulez le découvrir :)
