Alex Shepherd adlı karakterimiz bir askerdir. Alex bir savaş sırasında yaralanır ve hastaneye kaldırılır. Ancak hastanede garip şeyler olmaktadır. Alex, kardeşi Joshua'nın kaybolduğuna dair hastanede bazı işaretler bulur. Tedavisi bittiğinde hemen evine ve kasabası Shepherd's Glen'e döner ama karşısında bulduğu manzara tarifi mümkün değildir. Tüm kasabayı sis kaplamıştır, ortada ölüm sessizliği vardır ve neredeyse kasabada hiç insan yoktur. Alex hemen evine döner. Alex'in Annesi, kardeşi Joshua'nın gerçekten kayıp olduğunu anlatır. Üstüne üstlük Joshua'yı aramaya giden babası da kaybolmuştur. Annesi ise hem ruhsal hem de fiziksel açıdan çökmüş bir durumdadır. Alex kardeşi ve Joshua'yı bulmak için hiç beklemeden hemen yola koyulur.

Önceki oyunlardan farklar
Önceki oyunlardan en büyük farkı bence yalnızlık ortamı. Kasabada gezinirken o yalnızlığı çok iyi bir şekilde hissediyorsunuz. Bu ortam bile sizi ürkütmeye yetiyor. 

Grafiklerde diğer oyunlara göre daha başarılı. Ancak sadece daha başarılı. Oyunun grafikleri için "Yeni Nesil" olacağı söylenmişti. Ancak pek de "Yeni Nesil" olacağa benzemiyordu. Ve olmadı da. Grafikler sadece iyi olmakta kaldı.

Kontroller

Eğer mümkünse oyunu bir kolla oynayın. Çünkü tam kontrol için sürekli tuşlara basmak benim gibi bazılarının sinirlerini bozabiliyor. Oyun boyunca kontrollerde hızlı olmanız gerekmiyor, ancak gene de ben size kol tavsiye etmiş olayım.

Kayıt Noktaları 

Silent Hill oyunlarının klasiği olarak belli yerlerdeki kayıt noktaları ile oyunu kayıt edebiliyoruz. Ancak farz edelim ki çok ilerledik ve kayıt etmeden öldük. Ya da kayıt noktasını fark etmedik. Geriden başlayacak olmamız gerçekten çok sinir bozucu. 

Dövüş Taktikleri

Oyunda bence dövüşler yeterince zor olmamış. Rakibi sersemlet, sonra ağır atağını yaparak öldür. Felsefeniz bu olmalı. Zaten başka bir felsefe yok. Savunmada ise tam rakibimiz bize darbeyi atmadan önce boşluk tuşuna basıp takla atarak hamleden kaçabiliriz. Bunun ardından rakibimize yaptığımız birkaç küçük hamle rakibimizi sersemletecektir. Sonra da ağır atak ile rakibimizi öldürebiliriz.

Son Sözler
Oyun puanlarına diğer yerlerde baktığımda hep düşüktü. Genel olarak kimse beğenmemiş hatta bu oyuna serinin en zayıf halkası diyenler olmuş. Ancak ben ise bu oyunu çok beğendim. Bana soracak olursanız bence serinin en güzel oyunu bence bu oyundur. Size tavsiyem bu oyunu mutlaka oynayın.

Grafik 6/10
Oynanış 7/10
Hikaye 8/10

[h1]POR FAVOR LES AGRADECERÍA QUE SE TOMEN UN POCO DE SU TIEMPO PARA LEER ESTO, ESO ME HARIA MUY FELIZ, GRACIAS. Un comentario diciendo porque te ha sido útil o porque no antes de valorar se agradece bastante.[/h1]

[spoiler]Hace poco me volví a pasar el juego y he hecho algunas modificaciones en la review, la mayoría cosas de ortografía y redacción porque quise mantener la esencia del análisis del Harry del 2016. [/spoiler]

Silent Hill Homecoming es la sexta entrega de la saga que se lanzaría en setiembre del 2008 y con la novedad que sería el primer juego de Silent Hill en llegar a PC (Steam) y el único lamentablemente.

Sobre este juego hay mucho que comentar principalmente por la división de los fans y crítica, personalmente como fan de la saga desde que tengo memoria, y habiendo jugado todos los juegos a excepción del Downpour [spoiler](Ya lo jugué)[/spoiler], puedo hacer una crítica en base a lo que aprendí como fan de la saga y del género del survival horror.

Para mí Silent Hill y Resident Evil (bueno lo que era Resident Evil) son los principales referentes del género survival horror, siendo ya casi dos sagas muertas [spoiler](Eran)[/spoiler], RE por lo que se convirtió y SH por lo que se quedó en el olvido para Konami, tenía muchas expectativas sobre Homecoming, veía trailers, imágenes y se veía muy bien, pero leía comentario de personas que decían que era un juego malo, que no tenía nada que ver con SH, que era puro fanservice, que era un insulto para la saga etc, etc, etc, claro, la mayoría sin argumentos claros, hasta que me animé a jugarlo, y cumplió con todo lo que tenía que cumplir, tanto como SH y como survival horror.[spoiler](Es decente).[/spoiler]

A diferencia de muchos, yo empecé a jugar este juego con la idea de que sería un buen SH, pero que no superaría a sus antecesores por el simple motivo de que esos juegos nunca serán superados, SH 1, 2, 3, 4 y origin, son clásicos, esos juegos siempre tendrán un recuerdo en tu corazón, ningún juego por más gráficos realistas que tenga,o una historia perturbadora e intrigante, una ambientación brutal, hablo del cancelado Silent Hills, ni aunque  ese juego hubiese tenido todo eso, nunca hubiera podido ofrecerte esa sensación de la primera vez que probaste SH, son tantas emociones inexplicables con palabras, tantos sentimientos que ningún juego de lo volverá a dar, porque los clásicos no se superan con nada, mucha gente pensó que Homecoming podría si quiera igualar alguno de sus antecesores, eso, cualquier fan de corazón de la saga, sabe que es imposible.

Homecoming cuenta la historia de Alex Shepherd, un joven soldado que regresa a casa después de hacer servicio a la patria, cuando llega se da cuenta que su padre y hermano están desaparecidos, y todo su pueblo está en ruinas, no quiero entrar en spoilers pero yo creo que la historia de este juego es decente, principalmente porque tiene un parecido y/o una conexión con la historia de James (Protagonista de SH 2), pero también porque explora el después de la Orden (Culto de SH), esta es una de las historia más dementes y retorcidas de la saga, ¿sacrificarías a un miembro de tu familia como ofrenda para un Dios?.

Gráficamente cumple con lo necesario de un juego de 7ma generación, nada brutal pero muy bien logrado, el diseño de los niveles, ambientación, escenarios, etc, me parecen muy bien construidos, en este juego se verá poco el lado oscuro de Silent Hill, pero las veces que nos adentramos a ese mundo transmitirá lo que esa parte de la cuidad debe lograr, algo que quiero resaltar muchísimo es el diseño de los monstruos, son espectaculares, principalmente los Bosses y la historia que hay detrás de ellos, espectacular.

Y por supuesto uno de los aspectos más grandes del juego, es el sountrack, obviamente por el regreso del gran Akira Yamaoka, cada pieza musical, cada nivel, cada batalla, es una delicia para los oídos, si un juego de horror logra combinar ambientación + soundtrack, es que ha hecho un buen trabajo, y este juego, como todo Silent Hill, lo hace.

Ahora voy por una de las partes que fue más criticada, la jugabilidad, Homecoming hizo un cambio muy grande en este aspecto a comparación de sus antecesores, la idea no estuvo mal, pero no lograron acertarla al 100%, el caso es que ahora puedes defenderte de los enemigos, algo que hace este cambio es perder un poco el miedo a las criaturas que te acechan, digo un poco, porque si lo juegas en el nivel de dificultad más alto (Cosa que debes, porque así se disfruta el verdadero Silent Hill), no puedes defenderte de todos, porque estas limitado en curas y munición, así que en muchas ocasiones solo te queda escapar de ellos y rogar que no te golpeen, esos momentos de persecución sí que generan tensión, más aun en lugares estrechos y sin saber dónde está la salida, un cambio que para mí quedó en el olvido, al menos estuvo mejor que en el Downpour.

[h1]Piramid Head y las enfermeras:[/h1]

Mucho se habló de este tema, que no tenía ningún sentido sus apariciones, que era fanservice, que el juego no tiene sentido, bla bla bla bla.
Nada en Silent Hill tiene sentido, eso es lo hermoso de esta saga, su infinita y confusa historia, no hablo del Homecoming o de uno en especial, hablo de toda la saga en conjunto, porque sí, todo está conectado, y el Homecoming aún más, este es uno de los juegos que tiene una gran conexión con los sucesos de la orden y lo que paso después de Alessa, explora aspectos del culto que no sabíamos y cierra de alguna manera esa etapa, eso explicaría en parte la aparición de las enfermeras, de alguna manera Alessa sigue ahí, aún no descansa en paz, y en cuando a Piramid head, ya había dicho la gran conexión que tiene el juego con SH 2 y lo parecido que son sus historias Alex y James comparten mucho, no hablo de Piramid Head, es lo de menos, hablo del pasado de cada uno, y algún personaje, la mayoría de gente habla de Piramid Head sin saber quién es él, muchos piensan que es solo James y están muy equivocados, no voy a hacer un párrafo de 10 líneas explicando quien es, pero para eso está internet, pero tienen que buscar blogs serios y con argumentos, pero acaba una pequeña explicación:

"Piramid Head es la representación de la culpabilidad, es aquel verdugo que te atormenta por un acto que has cometido e intentas olvidar"; bueno, en resumen es eso, Piramid Head tiene una historia muy grande que abarca muchas cosas, y para finalizar, ESTO ES SILENT HILL, no un juego en el cual te cuente una historia en la cual el príncipe rescata a la princesa y fin, esta saga se caracteriza por tener una trama grande, rica, confusa, si buscas un juego en el cual te cuente todo, este no es para ti, en Silent Hill no encontraras las respuestas a simple vista, hay que indagar, buscar, explorar, muchas veces retroceder y recordar sucesos anteriores, esto es lo rico de Silent Hill, si quieres algo simple, no juegues esto, pero si lo haces, no te inventes cosas sin sentido, porque en Silent Hill todo tiene un porqué.

[code]http://store.steampowered.com/app/19000/[/code]

P. D. Lamentablemente el juego ya no está disponible en steam, pero puedes comprar una key en G2A está a 10$, para lo ofrece el precio es más que suficiente. [spoiler]Ahora ya está, pero en ese tiempo no estaba.[/spoiler]

P. D.D. El port de PC es una bazofia, tuve que instalar 14.000 parches para no sé que, y aún así el juego me pasaba de 120fps a 40fps por momentos, es horroroso, lo que más miedo me dio de este videojuego es el terrible port que hicieron, así que ya sabes, si lo compras. debes lidiar con estos problemas.

[h1]Cualquier duda o consejo, coméntenlo así podemos debatir sobre el titulo o sobre qué les pareció el análisis, GRACIAS. [/h1]

The thumbs up is soley on the game's story.  It's a good game, but it has some bugs.  Crashed a few times on me.  Also, I see a black screen (with audio still working) when the resolution is set to ultrawide 21:9 aspect ratios (2560x1080 or 3440x1440).  And if the resolution is set higher than 1080p the inventory window only displays 1/4 of itself.  If I play at 1920x1080 it seem to run ok on Win10 (with crashes here and there).  The game also tends to freeze for 10 seconds here and there; just be patient until it resumes.  So yeah, if you don't mind all that, the game's story is pretty descent.  On second thought, maybe I should just delete it and go play RE.  LOL, nah!

column8: Truly underrated Silent Hill game. Although I can't fully recommend to those who aren't already a fan of the genre. Very true to the Silent Hill formula and exactly what we'd come to expect from a Silent Hill game  in 2008. This is a good thing as the game sticks to what makes the original Silent Hill games good, with additional refinements for modern gamers. The largest drawback is the fact that the game lingers too much on tropes from Silent Hill 2 instead of forming it's own identity. Definitely a case of fan service. Which would be fine if this were some sort of fan project, but this is a stand alone Silent Hill title. Why is Alex Shepherd seeing the nurses from SH 2 when they are an incarnation unique to James Sunderland? These are the sorts of questions that will arise for any Silent Hill fan, who are the only people i would recommend the game for.

column8:
Como uma fã da franquia Silent Hill há mais de 15 anos, juro que tentei gostar mais desse jogo, sem sucesso. Talvez pelo fato de ser um port terrível, cheio de crashes e bugs, ou mesmo pelo fato de que o jogo em si tem suas falhas. Vamos lá:

+Boa atmosfera.
+Trilha sonora espetacular.
+boa ambientação
+Transições entre fogworld e Otherworld em tempo real.
+O combate do jogo em si. 
+Finais alternativos e bônus desbloqueáveis, aumentando o fator rejogabilidade.

-Falta de originalidade no design de alguns monstros, alguns reaproveitados de jogos anteriores.
-A inteligência artificial não é das melhores.
-Bugs, crashes e quedas de frame que nunca foram oficialmente consertados tornam o jogo quase injogável em alguns segmentos. 
-Falta de profundidade no enredo e nos personagens.
-Ausência dos achievements presentes nas versões de console.
-Loads longos demais.

Enfim, um bom jogo, mas não um bom Silent Hill. Se você for capaz de ignorar alguns defeitos é claro.

While it may not be the greatest Silent Hill game it's still a fun game I enjoy it and i find the story interesting While it's fun it has some issues and I found myself crashing a bit overall not worth 40 dollars but i'd say it's worth a buy If you find a sale Btw Konami please bring the classics to steam I will gladly pay for them

This game is ridden with bugs.
I am a fan of the series but I wish I had not bought it.

I can't believe STEAM sell this game to its costumers. This port just doesn't have compatibility with 360 or ps3 controllers. There are some patches at web, but when you fix the controller problem the game starts to crash all the time. This PC port is really unplayable. It's not the first time a buy a unplayble game pc port at STEAM: Devil may crie 3 is another example. Such a shame. 

Não acredit que a STEAM vende este jogo aos seus clientes. O port não tem compatibilidade com os controles do 360 ou ps3. Há alguns patches na net, porém quando se arruma o problema do controle, o jogo dá crash o tempo inteiro. Não é a primeira vez que compro um jogo injogável na STEAM. Devil may cry 3 é outro exemplo. Lamentável o serviço
Bring more Silent Hill games on steam!

Gdyby zapytać fanów współczesnych horrorów co jest najważniejszą częścią tego typu gry lub filmu, na pewno większość przytoczyłaby wyskakujące znienacka okropności, często nazywane jumpscare'ami. Faktem niestety jest, że współcześni entuzjaści tego gatunku oczekują właśnie takiego podejścia i na nieszczęście dla koneserów, twórcy głównego nurtu przeważnie odpowiadają na to zapotrzebowanie, wydając kolejne, nic nie wnoszące gnioty. Z drugiej strony przy takim stanie rzeczy dużo bardziej docenia się ambitne i głębokie produkcje, zarówno w kinie, jak też w branży interaktywnej rozrywki. Seria "Silent Hill" mimo upływu lat wciąż jest po tej dobrej, konserwatywnej stronie growych horrorów. Co takiego w niej jest, że pomimo faktu, iż nie straszy nas tanimi chwytami i tak sprawia, że gracz czuje się niepewnie podczas zabawy? Przede wszystkim duszna i mroczna atmosfera, odpowiednie budowanie klimatu grozy, przerażająca stylistyka i oprawa oraz rozsądne wykorzystywanie najlepszych schematów tego gatunku. "Homecoming" to swego rodzaju hołd w stronę pierwszych trzech części serii, jak również odrobina innowacji i nieco inne, zamerykanizowane podejście do pierwotnego konceptu. Na wstępie pragnę zaznaczyć, że ta recenzja będzie nieco inna niż wszystkie. Nie będę tutaj dokładnie omawiał pojedynczych aspektów gry, tak jak to zwykle robię w moich pracach, lecz zajmę się głębszą analizą całokształtu i skonfrontuje ze sobą dwie skrajne opinie odnośnie tej produkcji.

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=482785018
"Silent Hill" od zawsze dzielił graczy na dwie grupy. Jedni zakochali się w niesamowitym klimacie, chorych projektach poziomów i przeciwników oraz w grozie i poczuciu bezradności, które pośrednio wynikajało z topornych mechanizmów rozgrywki. Drudzy zaś zostali odrzuceni przez wspomnianą wcześniej toporną mechanikę, przeciętną jakość oprawy graficznej czy też nieprzyjazne dla niedzielnego użytkownika interfejs i sterowanie. "Homecoming" podzielił graczy po raz kolejny, ale tym razem ofiarami padli fani serii, którzy znienawidzili Double Helix Games za zbyt radykalne zmiany stylu i atmosfery. Zamiast klasycznych, czysto japońskich klimatów dostajemy amerykański obraz, któremu bliżej do filmowej sagi niż do poprzednich gier Japończyków. Druga grupa przyjęła tę produkcję o wiele cieplej i uznała ją za powiew świeżości i miłą odskocznie.
Ja zaliczam się do grupy zwolenników tej części i pod względem klimatu stawiam ją na równi z "Silent Hill 3".

Tyle jeśli chodzi o wprowadzenie. Jak widać kontrowersji i skrajnych opinii wokół tej gry i całej serii jest naprawdę sporo. Śmiało można powiedzieć, że niemal każdy element ma swoich zwolenników i przeciwników. Weźmy na przykład toporną mechanikę rozgrywki. W niemalże każdej grze byłaby to wada i na tym opinia by się skończyła. Jednak w "Homecoming" sprawa jest nieco bardziej skomplikowana. Toporne i trudne sterowanie z jednej strony odstrasza niedzielnych graczy, a z drugiej jest jedną ze składowych poczucia bezradności i strachu. Fakt, że nie posiadamy pełnej kontroli nad ruchami bohatera, a zdolności motoryczne naszej postaci są mocno ograniczone, chaotyczne i niezdarne, sprawia, że mamy wrażenie kierowania realistycznie wykreowaną osobowością, która nie potrafi posługiwać się bronią. To nie tylko rewelacyjnie buduje klimat, ale przy okazji sprawia, że gra nabiera poważnych barw. Gdyby twórcy nagle urozmaicili mechanikę rozgrywki, sprawiając by stała się bardziej przejrzysta i dynamiczna, mogliby przypadkiem zabić część klimatu i przy okazji gra straciłaby jeden ze swoich najważniejszych elementów. Jak widać po głębszym przemyśleniu całej sprawy, spisywanie tych mechanizmów na straty tylko dlatego, że są toporne jest zupełnie bez sensu.

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=472088099
Z oprawą jest podobny problem. Mamy 2009 rok i nagle na światło dzienne wychodzi gra, która wygląda jakby była opóźniona o kilka ładnych lat. Pomimo, że stylistyka jest wręcz rewelacyjna to jakość tekstur pozostawia bardzo dużo do życzenia. Tak samo sprawa ma się, z szeroko pojętym dźwiękiem. Muzyka przygrywająca nam podczas rozgrywki również brzmi wybornie, ale jej ogólny wydźwięk jest dosyć nietypowy. Wydaje się ona nieczysta, tłumiona złą akustyką czy nawet wręcz popsuta. Gdy zbierzemy jednak razem obie składowe oprawy i przyrównamy je do mechaniki rozgrywki, otrzymamy całkiem ciekawą kombinację. Z jednej strony toporny gameplay, z drugiej pozornie niskiej jakości strona techniczna. Z jakiegoś powodu to wszystko ze sobą współgra i nie odbiera się tego jako coś negatywnego. Do czego zmierzam. Przede wszystkim nie zamierzam tutaj bronić Konami, ani Double Helix Games. Gra może jest niedopracowana i patrząc surowym okiem momentami wygląda słabo. Poza tym nie jestem pewien czy to zamierzony zabieg czy po prostu niesamowity kunszt deweloperów, zdolnych zamaskować i załagodzić tak wiele niedogodności. Chcę jednak zaznaczyć, że dla mnie, w tym wypadku nie są to jednak wady. Wszechobecny nieporządek pasuje do siebie idealnie i tworzy coś niezwykle fascynującego. Niepokojące, niepewne widowisko, przy którym nie wiemy czego możemy się spodziewać. W pewnym sensie wady stają się największymi zaletami. Bo zastanówmy się przez chwilę, czy jakby udoskonalić mechanikę rozgrywki i poprawić jakość oprawy, "Silent Hill" byłby wciąż tą samą grą? Może i byłby lepszy, ale z pewnością nie miałby już tego klimatu.

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=473325649
Na koniec muszę jeszcze wspomnieć o fabule, zrobię to jednak bardzo powierzchownie i najkrócej jak tylko się da, tak, żeby nie psuć nikomu wrażeń z rozgrywki. Jest ona intrygująca, pełna zaskakujących zwrotów akcji i dosyć sensownie napisana. Jednym słowem jest po prostu dobra i wciąga gracza bardzo ciekawym scenariuszem.

[b]P.S.

Inną sprawą jest dosyć kiepski port PC(Steam), o którym mimo wszystko muszę wspomnieć. Gra została przeniesiona bardzo niechlujnie i zarówno blokada 30 klatek na sekundę, jak też sporadyczne przycięcia dają się we znaki. Tego nie da już interpretować na kilka sposobów, bo jest to po prostu byle jaka robota. Można to jakoś wytrzymać i przede wszystkim warto, bo gra jest czymś nietypowym i wyjątkowym.[/b]

Pro's- Great gameplay includes dogging, variety of melee weapons, ranged weapons. Good story makes sense and stays on track while having new characters introduced threw out the story to keep the story interacting. Good boss battles not just shooting as in other Silent Hill games you have bosses that have amoro you need to knock off before you can damage them, or you have to dodge graves while trying to shoot or melee the boss.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Con's- This is gotta be one of the laziest ports I have ever seen on steam. Konami did not care about this port or pc in general, crashes, missing textures or black textures, can not turn graphics on high because of the main model begging completely white. There are patches out on the internet but they can't even fix the shit Konami has published for $40.00. Wait for a big discount or go to a different retailer for a cheaper price do not buy at full price.

3/10 Fuck you konami!

column8:
Omg they moved the franchise to the U.S. Omg there is combat. Omg the story has nothing to do with the previous games. Omg most of the game doesn't even take place in Silent Hill.

Quit it. Don't have an opinion based on what you think your opinion should be. Don't have an opinion based on what people tell you you should think either. Play the god damned game yourself.

I was skeptical at first but the emotions I experienced playing through Homecoming made me recover my faith in the franchise. The overwhelming sadness, the heartbreaking characters, the soundtrack, the story behind the missing persons, every scene will tear a piece of your soul. Not to mention the constant feeling of opressive fear without cheap jumpscares or dangerous monsters. I believe you should not die without having played this game at least once in your lifetime.

column8: You know when you get a really good horror film like sinister or the conjuring? Silent Hill 2 is the video game equivalent of that. You know that when a good horror film gets a crap sequel for the sake of money? Silent Hill Homecoming is the video game equivalent of that. I know that some people like trashy films like this and those people will probably have fun with this game. As for me: no. 2 stars.

column8:
Minha séria preferida. Antes de ser arruinada quando a Konami passou a série para outros desenvolvedores, perdeu toda aquela mitologia, aquele feeling de desespero, de horror real. Não recomendo esse jogo pela história, ainda mais considerando que está cheio de bugs.

Quer Silent Hill, compre Silent Hill 1, 2, 3 e 4. Os demais não compensam. Nota 5.
L'ottimizzazione è pessima, prendetelo per console

Ce jeu est vraiment étrange et vraiment éloigné des précedents.
Le peu de lien avec ces derniers ne donne pas forcement envie de s'y intéresser mais il reste sympa à jouer.

Les -:

- Pas beau (moins que le 3 sur PS2, moins soigné, etc.).
- Doublages et musiques sympa sans plus.
- Histoire ... (sans spoiler) on aime ou on aime pas (j'aime pas).
- La fin OVNI obtenable dès la première partie et SANS BONUS. Vous pouvez très bien l'obtenir par mégarde en jouant le jeu normalement (ce n'est plus une fin BONUS a ce niveau là).
- Beaucoup plus bourrin (fait une grande partie du jeu, surtout la fin, avec le couteau, car rapide, et facilement utilisable).
- Les buuuuuuuuugs (quelques plantage du son, bug manette, etc.).


Les +:
- Certains design des monstres.
- Certaines scènes un peu choquante (surtout à la fin).
- Quelques bonus (costumes, etc.).

Donc, pour moi le jeu vaudrait 10/20, vraiment moyen, à tester à bas prix.
Je ne peut mettre un avis favorable dans l'ensemble, car de trop nombreux problèmes techniques, et le jeu en soit est loin d'être mauvais, mais très loin d'être bon.

A horrible PC port of a solid, if misguided fifth Silent Hill game. Some interesting ideas and design shine through uneven game play and mishandled / annoying combat mechanics. It is a fun game and a classic survival horror game through and through. Downpour did a lot of things better though. Recommended for all horror fans.

column8:
Quinto capitolo della saga horro Silent Hill, si differenzia ormai come il capitolo precendete dall'atmosfera che si trovava nei primi capitoli usciti. Composta da una trama differenze ma con degli accenni dei capitoli precedenti. La meccanica di gioco è stata cambiata per i combattimenti ma resa tecnicamente soddisfacente. Le ambientazioni sono buone, la grafica non è male e la trama è buona. Per i fanatici della saga anche se non aprezzeranno il capitolo lo consiglio comunque, mentre chi è esterno alla saga lo consiglio per provare lo stile silent hill, anche se non in pieno del suo stile, per quello bisogna giocare ai capitoli precendenti. 

Una delle parti migliori del gioco sono le ambientazioni e sopratutto le infermierine in bella vista!  ( ͡° ͜ʖ ͡°)

Nonostante sia una fan di Silent Hill, questo episodio è ben lontano dall'essere godibile e la noia e la prevedibilità si fanno strada ben presto. Più di una volta ho pensato di lasciarlo a metà senza arrivare alla fine. E poi il prezzo a cui viene venduto è assolutamente oltraggioso!
gg

column8:
The story, graphics, and music are great. Yes, unfortunately the port has some glitches, but if you only play PC, and don't even own a PS3, then I would still recommend buying it if you are an SH fan. The only major issue I had was a black border durring gameplay, which I found a fix for online. Besides that I cleared the game just fine. The combat was hard to begin with, but it gets easier and funner as you get used to it. This was actually the first SH game I ever played, as sad as that is, and after this game I bought and played all the other SH games on PC. I recommend it.

物語、グラッフィク、音楽、全部は良く出来てる。ポートにはグリッチがあるって事が残念だけど、俺と同じく、ＰＣしかやらないのなら、ぜひ買った方が良いと思う。俺には一つのグリッチしか起こらなかった。そのグリッチはプレイー中の際には画面の周りには黒い枠があったって事が、ネットではその問題の解決方法を見つかったから、その後は問題なかったので、最後までクリア出来た。最初的にはゲームの戦いが難しいかもが、やればやる程楽しくて、簡単になる。悲しい話が、これは俺が最初にやったＳＨゲーム。この後には全部のＳＨゲームを買ってやったので、お勧めする。

column8: This silent hill is the 5th game in the series. You are a veteran returning from war to your hometown finding everything has gone wrong. It is played in third person perspective but stll has the silent hill feel for the most part. Yet, it is still missing something and thats decent combat. The creature design is top notch and the music is still great but that combat hurts the game. I know Silent Hill isn't known for good combat, BUT this one is just unfair at times. You have a dodge but you get glitched or the camera gets a mind of its own. The puzzles are great and the story is mediocre. All in all it still is better than Downpour, Shattered Memories, and Origins. Is it worth $29.99 probually not. If you are a Silent Hill fan and don't want to pony up 80 bucks for a copy of Silent Hill 3 on ebay, then go for it.

column8: O jogo é muito bom, não é o melhor silent hill mas ainda assim te leva para esse mundo incrível e perturbador. Seu único problema é a otimização para pc que ficou meio complicada, se for comprar eu indico o controle do xbox 360 para facilitar as coisas, ou já pegar ele para o Xbox, vai retirar muitas das suas dificuldades.

I just finished Homecoming and as much as I love Silent Hill (and I do, Silent Hill 2 is one of my favorite games ever), I simply cannot recommend PC version of this game. 

[h1]The Good[/h1]

[b]Visuals: 7/10[/b]
Game aged significantly 7 years since its release and let’s face it, it wasn’t an eye candy to begin with. Overall it still looks good. You stop noticing low res textures eventually. Monster design is definitely amazing!

[b]Sound & Music: 7/10[/b]
If you have played previous Silent Hill games you’ve come to expect a great soundtrack. All though Akira Yamaoka’s sound is easily recognizable, soundtrack itself is slightly underwhelming. I remember listening Silent Hill 2 soundtrack on a loop for weeks. I don’t feel the same about this one but it has its bright spots. Overall good music and creepy ambient. You can find OST on youtube. It is worth listening to even if you’ve never played the game. 

[b]Story: 7/10[/b]
Story is full of traditional creepy characters and plot twists. Some of the ideas were not exactly fresh but overall story and characters were pretty interesting.

[h1]The Bad[/h1]
[b]Combat and controls. [/b]
It didn’t bother me that this SH game was more action oriented than previous installments but combat itself was rather frustrating. It felt awkward and slow. I died so many times until I realized that using a knife (the very first weapon) was the way to against most of the enemies. By the end of the game fighting was no longer a challenge. I had so many med kits and health drinks, I didn’t know what to do with them. 

[b]Save Points. [/b]
There are not that many. Since you die rather often early in the game and game crashes regularly (at least in my experience) replaying the same area over and over again becomes very annoying quickly. 

[b]Loading time. [/b]
It takes a WHILE to load a new area or a save game (I played it on i7-5820K / 16GB / GTX970). Also, sometimes game just freezes for a few seconds.

[h1]The Ugly[/h1]
[b]Glitches[/b]
There are plenty. To list a few:
[list]
[*]Controls are unresponsive during button mashing sequences. 
[*]You cannot damage monsters. Only happened once, I wasted all my ammo and died a few times. It was fixed after I restarted the game. 
[*]Sound sometimes is coming out of only one speaker and a couple of times audio was out of sync during cut-scenes. 
[*]Many people reported glitches with certain puzzles all thought I haven’t experienced any. 
[/list]
[b]Crashes [/b]
It must have crashed at least 25-30 time during a single playthrough. There was no particular pattern. Sometimes it crashes on startup (Often 2-3 times in a row. If you keep restarting it will launch eventually). Sometimes mid game, sometimes during cut-scenes, sometimes during a loading sequence. Very late in the game it crashed 8 times in a row in the same exact spot. This is when I was ready to give up. I’m glad it didn’t crash 9 times in a row otherwise I would never be able to finish the game :(
None of the solutions I found online helped me (although, I think lowering graphic settings does help in some cases). I tried playing on 2 different PCs, on Win7 and on Win10.

I am glad I finished the game. I enjoyed parts of it but overall it was a very frustrating experience because how bad this port is. In the end it was a sigh of relief rather than satisfaction from a completed game. 

[b]If you are a fan of Silent Hill franchise or horror games in general this game is worth playing but you will be better off playing it on a console. [/b]

Silent Hill Homecoming:  [b]7/10[/b]
Silent Hill Homecoming (Horrible PC Port Edition): [b]4/10[/b]

After playing fora  few hours I think it is a good game. It definately feels like Silent hill, the game has the town, the fog and all the monsters. However I don't feel any attachment to the characters, very little character development so far but I still need to play it more. 

If you are considering this game 1) The pc controls are horrendous, you will need a controller 2) Put the game on medium settings because it crashes frequently when on high settings 3) this is a game you would buy on sale.

column8:
While every aspect of this game isn’t the worst that Konami has ever offered.  The continued sale of this unsupported and fundamentally flawed product at 39.99 can only serve to polarize unwitting purchasers against the publisher and developer alike.

I originally bought this title as part of a sale in 2011.  As a huge fan of the first 3 silent titles I had high hopes despite mixed reviews.  However, I immediately regretted my decision. The port was so buggy I was unable to progress more than a few minutes into the game.  This game sat dormant within my library for 5 years with only 6 minutes of play until Steam’s revised return policy gave me a chance to right my mistake.  Sadly, steam did not grant my refund, 5 years is a long time, so half hoping to work myself into tizzy I reinstalled.  Well it worked….kind of.  Whether the result of a patch or my new hardware I was able to complete the game, though at times wised I hadn’t.

Silent hill homecoming features the series trademark moody, misty, and mysterious environments.  The game play is built around over the shoulder 3rd person combat, typical fetch quest, puzzles, and even a few undercooked metroidvainia style elements.  However, depth clearly wasn’t a design driver.  The fetch quests are simple, and due to relatively barren environments it doesn’t take to long to figure out what goes to what.  Next, Homecoming is missing legacy features like combine item, and inventory item examination thus removing further depth from this installment of the franchise.  But don’t despair, with the exception of a few mid game riddles, Homecoming treats you to puzzles like that slide puzzle at your dentist office or there own R rated version of the baby shape game.

The combat system is almost a bright spot.  The Combat utilizes several melee weapon classes and small arms featuring a relatively linear progression in reach and damage.  While the ranged combat is what you might expect from a 3rd person shooter, the melee combat is more developed than any previous SH title.  Players can dodge attacks, counter, block, heavy attack, execute finishers, and even combo in game.  Sounds pretty sweet right, and it would be if it wasn’t for your ability to crit-lock nearly all enemies, broken quick time events, and unfriendly camera angles.  Your inventory is also oddly limited.  For despite Alex’s ability to carry a knife, pipe, axe, shotgun, pistol, and rifle your character can’t seem to find more than a handful of space for ammo, making the survival horror staple of stockpiling resources a no go.

One thing I did like was Homecomings story and voice work.  The campaigns premise while unoriginal just works, and late game plot reveals do a great job making sense of memory flashes and found tokens.  In addition I found myself constantly guessing at who Alex is.  Is he crazy, already dead, or a resident of otherworld like Lisa from first Silent Hill.  Hell, for half the game I was pretty sure Alex was an imaginary friend.  Despite these great story elements Homecoming features some terribly developed characters, none of whom seem to find perpetual mist, infrastructure ending sink holes, or an army of other worldly demons all that odd.  While the game cleans this up late game in a Shamalan style twist, it does so at the cost of creating plot holes you could drive a bus through.

Graphically the game might be best described a barren, even for a port.  A lot of environmental objects are use repeatedly but sparingly.  The textures also are so underwhelming you might not realize Alex’s jacket is desert-camo and not desert tan.  The character models and monsters however are greatly detailed and feel a bit out of place in the low poly count world.

In terms of replay value Silent Hill Homecoming features 4 different endings based on three critical decision events distributed evenly throughout the campaign.  Since we got one ending, and one bonus costume out of our 11 hour campaign pass we’re confident there is a lot of game play left for the masochist that needs to see it all, but most of you should just Youtube them instead.  With the exception maybe of running about town bashing monsters wondering what could have been we can’t suggest buying.

Worst of all the game has a tendency to crash and at a minimum freezes for sometimes 30seconds at a time making it one of the least stable games in my collection.  We try to keep our reviews free of outrage.  Others have done it first and better, but even I found it difficult to maintain an objective tone while evaluating this title.  We suggest you don’t buy at any price point.  As always I hope this review has informed your purchase. Be well.

-Bandersuke

But don’t despair, with the exception of a few mid game riddles, Homecoming treats you to puzzles like that slide puzzle at your dentist office or there own R rated version of the baby shape game.

The combat system is almost a bright spot.  The Combat utilizes several melee weapon classes and small arms featuring a relatively linear progression in reach and damage.  While the ranged combat is what you might expect from a 3rd person shooter, the melee combat is more developed than any previous SH title.  Players can dodge attacks, counter, block, heavy attack, execute finishers, and even combo in game.  Sounds pretty sweet right, and it would be if it wasn’t for your ability to crit-lock nearly all enemies, broken quick time events, and unfriendly camera angles.  Your inventory is also oddly limited.  For despite Alex’s ability to carry a knife, pipe, axe, shotgun, pistol, and rifle your character can’t seem to find more than a handful of space for ammo, making the survival horror staple of stockpiling resources a no go.

One thing I did like was Homecomings story and voice work.  The campaigns premise while unoriginal just works, and late game plot reveals do a great job making sense of memory flashes and found tokens.  In addition I found myself constantly guessing at who Alex is.  Is he crazy, already dead, or a resident of otherworld like Lisa from first Silent Hill.  Hell, for half the game I was pretty sure Alex was an imaginary friend.  Despite these great story elements Homecoming features some terribly developed characters, none of whom seem to find perpetual mist, infrastructure ending sink holes, or an army of other worldly demons all that odd.  While the game cleans this up late game in a Shamalan style twist, it does so at the cost of creating plot holes you could drive a bus through.

Graphically the game might be best described a barren, even for a port.  A lot of environmental objects are use repeatedly but sparingly.  The textures also are so underwhelming you might not realize Alex’s jacket is desert-camo and not desert tan.  The character models and monsters however are greatly detailed and feel a bit out of place in the low poly count world.

In terms of replay value Silent Hill Homecoming features 4 different endings based on three critical decision events distributed evenly throughout the campaign.  Since we got one ending, and one bonus costume out of our 11 hour campaign pass we’re confident there is a lot of game play left for the masochist that needs to see it all, but most of you should just Youtube them instead.  With the exception maybe of running about town bashing monsters wondering what could have been we can’t suggest buying.

Worst of all the game has a tendency to crash and at a minimum freezes for sometimes 30seconds at a time making it one of the least stable games in my collection.  We try to keep our reviews free of outrage.  Others have done it first and better, but even I found it difficult to maintain an objective tone while evaluating this title.  We suggest you don’t buy at any price point.  As always I hope this review has informed your purchase. Be well.

-Bandersuke

column8: Otimo.. bastante tenebroso e tem uma aura sinistra igualmente a franquia.

Great game many scare moments throughout it's a pretty solid game from start to finish with some annonces on the technical side.

Pros: Nice story, decent animations, cool monster and boss designs.

Cons: Game freezes alot during loading. audio bug so sound can only be heard from one side of the speaker headphone (which ruins the experience a bit imo) clunky combat. bad weapon collition ( I shot an enemy 9 times and the bullets just went through it) 

i'd say it's a pretty fun game but the bugs and glitches take away from the overal experience 6/10 if i'd have to rate it.

column8: Pior jogo que já joguei da franquia, Konami aqui mostra como quer ser mercenaria!

Atrocious ! And I'm not speaking about the creatures or the nightmarish universe. I'm speaking about this nightmarish shameful port and it's nightmarish shameful graphics, hitboxes, lasting fps losses, unresponsive commands, light bugs, animation bugs, dodge bugs... I litterally can't play for more than 15 minutes in a row wether because the game will crash sooner or later wether for my nerves health due to progressive fps loss. Looks like there are memory leaks all over the place causing as many lags, freezes and crashes.

Excellent atmosphere, very good story, could have been a great Silent Hill except for the fact that nearly everything is so blatantly ripped wether from the movie wether from previous games. Oh, and Piramidehead cameos are a very sad joke. Except the final one in my opinion. Too bad everything else is, mark my word, a real shame. Hadn't saw this kind of bugs in light and animations since the darkest days of the first playstation at least, no joking.

Left alone this game most likely did everything that's listed in the "No twinkie database". For those who do not heard of this : it's a list of all worst choices in game design that can be made. My worst pick is undoubtedly here seeing a M14 on the ground from a fallen enemy and not being able to take it nor the ammos. Two times. And this magnum revolver clearly visible at the belt of a dead cop. And this grinder saw on a dead enemy. And so many others...

Funnily enough it's all in all a good, maybe even very good Silent Hill. Everything is here, symbolic, cult, psychology, nightmarish universe, all bathed in a deep feeling of loss and wandering.
But it's an atrocious game where nearly everyhting feel broken. Usually it's the opposite in regard of a big franchise where a game is still a good game in itself but disappointing compared to what fans of previous episodes wanted. Not this time. Shame.

I feel completely ripped even for 5€. Should have asked for a refund while I still could. I still struggled to finish the game because I wanted the end of the story but God what kind of a martyrdom it was.
Terrible port- glitchy as hell
column9: Terrible port- glitchy as hell

column8: https://www.senscritique.com/jeuvideo/Silent_Hill_Homecoming/critique/101538834

[h1] Recensione Silent Hill Homecoming [/h1]

[i] Silent Hill Homecoming è un gioco survival horror con la possibilità di difesa e combattimento dei nemici.
In se, il gioco offre un'ambientazione particolare, che è in grado di mettere ansia e paura fin dai primi momenti del gioco. 

Ma sotto questo grande incubo, purtroppo si nasconde qualcosa di molto più spaventoso, che ahimè, è stato l'elemento tanto negativo da non farmi consigliare questo gioco.
I fattori positivi sono ben pochi:

[*]  Trama strutturata.
[*]  Ottima ambientazione di gioco.
[*]  Nemici spaventosi e ben fatti.
[*]  Difficoltà adeguata con l'avanzare del gioco.
[*]  Enigmi e rompicapo. 

La lista termina qua.

Purtroppo questo capitolo di Silent Hill, presenta innumerevoli bug per la versione pc, perché il porting effettuato è a dir poco scandaloso.
Finirlo è stato forse uno degli incubi peggiori della mia vita, trovarsi d'innanzi scene di lag improvviso, boss battle buggate che non permettevano di liberarsi dalla presa di nemici, crash senza una sequenza logica, caricamenti che si cronometravano a MINUTI e tante altre cose da voler più volte disinstallare il gioco e chiuderla qua. 
Forse la pazienza o la pazzia, mi hanno permesso di terminare questa storia. 
Meccaniche di gameplay basilari, schiva, attacca. Poche volte è concessa la fuga, perché la maggior parte dei combattimenti sono OBBLIGATORI da compiere, poiché se in qualche modo vengono evitati, ci porteranno d'innanzi ad uno sbarramento da parte dei nemici.
In poche parole, se si schiva la battaglia e si scappa aprendo una porta, (esatto i nemici non hanno capacità nel girare le maniglie) e per disgrazia bisogna tornare in quel punto, troveremo i nostri affezionatissimi ad aspettarci allegramente d'innanzi al passaggio, pronti per attaccare e portarci quasi sempre al game over.
La versione di steam dice che la lingua italiana è inesistente, mentre all'avvio del gioco intravediamo già menù e sottotitoli in italiano.
Ma come sempre, noi dobbiamo essere discriminati, appunto, nella versione italiana, non ci è concesso di cambiare la grafica, risoluzione, comandi del Joypad. 
E per risolvere questo problema, bisogna applicare una serie di eventi molto fastidiosi per bug che nel 2016 non dovrebbero minimamente esistere. 
Il sistema di mappa che in tutti i Silent Hill è L'EMBLEMA per trovare la strada, è stato trasferito in una maniera assurda, in poche parole con una risoluzione 1920x1080 avremmo la possibilità di vedere solo ¼ di mappa, giusto per rendere ancor più imbarazzante il lavoro maledetto che hanno fatto.
In poche parole questo capitolo di SH mi ha soddisfatto in parte, ho amato molto la sfida posta da parte dei boss battle, ma odiato profondamente chi ha permesso di far uscire questo porting fatto decisamente male e a metà. 
Se volete giocarlo, fatelo con la versione console, che da come dicono le voci, pare sia fatto decisamente 1000 volte meglio. [/i]

column8:
the game is a bit resource demanding in some sequences. As well, it gets confusing at points where it says you need something to get past a door, but that object is on the other side of that door and there isnt another way around for half the game. That gets irritating. 

but, like all true silent hill games, it keeps the chills and scares coming. The constant sound effect and lovely feeling of always being watched is divine. And the sheer dread of playing in the dark is outstanting. i love it. 

Will add more to this review as I play more

so far 7/10 stars

column8: Game bem legal.

Be very wary and steer clear of this port. Just buy it on consoles if you have the chance.

Pros:
+ Decent Graphics at the time of release
+ Oppressive but effective atmosphere
+ Boss designs are very distrubing yet creative
+ Soundtrack is mesmerizing

Cons:
- Very annoying audio issues where a majority of the audio will output through one speaker/earphone. No way to fix it.
- Graphical inconsistencies with minor pop-in.
- Controls are unresponsive or fail to display command keys if they are rebinded.
- No achievement support, unlike the Xbox 360 version.
- Game is locked at 30FPS with no way to unlock to 60FPS. There is no community support on the game.
- Game is very short, ranging from 4-8 hours depending if you do not get stuck on its abyssmal level designs.
- Frequent crashing, especially if changing settings or simply just saving the game state.
- Oddly, the game is very combat oriented, which is unusual for a Silent Hill game, but its not a deal breaker, per se.
- NPC animations and textures are very stiff and lacking.
-Sadly, the game is just a rehash of the SIlent Hill movie and Silent Hill 2 combined, but not always in the right ways.

column8: e ruim selok sem som sa porra

+To κορυφαίο σύστημα μάχης που έχουμε δει σε Silent Hill. Θυμίζει αρκετά Dark Souls
+Πολύ ενδιαφέρουσα υπόθεση που ξετιλίγεται άψογα, σε αντίθεση με το μπάχαλο του Downpour στο τέλος
+Εξυπνο AI των τεράτων. Ισώς το κορυφαίο που έχω δει σε survival
+Πολύ καλά γραφικά και ατμόσφαιρα γενικότερα
+Καλοί γρίφοι
+Eπικά boss fights

-Απουσία Επιτεύγματων όπως και στο PS3 ενώ υπάρχουν στην xbox 360 έκδοση
-Απουσία save point μετά από boss fights. Πρέπει να τρέχεις πίσω π.χ. στο Δημαρχείο
-Αρκετά δύσκολο για όχι και τόσο έμπειρους παίχτες, ειδικά λόγω του συστήματος μάχης

Σε γενικά πλαίσια εξαιρετικό παιχνίδι και προσωπικά το δεύτερο πιο αγαπημένο μου της σειράς μετά το 2. Επειδή με ενόχλησε η απουσία επιτευγμάτων ωστόσο προτίμησα να το αγοράσω εκ νέου στο xbox 360 και να το παίξω εκεί, ωστόσο όσο το έπαιζα στο PC δεν είδα καμία διαφορά ή bug που να πρέπει να αναφέρω. Αν δεν έχετε xbox 360 πάρτε το με κλειστά τα μάτια εδώ. Από τα καλύτερα survival games ever!!!!

column8: 마우스 커서 두개 생기는거 어떡해 해결함 ㅡㅡ

This is not my first Silent Hill game, but it is my last. 

I got it for $9.99 on sale, and I feel like a heel for allowing myself to be tempted even at that price. For $9.99 I recieved nothing but amazing levels of frustration and anger. 

Why?

1. This "game" crashes continuously. It often crashes on start up - at the moment that it says Konami on the screen - before it is even remotely possible for there to be any legitimate reason for it to crash. It often crashes right after major boss fights, causing them to be refought. It crashes on cut scenes. Crash. Crash. Crash. Crash. Crash. Crash. Crash. Crash. Crash. Crash. Crash. Crash. Crash. 

2. Save points - These are so rare as to be non-existent. I know that "survival horror" is supposed to be "hard." I have played plenty of survival horror games. This is not hard. This is stupid. My play time consists of hours of playing the same parts and skipping the same cut scenes over and over and over because of save point placement being insanely stupid and rare. Save points after boss fights? Nope. Dieing 3 minutes after a boss fight and then having to fight the boss again was common. Doing the same thing over and over and over and over because the save points were randomly placed by idiots is not fun. 

3. Combat is constant and ridiculously difficult. I play shooters, hack and slash, RTS, survival - a bit of everything - and NO GAME I have EVER played made combat such a chore. 90% of the time, success was luck. Try to dodge? Nope. Try to stun? Nope. I ended up doing more pointless button mashing in this game - and still, success always came down to just luck. In the less than 12 hours I played this game I must have died 80 times - which is almost half as many times as the game crashed. This does not make a game "scary." It makes it rage inducing crap. 

I hate this game with a passion. I would vow to quit playing it, then come back and try again. I really gave it way more time than it deserved, but in the end, I quit half way through and wouldn't play it again for money. This was the least pleasant, least fun, least playable piece of crap I have ever wasted my time with. 

Consider yourself warned.

This game isn't as good as the other SH games. However that isn't why I don't recommend this game. The controls that you set won't save after you close the game. You'll have no way of knowing what the controls are unless you wrote the original ones down because you can't change them after the second load up of the game.

Absolutely terrible port. You may be thinking that people are just ranting. I did too, but trust me, you'll regret wasting your time.

column8: Grafica terribile e salvataggi troppo lontani da poter raggiungere prima che i bugs si facciano sentire...facendovi ricominciare ogni volta da capo. Consiglio solo ai fan della serie

(I know I am reviewing this game with barely an hour of gaming... But I had finished it way before buying it on Steam... Since I own the retail version as well...)

What ever, that is the only Silent Hill I approve of, but here again I am biased since I enjoy Resident Evil (especially Operation Raccoon City, 4, and Revelations), Half-Life, Aliens vs Predator and any other action paced game... Which is fairly not the goal of Silent Hill, I shall admit.


... But this one pleased me, and I think that's THE problem. This game will most likely make you happy if you are heretical to the original Silent Hill fanbase. But whatever they say... This is objectively a good game, and a good PC port. Its graphics are alright, the gameplay is cool and varied, the atmosphere is still very present, and the action scenes are well mastered. There's also a wide range of weapons, costumes to unlock and combos to put your hand on... Just as in any Resident Evil haha! I kind of like the storyline as well, and the multiple-ending scenario.



You get it... That's positive for me, but I can totally understand why the fanbase of the franchise despised it.

column8:
Ich bin ein großer Silent Hill-Fan und Homecoming gehört zu meinen Favoriten der Serie.

Dinge, die mir an dem Teil gefallen, sind die Atmosphäre und die Level.

Die Monster (bis auf Pyramid-Head) waren die meiste Spielzeit nervig und die Spinnenartigen Sensen-Monster haben mir hin und wieder die Spiel-Laune versaut.

Die Steuerung ist gut und halbweg's fließend.

8/10 *

Hola buenas, me acabo de comprar el juego (23/12/2015) y quería comentar ya que al port le sigue una estela de criticas negativas, y lo que vengo a decir es que el juego va perfectamente, con fps estables que jamas bajan, sin un solo crasheo, con opciones graficas para ajustar la resoulcion, 1080p en mi caso y con detalles de calidad: normal y alto. Para mi gusto, que lo jugue en ps3, la mejora grafica es monumental y lo estoy disfrutando muchisimo. En resumen, que a mi el port me va de lujo y no tengo ningun problema.

column8: nice

I was hesitant to purchase this game because of all the negative views.  When I saw it on sale, I thought, "Why not give a try"  With Steams new policy of try before you buy, what do I have to lose?  I was pleasently surprised of how well I like this game.  It certainly has the "feel" of the previous Silent HIll Games.  Great Atomsphere, cool combat system and an eerie story.  If you are fan of previous installments of the series, I can't think of reason why you wouldn't want to play it.    Graphics are top notch, runs on my computer seemless.  I have heard of some control issues, but haven't personally run into any.  My only beef is not enough save points.

The game has its problems:

- Frequently crash to desktop (Win. 8.1).
- Weird map system. You constantly have to zoom it to know where you are.
- The radio is almost useless, because it`s static pop up when you already have the visual of the creature (except in some cases).


BUT
+ Great combat system: it`s not an action game. You must adapt to the circumstances, search for weak spots, dodge and counterattack etc.
+ Play it on hard and feel the Silent Hill overwhelming you.
+ Atmospheric
+ Sometimes the music freaks you out!
+ Puzzles
+ Very limited ammunition (on hard)
+ The game shows some valuable tips between loading
+ Your light and radio can be used to change combat strategies.

All in all, you will have a good (an freaking) time enjoying Silent Hill Homecoming if you accept it`s flaws.

column8: Al-tho not as good as the previous games for its emphasis on combat and tense situations instead of psychological horror, jump-scares and straight up nastiness it's still Silent Hill. If not sure whether you want it or not just wait for the steam sales to grab it. Seeing that some people have controller problems glitches and crashes I have to say that I ran it on 3 different rigs and never had any of the issues mentioned in the comments below. Could be that I always ran an Intel-nvidia combo with a 360 controller.

The mood is present, the music is haunting and the imagery is dark but the story is lacking. A must play for Silent Hill fans but very low on the scale of good Silent Hill games. The controls are a bit stiff and delayed which causes you to die at the hands of lesser enemies. The puzzles are not very complex and the boss battles are easy once you solve the patterns.

The game was shorter than I hoped. However, as in most Silent Hill games, there are multiple endings which typically convinces you to play the game through again. In this case though, I would recommend skipping the second play through and just watching the alternate endings on YouTube.  

Not bad. Not Great.

column8:
A terrible port of a mediocre horror game that marked the moment Silent Hill truly jumped the shark as a franchise. 

While a few faint glimmers of hope remain in the music and boss design, the overall mood and feel of the game is nothing like classic Silent Hill games and it completely fails to create any sort of tension or compelling narrative. A greater emphasis on combat removes the horror from the equation, and the combat itself is awkward and jittery. Not to mention, the starting knife attacks so quickly it can stunlock almost every enemy in the game and makes every other melee weapon useless. 

And this is all assuming you can actually get it running. Especially on newer systems, you're likely not to be able to launch the game at all without some fiddling. And if you do, expect a lack of video options and weird performance issues or visual glitches all around, as well as frequent crashes. It's a messy version of a game that was already a mess, and yet somehow they still feel fine charging $40 for it.

If you're eyeing this one during a sale in hopes of one last little gasp of Silent Hill to satisfy your craving, just don't. You'd be wasting your money and your time on a game that is an amateurish, embarrassing shadow of those that came before it. It's not scary, it's not fun, and it's not interesting or well-written, failing to give any reason to justify its existence.

column8: A bad port of an already mediocre entry in this phenomenal series. Controller button labels are confusing, and maps don't always work. Changing resolution or graphic settings cause an instant reboot. If you have to play this one, pick it up on Xbox 360 or PS3. You're really much better off replaying one of the first 3 games, though.

column8: Excelente juego !!!!!!! Muy recomendado !!!!!

I don't know how this game gets so bashed. Yes I haven't played it that long, but I am going to defend this Game in most ways people criticize it.

1. It has 30 FPS!
My responce: This was before 60FPS was commonly accepted to be put to use as far as I know. This was made in 2008, which is 7 years ago, unlike games like Batman: Arkham Knight, where all of the other games were 60FPS and didn't have a lock. I played it and had no problems with it, unlike with most Shooters and Action games on the market. Horror games are meant to be slow, not fast like those types of games I mentioned earlier. If you really have a big deal, just look it up on the internet and I am sure you can find a solution.

2. It's way too expensive! How is a game from 2008 $39.99!
My responce: Look at the publisher who made this. The last game they made was from 2011. I do know that the developer did make a game less than a year ago, but the publishers do control the price of the game for the most part. I do agree that this game should have a price drop, but there is something we can look forward to: Sales. A while back, this game rarely went on sale, but within the past year, it has gone on sale twice and it uually goes down to $9.99. That is the price I recommend getting it on Steam. If you don't want to wait long (For example it didn't go on sale for more than a year before), then buy it on G2A. As of right now, the prices are under $9.99.

3. The controls are awful and a mess!
My responce: The controls aren't bad at all. They are the same as before with WASD. How are the controls bad? That is what confuses me with this.

So hopefully, these reviews won't make you shy away from this game.

column8:
Giocato su:

I5 7600k 16gb ram
Gtx 1080 
Win 10 pro

Gameplay : Silent hill homecomig e un survival horror psicologico in terza persona. Il gioco ruota sulla soluzione di enigmi e il combattimento. Le munizioni e armi da fuoco scarseggiano , quindi dovremo ripiegare sulle abilità di combattimento corpo a corpo.  Attaco leggero e veloce , oppure potente e lento. ci sarà la possibilità di schivare i colpi come un pugile. Seppur il sistema di combattimento sembra credibile e ottimo , al lungo andare ci si accorge che risulta impreciso e macchinoso , per un sistema non preciso di auto lock dei nemici e la latenza dei controlli.

Trama : Siamo alex un soldato reduce di guerra , che ritornato a casa , viene a sapere che che quasi tutta la popolazione e sparita nell nulla. Cercado la verità e famigliari , dovrete scoprire le verità scomode di silent hill . 

Grafica e Ottimizzazione: il compato tecnico e grafico e altalenante. Modelli dei personaggi ben modellatti , affiancati a modelli di bassa qualità . Ottimo desing mostri e ambientazioni . Ottima l'ulliminazione e la nebbia che creano la giusta atmosfera! 
In quanto a ottimizzazione ci troviamo davanti a un pessimo porting da console.

Problemi:
-Crash improvvisi su alcuni sistemi 
-Il gioco crasha con Alt+Tab ↹ in fullscreen
-Risoluzioni superiori al fullhd da problemi di visibilità alla mappa e ogetti.
-60 fps non sono solidi , anche forzando il triplo buffering , o con una cpu potente in singolo core.
-Il menu principale in italiano e rotto, mancano delle opzioni.
-Mancano le icone del controller del xbox

I problemi elencati sono risolvibili , a patto di dover installare a mano ogni fix , vi lascio il  link:
https://pcgamingwiki.com/wiki/Silent_Hill:_Homecoming

Oppure ho creato una cartella con tutti i fix già presenti , basta copiare la cartella del gioco e sovrscivere i file:
https://1drv.ms/f/s!AveXeHIwqUjWbORpT3t0p6QeG6Q

Conclusioni: E uno dei migliori survival horror psicologico. Problemi a parte . e migliore di tanti indie che si trovano su steam.

Consigliato
I love this game.

column8:
En Silent Hill: Homecoming tomaremos el papel de Alex Shepherd un joven soldado que regresa del ejercito a Shepherd´s Glen, su pueblo natal, para descubrir que su hermano pequeño Joshua y su padre han desaparecido así como la mayoria de habitantes, a la pequeña ciudad sumida en una densa niebla y habitado por criaturas surgidas del mundo de las pesadillas. La busqueda de su familia  guiará sus pasos hasta el vecino pueblo de Silent Hill, al que desde niños tenian prohibido acercarse y sobre el que se rumorea pesa una maldición.

Quinto juego de las saga que cuenta con entusiastas y detractores a partes iguales, en mi caso me encanta y me desespera al mismo tiempo y es que es dificil saber si recomendar este juego o no porque sus puntos fuertes brillan y sus puntos flojos pueden estropear la experiencia.

entre sus puntos fuertes que no son pocos, cabría destacar la historia: Un relato de horror muy bien construido, siendo intrincado pero no tedioso y bien desarrollado y dosificado a lo largo del juego, vamos que es un juego que cuando lo juegas una segunda vez te quedas con muchos mas detalles del entorno y que forman parte del transfondo de la trama y que antes se podrían haber pasado por alto. Otra de sus virtudes es el diseño tanto de entornos como de personajes, tiene algunos de los enemigos mas chulos que he visto en un survival horror, de los que dan mal rollo de verdad y además cargados de simbolismo como es habitual en la saga, y tanto la ambientación como la musica ayudan a crear una muy buena experiencia  de las que te hacen pasar un mal rato.

Pero no todo es bueno en este juego, pues en algo tan esencial como la jugabilidad es donde está su mayor defecto. Lo primero que hay que decir es que se trata de un port de consola y no el mejor hecho precisamente, ni siquiera los botones que el juego indica para interactuar con puertas, interruptores, liberarte de agarres enemigos, etc... se corresponden con los botones del mando de microsoft (lo cual es raro teniendo en cuenta que este juego tiene una versión en xbox) lo que equivale a que un agarre del enemigo suponga una muerte casi segura, así que todo el sistema de combate se ve perjudicado resultando en esquivas que no funcionan, golpes que hacen retroceder a los enemigos fuera de tu rango y te dejan con el culo al aire y otras perlas del estilo. Por si eso no fuera suficiente hay momentos en los que el juego tiene unos picos de dificultad totalmente absurdos y que pueden llegar a desesperar y que requieren de gran perseverancia y de aprender que cualquier enemigo puede hacerte morder el polvo, mas de 2 juntos es un suicidio, huir siempre que sea posible es la mejor opción y afrontar solo los combates que no se puedan evitar, aunque quizá esa fuera la idea desde el principio y no abrirse paso a golpes de hacha. Los que seguro no se pueden evitar son los jefes finales, que aunque son muy chulos son unos bastardos que te harán la vida imposible.

Pese a que el juego tiene ya unos añitos se mantiene bastante fresco y pese a sus enormes problemas vale la pena revisitarlo.

7/10

column8:
Malgré le fait que je sois un fan incontestable de la série silent hill, celui la doit être le pire de tous.

- Crash souvent (impossible de faire de retour windows),
- Temps de chargement trop long,
- Gameplay affreux (orienté action un système d'esquive),
- Histoire facilement compréhensible (les silent hill sont réputés pour laisser un flou sur l'intrigue mais la je chipote),
- Pas assez d'énigme et Boss final trop simple.

Voilà les poins qui m'ont déplus pour cet opus, mais si vous restez un fan de la série, tentez quand même de le faire.

column8:
Caso alguém venha a ter problemas com gráficos (sombras e texturas que não carregam, bugs na iluminação, etc), experimentem esta solução.
Na pasta do executável do jogo, procure pela pasta Bin. Dentro desta pasta deve haver um arquivo chamado enbseries.ini - abra-o com o bloco de notas.
No final dele, haverá uma parte de texto que está escrito FIX. abaixo de Fix, mude os valores para o seguinte:

[FIX]
PixelShaderLimit=4096
DisableShaders=0
ForceOldDXVersion=0
UseVertexTextureFetch=1
DelayTime=0
ForceAffinityMask=0

Espero que ajude. Postem seus resultados.
No idea what these nimrods are complaining about, the game runs fine on highest settings. But then again Beast computer is Beast.
column9: No idea what these nimrods are complaining about, the game runs fine on highest settings. But then again Beast computer is Beast.

column8:
This game is spooky and terrifying more than just whats in the game.  In the game, the world around you can fragment and break away as the world of silent hill infects everything around the character.  Oddly this game has that effect in real life, making it more than just a horrific game to play, but a horrific experience for everyone in the world even YOU!  *chains rattle

This is a throwback game to survival horror with exploration at its heart.  The world thats made is pretty much free roam to be explored with items to find making it feel a bit like RE1.  When this was released everyone hated it, its competition was Dead Space so thats a tough one to go against without bringing the A game.  This game though does what few games do anymore which is exploration in a world of survival horror, the monsters while not diverse fit the atmosphere including a boss right out of Human Centipede named Asphyxia derived from greek meaning without heartbeat.

Anyone who hated the movie, will hate this game.  Story is similar but vastly different in its approach making it fresh for fans who saw the movie a billion times.  Those who hated the movie should check it out again now to see what a top movie studio can bring to blood guts and gore that they really havent done since if they want something to appreciate.   For survival horror fans who couldnt stomach this game at release its the modern day now so all we get are walking simulators with spooky stuffs.

This game is horrific to look at visually, in all the wrong ways which somehow makes this game even creepier.  Released for Xbox 360 and PS3 using the Havok Engine, which brought us everything from Skyrim to Oblivion and Dark Souls.  Silent Hill comes off looking like some abomination mix of PS2 textures, with PS3 character models for some characters while others are PS2 looking or even PS1 with the fidelity of their textures.  This mashup of quality lends itself actually to Silent Hill, where something is always a bit off.  Something always lurking below the surface, in a good way this bad quality in any other game actually adds to its charm here of being an evil demonic messed up interdimensional crossover crazy kinda world.  

The lighting however is pure genius, some of the best ever in gaming for this genre.  The world isnt BLACK like other games to add a fake fear factor.  For many games that is their gimmick a one trick pony of wondering whats outside the dark.  Its a cheap gimmick, and people make that world, they design it for atmosphere and if we cant see it or feel the atmosphere their just wasting their time and ours.  In this game its dim everywhere just right to get a feeling for the world or place you are in, there is a flashlight to further light up areas since its so dim.  Dim means we can see the world its amazing a work of art that way in survival horror design where many games opt to just make everything black.

The gameplay is brutal, playing it on normal isnt bad at all, playing it on hard is doable as well.  Dodge is almost broken but works under very very precise conditions relying on the skill of the player to memorize the moves of a given boss to anticipate them and react.  On hard with bad controls every boss can still be beat with melee.  The controls are as horrific as everything else, there isnt much if any of a tutorial so its just wing it and see what works with different weapons.  

Bugs, well this game has em all, from being version 1.0 we bring you random crashes and bugs galore.  The game will freeze erratically at times then magically unfreeze.  Oddly many of these glitches somehow also add to how the game infects your computer and its own engine.  The world of silent hill and how it wants to ruin everything can not be contained!  None of these are gamebreaking, there are save spots so if it crashes no big loss.  

Bridgetips:
1.  Turn out the lights, play at night, say goodbye to the real world and hello to Silent Hill.
2.  Use the knife for almost everything.   The combo to use is Fast-Fast-Fast-Heavy
3.  Enemies in the streets respawn, run by them when possible.
4.  After fighting Curtis who has a buzz saw, go back in Curtis's room and get the 301 key on the wall, when leaving before the 1st gate get your weapons back in room 301.
5.  Use doorways to your advantage many enemies cant get through them or only one can get through at a time.
6.  Use the environment like desks and tables to heavy stab across out of range of enemies.

*Using a controller get this mod made by steam user grasmann who is an awesome member of the community putting in the button prompts for xbox or ps controllers here:  http://steamcommunity.com/app/19000/discussions/0/618458030648125452/

Rating:  7/10  Value: $9.99

Earlier it was mentioned this game was horrifying in the real world.   This game can wreck the reputations of even the most high tech and largest corporations in the world, Amazon.  It would be correct to understand that this game is made by Amazon who owns Double Helix game studios.  Even scarier is currently if trying to visit the double helix website, all browsers will block you saying its an unsafe sites.  Nothing is safe from the horrors of this game, while this game is for sale on steam, its interesting to note that Amazon does NOT sell this game on PC as of this writing.  The limits of Silent Hill know no boundaries oozing into our world infecting all this game touches.  Even scarier is wanting the game fixed calling a contact at Amazon who owns Double Helix only to find out noone has the phone number to the company they own.  Who knows what nightmares will be unleashed if and when that phone number is found, but most likely problem with game is it was literally made for XP, so they gotta update it, gotta do something and its high time they fix it or at least were made aware we care enough for them to fix it, so lets hope we now get our update!  

More fun trivia?  
Silent Hill is based on a real place, hell on earth, a town called Centralia in Pennsylvania.  A place of absolute evil that stinks of the bowels of hades with the burning smell of sulfur.  A hell burns underneath this town from an underground coal mine fire that is impossible to put out so it just burns forever.  A town covered in ash with columns of smoke rising randomly into the sky blacking out the sun on the brightest day.  

The roads missing in the game thats legit, fun fact in Centralia there is only one road in and out.  The government  tried to build a highway through the city then the day that highway opened, a giant hole opened swallowing it up.  The town is so evil, the government built the highway around the entire town keeping the town cut off.  The town has few residents many part of a singular religion which has some unique elements to say the least.  

Graveyards are actually full of children.  Its rumored that locals had deformed children due to the toxic byproducts of the fire.  These locals were too kind to kill their children, so they would put the children in the old mine shafts left to themselves eating eachother or the scraps the out of work mine town could afford, who knows if their still there or what tourists they feed on who make the mistake of making a pit stop.  

These stories also gave rise to the Hills Have Eyes movies, and inspired Rob Zombie for the underground parts of Devils Rejects.  At each entrance to the town are shrines to the Virgin Mary with candles, flowers all kinds of stuff, who lights all those candles?  The town next door has a HUGE what must be 6 or 7 story tall statue of some christian preacher guy with his hand outstretched in a stopping posture towards the town of Centralia as if keeping the evil away.  The whole area is suspect of supernatural something or other, yet most who go there trying to survive the night lose their minds or never live to tell the true tale of what lies within the dark heart of Centralia.

column8:
Non prendete sul serio la mia recensione, perchè io sono un Fan di Silent Hill e quindi darò una recensione positiva al gioco anche se ha molti problemi.
Allora questo è l'unico Silent Hill che abbiamo su Steam purtroppo, visto che gli altri Silent Hill sono un capolavoro e sono molto più belli di questo capitolo, anche se questo capitolo ha un interessante storia e SOTTOLINEO che non ha nulla a che fare con la storia di Silent Hill degli altri capitoli.
Il gioco soffre di molti problemi purtroppo i FPS sono bloccati a 30 e non salgono, la grafica sembra di un gioco della PS2 (anche se io non giudico un libro dalla copertina) ma a me onestamente piace, non so perchè il gioco si freeza per 20-30 secondi senza motivo, c'è un bug molto grave nel capitolo dell'Hotel in cui se muori, il gioco si bugga e bisogna fare l'intero gioco di nuovo, non ha opzioni grafiche.
La storia come ho detto sopra è molto interessante, ma non è spettacolare come gli altri capitoli precedenti, ma devo ammettere che in questo capitolo, il design dei mostri sono davvero molto belli sopratutto i Boss.
Che dire a me questo capitolo è piaciuto ma non come gli altri capitoli precedenti.

Pro:

+ Silent Hill
+ Trama interessante
+ Design Mostri/Boss

Con:

- Bugs 
- 30 FPS Lock

----------------------------------------------------------------------------
English

Do not take seriously my review, because I'm a fan of Silent Hill and then give a positive review to the game although it has many problems.
Then this is the only Silent Hill that we have on Steam unfortunately, since the other Silent Hill is a masterpiece and are much nicer in this chapter, although this chapter has an interesting history and stressed that has nothing to do with the story of Silent Hill the other chapters.
The game suffers from many problems, unfortunately, are locked at 30 FPS and not go up, the graphics seem a PS2 game (though I do not judge a book by its cover) but I honestly like it, do not know why the game is to Freez 20-30 seconds for no reason, there is a very serious bug in the chapter of the Hotel where if you die, the game bug and you have to do the whole game again, no graphics options.
The story as I said above is very interesting, but not spectacular like other previous chapters, but I must admit that in this chapter, the design of the monsters are really quite beautiful especially the Boss.
What about me I liked this chapter, but not like the other chapters.

Pro:

+ Silent Hill
+ Plot interesting
+ Design Monsters / Boss

Con:

- Bugs
- 30 FPS Lock

First, it resets the retarted default control scheme whenever you exit the game.
BAD.

Second, THE BOOKSHELF PUZZLE WHEN YOU GO TO YOUR HOUSE IS UNSOLVABLE ON PC.

Not sure if it's a bad port and this is a better game on console, but at least the Steam version of this game SUCKS! DONT GET IT ON STEAM!

Really I'm sure this is a great game from what I've played but I actually can't get past the bookshelf and I raged at the control settings I had resetting for no reason when I restarted the game, so I'm not playing through it anymore.
Fuck it.

column8:
NÃO COMPRE ESSE GAME!!!

Péssimo port o game possui travamentos contantes, trava no inicio, nas telas de loading. As vezes o som seja ambiente ou de falas fica dessincronizado. Os botões são misturados, no game a quicktime event, nele aparece o botão na tela para executar a ação mas o botão que aparece na tela é diferente do que realmente é para ser apertado, então você morre. 

O mapa fica cortado no meio, não aparece totalmente na tela, já falei que trava muito? 

Melhor jogar a versão de console, eu adoro SH mas vou ter de deixar esse passar por não conseguir jogar, não pena dificuldade mas pelo péssimo port. 

CPU: i7 4790K 
GPU: GTX 670 2GB

I had to unplug my 2nd monitor for the game to even load, and now that I am in I had to crank both my speakers to full both software and hardware side, plus in game, and I can still barely hear it. Also the bass seems to be absent or unsupported by the audio.

And all of this is from less then five minutes of gameplay. ..... This is not off to a good start...
