column8:
Silent Hill Homecoming é um game que faz parte do universo mas que foge um pouco do estilo de jogabilidade, e isso o torna ruim? Não. O jogo é bom,porem ele vai muito para o lado da ação e se esquece do lado do terror e isso faz ele ser  menos admirado em relação aos seus antecessores.Outro ponto que deixa Silent Hill Homecoming para traz é sua historia,ela em si não é ruim mais poderia ser melhor aproveitada e seu plot twist é bem "bocó".se você ignorar esse 2 pontos e alguns bugs SH Homecoming pode ser considerado um bom jogo.
Como todo jogo da franquia Silent Hill sua trilha sonora continua excelente,apesar do jogo ser de 2008 seu gráfico é muito bom.outro fator que é muito positivo para o jogo são seus monstros,cada um deles tem um significado e uma representação na historia e é muito legal ver que mesmo com o passar dos anos a konami continuou com o mesmo esmero em relação a isso.
recomendo muito Silent Hill Homecoming tanto para novos fans da serie pois não é um jogo com tanto terror quanto aos que já jogarão seus antecessores pois é uma boa chance de revisitar esse ambiente tão agradável que é silent hill <3
otimo recomendo

Adoro Silent Hill, sou muito fã de toda a saga, mas Homecoming apresenta pontos negativos que não podem ser relevados.

Já havia jogado ele cinco anos atrás, e resolvi comprar porque estava na promoção. A questão é: lembro que na época tive alguns problemas com o jogo (demora ao carregar, o jogo fecha às vezes repentinamente ou trava). Mas mesmo assim, comprei porque queria lembrar de como era, e aqueles pontos negativos não me inibiram de zerar.

Joguei por algumas horas, quase chegando ao final, mas então veio a luta com o penúltimo boss que tirou toda a minha paciência (e olha que em relação a Silent Hill, tenho bastante). Alex demora para responder os comandos e não consegue livrar-se do monstro (mesmo ao clicar freneticamente, não dá resultado). Nem vou comentar sobre o áudio, que parece sair só da direita, além da versão da Steam aparenta estar mais bugada (como assim?).

Entretanto, o jogo não é totalmente ruim. A trilha sonora é linda, Akira Yamaoka e Mary Elizabeth não deixaram a desejar (a música do menu é a melhor). A história é muito boa e os finais também. O clima da cidade realmente lembra os anteriores, os monstros são até bem feitos e os puzzles são relativamente simples e a história não é a mais complexa e profunda que tem nos jogos anteriores, mas no geral é ok. Apesar disso tudo, estaria sendo injusta caso recomendasse, já que nem todo mundo conhece SH e talvez se começasse com esse ficaria desanimado de jogar os outros. Nota: 6.5/10

Jogo de ótimo potencial, mas tem umas coisas totalmente broxantes. O roteiro é bom, a música é boa, o ambiente é bom, o gráfico é aceitavel, mas a jogabilidade é péssima. O jogo chega a criar um clima pesado (o que é a intenção se você busca terror), mas quando chega na hora da interação com o mundo aí a coisa desanda.
O combate é um dos piores que eu já joguei. Num capítulo avançado eu perdi com machado para um monstro que eu matei fácil com uma faca no primeiro capítulo. Além disso há o fato de você ter que ficar atento se você está no modo de combate, pois se não estiver vai ficar usando comandos de combate enquanto seu personagem apenas apanha quietinho.
Também vale ressaltar que o jogo é sandbox, fato que não consta na descrição. Não que os jogos precisem ser abertos para funcionar, há muitos lineares que funcionam e a maioria dos jogos de tiro é linear. O problema é que aqui ocorre exatamente o pior tipo de sandbox: o "faça isso". O que é o "faça isso"? "Faça isso" significa que em certos momentos da narrativa você ficará preso até achar a única célula do mapa capaz de interagir e te lançar a próxima cena. Eu particularmente fiquei irritado quando eu estava em um hotel e a pista era fazer algo do lado de fora, eu o fiz o quebra-cabeça exterior e voltei e não havia mudado nada; fiquei um tempo nisso até resolver ver na internet o que fazer e descobrir que eu devia ir a uma parede onde antes não havia nada e usar um botão de elevador.
Ainda continuando o tópico sandbox, os mapas exteriores (até onde eu cheguei) não dão conta de um quarteirão. A explicação? Uma das saídas da cidade é um nevoeiro intransponível, e todas as outras ruas são vetadas por crateras.
Tentei gostar do jogo, mas não deu.
It is pretty good.
column9: It is pretty good.

column8:
Para quem gosta da franquia, Homecoming não deixa nada a desejar em comparação às versões anteriores.
Os gráficos do jogo são bacanas. Não é muito longo (salvei em dez horas de jogo), e o enredo foi bem feito e tem congruência.
Segue a maior parte dos padrões do silent hill, inclusive com finais meio bosta.
A jogabilidade, no começo, é um tanto difícil de aprender, mas com o tempo dá pra dominar. Não experimentei no controle, mas, se seguir o padrão dos demais, a jogabilidade no teclado é bem melhor.
Excelente jogo. Me tirou do CS GO por uns dias.
This is the godawful port of a good game. It kind of ruins the experience, so I only recommend buying and playing this version if you absolutely have no choice other than this, like me.
column9: This is the godawful port of a good game. It kind of ruins the experience, so I only recommend buying and playing this version if you absolutely have no choice other than this, like me.

column8: É uma pena ver uma mais série de terror seguir o caminho, que nós ja vimos várias franquias de terror seguirem, Silent Hill Homecoming a princípio aparenta ser um jogo com uma história promissora e com elementos de cenário que lhe fazem uma ambientação amedrontadora, porém com o decorrer do jogo, a mecânica de combate repetitiva e fraca, além de muito frustrante, faz com que tal ambientação se torne ineficiente. O jogo rapidamente se transforma num jogo de ação com elementos fracos de terror, a história começa a se desdobrar de forma obvia e decepcionante, e a atuação dos outros atores, a não ser a do protagonista, simplesmente não passam a emoção devida o que dá um certo ar cômico para situações em que não deveria haver espaço para risadas. Para fãs da série, é extramamente aconselhável não jogar com expectativas, para pessoas que nunca jogaram silent hill por medo, ou qualquer coisa do tipo, o máximo que pode acontecer dentro deste episódio é um susto ou outro com sua própria sombra, visto que a aparição dos inimigos é perfeitamente evidente, e não há muitos elementos para causar o medo. Então avalio o jogo como um MEH/10 o que seria um 5/10, dá para ser jogado porém não vale a pena caso seja adquirido por um preço maior que 10 reais, e não haja um jogo melhor na mesma faixa de preço. EDIT: Port também é mal feito e a compatibilidade com o controle é confusa, além de o jogo, a partir de um certo momento, sempre dar umas travadas.
Good game
column9: Good game

column8:
Don't buy that game

90% Crashing (I have a i7 and a GTX 960) (The problem isn't mine)
5% Audio/graphics sounds problems
1% 30 fps only problems
4% Can't edit options

Dear Kojima: Bring me my money back!

O primeiro SIlent Hill que joguei foi 1 em 2002 na época no meu antigo PSone ainda, depois nunca mas tive vontade de jogar nenhum outro jogo da série, joguei apenas o inicio de alguns outros da série mas não dei continuidade como o primeiro que jogui até o final e virei, esse Homecoming é o segundo que jogo até o final do jogo, tanbem gostei muito desse jogo, o clima sombrio das fases, a unica coisa que acho que não fico legal tanto no primeiro Silent Hill quanto nesse são os inimigos dos jogos, são além de lerdos são sem graça, poderia ter inimigos melhores e mas sinistros com o climas macabro do jogo, os inimigos realmente deixam a desejar pelo menos nesses 2 jogos que citei da série! 

Nota 8/10!

This was my first Silent Hill game and my second Silent Hill experience (after the really good movie). In this game, you arrive in a small town to discover that almost everyone disappeared. It's up to you to discover what happened in Shepherd's Glen. The interesting story is part of the reason why I bought this game.

If you liked Alan Wake, you'll like this game. It's also a 3rd person horror game and it's almost as scary. I would say it's more gore than scary most of the time but the atmosphere is still really good. As for the gameplay,  you discover many weapons (melee or ranged) throughout the game but the ammos are limited so it's up to the player to use them wisely !

It's not really long but I would say it's adequate for this kind of game. It took me about 7-8 hours to finish. It's longer than most of the horror games nowadays.

As for the PC port, I read so many bad reviews that I was wondering if it would run on my computer. Finally, it worked without any problem for most of the game. I did NOT encounter any crash but at the end of the game, the game 'freezed' before saving for about 20-30 seconds. Pretty annoying but it's nothing game-breaking. There's also a puzzle at the beginning of the game (Wires) that did not work at all since i couldn't click on something else with my mouse. I had to plug a controller and then unplug it to finally be able to select the next wire. That was the worst bug I saw in this game. 

In conclusion, buy this game if you love horror games and don't mind about some bugs from the PC port (also considering that it's the only Silent Hill game on Steam, there's not much to complaint about.. at least we have this one)
column9:
This was my first Silent Hill game and my second Silent Hill experience (after the really good movie). In this game, you arrive in a small town to discover that almost everyone disappeared. It's up to you to discover what happened in Shepherd's Glen. The interesting story is part of the reason why I bought this game.

If you liked Alan Wake, you'll like this game. It's also a 3rd person horror game and it's almost as scary. I would say it's more gore than scary most of the time but the atmosphere is still really good. As for the gameplay,  you discover many weapons (melee or ranged) throughout the game but the ammos are limited so it's up to the player to use them wisely !

It's not really long but I would say it's adequate for this kind of game. It took me about 7-8 hours to finish. It's longer than most of the horror games nowadays.

I had to plug a controller and then unplug it to finally be able to select the next wire. That was the worst bug I saw in this game. 

In conclusion, buy this game if you love horror games and don't mind about some bugs from the PC port (also considering that it's the only Silent Hill game on Steam, there's not much to complaint about.. at least we have this one)

column8:
This is SO recommended for any Silent Hill fan, as I found this game so amazing, that I can never get enough of it, though the controls are a bit hard for me, since I don't have any software to allow me to use the analog sticks on my PS3 controller, since the last one I had, gave me a Blue Screen of Death, and keyboard controls are a hell of a lot more painful, I'm trying to get used to them but I can't. DX

Overall, this game is what made me fall in love with Silent Hill all over again, even though there are some low-res textures and shit, but it's still a great game. One thing I hate: Needlers. I HATE them so damn much. Over all, I give this 10/10, it's great.

column8:
Unikalny niepowtarzalny klimat, historia sięgająca podłożem do naszych najgłębiej skrywanych lęków oraz stan ciągłego niepokoju, to tylko szczyt góry zalet jakimi charaktryzuję się ta  gra. Nasza historia zaczyna się interesująco – nasz bohater, żołnierz  Alex, trafia wprost z frontu do szpitala Alchemilla, cóż przynajmniej on tak myśli. To właśnie tu rozpoczyna się piekło. Alex wraz z rozwojem fabuły zagłębia  się w historię swojego rodzinnego miasta oraz poznaje  mroczne sekrety przeszłości. Pomijając szczegóły fabularne  które poznacie  grając, sillent hill  to bardzo dobry przedstawiciel gatunku survival horroru z ciekawą grafiką nie ustępującą za wiele w stosunku do niektórych aktualnych produkcji, z nieco  irytującym interfejsem walki który nie każdemu przypadnie do gustu . Polecam wszystkim 

Unique unique atmosphere, history dating back ground to our innermost fears and the state of constant anxiety, it's just a mountain top which has the advantages of this game. Our story begins to be interesting - our hero, soldier, Alex, goes straight from the front to the hospital Alchemilla, well at least he thinks so. This is where hell begins. Alex, along with the development of the plot delves into the history of his hometown and meets the dark secrets of the past. Apart from the details that you will know the feature game, sillent hill is a very good representative of the genre of survival horror with interesting graphics outgoing not much compared to some current production of slightly annoying interface fight that does not appeal to everyone. I recommend to all

El port de PC es de lo más mugriento que han visto mis ojos; con problemas de audio, tiempos de carga de más de 5 minutos, CERO opciones gráficas (solo se puede elegir la resolución y bajo-medio-alto, en general) problemas de estabilidad de FPS, y la buena costumbre de crashear cuando le sale del prepucio. 

Lo bueno que tiene este juego es que si lo compraste en físico puedes usar el disco para jugar con tu perro, o atarlo a un mango y usarlo para cortar pizza. Si lo compraste en versión digital es una buena forma de probar el sistema de reembolsos de Steam, como ya he hecho yo.

Gioco ottimizzato malissimo !! Mi continua a smettere di funzionare nel livello che torni a casa da tua madre... eppure il primo livello dell'ospedale girava perfetto.. sto dentro ai requisiti consigliati, quindi è proprio il gioco che è una sola !!
Non compratelo, sono soldi buttati per un gioco pieno di bug, che lagga in continuazione e che si interrompre e crasha di continuo e dato che essendo un Silent Hill non puoi salvare dove vuoi, ma solo nei punti di salvataggio (nemmeno vicini uno all'altro) questo è un bel problema che ti fa rimanere bloccato come sono io, o nel migliore dei casi ripetere moooolte volte gli stessi passaggi, ore di gioco buttate e soldi spesi male !! SCONSIGLIATISSIMO !!!

I've never wondered could exist a Silent Hill so poorly made and adapted to PC. There are many things on this game that will irritate you all the time. I'll list some of those things below: 

-bizarre glitches 
-infinite loadings 
-annoying freezings
-bad support for gamepad controller
-low FPS 
-bad controller response
-annoying camera 
-almost invincible bosses with a "hard-to-find" weak point
-a SH that you don't play in SH town (WTF?)
-etc
-etc
-etc

Summarizing: generally, a SH game give you the creeps and some scares, which is something nice when we talk about a survive horror game. But this one will make you more bored and angry than excited the most of the painful gameplay experience. If you intend to buy this game and play it to make you feel "complete" as a hard fan of SILENT HILL, just like me, think about it twice. Honestly, I cannot say I regret to buy this game, but surely I can tell you SH Homecoming is a really disappointing game for all those reasons I listed above. I hope it could be helpful.

column8:
Mi intención era hacer un analisis positivo, pués me pareció un Silent Hill muy decente cuando lo jugué en PS3 y se ganó un  hueco en mi memoria como un gran juego de terror por su estupenda atmósfera, aunque técnicamente tenga sus carencias. 

Así que el motivo de que no recomiende su compra se reduce básicamente a que es un puto port de mierda, y punto. Estoy hasta la punta del cipote de que cada vez que me salga una pantalla de "Cargando" tenga que rezar 4 jesusitos de mi vida y un ave maría purísima para que no me crashee el juego porque. sí, son crasheos random. No es que haya un punto específico en el que el juego se pille, o lo haga por una acción tuya, no, es que es una puñetera lotería, y ojo que como te pille con el punto de guardado donde guardaste por última vez en el quinto pino, pues ya te cagas en todos los santos muertos de Konami o quien pollas haya hecho semejante despropósito de port. A ver como coño os buscais la vida sin Kojima, inútiles. Haced vuestro puto trabajo, ¿tan dificil es? Si sacais un port a PC, porteadlo bien, pero no me hagais esta chapuza por favor. No se si sera un caso aislado de Windows 7 o si pasa en más SO, pero así no se puede sacar un juego y pretender cobrar por ello.

Llevo 6 horas jugadas y apenas acabo de llegar a Silent Hill, para que os hagais una idea de la pérdida de tiempo que me lleva tener que llegar hasta donde estaba después de cada crasheo. ¿Así como puede jugar uno? Además de que se carga completamente la experiencia y la inmersión. Evidentemente he mandado el juego a tomar por culo. Ya no son solo los crasheos, sino problemas de texturas, sonido envolvente etc. Chapuza

Uzun zaman oldu Silent Hill oyunu oynamayalı. Koca seride bitirmediğim tek oyun Homecoming kalmıştı ve nihayet onun da sonunu getirmiş bulunuyorum. Silent Hill atmosferine o kadar aç kalmışım ki oyunu iki günde bitirdim :)

Silent Hill 4 The Room'dan sonra stüdyonun dağılması ve diğer firmalara oyun yaptırılmasıyla 2008 yılında hayranlarının tepkisini toplamayı başarmıştı Konami. Aynı yıl çıkan Silent Hill Origins gayet güzel bir oyundu ve seriye yenilikler getirmişti. Fakat ana oyun olarak geliştirilen Homecoming seriye devrimsel değişikliklerle geldi. Öncelikle oyunun Silent Hill adına yakışan bir oyun olduğunu söylemem gerekiyor ama tabi ki eskileri aratan eksikleri de var.

Kahramanımız Alex Shepherd askere gidiyor ve uzun yıllar yaşadığı kasabadan uzak kalıyor. Geri döndüğünde ise insanların kaybolmaya başladığını ve tuhaflıklar olduğunu anlamasıyla kaybolan kardeşi Joshua'nın peşine düşüyor. Seriye ilk getirilen farklılık oyunun Silent Hill kasabasında değil başka bir kasabada başlaması olmuş. Shepherd's Glen'de Silent Hill'i aratmıyor. 

Teknik kısımları açıklamaya başlayacak olursam öncelikle oyun gerilim ve gizem ağırlığından ödün vererek biraz daha combat ağırlıklı bir oyuna dönüşmüş ki ben bu tarz oyunlarda kavga dövüşten nefret ederim. Hatta boss savaşlarından bile yer yer nefret ediyorum. Homecoming'te ise 4 tane boss savaşı var ve bu normal bir Silent Hill için çok fazla. Sürekli aklımda ordan hemşire çıkacak mı yoksa köpek mi gelecek düşüncesi vardı ve bu yeterinde rahatsız edici bir şey benim için. Pc optimizasyonunun Dark Souls'tan biraz daha iyi olduğunu söylemeliyim. Yani vasatın altında bir optimizasyona sahip hatta yer yer Playstation'ımın dvd si çizilmiş te okumasını bekliyormuşum gibi uzun uzun bekledim oyunun akmasını.  Hikayesi gayet içine çeken ve anlatımıyla da takdir kazanmayı başarmış yapıda. Müzikleri ise her zaman ki gibi çok güzel. Puzzle ları önceki oyunlara göre oldukça basit tutulmuş. Havok grafik motoru Silent Hill'e çok yakışmış. Dodge sistemi ve kamera açısı ise bana Resident Evil 4'ü hatırlattı fazlasıyla.

Serinin hayranlarındansanız benim gibi Homecoming'i mutlaka oynamalısınız diye düşünüyorum çünkü The Order'a dair açıklayıcı bir senaryoya sahip üstelik eski oyunların hepsinin harmanlanarak önümüze sunuluşunun ne kadar fark yarattığını gözler önüne seriyor.

7/10

column8:
I saw the gameplay on PS3 and I was happy that I had purchased the game some days ago. I only payed $1.50 on a Brazilian gamesite. It activated no problem and all was perfect. So I saw the gameplay and the game looks awesome.
So I launch the game on Steam. I put the game on the highest settings since my computer is like 3 times better than the required specs. Boy was I dissapointed with the port of this game. I played trough the first chapter and it took me longer than an hour. Not because I don't know how to play or what to do. The game runs maybe at 5-6 fps, The only thing that doesnt lags are the cutscenes. Also when you die or go to a next level or sometimes even different area it loads from 5- 10 minutes. It is ridiculous how badly they optimized this game for pc. I dont know if its the steam version since I saw a guy on youtube play this on pc flawlessly. Must have been a pirated version.

I can't recommend this game at all and on top of that its like $40 in the steam store. DON'T BUY THIS GAME

Really sad because it looks like an amazing game.

1/10

column8: PC版的4部寂静岭，我全玩过，我非常喜欢这个系列。归乡的剧情不错，很有深度，但PC版的优化不好，频繁闪退！

Não recomendo esse jogo.Infelizmente,a Konami modificou radicalmente a mêcanica de jogo desse Silent Hill e deixou o game chato e irritante,mas o pior de tudo,é que esta versão do Steam,está totalmmente deteriorada,ou seja,cheia de bugs absurdos,que fariam com que o jogo fosse retirado da biblioteca,o que a Steam não fez e pelos comentários que se pode conferir aqui mesmo,esse jogo apresenta problemas na plataforma Steam,desde que foi trazido pra cá,há quase três anos,já nas versões Xbox ou Playstation 3,pode-se jogar até o fim,sem qualquer tipo de problema.Bom,bugs à parte,Silent Hill Homecoming não é digno dos fãs da série,deixa muito a desejar no quesito terror e jogabilidade,uma pena perceber que uma gigante dos games,não soube aproveitar um de seus mais famosos títulos e o transformou num lixo e que não vale um centavo sequer.Infelizmente,eu não sabia dos bugs e nem da chatice de Homecoming e ele foi um dos games que escolhi para que meu namorado me presenteasse no Natal...erro que cometi e agora,eu nem sequer baixo mais o jogo,pois o meu está bugado e simplesmente não sai de um vídeo onde parei.Uma pena,dinheiro jogado ralo abaixo.
Spegni la luce e comincia a farti alzare i peli dopo 5-10 minuti. Se ti immedesimi troppo meglio giocarlo in compagnia...

I liked the story in this game, music was awesome and kept me interested enough that I finished the game.

What was really a let down was the constant freezing, crashing and lagging....if it wasn't for all of this I probably would have finished the game in 15-20 hours as opposed to 25-30. 
Save points were ridiculously spaced out and difficult to find as well. Frustrating when you die and have nearly reached the next save point and have to do a big chunk of gameplay all over again. Or when the game crashes for no apparent reason right before the next save point. Really disappointed with it.

Probably would only recommend it to patient gamers and hardcore SH fans. Not worth 30 bucks.

column8: Bem legal como todos Silent Hill  e com bastante terror, alguns inimigos são chatos de matar outros bem facil,vale muito apena ser jogado com os anteriores, os unicos pontos ruins desse jogo é que jogando com controle de xbox as cores de comando não correspondem com as da tela, oque chega a ser bem irritante, movimentação pra um jogo de 2008 ta muito travada, golpes  o Alex só consegue usar 2 seguidos e para e só depois de uns 2-3 segundos que ele ataca denovo oque pode fazer morrer bastante principalmente na delegacia onde o melhor vai ser fugir dos primeiros e matar os outros com armas de fogo, os puzzles do jogo são relativamente faceis tirando o ultimo, a historia se baseia no protagonista, se for jogar esteja preparado pra enfrenta alguns bugs e travadas no loading, a historia do jogo pode parecer bem confusa em 80% das vezes, mais com o decorrer do jogo você vai conseguir entender tudo, e no final é explicado o motivo de tudo que aconteceu,

Reminder to self - don't try to play it again.

Review below ... 


The worst game I own on Steam.

Di-a-boli-cal. 

Slow, so slow it's unbelievable. Controls horrendous. Graphics pathetic and look 2002 era.

This is my first SH game and I hate it. When I had nearly finished chapter six I still had only have two hours game play on the clock. 

I am sick of dying. Stupid combat with inadequate weapons or no ammo. Sick as hell of having to repeat tragically difficult or awkward stuff. On top of that it crashes everytime I minimise it, like when looking for a walkthrough. Basically 2.5 hours of nothing and 50% of that time is from dying and repeating. What the hell is that for over 1/3 of the chapters of game?  Added to that pointless notes to read taking up time.

All I can say now is thank goodness a Steam copy arrived for £5.40, and not full Steam price of £18. 

I got worn out in the maze of the hotel in chapter six. I would do a tiny bit, and run back and save. Basically because save points are like one per chapter, occasionally two, and occasionally none. I tried to carry on a few times, and clawed my way through. Then finally I met the chapter six boss. It plays a trump card of insulting here. The combat controls change between the two stages of the boss fight. In the first half letting go of shift releases aim and you are free to move at normal speed. Second half, releasing shift does not let go of aim. It is toggled on.

Wrangling with the controls to axe the creature's arms is nearly impossible. By default it aims for the head which is out of reach. It is so hard to remember to cancel toggle shift after a strike. You get knocked down and get up to find you can hardly move because shift is still on. Smashed to the floor again. Maybe thirty goes at this boss. The end. I gave up. Four days it took me to try finish chapter six.

I did come back and do a bit more, beat the ch 6 boss after about fifty goes. I played on a little and the insults just kept coming. One was a code for a locker was the time on a clock on a wall. Basically without the ammo in the locker you can't beat the next mini-boss monster. Of course you can't minimise the game to check a walkthrough fo the code because it will crash. Therefor you are bound to re-start from last save.
column9:
Reminder to self - don't try to play it again.

Review below ... 


The worst game I own on Steam.

Di-a-boli-cal. 

Slow, so slow it's unbelievable. Controls horrendous. Graphics pathetic and look 2002 era.

This is my first SH game and I hate it. When I had nearly finished chapter six I still had only have two hours game play on the clock. 

I am sick of dying. Stupid combat with inadequate weapons or no ammo. Sick as hell of having to repeat tragically difficult or awkward stuff. On top of that it crashes everytime I minimise it, like when looking for a walkthrough. Basically 2.5 hours of nothing and 50% of that time is from dying and repeating. What the hell is that for over 1/3 of the chapters of game?  Added to that pointless notes to read taking up time.

All I can say now is thank goodness a Steam copy arrived for £5.40, and not full Steam price of £18. 

I got worn out in the maze of the hotel in chapter six. I would do a tiny bit, and run back and save. Basically because save points are like one per chapter, occasionally two, and occasionally none. I tried to carry on a few times, and clawed my way through. Then finally I met the chapter six boss. It plays a trump card of insulting here. The combat controls change between the two stages of the boss fight. In the first half letting go of shift releases aim and you are free to move at normal speed. Second half, releasing shift does not let go of aim. It is toggled on.

Wrangling with the controls to axe the creature's arms is nearly impossible. By default it aims for the head which is out of reach. It is so hard to remember to cancel toggle shift after a strike. You get knocked down and get up to find you can hardly move because shift is still on. Smashed to the floor again. Maybe thirty goes at this boss. The end. I gave up. Four days it took me to try finish chapter six.

I did come back and do a bit more, beat the ch 6 boss after about fifty goes. I played on a little and the insults just kept coming. One was a code for a locker was the time on a clock on a wall. Basically without the ammo in the locker you can't beat the next mini-boss monster. Of course you can't minimise the game to check a walkthrough fo the code because it will crash. Therefor you are bound to re-start from last save.

column8:
I am not sure where all of the complaints about Silent Hill Homecoming on Steam originate from.  For me the game installs and plays fine.

The game itself is a good "clone" of the Silent Hill franchise.  The reason I say that is the original Team Silent only made Silent Hill I through IV.  Because of this, all the rest are more or less a clone of the original series, and Home Coming, despite really feeling like one, is itself a pretty good one.

I am not going to go much into the game or gameplay itself, if you have ever played a Silent Hill game you already know what it is like.  There is not anything really new or different with Home Coming aside from the story.  Where the game is fun is just in the feeling of being in another Silent Hill story: the creepiness, puzzles and atmosphere are all there, and then there are definitely those moments where you have to just smile as what you just experienced was pretty awesome!

If you are a fan of the survival horror genre, or just a fan of the Silent Hill series, Silent Hill Homecoming is definitely one you will want to get.

column8:
If you intend to play this game, purchase the console version or something.
It's an awful port, for example: the audio doesn't work on any chipset that I've ever tried it on. I've installed this game on several machines (mine and my friends') and it doesn't produce sound properly on any of them. I've tried playing it with various integrated, crappy and very common chipsets as well as several Creative Labs and ASUS PCI-E products. None of them work with the game properly; it's astounding. There are other things to pick at, surely, but this is what bothered me the most ...especially since the game heavily relies on sound to create atmosphere and suspense, etcetera.
The game itself may or may not sate the desire of a Silent Hill fan's want of a Silent Hill experience. It borrows a few bits from the film and is sort of reminiscent of the visual aesthetics of it's predecessors along with some creative new elements and it's own story-line. Anyhow, if you decide to buy it, good luck!

column8:
Buenas, solo queria comentar que aunque la ficha de steam especifique que solo trae inglés, al empezar el juego se pone automaticamente en castellano sin necesidad e sustituir o añadir ningún archivo.

Por otro lado, puede jugarse con pad. Tengo conectado un mando de xbox one y solo hay que ir a controles y especificar que quiere jugarse con mando. Eso sí, en pantalla no veremos los iconos de los botones del mando de 360/one, si no los genericos. Se agradece, al menos , que podamos jugar con mando pero podria ser mejor.

Puede ponerse a resoluciones hasta 4k y 60 hz.

En mi opinión un buen juego para tener en la biblioteca.

I have played this game when I have been offline so my hours played do not reflect the real time I have invested in the game.

Beginning with story: Not engrossing enough to keep you gripped. You will typically be able to predict what is coming next.

The characters are wrote in such a way that they lack depth and it is hard to form a bond with them.

Gameplay: Punishing, almost arcade-style. You will die frequently as the enemies are scripted to pummel you with quicker attack speeds and wider attack range than you can achieve. You will find yourself spamming the dodge-uppercut move hoping for a lucky shot.

The puzzle sections are good, not great. They offer subtle aids to help you complete them, but the reward for your endeavour is not always felt.

The saving mechanic is flawed mainly because the save points are placed at random points, forcing you to rely on checkpoints. Some checkpoints are poorly done as they force you to watch cutscenes again and again that you can not skip.

Software: The software crashes at random points in the game. I don't claim to have the best gaming pc, but I have researched that even high spec pcs suffer from the random bugs infesting the software.

Verdict: This game has about 5% of the spirit of Silent Hill, leaving much to be desired. Unless you are a diehard who must own everything Silent Hill, avoid this one and research other horror titles to spend your cash on.

Un épisode de Silent Hill plus action que survival qui aurait pu être pas trop mal si cette version PC n'étais pas complètement buggée pour un jeu à peine plus beau que les précèdents (qui étaient sortis sur PS2/XBOX/PC)...
Je n'ai jamais vu un jeu aussi mal optimisé (textures qui ne s'affichent pas, ralentissement énormes alors qu'il n'y a rien à l'écran & qu'en plus ce n'est pas très beau, chargements extrêmement looooooooooooooongs... (parfois même juste pour un petit jardin cloisonné de 10m² il faut plusieurs minutes sur disque dur SSD!) , sans compté les freezes de 10sec en plein jeu lors des sauvegardes automatiques & les diverses cut-scènes tronquées ou n'ayant que le son avec la video qui démarre à la moitié... on rajoute à ça les QTE qui inversent aléatoirement les boutons/touches de la souris au grès de leur envie, résultat on se fait tué bêtement par un ennemi trop prêt & on est bon pour recommencé l'intégralité de la séquence depuis le dernier check-point... voir de redémarrer le jeu complétement ce qui prend aussi un temps fou.
Avec un style de jeu qui se base sur l'immersion & l'ambiance, l'expérience est totalement ruinée.
Vraiment dommage car l'univers de la série est bel & bien présent, certes moins horrifique & oppréssent, la seule peur dans celui-ci étant de râter une de ces QTE buggés ou les crashs intempestifs & devoir se retaper une partie du jeu, on fait donc régulièrement des détours aux points de sauvegardes, ce qui n'est pas dans l'esprit des précèdents.
On attendra donc le dernier “Downpour” s'il sort éventuellement un jour sur PC...??

I've played all the SIlent Hill games. Completed all of them, except this one. I just can't do it, guys. I'm sorry. There are some good graphics in this game. But the gameplay, interface and most important of all, story, just make this into the worst Silent Hill game I've ever played.

The save points are in stupid places, very far apart and hard to get to. That's not a problem because you'll die a lot (you won't) - it's a problem because after playing for another fifteen minutes of nothing happening or being ambushed by the same monsters over and over again, you're going to be so bored you just need a break. And you can't take one, because then you'll have to play through this whole tedious section all over again.

You're a much more combat capable character in SHH (I imagine someone saying "Shh..." and placing their hand over this games face to just shut up all the stupid) but that's not necessarily a good thing. It takes a run and hide, survival horror and makes it a dodge, counter, attack fighting game. There's not so much a sense of fear, but frustration, over the enelies getting in cheap or lucky shots, when you should be going, "OH GOD WHAT THE FUCK IS THAT?!"

Good news is, this game adds nothing to the overall mythology (at least not in the time I've spent playing it) so you can skip this and hope the next Silent Hill game coming out is pants shittingly good.

column8:
La saga Silent Hill siempre ha tenido una chispa especial que le ha distinguido del resto y aportado sus elementos representativos y su propia personalidad. Este se aleja bastante de los demás.

Y probablemente se deba a que es el primero que se ha "americanizado", lo que le ha restado mucho del carisma que aportan los videojuegos japoneses; no es que sea una crítica a este sentido, sino que algunos detalles de genialidad sólo lo saben aportar desde el país del sol naciente. Aquí los personajes no poseen el mismo carisma, no resultan tan memorables como por ejemplo en Silent Hill 2; la historia tampoco resulta tan atractiva como en otros, y se nota cierta falta de alma por parte del videojuego.

Algo que sí se ha mejorado y que resultaba lamentable es el sistema de combate, tampoco es como para tirar cohetes, pero ahora es mucho más efectivo y requiere de habilidad. Las constantes en cuanto a escasez de munición y elementos siguen estando vigentes y resulta un desafío avanzar por los parajes de Sheper´s Glen, plagado de bestias sacadas de las pesadillas más macabras de los desarrolladores.

El nivel gráfico incluso me atrevería a decir que ha bajado, se han utilizado unos efectos "granulosos" que aunque se supone dotan al juego de aire cinematográfico, a mí me parece que más bien son una excusa para no reconocer la caída, nota muy presente por ejemplo en los rostros de los personajes; hasta ahora pocos videojuegos producían una sensación de emoción en los jugadores como esta saga; pero en este se ha perdido ese encanto, no ayuda tampoco como dije la falta de carisma de los personajes.

En definitiva, de todos los Silent Hill que han salido en PC, y habiendo completado también Origins y el primero, me parece en reglas generales el más decepcionante. No resulta tan recomendable como el resto, no es mal juego, pero le falta mucho para llegar al nivel de otros memorables.

Nota: 6,25/10

column8:
I'm a huge old school survival horror fan, and picked this up on sale. Primarily for nostalgic reasons. I played it when it was first released on the PS3, and I remember I was a bit disappointed. Especially the bizzare, totally not related to anything ending I got when I completed the game.

I'm not experiencing all of the "game won't start" problems other people are talking about. But the game freezes for long periods of time to think about what it has to next, the controls are even clunkier than I remember them being on the PS3, the cut scenes go black or are 10 seconds out of synch.......Lots to not love.

The graphics have actually held up quite well after 7(?) years.

After about 6 hours of gameplay, I can honestly say that this game is in the running for the worst port. Ever.

But, it's scared the bejeezus out of me couple of times. And that's why I bought it.

The puzzles so far have been "meh".

If you can find it on sale, grab it. But only if you're an old school survival horror fan. Save points are few, you WILL die because of the crappy controls, you WILL  have to replay portions of the game because of these two things. Alot.

column8: I have not played any of the Silent Hill series - i was caught up in the Resident evil saga instead - the silent hill game is okay, it creates a scary/creepy atmosphere - mainly because im not sure what i am doing, but also because it is so dark. This is my biggest problem (and may be to do with my system) but the graphics look a little simplistic and dated, making it a 'look for the thing rendered more detailed' style gameplay - but the main gaping point is it's sooo dark i have to strain to play it....therefore i stopped playing it and never got passed the 'sanitorium' bit which is the first part. I literally can't see what i'm doing so the horror aspect is good when you see it, and the noises are creepy so jump scares aplenty, but other than that it's aimlessly wandering through a 'this door doesn't open so it must be the other one' style. Not really that exciting and didn't instill any confidence in wanting to try any others. I wish i could play it more but even with brightness turned up i can't make anything out without getting a headache.

column8:
Silent Hill Homecoming....
Musica para acompañar el analisis: 
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=T4HfgwLmyd8
por donde puedo empezar con este analisis a este juego.
--------
Historia:
--------
La historia gira en torno a Alex Shepherd , joven soldado recidente de la ciudad vecina de Silent Hill , Shepherd Gleen.
Luego de ser herido en el campo de batalla y muchas pesadillas, decide regresar a su hogar ya que siente que algo malo le a pasado a su hermano Josh Shepherd.
Al llegar encuentra que algo anda mal ya que no hay personas en la ciudad y poco a poco se ve envuelto en la pesadilla que a corrompido Shepherd Gleen hasta llegar a la ciudad de la niebla eterna.....Silent Hill,para lograr encontrar respuestas a sus inquietudes...
Esta es la propuesta que nos plantea Homecoming.
La historia aunque en un principio parece simple poco a poco se va volviendo mas compleja, como el descubrimiento de la orden que se ve envuelta en la historia , revelaciones importantes con respecto a nuestro protagonista y la pregunta  a la que gira la drama ¿donde y que le paso a Josh y la gente del pueblo?
en este sentido la historia es buena , oscura e interesante.
--------
Graficos:
--------
Silent Hill Homecoming aunque lanzado en el 2008 tiene un motor grafico muy imponente, con un sistema de iluminacion,particulas, sombras brutal! que logra envolverte totalmente  y texturas increibles de gran detalle y tamaño [imponentes con texturas de 1024x1024 y 2048x2048 cuando juegos modernos recurren a texturas de baja calidad de 512x512....]
aunque no todo es color de rosa, ya que Alex y las criaturas con las que te encontraras tendran esa calidad pero los personajes secundarios aun con texturas de gran tamaño tienen muy poca definicion.
algo que lo hace un tanto inconsistente pero que para los que no nos preocupamos tanto por los graficos no nos va a hacer mucho problema ,pero si eres pc gamer pro.... pues esas texturas te van a hacer sangrar los ojos.
--------
Sonido:
--------
Simplemente....MAGNIFICO! Akira Yamaoka lo hizo denuevo con un soundtrack muy bueno , temas vocales muy acorder con la trama y musica complementaria que te logra envolver en el juego.
este juego esta echo para jugarlo con audifonos a todo volumen!
--------
Jugabilidad:
--------
Aqui encontramos uno de los puntos mas bajos con este producto... la jugabilidad aunque en parte es comodo, las animaciones son un tanto robotizadas con respecto a nuestro personaje [ya que las criaturas tienen animaciones espectaculares y muy naturales] ,aunque los controles son en parte comodos, en si se siente raro a comparacion con los juegos mas clasicos.... talves sea por el cambio de camara u otros factores pero en si no es nada dificil aprender a jugar homecoming por lo tanto cumple que no te frustres con los controles.
--------
Personajes:
--------
Homecoming es hasta el momento uno de los silent hill con mayor desarrollo de personajes, entre los cuales destacamos a Alex Shepherd, Josh Shepherd,Elle Holloway, James Wheeler, Adam Shepherd, Lillian Shepherd , Margaret Holloway,Martin Fitch,Sam Bartlett [ademas de personajes fallecidos y otros que tienen relacion baja con menciones y cartas].
algunos se desarrollan de manera muy bien mientras que otros simplemente parece que estan de relleno porque no se desarrollan a mucha profundidas pero si son importantes para el desarrollo de la historia y eso hace un poco mas inconsistente el juego.
--------
Con eso terminamos con una evaluacion de juego simple.... pero esto es un SILENT HILL asi que tenemos que evaluarlo como parte de la saga...
--------
Como Silent Hill de la saga numerica:
--------
aun con ciertos errores en la inconsistencia del juego,Silent Hill Homecoming logra hacerte sentir en la saga, tras lo diferente que fue The Room, Homecoming logra hacerte sentir [como su nombre del juego indica]"de vuelta a casa".
una atmosfera mas que absorvente, un nuevo "otro mundo" de los mas perturbadores de toda la saga [yo lo pondria entre el segundo y tercer puesto de otros mundos mas pertubadores]
Criaturas de las que yo considero mas perturbadoras y con un diseño que si en algun momento te encontraras en una calle.... harian que se te caigan los pantalones de terror que producen.
5 finales muy bien estructurados que no desentonan con la saga [salvo el final ufo... pero se perdona]
un soundtrack excelente como toda la saga, el maestro Akira Yamaoka logro su cometido con este juego.
para finalizar el analisis....
¿Recomiendo Homecoming? porsupuesto que si! Homecoming es un juego entretenido, con fidelidad a la saga , los chicos de doble helix lograron su cometido de querer regresar a parte de sus origenes a silent hill aunque eso si hay partes muy bien echas y cosas que no son muy de sus origenes que digamos para finalizar hay que aclarar que no es perfecto es un juego bueno pero no uno perfecto como los de Silent Team,
Nota Final: 8.5/10
Musica para cerrar el analisis:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xOSbEafTHfo
muchas gracias por leer mi analisis :D
Highly recommended!
column9: Highly recommended!

I love silent hill, and have played all the games in the series, and enjoy them all in some way. The game itself isnt among the worst and has good atmosphere and of course the soundtrack is amazing. The pc port however, is not; it's actually pretty terrible. Sometimes it plays fine, sometimes the cutscenes freeze, and sometimes the game crashes for no reason, and there's no fix for any of this. At 40 dollars i'd be hard pressed to recommend this to anyone, maybe 5 or 10 at the most, but lousy job on the pc port konami, for shame.

column8:
El único silent hill que tenemos en steam, silent hill 5 (homecoming) trata la historia de alex sheperd, un militar que vuelve a su casa después de pasar largo tiempo en un hospital militar. Cuando vuelve se encuentra que su pueblo ha cambiado mucho y ha desaparecido la mayoría de la gente con una conexión muy clara, un pueblo de al lado llamado silent hill.

Para mi gusto es el peor silent hill de todos, pero no deja de ser silent hill. Quién haya jugado a más silent hill no saldrá defraudado, aunque como digo, no llega a la calidad de los tres primeros.

Para quien no haya jugado nunca a silent hill decir que silent hill homecoming es un survival, originario de consolas, no lo olvidemos, en el que lo que más destaca es la historia, la duración es corta, los puzzles son bastante sencillitos , esta orientado (por lo menos este más) a la acción y es bastante pasillero a modo de ejemplo, poder moverte por parte de un pueblo y que esten todas las puertas cerradas menos las necesarias para continuar la historia). El juego no carece de quicktime events pero hay que reconocer que son muy puntuales. Consta de cinco finales diferentes que varíaran según las decisiones que tomemos en tres momentos claves de la aventura, y como todos los finales, meh.

Viéndolo asi la verdad es que puede quitar las ganas de jugar, pero no, tiene algo, ese algo que ha convertido esta saga en un icono del videojuego de terror.

Tecnicamente es un port de consolas, y se nota, pero dentro de lo que cabe se juega bastante bien (con mando, con teclas no lo se) y con algunos problemas con la cámara al atacar  que pronto te acostumbras. Los gráficos no son de otro mundo y  sufre de ciertas ralentizaciones puntuales pero como ya he dicho, son salvables.

Insisto que, el mejor punto a favor es su atmósfera, su historia y el folklore característico de esta franquicia que le ha hecho ser un imprescindible en los juegos de terror.

A la espera de que alguna vez konami se digne a traernos a steam los tres primeros silent hill  (y el 4, aunque éste es más flojo) no me queda más que recomendar éste y desear que el próximo, el llamado silent hills también aparezca por compatibles.

6,5/10

首先你玩这游戏，不要问它恐怖不恐怖，跟某某比怎样怎样，玩过后你自然会明白。游戏里面有很多的心理暗示，音乐背景氛围造成的让人身临其中感觉，别提多令人无限回味了。性感的女护士，让你欲罢不能，帅气的三角哥，让你无法自持。还有很多萌萌的小宠物顿时让你爱心泛滥。尤其是可爱的小弟，别提多调皮了，丫的，不要让我抓住你！

还有就是游戏不能切回桌面，否则会停止工作，记得存档点一定要及时存档。。。。。

[b]Silent Hill: Homecoming[/b] nie zawodzi - zaległa gra sprzed lat - i jak zwykle atakuje zmysły typowo japońską, chorą na maxa jazdą, przy której czytadła Kinga są niczym marinistyczne romanse, osadzone w połowie dziewiętnastego wieku ;D

Co by dużo nie mówić, gra od początku poraża oprawą graficzną z zeszłego stulecia niemniej w tym akurat przypadku dodaje to grze upiornego uroku, do tego dochodzi równie koszmarne sterowanie i praca kamery, którą spokojnie można posądzić o permanentnego zeza, szczególnie jak se wniknie w teksturę za plecami bohatera i od tego momentu posługujemy się jeno zmysłem słuchu oraz szóstym zmysłem, co dodatkowo potęguje koszmarną atmosferkę ;>
Mimo tych wad/zalet (tak, tak, niektórzy uważają takie oldskulowe sterowanie za dar od Boga, #bożesztymój) , gra ma niezwykły klimat, będący jej wizytówką i proszę nie porównywać tego tytułu do crapowatych filmideł - OK, jedynka jeszcze ujdzie, ale dwójka to profanacja totalna, za którą producenci tego parcha sami powinni trafić do tytułowego Silent Hill, w ramach szeroko rozumianej pokuty ;D Filmy to kaszanka, gry to prawdziwe salami z osła, albo innego okapi.

Do tego co wyżej, dochodzą coraz to koszmarniejsze poczwary, których eksterminację uskutecznia się z reguły za pomocą oręża białego, który szybko staje się czerwony, amunicji do pukawek (na wyższym poziomie trudności) jest tradycyjnie jak na lekarstwo, zresztą lekarstw tyż nie ma za dużo i całe szczęście, bo najgorszym ciosem dla serii byłoby wprowadzenie autoregeneracji ;]
Można poschizować się w okolicach północy, polecam do tego zimnego bro plus kilka listków Relanium!

OK, to na tyle, wuja kończy już grać i zaraz potem wskakuje w wir [b]Outlast[/b], o którym to skrobnie w kolejnej audycji :}

8/10 i Polecam - gra co jakiś czas jest do wyrwania w śmiesznej cenie, więc brać i nie żałować! ;>

Czytała Krystyna Czubówna.
Produkcja: Nołlajf Studio.

column8: Muy muy buen juego, pero.... tiene unos bugs que dan miedo.

Meilleur de la saga pour moi, excellent jeu, contenu vaste et toujours aussi prenant.

I love the Silent Hill series.  "love" like I have all the game cases lined up on my bookshelf for display and replay emulated copies of them often - Love.  What makes the series so great?  The story; the subtle psychological horror of you and a town gripped by subconcious evil.  A story of isolation that can only come from it's Japanese author.
Silent Hill Homecoming takes this legacy and corrupts with American misunderstanding and pretty much performs sub-par on everything except what Konami had forbid them to change: the direction of the original author.  God help us....quick time events, shoe-horned love intrest [when will America stop this?!], and misunderstanding of enemy design [what the hell do they represent to Alex?].
Compound all that with more frequent combat and more jumpscares [RE series jealousy?] and the subtle atmoshere is nearly lost. 

But why do I recommend it?  Stockholm Syndrome really.  I bonded with the story despite everything terrible about the game.  And at least it wasn't as bad as Origins.

I hope this game manages to improve, and I hope the game has a fun plot and good scares. But I will never know.

This is the worst port I have ever played - and by played I mean, attempted to play before being kicked out an hour in. There are countless fixes available online but by their own admission they don't fix everything. For a lot of people, they fix nothing.

Do not buy this until they fix it.

column8: Um dos melhores jogos da série na minha opinião, tanto em jogabilidade como na imersão o jogo é muito bom, para alguns criticos que prezam pela tradição independente do nivel de diversão, pode aver uma falha aqui outra ali, mas para mim e outros player que apreciam a diversão, este jogo é excelente, sempre me deu vontade de saber o que está por vir. Como fã de Silent Hill que sou este titúlo foi um dos melhores que ja joguei. se não acreditam, eu os encorajo a jogar e tirar suas próprias conclusões, gosto é gosto, mas eu arrisco dizer que irão gostar.
暴雨何时登陆PC？

Despite of the fact that Homecoming is the worse part of the series, it is still scary. A LOT. Usually, It takes around few minutes to sense the first fear especially caused by the fact that the creautres could appear even at those places where you've cleared everthing. I am not joking, you could clear the whole floor and then see a monster behind you. The range of monsters is quite nice, by the way. 

The sounds are perfect as well as the mist that disables you to look around. However, graphics and physics are awful and the story is lacking of logic. There is also a lack of save points that could dissappoint someone but in my opinion that forces you to play further rather than exit with the words "Holy shit I cannot play that anymore" :D

column8:
Pour un Silent Hill conçu par une autre équipe de développement que les originaux, il a du potentiel, seulement ce portage PC est truffé de bugs.

Déjà, en y jouant sous steam, le nombre de crashs est hallucinant (entre toute les 5 et 20 minutes) et on ne peux pas alt+tab sans crash non plus. Obligé de jouer hors steam, en lançant en tant qu'administrateur pour "résoudre" ces 2 problèmes (malgré ça, le jeu crash encore de temps en temps). 

En plus de ça, on a des bugs sonores (sons qui ne sortent que d'un haut parleur), des temps de chargement à rallonge (parfois en pleine séquence de gameplay, le jeu se fige pendant une bonne demie-minute).

Et si vous pensez que je suis un cas isolé, allez donc faire une recherche sur le net...

Pour continuer sur les défauts du jeu, l'orientation plus "action" que les anciens épisodes aurait pu ne pas être une mauvaise chose si les esquives n'étaient pas à timer à la micro-seconde près (surtout avec les boss), et que la seule arme de mélée efficace soit le couteau (que l'on a dès le début) relégant les 2 autres types d'arme de mélée au rang d'ouvres-porte (littéralement).

Tout ça est vraiment dommage, car l'ambiance est fidèle au reste de la saga (et réussi à nouer les univers des jeux avec celui des films) et l'histoire est assez prenante si on réussi à dépasser tous les problèmes techniques. 

Les musiques, et le sound design qui, eux, sont toujours l'oeuvre du même bonhomme depuis le début jouent clairement un rôle la réussite de la restitution de l'univers "Silent Hill", et on peut noter que graphiqement, le tout tiens la route pour un jeu qui a plus de 5 ans.

Bref, tout ça pour dire qu'il est peut-être recommandable sur console, mais certainement pas sur PC...

As a Silent Hill saga fan, I reckon this was a good attempt at simulating the greatest moments of the franchise. The game kept me engaged for as long as it lasted. It can get a little buggy sometimes, but otherwise it was an ok game.

column8:
Just another buggy piece of junk. 

Once I got through the usual black screen startup inherent to a lot of rushed PC games, I had to figure out why the game was running on such a low (often stuttering) framerate on my usually quite decent hardware (core i5 + gtx 770), but after tinkering few minutes with some settings in the config files and trying to overload vsync in nvidia control panel (turning it off gave me terrible screen tearing, which was a pretty bad sign considering my hardware and the game graphics), I got to the conclusion that the game was just performing the best it could and that its coding was just a mess... of course this was confirmed when I encountered ridiculous 5/10 seconds freezes after some cutscenes. The whole thing was starting to make me quite uneasy as save points in this game are set way too far appart, but more on that soon!

Anyway, despite the terrible performance, I still wanted to give it a shot, as I'm a big amateur of the Silent Hill series and actually owned the same game on X360, but never got much far due to the utter annoyance of the combat system in hard difficulty and one awful freeze that made me lost one hour of boring gameplay. But this time I was determined to go through with it, thinking a pretty average game with Akira Yamaoka's music might at least give me a bit of pleasure.

So there i was, wasting another time tediously running around on some cheap scavenger hunt from corridor to corridor in what appears to be an even more cheap knock off of a Silent Hill game, which quickly throws a bunch of cliches from Silent Hill 2  at you without even trying to have its own identity. It's really quite impressive how bad Double Helix was at this, but hardly surprising if you look at their other games or even at the ones from their former companies (nothing really good appart from a bunch of games in the 90's). How they got this gig is mind-boggling and just shows how Konami execs have become out of touch this last decade to the point of trusting these hacks with one of their most emblematic franchise. It's kind of sad from a company that most definitely was at the top of its game from the 8bit to the PS2 era (one of my best gaming memories as a kid where on their SNES games. still remember how seeing their logo screen popping up would instantly reassure me that I was in for some quality gaming time).

But I disgress... Remember what I said about those save points being way too far appart for a buggy game like this? Right after the first level of the game, you get into a really tedious part of the game, which pretty much consists of running around way too much in different parts of the town. I only had one save point in the beginning, but then I got to almost fully explore a house, picked up quite a bunch of stuff, got to explore the first part of a cemetery only to have to backtrack quite far, because I didn't see the right climbing path the first time around. And then, just before I finally got to the next save point, BAM! got accidentely ALT-TABed out of the game, which of course crashed when I tried to get back in it! Almost made me smile... Almost :p. Anyway, I was just looking for a good reason to put this game down early (and forever. this time) and it looks like it made me a favor by collapsing from the weight of its own mediocrity after a mere 1 hour of gameplay.

So there you have it. Think twice before buying this terrible port. Even if you actually remotely enjoyed it on consoles, you're probably going to have a bad time. Besides, there are so much better games like this one to try (hell, even a small indie game like Lone Survivor gets it more). In the meanwhile Konami might pull their head out of their arse and redeem themselves by releasing the 4 earliest Silent Hill games on Steam. Hopefully it'll happen before they cut their veins open, while ingesting pachinko balls and frenetically playing DDR until they die while trying to figure out how they can "revive" another franchise. Yeah... this must how they've been making their decisions lately.

column8: I might just really suck at this game. But I think the combat is terribly flawed, in a game that is so action heavy. The game is buggy and crashes to desktop at random. It is a shame cause I really like the story, and I am loving the atmosphere.

As a gamer, I go for the story first and the game second. The story of 'Silent Hill: Homecoming' left me cold. Very cold. It didn't really feel like a Silent Hill game at all. It was more like the movie (which I hated, btw).

While the mist, the otherworld and most of the monsters fit into the series quite nicely, the main characters and the bosses however did not. I know they wanted it to be more like in the movie, and some of you might actually like that. The movie is really popular after all. 

The controls are simple, battle works fine, but sometimes when attacked by a feral my game glitched and I couldn't fight it off, resulting in game over. Let's talk about puzzles. I like puzzles. Me and my SO have spent days on the puzzles of SH2, 3 and 4, but not homecoming. Not because the puzzles were bad, oh no. Most of the puzzles are the usual find item to go forward, with a few delicious exceptions. I particularly enjoyed the otherworld house. Music and themes fit nicely with the slightly out of focus and hopeless genre, sounds the enemies make are panic-inducing at times (especially the Needler, who the hell came up with that??), and voice acting, while a bit stiff, is way better than in a certain previous title.

It is hard for me to say that the game is bad, at least from the perspective of a devout fan, but I feel like I absolutely have to. I did not like this game. Silent Hill fan? You should try this game. Maybe even buy it, if you can get it for less than 15€.

There's one good thing about it though: Unlockable Pyramid Head Helmet.

column8: Not one of the best Silent Hills from the series, but definetly has the same feel of the previous games.  The same feel of different worlds, why your characters is visiting silent hil, what's the whole story searching, and tons of puzzles and mobs.  Graphics are decent, but compared to the previous fighting mechanics, this one is a little bit more difficult to master, but once you get used to dodging and running then attacking you'll do fine.   Overall I enjoyed this game and plan to play it again.

column8: Io ho giocato a tutta la saga di silent hill fin dal primo capitolo per ps1  e devo proprio dire che con la storia principale non c'entra a nulla!!

Je déterre ce jeu, et mon évaluation de 2014 pour mettre tout ça à jour.

Alors Silent Hill Homecoming, que vaut il ?... Et bien dans mon souvenir, c'était bien mais pas fou. Jugement un peu faible puisqu'en 2014, le jeu plantait systématiquement dans les égouts, et je ne suis jamais allé plus loin. Aujourd'hui je me suis penché sur le problème et ai trouvé un patch non officiel qui marche au top (pour moi, car pas pour tout le monde). Je joue en 2560x1440 aucun crash aucun ecran noir, plus de bug, hormis le son.

Du coup on avance un peu plus loin on en découvre plus et du coup, c'est pas trop mal dans l'ensemble, l'univers les musiques les monstres, on s'y retrouve. Sur clavier l'expérience de jeu est clairement fluide comparé à certains jeux. Je n'ai pas testé avec la manette.

Quelques pertes de fps par moment, et un son qui bug aussi, apparemment il faut passer le son windows sur du 5.1 ou installer razer surround je sais pas quoi, ça n'a pas fonctionné.

Je viens de finir le jeu, enfin une des premières fin car Silent Hill est bien réputé pour avoir plusieurs fin selon vos choix,  un beau rebondissement à la fin même si pour les plus impliqués c'était évident. Globalement il est pas mal, même si certains points me gêne, comme le manque cruel de munition, certains passages un peu "vide", et le système de combat qui donne du nouveau mais ne vous rend pas forcément à l'aise pendant les combats. Et gros point noir, l'apparition de Pyramid Head très légère, aucune poursuite, aucun combat, vraiment dommage pour un personnage emblématique du jeu.

Pour 5 euros en promo, rien à redire.  20 € en temps normal, vu l'age du jeu, un poil cher.

7.5/10

IL GIOCO HA UNA BELLISSIMA GRAFICA TRAMA COINVOLGENTE COLONNA SONORA  ED EFFETTI SONORI AZZECATI!!!
PENSO CHE INSIEME AI SH2 E SH3 SIA TRA I MIGLIORI.
PER POTER GIOCARE AL GIOCO IN MODO CONFORTEVOLE CON IL CONTROLLER DOVRETE SCARICARE IL SEGUENTE PROGRAMMA " PINNACLE GAME PROFILER"  CHE SARà UTILISSIMO CON MOLTI ALTRI GIOCHI PER PC CHE NON SUPPORTANO IL CONTROLLER.
OVVIAMENTE IL GIOCO PIACE SE VI PIACE IL GENERE HORROR /SUSPENSE ALTRIMENTI NON FA PER VOI.
BUON DIVERTIMENTO!!!

A bit of a warning, this will be my rantiest review I think I've ever done.

Let me start off by politely, and courteously, taking a moment to ask why, out of every Silent Hill game, is this the only one on Steam? Now don't get me wrong, I'll get to Homecoming in a moment, but as most other entries in the series had PC ports, why. biased Konami, is this the only one Steam gets? 

With that out of the way, Silent Hill Homecoming is the sixth main entry in the SH series, a psychological survival-horror series that has come to be known best for its atmosphere, story, surrealism, and creepy monster designs.

Silent Hill Homecoming came out on the heels of the Silent Hill film, and it shows. Several monster designs and much of the visual look of the game can be attributed to the film. Most notably, the game has some impressive Otherworld transition sequences inspired by the movies. They look cool, and sound cool, so they at least get the job done there.

And that's something to be said for Homecoming. It's not a terrible looking game, the designs of the characters and monsters at least look cool, the environments look appropriately ominous, and the fog effects, while a bit sparser than other entries in the series, are still rather well-handled.

However, the film inspiration becomes a bit much in areas. This was the game that shoe-horned Pyramid Head in for no reason, and I literally mean no reason. Oh, he appears in cutscenes, but not a single time in gameplay. Not once. And that's not even arguing on how he has no reason to be here. Both in the fact he literally does nothing in the story and it goes against on what Pyramid Head was in SH2. And then there's scenes that were so obviously inspired by the movie, and enemies inspired by the movie. It essentially is an extension to the Silent Hill movie in game form, honestly.

But so much goes against what the SH series is. I was literally in hysterics during a scene almost half-way in the game when suddenly you get a sassy black sidekick comic relief character and escape a police station being invaded Dawn of the Dead style by giant hammerhead land-shark monsters. Don't get me wrong, this is brilliant B-Movie hamminess, but what the fuck is it doing in the fucking Silent Hill series?

And that's what I think one of Homecoming's biggest problems is. It doesn't know what the SH series is. I am convinced the creators just watched the SH movie and made the game based off of that. There's no other explanation for it. Homecoming must of at one point in development been a video game adaption of the movie, because it has so much in common with the film; the nurses work just like they do in the film, so does the cult, and the aesthetics... But it's almost nothing like how the rest of the series is.

But let's get off our fixations of its identity crisis and focus more on the game as its own experience.

Silent Hill Homecoming tells the story of a man named Alex Sheppard who's returning from the military to visit his home in Sheppard's Glen (of course conveniently named after his family). He's been gone for a long time and finds that his hometown has completely changed. There's a few people still living in town, but the place is mostly deserted. Alex comes home to find his brother and father are missing, and his mom seems completely out of it with a pistol on her lap. Alex goes to investigate what exactly has happened to his family, and to this town, and what sort of connection it has with the nearby local resort town of Silent Hill.

To the story's credit, I did end up liking a few of the characters, most notably Alex, who did end up earning some sympathy from me through his journey. And Wheeler, your sassy black comedy relief character, was enjoyable, though so out of place. Most everyone else was forgettable, however. The plot twists unfortunately are mostly super predictable, the worst of all being the 'main' twist, and while I don't want to spoil the game, towards the end we get into some ludicrous Saw-inspired segments that just feel completely out of left field and unneeded. Homecoming also holds my personal honor for having the worst multiple endings I have ever experienced in a horror game. I'm not kidding, they are that bad.

The game has a few puzzles, and by puzzles I mean over half of them are sliding tile puzzles or this puzzle about crossing wires. Whoever the fuck at Double Helix thought that making most of the puzzles in the game fucking sliding puzzles really deserves a solid kick in the ass.

The game is also overly focused on combat. The combat to be fair isn't bad, with a very Zelda-esque system, being able to lock-onto enemies and circle and roll-dodge from them, but the weapons are notably unbalanced with some being far better than others. Also while technically the 'best' combat system in the series (and they try to rationalize it with the fact Alex is an ex-soldier), the series was never really about the combat, making it feel like the developers missed the point.

Also the PC port is a hit or miss based on your system. It either works perfectly fine, or it doesn't. Fans have made a lot of work-arounds for problems in the game, but it has had absolutely no official support. It was basically released on Steam, and left to die there.

This so far makes it sound like I hate Homecoming, but in earnest I didn't.

Homecoming has so much wrong with it, as a Silent Hill game, as a horror game, and as an action game, that it's easy to mention, but it's actually not a terrible game, and has several quite good moments and actually is an okay to good game, though I'd argue one of the weakest in its series.

Homecoming has some decent moments. Exploring the house is both interesting and a bit haunting. Going into the basement the first time is a bit unnerving. A few of the boss fights, especially the second one, are actually well-done. The game isn't too repetitive and does have moments that split away from just combat or just exploration. Speaking of that, there's a decent exploration element in this game that often is a bit rewarding for little extra tidbits, imagery, and sometimes goodies and hidden weapons. The game has some fun unlockable costumes and weapons.

The story is enjoyable in a B-fare kind of way, and is backed by good music and sound design. While not Akira's best work, the music still holds up well for the title. There are small touches to the game too and details that are appreciated, including each grave stone in the graveyard having a different description on them (and there are many), some small scares that the player may miss if they aren't observant or don't explore a bit. The atmosphere is okay, though the game really isn't scary.

But I didn't hate my time with it, in fact, I would say I enjoyed myself playing it. It's got so many flaws and they're so easy to point out, but despite it all there is an enjoyable game in here. It honestly probably would of been better if it was Silent Hill The Movie: The Game though, as it really does things that just doesn't sit right as a fan of the series. But in its own way, it's an enjoyable B-Movie sort of horror game that has dips into legitimately good moments and ideas. 

If you go in expecting some B-Horror fun, as opposed to a Silent Hill game, it's a pretty okay to good game in its own right, just has some flaws, but I wouldn't say the flaws ruin the game and there is some fun and interesting sections to be had as the game goes on. If you go to it for a Silent Hill fix, however, I think you'll be bitterly disappointed. A misguided, but ultimately pretty okay game, that could of been a good game if it wasn't bogged down by a few problems.

column8: à pas mal de problémes de compatibilité avec windows 7 n donc je ne le conseille tout simplement pas si vous avez un windows 7 n

The game itself is a decent game, although it isn't an original story, and many of the monsters are also taken from other silent hill games, it is still a fun game. The main reason this game sucks however is that whoever ported this to the PC deserves to get slapped. The game will not start if you do not edit the config file and manually set the resolution to your resolution, and even if you do that it might not start at all. Then if you open steam in game, or alt tab, it crashes immediately. There are also many glitches that cause the game to be unplayable. 

Allowing the use of a controller would make this game a lot better, as well as fixing all these terrible bugs and lowering the price. Seriously this game came out 6 years ago, why is it $40?

Silent hill 2 and 3 are both on PC, as well as a few others, as to why they chose to add this and only this silent hill to Steam is a mystery to me.

column8:
Os aspectos positivos são a trilha sonora matadora (característica da série) e a ambientação que lembra o primeiro filme da série, mas não é o suficiente para um game.

A forma como o game foi portado para PC foi a mais porca o possível (o que atrapalhou a ambientação interessante), os controles não respondem muito bem em combates e a jogabilidade e história ficam repetitivos a um ponto insuportável.

Perso j'ai acheté ce jeu pensant retrouver la ville de Silent Hill avec autant de plaisir que ces prédécesseurs, mais le jeu bug dès le lancement j'ai le son sans l'image.Donc le fait d'avoir payé pour rien est assez navrant, évitez les mauvais plans comme celui ci est passez votre chemin.

Actualización : NO RECOMIENDO , dado el precio actual no es coherente con la baja calidad de este port . A estas alturas todos ya han jugado este SH , pero si nunca lo jugaste espera a q este en oferta de por lo menos el 90 % 


 NO RECOMENDADO PARA LA MAYORIA : La verdad que a pesar de ser tan criticado y de tener muchos errores y horrores tecnicos para mi es un muy buen juego de terror y tiene todo lo que se puede esperar de un Silent Hill. Solo que ahora tiene un enfoque distinto en lo que es el combate, en parte por que asi tiene coherencia con la historia del PJ , que seria un ex-soldado. La experiencia de juego se potencia si se juega de noche , en la oscuridad y solo si es posible.
   Los controles no son malos para nada, pero son dificiles de acostumbrarse, yo uso mouse y teclado , quizas con joestick la cosa es mejor. Pero esto hace que crezca la tension a la hora de afrontar los monstruos , c/u de estos se convierten en un reto aparte.
   Graficamente es genial , de lo mejor visto en un SH , con un calido efecto de pelicula vieja . No tiene casi nada que envidiarle a "Downpoor" aunque podria haber aprovechado mas los recursos de la PC y no poner opciones tan"CONSOLERAS". Aun asi hay que tener en cuenta que este es un juego de hace casi 6 años 
  Y para los que sufren de "cuelgues" , a mi me paso por probar configuraciones en la grafica, en mi caso el Nvidia control panel. Parece que al juego no le gustan estas modificaciones ,asi que conviene dejar todo en predeterminado asi no van a tener problemas salvo algun que otro congelamiento momentaneo que no pude solucionar, parones que pueden sacarte las ganas de seguir jugando.

  conclusion : Recomendar  (si tenes mucha , pero mucha paciencia, te bancas los muchos problemas y fallos tecnicos y sos muy , muy fanatico de la saga) Es una obra maestra del terror psicologico. Silent hill nunca se vio tan real , gracias a las fisicas vas a correr la cosas de lugar , abrir puertas ,etc de una forma muy verosimil. El sonido es opresivo y terrorifico como siempre. Hay una permanente sensacion de que algo malo va a pasar ,que en verdad aumenta la tension.

I really like this game has a good storyline and really good graphics!
I highly recommend it to anyone who wants to play a game with so much adventure!

Questo gioco ha problemi nel partire ! l'ho reistallato 2 volte e se fai nuova partita non parte. Nice... senza contare l'ambientazione iniziale cioè Silent Hill che a quanto pare è una citta sospesa per aria. ho fatto 30 minuti di gioco per disistallarlo.

I am extremely disapointed in this game. I have played every other Silent Hill game for PC with no issues but from the moment i loaded this game i was plauged with control problems. To put it bluntly the controls DO NOT WORK!!! In the sequences where you must button mash to proceed...like fighting monsters or cutting open doors the mouse buttons simply dont register. Forget about trying to dodge as it simply is broken and will only work about 25% of the time. I cant even believe i am writing such a negative review about this series but i feel disgusted and would only be happy getting my money back. I truly feel ripped off. I am now on the Asphyxia boss battle and have spent the last 3 days trying to get the mouse to register the button mashing sequence with no luck..Then it dawned on me i was frustrated and not having fun and since my time is limited i cant afford to waste time attempting to play a broken game thats just frustrating me. My mouse and keyboard are both less then a month old and both work fine on all of the other games i have installed on my rig. Save yourself the dissapointment and avoid this discrace of a game.

column8: Tiene algunas partes que los fans de la saga encontrarán interesantes, pero con este juego comenzó el declive de Silent Hill.

Gioco molto bello, ricorda molto le atmosfere dei primi episodi, rovintato purtroppo da numerosi bug nell'audio e nella grafica  e una gestione del joypad pessima che rende spesso difficoltosi gli scontri con i boss di fine livello.

El juego esta penosamente optimizado para PC, oscila siempre entre los 30 fps.
El juego tiene una cantidad tremenda de bugs.
Lo unico que me animo a comprar este juego es la historia, ya que me considero un gran fan de la saga.
Los tiempos de carga son excesivos.
El juego se queda pillado cuando le da la gana y tiende a pararse obligandote a reiniciarlo y perder los datos hasta el momento
mi penosa nota es un 1/10

I will admit though besides the 'pyramid head' fanpandering it's not bad for a bad non team silent SH game. It's certainly lengthy enough as well. Just don't bother also why is it still 39.99 ???

I really enjoyed this game, its a shame the experience was ruined by the crappy effort Steam put into porting this to PC. Its racked with glitches, for instance the game is unplayable unless you run it from the exe. inside the folder (the one automatically created by Steam doesn't actually run the game!). Even then, the loading sections take horrible amounts of time and make the game seem like it's frozen, (several times it took 3/4 minutes just to load the save menu) and will constantly do this as you move around the maps to new areas.

If you can handle these slight hiccups then go for it, but I'd really recommend either waiting until Steam patches up the glitches properly, or buying a hard copy of the game that runs smoother. Overall the game itself is very entertaining, YES the story is a little predictable but what can you expect from a sequel??? If you're a fan of the franchise then its an essential play.

column8: Silent Hill Homecoming é um game que faz parte do universo mas que foge um pouco do estilo de jogabilidade, e isso o torna ruim? Não. O jogo é bom, tem otima jogabilidade (coisa que os anteriores não tem), a ação é bem feita, controles bons. E é na jogabilidade boa que mora o mau do jogo, a jogabilidade é boa demais para um silent hill que sempre pecou nisso. O foco mais na ação também destoou do clássico. Talvez o jogo não seja tão profundo psicologicamente, mas é silent hill. Respiramos a cidade e exploramos ela de forma satisfatória. Eu gosto muito do jogo. Recomendo. Tem seus defeitos, mas tem muitas qualidades também. E bem bugado, mas isso nem é mais um ponto negativo tendo em vista que todos os games saem bugados hoje em dia.

Unless you can somehow get this game for free I would highly recommend not buying it. I can't even finish playing my copy because there are so many bugs and issues. I love the Silent Hill series and have played most of them on the PlayStation, but Homecoming on the PC is an absolute travesty.

The key controls for the game that are weird and so are the prompts for certain buttons.
There are many places where the camera angle becomes awkward and the only way to fix it is to run around and hope that your camera centers again. In addition the alt + tab only manages to cause the game to crash.

However the biggest issue and what has ultimately caused me to write this review and prevent me from even finishing the game is that half way through playing Homecoming has failed to register my keyboard. No matter what keys I press no effect will register. It is not frozen because my mouse still works in the game I just can't move or open the menu screen.

Like I said I love the Silent Hill games however these aren't issues that I can just ignore and look past which I have been known to do for many games. These are problems that make the game unplayable and I'm rather disappointed..
