very nice very scary

The worst game of the Silent Hill franchise has finally arrived on Steam, even worse than before. Better horror games exist literally everywhere. Let me just start by saying that I enjoy the story in this game, but the technical glitches, frame rate drops, and occaisonal game freezes make the game almost unplayable. Do yourself a favor and pick up Amnesia or Outlast instead.

8/10

column8:
Despite the mixed opinions about this game, I thought it had a good story and managed to capture the drama of Silent Hill. The graphics are good, and while the soundtrack isn't as remarkable as the previous SH titles, it does fit with most environments of the game.
The only issue with this game is how it was poorly ported to PC. It required a lot of patience, with the freezes, glitches and eventual crashes.
If you're a hardcore fan of Silent Hill games, you may not mind having to deal with these problems. 

But if you never played Silent Hill or are looking for a nice horror game, be advised that this game might not be your best choice to start. Try playing the previous ones first.

column8:
I usually don't recommend stuff that I haven't finished yet but what I am feeling now is important enough to break this rule.

I feel like I am trying to open a fucking coconut barehanded in the desert. Fighting to open the friggin coconut that may be empty just because I am in the desert and if the stuff inside the coconut is good it'll be worth but if it isn't I'll end hurt and sad.

I found SH Homecoming on Steam and gladly bought it because I was missing those spooky games and I din't felt like playing Dead Space again so huh, why not? I could've played those stuff that have been coming out those last years but I seriously think that games were you just run and hide into closets praying to the dumb AI "please, don't look at here!!!" sucks therefore my options were limited and here I am.

I saw bad ports before like Devil May Cry 3 or Dark Souls but this one is a gem. You can't alt tab because it'll crash the game, everytime you die you'll face an absurdly long loading that of course is there to make you avoid death...right? The controls are clumsy and so is the camera. Sometimes, while being raped by monsters the game will show  prompts asking you to mash buttons like "1", "2", "3" or "4" so if you know a place that sells a gamepad with those buttons please let me know!

"So why do you recommend this?" you ask. Welp, its basically Silent Hill again. Akira Yamaoka is still there, the city, the feel, the shitty combat, retarded dogs, creepy stuff, all of it, and I feel like that if the ending pleases me a couple of days later I'll forget about all the problems about it.

If you like Silent Hill, get in there. It'll probably be the best worst game you'll play for some time.

column8: A really cool Silent Hill

Pros: Good graphics. Challenging combat. Fairly good atmosphere. Not bad story.

Cons: Easy puzzles. More combat-driven than earlier Silent Hill games. Feels like a rehash, too "safe".

My recommendation: If you don't mind that it's not SH 1, 2 or 3, go for it.

column8:
This game isn't that bad, it is just not a good silent hill compared to what we had with 1, 2 ,3. the combats are a bit more dynamic, doesn't make you that overpowered, and it fits the fact Alex is a soldier. The serie got better storyline than this one, but it is ok. Also the graphics aren't bad for the time, just some character that have their face poorly animated but it is fine. 
You will find Joshua beeing an anoying little twat, and cliché the whole story, but it is justified.
As a fan of the serie, this game feels inspired from the moovie,and  it is kind of weird.
Conclusion: this isn't a bad game but it isn't as good as the other sillent hill from the franchise.

column8: Autentico juego de terror, es una pasada, el nivel de dificultad es bastante dificil lo que hace que tengas miedo de encontrarte enemigos. La trama del videojuego esta muy currada.

So what happens when you take one of the best survival horror franchises and f*ck it up, you get something like this. I loved the first 3 Silent Hill games and the fourth one was okay but this game is terrible compared to Silent Hill standards. the monsters are boring, the combat is way too easy in the beginning and suddenly becomes very difficult later in the game and the game can be scary from time to time but overall it doesn't live up to the scarieness and constand terror from the previous Silent Hill games. the puzzles aren't that bad but nowhere near as good as the puzzles in the previous Silent Hill titles. and on top of that the game even counteracts the storyline from the previous Silent Hill titles, just to give you a small explaination Pyramid head or "bogeyman" is in this game which is part of James' (from Silent Hill 2) personal nightmare so Alex shouldn't be able to see him.

So where did it go wrong. First of all developers try to make this game more mainstream so people who weren't interested in Silent Hill before might become interested, same thing happend to Resident Evil. in the end nobody gives a sh!t about these games, people who werent interested in the game still aren't interested and the (hardcore) fans don't like it either. Second of all this game isn't created by the origional developers also known as "Team Silent" and nobody in the entire world, and by that I realy mean nobody in the entie world except off course for Team Silent really understands the story of Silent Hill so it's best if nobody makes another Silent Hill game, at least not without the help of some of the developers of the origional Team Silent.

I give this game a 5/10 as a horror game, it's mediocre at best, but a 2/10 as a Silent Hill game because in my opinion it has nothing to do with a Silent Hill game, and please stop f*cking up Silent Hill.

Still not convinced, watch this video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=W5-XhBpfqMM. There's no one on youtube that knows more about Silent Hill than they do.

column8:
As a fan of Silent Hill since the beginning, this title undoes everything that made the series unique and enjoyable. The strong points of the series have always been atmosphere, design, and sheer compelling mystery. Homecoming fails on all of these points. 

Firstly, the story, unlike those in previous games, is utterly predictable and tedious. It's straight out of the worst horror movies; every spoken line will seem familiar and you can predict half the scenes and twists before they happen. The stories in the previous games weren't always perfectly written, but they were never this insultingly cliché. There's no mystery, no creeping fear, no unresolved questions.

As for the monsters, they nearly look right for the series, but their behavior is worlds apart. Instead of being willful and mysterious, they're just like the posturing, aggressive beasts you'll find in any other game. That's more a matter of taste, but fighting them is definitely more simplistic than before. When you engage an enemy, you can practically feel the scripting pop into gear; the whole process is nothing but a timing game. Block, button mash, the end. Or, if the monster gets a hit in, enjoy being hit again and again and again as you try to either get back up or get out of the way. It's cheap and nothing but cheap, and not remotely enjoyable. Compounding this fact is that you have only 3 melee weapons that differ in speed and attack pattern, and these qualities stay the same even when you get new weapons (which just replace one of these 3, and play exactly the same).

The puzzles are shockingly simple. The solutions are frequently completely obvious, sometimes even without reading the hint (which is usually posted immediately near the puzzle, and barely obscures the solution if at all). In two cases, object interaction puzzles are actually repeated; one is only slightly different the second time around, but the other one is literally the exact same puzzle with the exact same method of solution! Overall, the puzzles come off like an afterthought, and add nothing to the experience.

If you're looking to extend your Silent Hill experience with Homecoming, forget it. Because it isn't Silent Hill, it is a horror game called Homecoming.

column8: Whatever you do - DON'T buy this game, dont even get it for free cause it's useless. This is the most awful PC ports i ever met. God knows i'm a pacient guy and i played a lot of bugged games in my life, but this is just impossible to play. Its the full crap edition - crashes, freezing, controlling problems, black screens, sound glitches, bugged puzzles, and it's endless, the list can go on forever. Both PlayStation 3 and Xbox 360 versions of Silent Hill: Homecoming contained numerous bugs, but few that haulted your game completely. Silent Hill: Homecoming for PC however has some serious issues and remains unplayable. There are no fixes for it at all. After enjoying SAW verry much, Konami dissapointed me so hard to the poing that i wont get any other game distributed by them regardless how much i would like to play it. How Steam can justify selling this crap is beyond me.

column8: This is a good game.  It is definitely different from  the originals (SH 1-2, include 3 if you like it) but thats okay! Yeah, it isn't nearly as scary as SH1 but it is still good! This is an American take on the series and I think they did a good job. I like the story and the protagonist. This game has more of an action game feel with no riddles that I really remember being in past SH titles. I think the games looks good, and is fun to play. It feels like the same length as other SH titles, so it shouldn't take too long. Also, there are alternate outfits and endings to up the replay aspect. Worth a play if you like the series.

An updated combat system mixed with ending-changing choices makes this one of my most favorite games of all time.

column8:
MOCNA GRA!!!

Oczywiście... mając wcześniej na uwadze, że tego typu pełnoprawnych produkcji na platformę PC jest dość skromna liczba.Pamiętając również, że to piąta odsłona charakterystycznej dla siebie serii, dalej patrząc przez pryzmat historii gatunku.Gra szczególnie wnosi inną mechanikę opierającą się o bardziej dynamiczne starcia z przeciwnikami, które stawiają na naszą ekstremalną zręczność typu unik/blok, atak.

Klimat gry i zarazem jej najważniejszy element jest wystarczająco gęsty, mocny, ale już średnio przerażający i bardziej znowu uzależniający/wciągający.Potęguje go bezbłędna (bardzo dobra) oprawa dźwiękowa, starsza grafika i dobra fabuła, serwująca jedno z pięciu możliwych zakończeń - w moim przypadku zakończenie godne mistrza :P czyli to Dobre.

To nie był mój pierwszy kontakt z serią Silent Hill, ale pierwsza część, którą całą przeszedłem, gra jest dobra, ale nieszczególnie wybitna/genialna, przy czym zaznaczam, że jestem znacznie lepiej zaznajomiony z serią RE i zarazem jej wiernym graczem.

Gdyby tylko nie te ekrany ładowania i sterowanie to...
...było by super.
Why are you reading this? This is Silent Hill. Go buy this game NOW!

Игра имеет очень большие минусы, которые можно было избежать. Главный минус заключается в системе хсохранений. Сохранялок в игре мало и при неудачной смерти, или вылете час-два игры приходиться повторять . Так же минус в управлении, оно выводит из себя и заставляет материться. Сюжет тянет на...кого я обманываю, не тянет он вообще. Игре ставлю 3 из 10
Polecam jeśli ktoś grał w serie i che przeżyć to jeszcze raz

A horrible excuse for a Windows port. Audio only came out of one side, loading seemed like it was coming off of a DVD, but the controls were ok, and it did run. A generally painful experience that I would not recommend, and generally consider a port port. The game it self may be ok, but the porting job is very poor. The load times are on par with a 360, which defeats most of the point of a PC port. If I recall correctly, the game only had two graphical quality settings; low and medium. How does that happen? I would have accepted low and high, but medium? Thats just lazy development there. I would recommend this game be played on a console before this poor PC port. It looks like the company was just trying to make a quick buck, because it lacks effort, and lacks even trying.

column8:
I have a very high tolerance for bad console ports, because they're usually at least running at a tolerable framerate. 

I also usually finish a game's campaign and do some side content in it before i write a steam recommendation as well, But this, i didn't even want to attempt to get past the first three rooms. 

This is such a bad console port, i wonder if they even optimized this game AT ALL. Wanna get a good idea how bad it is? At lowest settings this game runs at 15fps on a very low resolution. My computer can run Battlefield 3 maxed out at 60fps at 1920x1080. So now you have a good idea of how bad this port is. Not only that, but i had to disable my second monitor to even get this game to start, what the fuck. Also, the load times are atrocious, it takes literally more than a minute and a half to load anything. I was going to give this game a chance, even despite bad reviews, but now i'm uninstalling it and never playing again.

column8: O...M....G....! Do I ever recommend this...! I can't believe I haven't until now. If your a Silent Hill fan this is a must, dispite biased reviews this game is filled with darkness, monsters both classic and new, a half decent story line, half crazed and or insane characters you never know if you're being helped or hindered. I've found the mixed range of weapons and supplies ample at best and some of the puzzles fairly challenging. This also has a cameo appearance by none other than THE PYRAMID HEAD ! How scarry is that? Replay value is good if you want to collect all the unlockables. Also however as of today so far, this game on Steam has no developers console command (~tilde key) to input any cheats so you will have to play the old fashioned way, by the skin of your teeth and the hair on your back! Good luck boils and gruels.

column8: If you're into horror games or being scared shitless, then get this. It's not like FEAR jump out at you every second scary, it's not like Amnesia making you think something is there when its not kinda scary, It's not Dead Space jump out at you every second and make you believe something is there when its not scary then becomes predictable and not scary, this is genuinely scary. Very good story line too (a bit retarded to start with) but it gets there... Very fun and will keep you on edge, if this is your kinda thing, then this is a very good one to have.

column8: The plot and environment of Silent Hill Homecoming provide a good amount of immersion for the horror game fan. Well, they would if it wasn't for a broken combat system, godawful quick time events and a PC port that has as many demons (read: bugs) as the people Silent Hill calls out to. While the other weapons in the game are nice against certain creatures, the knife will become your best friend because of its speed and reliability. If only Alex were as reliable with his dodging. Even with its many faults, if you're a fan of Silent Hill or horror games in general you should definitely pick this up when it's on sale for 5 or 10 dollars and give it a play through.

column8: The ambience, as I expect with any Silent Hill game, is marvelous, but this particular addition to the franchise seems to play off of all of Silent Hill's currently major clichés, and expand on them in a poor attempt to draw people in for the same themes. This game has the unfortunate downfall of being another shoddy console port, making the controls abysmally wearisome, which in turn draws from game content. If you want to play this, have a controller, and don't immerse yourself expecting any Silent Hill 2 brilliance.

column8: The game isn't awful but it's a poor console port and isn't really a Silent Hill game. Infact the last actual Silent Hill game was 4. This is just trying to copy the Silent Hill movie which wasn't very good at all and nor was it faithful to the original storyline. Don't give Konami any money for this, it's a slap in the face to fans of the originals. If you actually like this game you should really watch Twin Perfect's 'The Real Silent Hill Experience' on Youtube, then you'll change your mind on it and understand why this is NOT a Silent Hill game nor is it even a good game in general.

column8:
Bad port.

I haven't played all the way through this, so I can't very well say the story makes no sense. Maybe it will.
The porting job they did on this, though. Ugh. You can select a monitor refresh rate up to 120hz, but it won't matter, it'll still run at 30fps. There's native support for an Xbox 360 controller, but the onscreen button prompts are numbered instead of having A, B, X or Y on them, and they have the wrong color. Running at above 1280x720 makes your map and item window too small:
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=5723721
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=5723722
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=5723719
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=5723718

The game also seems very eager to prove itself part of the Silent Hill series (like Silent Hill 4, though at least for all its faults, that game tried to do something new), ripping a lot from Silent Hill 2. The combat is more involved than previous SH games, but still a bit clunky.

If you have a PS3 or Xbox 360, play the game on that instead.

column8:
all together its a good game and sadly the only silent hill title on steam...

the graphics nice to look at, especially shadow and light effects.
music and sound effects keep the atmosphere dark, the animations look very nice and after the first 20 percent of the game it gets scary too.

negative about it: the riddles are not so inventive, silimar to other games.
also it took a while to get used to the controls.

if youre a fan of the horror genre, this one shouldnt be missing in your inventory.

column8: This game was creepy as hell, but I enjoyed exploring the game world and fighting the unpredictable enemies in the process. I was ultimately left wanting more, but the story was still a decent length and challenging in places. On more than one occasion I felt as though they needed to explain things better or put more emphasis on certain aspects such as enemy types and weapons. Overall though, it was an enjoyable experience, it's not too often you get to play a decent horror game :)

column8:
I'll start by saying i LOVE the Silent Hill series, and thats why it hurts to give this game a thumbs down, but lets face facts... the american made Silent Hills are bland, boring, fail to capture the essence of what truly makes a Silent Hill game, don't live up to the name and its even more insulting that THIS is on steam, and the japanese made Silent Hills are not... especially Silent Hill 2... but then again thats just my humble opinion. It's a BAD game, and comparing this to the old games... just don't, its doomed from the start.  Konami can wash away the shame by just putting Silent Hill 1-4 up for sale on Steam, and it would make a lot of old school gamers happy... come on Konami... i want you to take my money... but you have to give me some quality stuff in exchange

In light of recent events, i cannot express how dissapointed i am that all we got was this piece of crap and something awesome like P.T. will never be avalable on Steam... Piss on this game, piss on konami

column8: A decent installment to the Silent Hill franchise. Clearly influenced by the film and more "American gore" than "Japanese wierdness", but overall I liked it. Good storyline, combat is greatly improved from PS versions, and really nice atmosphere. Scores 8/10 from me

column8: 5th Silent Hill installment. As much as I played before my game actually glitched out and can't go further, the controls are nicely ported over considering this is a console port. Everything feels a bit laggy only because the game has a fps cap of 30 which is hardcoded in. It's a bit confusing at first because the controls aren't explained anywhere but it shouldn't be too hard to figure out. I'd probably stay away from this one since there seems to be a lot of bugs and that 30 fps limit.

column9: Greatest Silent Hill game.

column8:
spoilers? yes.

So I might have been to young to habe played the original silent hill when it was new, but I did play it at a friends house, also played 2 and 3 and shattered memories + downpour, I still think Silent hill 1 is the best in the franchise and this can and will never touch that. But how everyone whines about how it does not fit the silent hill universe and all, I will mostly ignore that in this review: this is my review about Shepherd's glen, homecoming.

so to get the silent hill things out of the way:
athmosphere: indeed, I got more scared by the blur of the dated silent hill, but this still can scare if you are playing alone in the dark and really into the game, but it will never get close to other titles in the franchise. Also the monsters: in other games they might have been more scary and here more agresive, but going with the entire silent hill thing of the character's mind and all, it actually fits. Alex is a very VERY agresive person, most of the other games featured just normal people, nothing with a real agresive past where here you have a soldier! added up with an abusive past no wonder this guy likes to fight.

Well, let us go on with Shepgerd's glen, homecoming;
bugs? I've played trough this at least three times and never have I encountered anything but a few weird monster movement wich to be honest made the things more scary.
pord? well, I have seen better, WAY BETTER. but this is NOT one of the worst, some of the buttons are awkward but it could have gone full lego lord of the rings.
story? Personally, I LOVE the story, it has great moments and for me it fits all into place.
soundtrack? It's still a silent hill game, and Akira Yamaoka is still on it, off course it's great.


So the review in short: 
Personally I love it a lot, rip it of the silent hill title and people would call it a silent hill look a like, but remove those people and you got a very VERY nice game, sadly there are a lot of people getting bugs, if they would fix it for those people I'll call this an easy 7.5/10
I guess a 7/10, not silent hill but not horrible.

note: Welcome to the land of fan-service.


My excuses for the poor english.

soundtrack? It's still a silent hill game, and Akira Yamaoka is still on it, off course it's great.


So the review in short: 
Personally I love it a lot, rip it of the silent hill title and people would call it a silent hill look a like, but remove those people and you got a very VERY nice game, sadly there are a lot of people getting bugs, if they would fix it for those people I'll call this an easy 7.5/10
I guess a 7/10, not silent hill but not horrible.

note: Welcome to the land of fan-service.


My excuses for the poor english.

column8: I'm a fan of the Silent Hill games but this one does not have the magic of the other games. The best part of this game is unlike other Silent Hill games the graphics are nice. However it lacks the atmosphere, the world does not seem as oppressive with human enemies and your two sidekicks running around with you. The combat is annoying, you cannot change weapon whilst aiming a gun and if you get knocked down when you get up you return to the aim view. You can easily get stuck where you get knocked down then by the time you get up and aim again you get knocked down again. So you have to use the melee weapons but once you get the knack you can defeat all the enemies (even the bosses) with the basic knife which then removes the tension. Another issue is some of the save points are ages apart. This presumably is an attempt to raise the tension but it just means when you want to quit you can end up playing for another half hour till you get to the save point.

column8: This is a game that is an must for horror fans the setting is creepy. Our hero Alex shepard returns home ownly to find things arent as they seem his brother josh is missing and his home town is all but deserted mist fills the air horrors from beyond the grave walk the streets from sewers to grave yards and an encounter with an possed doll. The ownly flaw is an bug that cause youre frame rate to drop if u can over look this minor flaw youl be treated to an magnificent display of survival horror.For fans of resident evil dead space and alone in the dark

column8: Quinto Capitolo della Serie videoludica che ha Cambiato il concetto di Horror Psicologico. in Homecoming impersonificheremo Alex Shepherd, un ragazzo amante del mondo Militare, di ritorno dal servizio di leva obbligatorio . Ritroverà una città completamente deserta e nel caos, un fratello scomparso e una madre autistica. Un viaggio che lo porterà a dubitare della sua stessa persona, delle sue stesse passioni e delle [poche] persone a lui un tempo care, rimaste a Sheperd's Glen. Capitolo interamente accompagnato dal fantastico e profondo Akira Yamaoka con i suoi brani dal puro gusto horror-orientale , tecnicamente ha qualche pecca durante i combattimenti, spesso difficili e all'inizio frustranti per i giocatorucci abituati a giochini banalotti . consigliato ad occhi chiusi .
Fuck this fucking game.
column9: Fuck this fucking game.

column8:
I don't understand why most of the people giving this game a low rating?
Are they looking for something else? This is Silent Hill, a game that came out on the Playstation few years ago? Stop being nostalgic. Sure, this game isn't everything the older games were, but it's still damn good especially for you Silent Hill fans :)


Something new, something old, something borrowed and something rust-red...

column8:
Alex Shepherd wasn't the most popular kid at Silent Hill High, but his life is thrown into chaos and shame after he commits a social faux pas in a girl's bathroom. Disgusted at his folly, Cool Kids Council delivers a challenge: Have you and your date elected Homecoming King and Queen, or be excluded from Prom Night... FOREVER.

Now Alex has twenty-four hours to find a date for Homecoming and perfect some wicked sick dance moves. Can he overcome the trials and tribulations of high school life, or will he be subjected to eternal disgrance? It's up to the player to decide which ending Alex Shepherd will have to live with in this suspenseful action thriller.

7/10.

column8:
Bought it for $30, cause I love horror games. Was looking for a nice creepy game 
that I could just zone out to, and shoot up creepy monsters. Pretty much delivered there.

I've heard a bunch of mixed responses to this, such as it doesnt follow the original formula, the character's aiming was 'too good', and such. Now, I havent played the original games, Ive only seen the movie, which i think is one epic damn movie, and i like how homecoming plays out. Considering the story, it is one of those games you will play once or twice for the story, and wont touch for 6-8 months. Ah well.

Just to sum up; great story, lots of gore, good gameplay, multiple choice endings, and alien ray gun!

What's not to like?
